text:
Su ubicación es muy buena, puedes llegar a casi todos los puntos caminando a en metro. El personal de recepción muy amable.
Solicitamos habitación de no fumadores y nos dan una con un olor terrible a tabaco, la 904.
Nos pasan a la 1004, habitación muy pequeña, no refleja lo que enseñan las fotografias. A nustro regreso de cenar, a las 11 de la noche la cerradura no sirve, mientras bajo a recepción y subo otra vez, la ceradura no funciona, bajo otra vez y me acompaña el Sr. Miguez Giraldez, de seguridad, y confirma que la cerradura esta mala. Mientras tanto mi hija de 11 años tenía que dormir en el pasillo. A las 12.30 de la noche seguían tratando de arreglar la cerradura. El gerente de turno Sr. William Landicho ni siquiera le importó la situación, hasta que le tuve que alzar la voz y amenazarlo con abogado, nos dío una habitación mientras abrían la nuestra. Solicionaron el problema a las 2.30 de la mañana. Lo peor, al día siguiente paso lo mismo. Pesimo servicio al cliente.
Solo el Sr. Diraldez sabe lo que es servicio al cliente; solo por él volvería a ese hotel.

text:
Hands down, one of the best shopping experiences I have had - and I am comparing to all of them, not just fish.

I was seeking a brand new, custom tank. I shopped around but Aquatouch had a good price and, more importantly, the best service. From start to finish, everything was covered - tank and stand. All of my questions were answered (and I had a lot!). I just got the tank this week and it's beautiful! I am still getting follow-up support on setting up the tank.

I want to note something very important - I always felt like I was dealing with honest people.

The store itself is clean and neat. They focus more on saltwater than fresh. I'm not a saltwater expert but I would say their selection is good. The saltwater fish are all active and appear "happy" to me. The planted freshwater tanks are beautiful. I think they specialize in more of the high end freshwater fish and plants.

This store will remain tops on my list. If you are going to make that huge investment in a large tank, I would just go to Aquatouch. I already did the research for you. You'll get great service, good prices and have all your questions answered.
label: positive

text: Symbologist Robert Langdon (Hanks) is called to Rome to help decipher the mystery behind the Illuminati before a new science experiment blows up the city.The Da Vinci Code broke records in 2006 but for the vast majority of Dan Brown followers it did not do his award winning book justice and though running at a good 2 and a half hours, seemed to bore many.Having read the book, I was perhaps one of the few who enjoyed Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou attempt to solve the mystery of the murder in the Louvre but for Angels and Demons the scales were raised once more as lead star and director return.Having asked around, most people seem to prefer Angels and Demons to The Da Vinci code for an entertaining read and it seems as critiques and fans, whilst still not fully justified, prefer this latest adaptation to the 2006 release.This Howard picture certainly has a more clinical energy and exercise to it as unlike Da Vinci, Tom Hanks' Robert Langdon has only one night to solve the mysterious activities of the forgotten Illuminati in the Vatican and because of the time limitations, the action and desperation up the ante and deliver an excitement that certainly beats The Da Vinci code but also generates plenty of twists and stunning murder sequences.The interesting factor of this 2009 release is the constant elements being justified for the murders. Earth, wind, water and fire are all included in drastic and powerful sequences to pronounce a feeling of overall power to the situation.This really does justify the tag of thriller with a constant tension and sharp drama with the issues and beliefs once more given a full working over.Just like 3 years ago, there are many debates and discoveries of symbols once believed to be lost forever and Langdon is again the key character to show everyone the light in and amongst the controversy of other pressing circumstances.It is fair to say Dan Brown is a complex writer; he certainly likes to cram issues and dramas in amongst his action and thrilling sequences. As well as trying to discover the Illuminati, there is also the scenario of the election of a new pope, the dealings with a new scientific experiment and the power of Religion is again present. All interesting to discover and listen to, if occasionally the debates and dialogue tend to send your mind drifting but as there is so much in the novel, this was always likely.Ron Howard, who kept a frankly ordinary type of direction rolling in Da Vinci, returns in perhaps the worst way possible. His jerky ever moving camera styling does nothing to keep the pressure up, and we can never fully accept what is happening on screen thanks to this frankly awfully portrayed style. He is certainly no Paul Greengrass and this is by no means Bourne.Slick and stylized this is faster and more interesting than Da Vinci
label: positive

text:
高級感があり非常に良い
画像だとちょっと野暮ったく、でかいように感じましたが実物はそんなことはなく、 高級感があり思っていたより小さかったです。 今までは読書やパソコンに向かう時など腕時計の置き場に困ってましたが これがあれば愛機を眺めながらゆったりと良い時間が過ごせそうです。 問題点としては、自分の場合は留め具を一番下の段に合わせて丁度いい位置に来ました。 （写真１番目と２番目。時計：ロレックスミルガウス、ケース径41mm、手首の外周約19cm） 三段目以上の段だと時計がちょっと下の位置にずれてかっこ悪くなってしまいます。 （写真３番目と4番目。） なので、時計のベルトや留め具の長さによっては、時計を丁度良い位置に合わせられない、 といった不具合が生じるということは、もしかしたら考えられるかもしれません。 あと他の人が書いているように、ケースがもっと大きい、いわゆる「デカ厚」の時計だと 文字盤が木の枠をはみ出してしまうでしょう。 あと、上下に角度を変えられる作りになっていればもっとよかった。 （さすがにそこまでやるともっと高額になってしまうでしょうけど・・・）
label: positive

text: Hotel molto comodo per chi vuole vivere New York, si trova proprio dietro Times Square, a 2 minuti a piedi dalla metropolitana (varie linee), quindi l'unico punto a favore di questo albergo è che è veramente in una posizione centrale. Per il resto.....bisogna accontentarsi, le camere sono davvero piccole e molto rumorose a causa dell'impianto di condizionamento che quando è accesso fa dei rumori pazzeschi! La pulizia è molto trascurata e anche lenzuola e asciugamani non sono il massimo! Il personale è abbastanza gentile, ma molto disorganizzati. L'albergo è in fase di ristrutturazione, quindi già da fuori non si presenta bene (impalcature) e anche all'interno la hall non è il massimo. A me per 4 notti andava bene, considerando che ci si deve dormire e lavarsi visto che si è fuori in giro per NY tutto il giorno, ma direi che non ci tornerei più, soprattutto perchè a pari prezzo credo che a NY ci siano alberghi migliori!!
label: negative

text:
I really really want to give this place more than 2 stars because I have been to other locations and liked them quite a bit. And truthfully the food was quite good. However the service was severely, SEVERELY lacking.

Positives: Like I said, food was good. Drinks were brought promptly, etc. etc.

Negatives: Our waitress. She said she was new, so maybe the blame should ultimately be placed on the management for lack of adequate training. First off, we had a table of 7 and she said for tables of 8 or more they don't do separate checks. So when we repeated that we only had 7 at our table, she still gave us attitude about having to split checks. I know it's a pain in the butt but no one in our party had cash.... Then she forgot a few of our drinks. They were brought promptly but when you forget a few, and also forget the waters we ordered and never come back to check on us again until you bring our food out, we may have a problem. So 2 people we were with went about 20 minutes without drinks while the rest of us were sipping our beer and wine (and missing our waters.) When we went to order our food, a guy we were with asked what came on his sandwich and she replied "well you can read can't you?" Um. Ok. Then our food came out. We ate it, liked it, and then sat there for about a half hour after we had all finished eating. We were upstairs and there was almost nobody else up there so I'm not sure why it took so long for her to come back and pick up our plates (or ask us if we wanted more drinks?) She finally came back and we asked for the checks, she brought them and we paid. And then sat there again for about a half hour. At this point we were all super frustrated. It took a bartender to realize how long we'd been sitting there and he finally came and took care of our checks. UGH.

All in all, I love there food and that they cater so well to us gluten free folk. But I probably won't be back to this location for a while.
label: negative

text:
Просто отвратительно. Больше сюда никогда не придем. 
Зашли только потому что очень хотели есть и очень любим вьетнамскую кухню.
Думали покушаем и видом на море насладимся с 4 этажа торгового центра.

Во-первых: не умеют готовить, это невозможно есть, на картинке одно, а по факту выносят другое. Овощи несвежие, протухший сыр, зелень вся вялая, отвратительно! Какие-то непонятные напитки в банках и даже они просрочены…
Попросили сделать лимонад, нам он не понравился, какой-то с горчинкой непонятной. В итоге на наш отзыв о лимонаде, который мы говорили официанту отреагировал какой-то человек, который, когда мы заходили в это «чудесное» заведение, лежал на диване в неадекватном состоянии, а именно он сказал: «Если хотите попить «лимонадики» и нормально поесть, то вы ошиблись этажом». Что-то вроде этого он произнес запинаясь и путаясь в своих же словах. Мы удивились.😅

Во-вторых: насколько я понял, что это либо учредитель ресторана, либо администрация ресторана, так как он раздавал задания персоналу заведения, зовут его , вроде бы Сергеем. Еще сложилось впечатление, что он нетрадиционной ориентации… такое ощущение было, что он был совсем не пол алкогольным опьянением.

В-третьих: чуть позже пришел его друг и в дня они устроили черт пойми что. Стали орать на персонал, вести себя как какие-то животные, к этому времени мы только слышали визги этих людей, так как заходили в лифт, зная, что больше мы сюда никогда не придем.

В-четвертых: оказалось, что эти люди нарушают общественные правила, нарушают покой граждан Ялты, орут и включают музыку поздней ночью и ранним утром, на замечания своих соседей не реагируют, а охране торгового центра «Фонтан», в котором они размещены, по всей видимости, все равно. 
Прошу принять меры в отношении этого юридического лица.
label: negative

text:
A fitting embodiment of It Is What It Is.

I've been twice, in 1991 and again in 2005. From what I can remember, it hadn't changed at all between then. Smoky in the bar area, though another review tells me that's old news now. I wasn't 21 for either of those visits, but I can imagine sitting at the bar for a couple of hours around lunch would give me the full experience were I to do it now.

Food-wise, nothing spectacular with the enchiladas I ordered the last time. But the beauty of El Charro is that it doesn't advertise itself as the best of the best, just a fixture at that location and a reputable spot to grab a drink or some acceptable Mexican food if you're in the area. I'm sure if I find myself near that part of town again some afternoon I'll stop in again.
label: negative

text: Maybe we just got the worst room in the hotel, but our stay was awful. The climate control was terrible-- our room was constantly stuffy, humid and warm, until we finally turned the thermostat down to 66, which made it too cold but at least a little less humid. The coffee maker broke on the first day; when we asked for a new one, they delivered one and left it, in the box, on the dresser. They didn't open the box, unpack it, set it up, or take away the old one (we had to do all that). Trash was left lying outside our room for over 24 hours even though the maid had cleaned the room in the meantime. There wasn't enough storage (only two small drawers). And, the room was incredibly noisy-- water noise from surrounding bathrooms woke us up every night. I wouldn't stay here again.
label: negative

text: We stayed at the Double Tree Hotel at Southcenter on 5 Jan 2012 and found the hotel not very pleasant. We stayed on the 7th floor and the hot water was a long time coming. The bathroom is very small and not what I expected from a suite room. The sink is out in the bedroom which is ackward if you need to get a drink of water in the middle of the night. The room, although clean, was quite dated and showed signs of too much wear. The lobby atrium open to the roof allowed noise to travel up from the bar on the main floor to our 7th floor room. The breakfast was quite pleasant in the morning and we appreciated the fine service. The hotel needs a complete make over before we will consider this hotel in the future.
label: positive

text:
My husband and I enjoyed a nice stay at the Bristol, but after requesting a quiet room months in advance, I was very disappointed to see that we were right across from the bus station. My husband thought that maybe that was the "quiet side", but I can't imagine that is was. The bed was quite uncomfortable, along with the pillows, so it was really hard to get a good night's sleep.
The front desk staff were very sweet, almost to a fault. As a group of guys were loudly gathering for a night on the town in the lobby, drinking out of Solo cups and playing the piano, the front desk seemed too meek to intervene. It just made the hotel look more like a frat house and less of a classy downtown hotel, that I know it has the potential to be. The room was clean, location was nice and the front desk and room service staff were very friendly, but I don't think I would stay here again.
label: negative

text: Seat size ok. Service abominable. 1hr delay and lost connection fare Plus additional bus and train fees. Subsequent 2hr delay meant missing last train out of Melbourne as well, getting stuck on a 3hr coach run to arrive at 4.15am (I was due in 10.30pm). How can they so badly mismanage flights? And so late for updates? They must have known earlier than notification that they'd not make it, they should have been offering refunds early to allow passengers to try their luck with the other, earlier, on time departing airlines. I'll never fly again, and most certainly not with Rex.
label: negative

text: I stayed in this hotel while attending a conference in June if 2012. The service was excellent. The rooms were clean and roomy but with this high rate I would expect a safe, a microwave and a mini fridge in my room. No continental breakfast was also a downer. I guess the starbucks in the lobby and two other restaurants explains this. Bottom line is if your company is not paying for it avoid this hotel.
label: neutral

text: We reserved a 2 bedroom suite for the last night of our TX travels. The desk staff were pleasant enough - but tried to put us in a unit already occupied. They rectified the situation with some Haagen Daz Ice Cream which was very nice and a much appreciated gesture. When we got to our "real" room - it looked like it needed some serious updating - but would suffice for one night. When we returned from our all day adventure in San Antonio - we discovered the air conditioning wouldn't adjust despite many attempts in many ways to adjust it - we ended up closing vents just so we didn't freeze ourselves out (it was too hot to turn it off completely). The living room TV didn't work with any of the 3 remotes in the suite and the light over the stove didn't work. It would not have done any good to report it when we noticed it because it was about 11 p.m. I did report it the next morning - and was offered only 2000 Marriott points for our trouble. I have stayed in many other Residence Inn properties and usually find them well maintained and extremely pleasant. I would never stay at this one again.
label: neutral

text: The hotel was clean, newer and had an above average breakfast for this chain. Unfortunatley the staff were unengaged, less than friendly and not well trained, all a reflection on the management of the hotel. Upon check-in, with a less than friendly front desk agent, we were given 2 rooms (a room apart from each other) and told that one of our rooms may not be clean. Who hands out dirty rooms? When we went to the room it was apparent someone had been smoking in it and there was a ozone machine still in the room. We went to the desk to ask for another room and were given the room that originally seperated our two rooms (which were adjoining). Why weren't we given these to begin with? At check out there was an adjustment on our bill and during the process the Front Office Supervisor did not say ONE word to us. No how are you, thank you or sorry. In fact the most pleasureable employee we came across was the housekeeping staff! A definite service disaster!

text:
We ended up with this hotel through a Priceline request of 3 star hotels.
This was NOT a 3 star hotel. We understood that New York City prices are generally way out of whack with what you get elsewhere, but the hotel seems to be pretty run down.
Having read other reviews we heard they were amidst renovations, so we tried to get a revamped room. The first room was a sardine can, so we moved to a room with 2 beds (my wife and I slept apart because the beds were so small). The updated room seemed to have a slightly newer bathroom, but not much else.
Problems we had:
- strange smell in room
- screaming kids across hall (not hotel's fault) but since the halls are so small and walls thin, you can hear alot.
- window shade didn't go down letting sunlight in early
- weak shower pressure
On the bright side - the staff was very courteous and the location is good for tourists.
Long and short - DON'T USE PRICELINE FOR HOTELS. We ended up checking out a night early b/c the hotel was so beneath our expectations (and what we paid for), and Priceline has given us nothing but trouble with customer service. Their ratings for hotels have no merit, and their treatment of customers is beneath terrible.
label: negative

text:
Dagda, I really wish I liked you more. It's honestly not you, it's me.

I really wish I could like Dagda more, it has so much that I usually love. Great ale at the bar. A pretty decent selection of wine for a dive bar/student place. Cool interior. Good prices. A great selection of whiskey. But every time I go in it's jammed packed with people, so many people you can't move no matter what time of night it is. And it's sticky hot, probably because of all the people. And it smells. And it's just.... it just never seems worth it to push through all the people for a drink. The staff are friendly enough (they never have much to say but all you should really be looking for in a place like Dagda is a drink suggestion anyway, in my opinion). I enjoy other pubs more that carry the same sort of stuff. 

So yeah, I really honestly wished I enjoyed Dagda more, but I don't. It's not unique to me, just smelly and cramped. I just... don't get it. Like Joe A. said, it just doesn't work for me
label: negative

text: I used grab food mostly, and I'm deliberate to order from within 5km vicinity. Delivery time is inconsistent, more often later than it is on-time. The expected delivered time just keeps extending from what it was communicated when at order stage. Speaking to their riders, they always say they come from more than 10km away. Strong signal that they either don't have enough riders, or they have a massive logic issue in assigning riders.
label: negative

text:
We stayed at this property for 3 nights during August 05 and had no problems. I give it 3 stars because that is what it was, just average. The rate wasn’t that great but the rooms were nice and the location was FANTASTIC! You were pretty much were within walking distance of a lot of attractions and if you weren’t, there are 2 trolley stations very close.
We were picked up at the airport by the shuttle w/i 20 minutes of calling which was nice. It’s only about an 8-10 minute ride to the hotel. The downside of the shuttle was it started at 5am and we had to be at the airport before then so we had to pay for a cab. I didn't like that they would take us to the airport earlier in the shuttle so it ended up a $10 cab ride with tip.
We lucked out and got a huge corner room so space was not a problem at all. The bathrooms were fine and I didn’t have any problems with the shower (i.e. low pressure, cold).
They have a full breakfast that is included every morning which was very good and fast. The only problem is the place is packed during peak eating hours and a table is hard to find. They had a full spread of hot and cold foods.
There is also a manager’s reception everyday from 5:30-7:30 which was very good also. They had snacks and drinks. The section of alcohol was more then I have seen at most other hotels also. They had a beer, wine and some different liquor. This is also something that got packed but the line went fast.
I would say that the concierge was the worst thing about the trip. She was pretty useless. It seemed like the places she suggested were not even close to what we were asking for. At one point we asked for a sports bar and she must have been getting a kickback from this bar because she sent us to a bar that had sports on TV but wasn’t even close to a sports bar. She also told me the hotel bar was a sports bar so after that I didn't give her much credit. The people at the front desk were just as helpful as she was.
Since we were there during the summer the place was packed. The bellboy told me they were 90-100% booked during the summer. Sometime you had to stand there and wait 5 minutes for an elevator but there was a sign they were starting an elevator renovation if thats going to make a difference I dont know.
Overall it was an average stay. If someone asked would I stay there again I think I would if they had better rates but if not I think I would pick another hotel in the area.
label: positive

text: my 2 teenaged children and i stayed in the holiday inn martinque on broadway from june 20 to june 23--it was a great location--due to the fact that we were depending on public transportation it was perfect- the subway was right outside the hotel and penn station was a few blocks away---the staff at the hotel were terrific--we were always asking for directions --micheal who worked in the lobby was great-- he directed us to restaurants--scheduled cabs for us and always helped us out with directions with the subway--the doorman that worked during the day( i don't remember his name) was very personable,funny, and always made sure we were going in the right direction-being a mom alone in the big city with 2 children was scary but the staff at the hotel made me feel right at home---our room was always clean with plenty of towels and hot water- we were in a regular room-small but adequate- nothing luxurious but we had cable and the ventilation was excellent- if you'regoing to spend alot of time in your room you would want something much bigger with more accomadations- but this was fine when you're doing alot of sightseeing and really just needing a place to sleep---the restaurant that was attached was very good-we ate there one afternoon-their servings were large and they had great desserts--their fruit dessert with fresh kiwi and srawberries was divine

text:
the buffet was above the average vegas buffet but a few things could've been done better...

- the layout of the buffet was all on one side but did not understand the placement of food...seafood closest to the register, meats, appetizers, asian cuisine at the very back and desserts in the middle of the buffet... im no expert on where the placement of food should be but didnt understand the asian cuisine at the very back...would think appetizers would be the very back and work you way to the front or it only makes sense...also because of the way the buffet is laid out, lines that form for the crab legs or prime rib congest other areas for diners to grab food and makes things very unorganized

- fruit ....there was hardly any fruit...i spotted some pinapple but there should be more

- price was your average new buffet price for dinner at $44.95...for an extra $15 dollars you are able to hop into the express line to skip the line...didn't think it was worth it too much since the line moved rather quickly

- food: tried quite a few things but the items worth mentioning were the prime rib which was a 3.5 out of 5 stars, hot and cold crab legs was a 3 out of 5 stars because it didnt taste any different from crab legs at other buffets...lamb 4 out of 5 stars was juicy not dry at all 

- desserts : i give the creme brulee 4/5 very easy to eat not too sweet, red bean and coffee mochi 4/5, chocolate covered strawberries were delicious as well

overall the buffet was good but could've been better
label: negative

text:
Randomly Turns Off
These were pretty easy to set up and easily integrate with my Amazon Echos. However, every one of them randomly turns off as if there’s a momentary short or something. I’ll be watching TV sometimes for hours sometimes for a few minutes then the power will suddenly cut out before immediately coming back on. Even when I’m not actively using the things plugged up to them, I can hear them clicking on and off periodically. I never have an issue turning them on or off when I want to, but it’s really annoying having them randomly turn off when I didn’t turn them off. I’d mostly recommend these for functions that don’t require them to remain on for extended periods of time.

text:
I stayed here for four nights in June 2012. I was attending a meeting at the Hyatt next door and this one of the nearest places to the Hyatt and inexpensive.
I am a vegetarian and usually carry some frozen food with me. I needed to microwave it. Now as per hotel staff on duty on most nights I cannot use the only microwave in the breakfast room. However on some days some very helpful and attentive staff at the front desk were available. So there you are.. if you are lucky you would get helpful staff otherwise you have had it.
The WiFi is also very poor in signal strength and I had to use the computer in the lobby for my internet access. However the computer's monitor had a focus problem and most text on it was kind of fuzzy. I wiped my eyeglasses and still they were fuzzy. I called a fellow guest nearby and he confirmed that the problem was indeed the monitor and not my eyes or the spectacles!
The location of course is great with Union station right across. The shuttle service is also very helpful to go around.
I feel this hotel has great promise if only the management decides to overhaul a few glaring deficiencies.
label: neutral

text:
We booked four days stay at this hotel for the site for family of four.
When we arrived there, there was no one help us with the luggage. The valet attendant was not interested in helping us since we are not paying $35 a day for the valet parking. We had to lug all luggage ourselves to 12th floor lobby.
The check in was quick and friendly and we were arranged to the premier floor at 24th floor.
The bedroom had two comfortable beds. It also has a sleeper sofa in the living room. But the living room is very narrow and once the sleeper is open, there is no room to walk around. The fridge cabinet was bolt shut with no way to open it. The TV in the living room was awkward placed and it is hard to see it from the sofa. It did provide free water in the room.
The furniture looks worn. The TV in the bed room was old 27 in CRT instead of LCD.
However, it did have a relative large shower/toilet room, but a single sink was room on the hallway.
Overall, it feel cramped and worn. It did have a partial view to the San Diego Convention Center at San Diego bay between two tall building.
One of the phone with remote handset was broken that I can not call the front desk from it.
If you want to use the internet, you have to pay 10 a night, which is outrageous. But you can go downstair at lobby to get free slow wifi. It did have four free computers for looking up the information and browse the internet.
The swimming pool was small and the gym is cramped though it has a lot of walking machines.
There is a little gift shop at the lobby which is very convenient for emergency stuff.
Regarding to parking, there are free off street parking overnight between 6pm - 8am, but you need to watch out the street cleaning day. You can also park at self-prepaid parking lot with price range from $13 to $7 depends on the location. However, it allows for only 10 hours of continuous parking. Hotel valet parking is $35 but you may have to going around several floors to find the spot (makes you dizzy going around).
Only half of the building is hotel rooms and the rest are offices and San Diego Symphony hall.
It is about 6 blocks from GasLamp districts, and most of the street around the area are pretty deserted. But the area around Gas Lamp districts has a lot of people, bars and shops and is 10 minutes walk from it.
There is free WSJ, USA Today and San Diego newspaper at lobby but not by the door.
One thing I found was pretty annoying was that on check out, we were told we own nothing, and we did not get bill under the door for hassle free check out. But when I went home, I found they tagged $21 on my credit card. I had to call them to correct it.
Overall, my impression of the stay was OK. I chose it because of its downtown location and fancy outside, but it was not what it cracks up to be.
label: neutral

text: أصناف الطعام المقدمه بشكل عام جيدة هناك بعض التنوع في اصناف المطلبق والمعصوب والعريكة اما الفول فنوعين فقط . ميزته التنافسيه في نظري تكمن فقط في تعدد الفروع وتغطيتها لمعظم مناطق جدة اما تميزه في الطعام المقدم لا اظن انه منافس كثيرا المهتمين فعلا بالفول والتميس والمعصوب يعلمون جيدا ان هناك مطاعم اكثر اتقانا وتميزا في الطعام المقدم وباصناف متعدده لكن يضعفها انحسارها في مناطق ممعدودة وربما لايوجد سوى فرع واحد لها . الكادر الذي يقدم الخدمه غير مدرب وأحيانا ينقصه شيء من اخلاق الاحترام والتعامل مع الزبائن في فرع مدائن الفهد في جدة على سبيل المثال : نادرا ما تكاد تجد الكادر العامل يقدم لك الخدمه بوجه بشوش . مشكلة التميس البارد : كثير ما ارفض التميس الي اطلبه وانتظر دقائق انتظار لتميس حار من الفرن طيب اذا زيادة ليش تسوو وتحطوه على جنب ؟ طاولات فارغه ادخل هذا فروع ابو زيد وستجد من الطاولات لايوجد عليها مملحه شطه كمون زيت وهذه المنكهات كلها اساسيه تعتبر مع الاكلات الشعبيه مثل الفول والقلابه وانواعها. في الزحمه تسوء النظافه اذهب الى فرع الكورنيش في اي وقت .. وانظر الى سوء النظافة على الكراسي والطاولات والتكييف الضعيف ايضا خصوصا وانا في ايام الصيف. انا اظن ان صاحب المطعم يريد ترقيع جانب الخدمة والكادر العامل باي احد توفيرا للمال والجهد في التدريب. وهذا ينعكس سلبا في المستقبل .
label: negative

text: I can hardly believe that this inert, turgid and badly staged film is by a filmmaker whose other works I've quite enjoyed. The experience of enduring THE LADY AND THE DUKE (and no other word but "enduring" will do), left me in a vile mood, a condition relieved only by reading the IMDb user comment by ali-112. For not only has Rohmer attempted (with success) to make us see the world through the genre art of 18th century France but, as ali has pointed out, has shown (at the cost of alienating his audience) the effects of both class consciousness and the revolution it inspired through the eyes of a dislikably elitist woman of her times. The director has accomplished something undeniably difficult, but I question whether it was worth the effort it took for him to do so -- or for us to watch the dull results of his labor.
label: negative

text: Eldorado Grill first came on our radar when we tried their Texas torpedos at Taste of Madison. While there's not much new about a bacon wrapped jalapeno popper, their addition of shrimp and the just-right amount of cheese caught our attention. Our two visits to the restaurant since then have both been solid. My spice loving husband is a huge fan of the pork adobo, which although it is offered extra spicy, he finds the heat sufficient in the original preparation. The guacamole chalupas feed my love of all things avocado and cheese. As far as drinks, if you are a tequila fan, you can't go wrong with the 100% agave margarita. I like my margarita to actually taste of tequila and not just sweet and sour, and this margarita fits the bill. We liked it enough on our first visit to bring the in-laws back on their next visit to town- a high vote of approval!

text:
The area around the hotel is full of homeless people and although there are designer shops just down the road it's still not a nice place to be walking about. Otherwise, the location itself was handy for getting most places.
The room itself was nice but we had a few issues. I'm allergic to feather bedding, which isn't an uncommon complaint but although the hotel were able to offer polyester pillows they didn't have any duvets to replace the feather one so it was taken away and we were given a couple extra blankets which weren't as warm and we ended up having to sleep with the heating on which wasn't ideal.
The toilet took forever to flush and you had to hold the push button down for a good ten seconds for it to kick in.
The door to the bathroom had no handle, just a recess in it to pull it forward and back to open. It wasn't the easiest to handle, especially for those with nicely manicured hands. I could also see this as a problem for those with dexterity problems. It's also easy to push it too far open and then it becomes stuck in the recess and is a nuisance to try and get back out.
The room was a little bit scruffy around the edges - some of the light fittings had bits hanging off which isn't what you expect from a hotel that advertises itself as a boutique hotel. The chest of drawers was also sitting unevenly, so everytime you opened one drawer another rolled out and you had to push umpteen drawers in until you hit the right combination to get them all to stay closed again which was annoying.
As far as noise was concerned, we were on the 8th floor and it wasn't an issue although we did sleep with the windows closed because of the duvet problem. Perhaps in warmer weather this might have been an issue.
On the plus side:
A store (walgreens, I think) right next door which was handy for any refreshments, toiletries etc.
Lovely big full length mirror with a plug point beside it to get ready in the main bedroom as well as a nice bathroom mirror with plugpoint as well.
Super comfortable bed.
Spotlessly clean.
The towncar to the airport is a fab service and was a nice treat at the end of our honeymoon for not much more than what we would have paid for a cab, The driver was a lovely guy.
All in all, a nice hotel that is slightly let down by the location and the failure to pay attention to detail.

text:
I've been to Stone Peppers on a number of occasions and overall, the food an service have been good in the restaurant. They have a large selection of pizzas, sandwiches and salads that all have fresh, quality ingredients, and it is a relaxed atmosphere. 

My review would be better overall, but the bar has never been a good experience for me. On one occasion, I went with a friend during a Penguins playoff game. It was crowded, but not excessively so. Since no tables at the bar were available and all the stools were taken, we stood near the bar and waited. It was next to impossible to get any of the bartenders to respond to order drinks. We ran into some other friends who were sitting at the bar and had requested more beers and had been waiting for 20 minutes for their drinks. I had another similar experience when the bar was not crowded; the bartenders just seem to not be interested in serving customers. In both cases it seemed like they were more interested in talking to their friends or flirting with regulars. 

I'll go back for the restaurant, but never again for the bar.
label: negative

text:
Went here during Memorial Day weekend and waited a long time in guest list line, which I expected so I'm not complaining. The venue is nice-looking - very upscale, but it's tiny! Their little "dance floor" area is right in front of the dinky DJ booth, which is located on the way to the bathroom. If you have to pee, you either walk all the way around, or fight through that crowded dance floor of sweaty and wet people. I understand that it was a busy weekend, but even if it wasn't busy, there still isn't much room to move around.

Their floors are super wet too, and they do a horrible job keeping it safe. I saw multiple people slipping and eating shit. They weren't even running. Safety hazard.

They make you check in your bag, and charge you a lot for it.
A margarita cost $44, and it wasn't even that strong.
Too many rules - no splashing, no bringing drinks into the pool (so if we drink alcohol and get dehydrated, we can't go in the pool unless we finish our drink?) and you can't place your belongings near the plants because it will crush them. They really pay employees to guard their plants and move towels that were touching them. 

So while I did have fun because I was with a fun group of people, it was kind of annoying having a guy blow his whistle throughout the entire event. Also, people who went there also seemed a bit more uptight than at other Vegas pool parties. It's definitely more of a tame fashion party where they stand around and look good, unlike EBC where everyone is trying to have a good time dancing it up.
label: negative

text: My fiancee and I stayed at Hotel Giraffe for four days in mid-March, and we loved every moment of it. The room was spacious, especially for Manhattan. Service was consistently excellent, from the front desk at check-in to the turn-down service (complete with chocolates and soft music on the stereo) each night. The continental breakfast was lovely, and the wine and cheese each night was a wonderful idea (as was the Internet-connected laptop at one table). It was a splurge for us, but we definitely intend to splurge on Hotel Giraffe again!
label: positive

text:
I went for dinner to the buffet. It was $27.99 per person, not including the alcohol pass.
The food was just okay, sure you get as much as your glutenous heart/stomach can desire but a lot of okay isnt as good as just enough of great. With so many options on the strip for dinner $30 per person can get you some pretty amazing meals.
They have a lot of italian and french inspired foods to choose from. Yes they have crab legs, but they are cold and not that big. Also prepare to bring you ingenuity because they dont provide crackers or those handy small forks. Even the roast beef and steak are on the lukewarm side.
The pastas are decent but again the quality of the selection of food is only okay at best.

Look around for a better quality of food buffet or more than likely an actual restaurant. Plus then you can avoid all the people running into you while your trying to pile your plate high.
label: negative

text:
My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton City Center last weekend for him to attend a conference...I tagged along as I had never been to Indy before. The lobby was spacious and attractive, with several comfortable chairs both alone and in groups (which was important since the free wifi could only be used in the lobby). The desk staff was overwhelmed with so many people checking in at the same time, but despite the lines, they remained cheerful and helpful. As we checked in, I jokingly asked if they would like to give us the honeymoon suite for the same price as the room we had booked, and was amazed when our clerk searched and did upgrade us to a suite for the same price!
Our suite was great! Large, spacious rooms on the 20th floor, attractively decorated . The living area had a comfortable chair and sofa and large flatscreen TV with HD satellite channels, and a wetbar with microwave and small fridge and coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee. Large double doors closed off the bedroom, which had a very comfortable king sized bed, another chair with ottoman, desk, and TV. The bath area featured a huge vanity in the bedroom and another smaller sink and vanity in the tub area. One thing I really appreciated was the lighting----the vanity lights were bright and their were lamps everywhere you would want them----something that is often skimped on in hotels. I hate a dark room, or one where you can't read because the lamps are too dim or not where you want them.
The location was perfect for exploring downtown---just a block away from monument circle, a few blocks from the capital and museums, with restaurants and shopping all close enough that we did not move the car once we checked in.
On the business side, my husband reported that the conference rooms were comfortable and easily accomodated the large number of people and various meetings that were being help with his convention.
The only negative comments I have are that the free wifi was only available in the lobby, not in the room, and that it was not working for most of our stay. Also, we could hear a lot of street noise in our room----sirens, horns, etc. And, we had to pay $23 a night for parking in the garage. But, we had a great stay, and highly recommend this hotel!
label: positive

text: 대남 파견된 100여명 간첩으로부터 시작된 광주사건 그로인해 많은 무고한 광주 시민들이 선동되고 정권과 싸우고 다치고 피해를 받고 분노가 차올랐겠죠. 518유공자명단 공개하고 진상규명하여 각종 유공자 혜택받으며 관료직등 앉아있는 진짜 간첩찾아내 잡아야합니다.절대 광주 사건 관련된 모든 분들을 간첩이라고 얘기하는 것이 아님을 말씀드립니다.일반시민들은 간첩들에게 이용당했을 뿐입니다.

text:
ACE makes my favorite beef chow fun, EVER.

I've never had a dish I disliked here up until last night. Hawaiian BBQ beef! Wow, not what I expected at all. I was expecting grilled beef slices (think bulbogi) but what we got was sliced up meat (similiar to the look, consistency and taste of pot roast) covered with teriyaki sauce. Umm, for reals? Never would've I imagined. But that's what happens when you take someone who is not too familiar with Chinese food and you do the everyone choose one dish and we'll share route. It was so bad I had to comment, "When you go to a Chinese place, order Chinese dishes." lol.

Anyway, no worries beef chow fun made everything better.

I've been here numerous times now and have enjoyed everything else I've had. Some of my favorites include:

-Beef with Scramble Egg sauce over rice.
-Salt & Pepper Squid
-Salt & Pepper Chicken Wings
-Orange Chicken
-Baked Pork Chop spaghetti
-Mongolian Chicken
-Fried Rice
-Lo Mein

I haven't really ventured towards their more traditional chinese dishes but some day I finally will. I saw stir fry pickled chinese mustard that really intrigued me. It's one of my favorite homestyle dish. But I'll save that for a solo meal because it has an acquired taste.

Oh and their taro coconut tapioca drink is yummy. It reminds me of a taro dessert my mom would make. It's creamy, coconut milk with taro chunks, sweetened and with little clear tapioca pearls. 

*Also, their menu stated that they will cook fresh raw seafood for you. You just have to bring in the receipt alongside. It's $5 each dish and you can choose from a long list of sauces/styles you would like to have it prepared. Very convienent with Mekong Market across the street. Yummm... I think I may have to return with a lobster to have them make me lobster with gravy over e fu noodles.
label: neutral

text:
You've go to be kidding me. Through no choice of my own, I was made to stay at this joke of a hotel. First off, the website falsely advertises the hotel rooms. Aside, from a small part of the hotel in Tower 3 that has been renovated and looks like the pictures on the website, the rest of the hotel is old, run down and filthy. The toilets were leaking and there was even an empty beer can on the floor of one of the rooms. My roommates and I switched 3 times, before settling into the 4th room on the renovated side of the hotel. Problem with the final (renovated) room: 2 double beds for 3 women. Additionally, the bathroom didn't have a ventilation system, so expect a stuffy, humid, sometimes not so fresh-smelling bathroom and a sink practically over the toilet and the room was ridiculously small. Also, don't look so close because these rooms are not that clean either. As for the unrenovated rooms...yellow sheets, stains on the carpet, marks on walls, dirty windows. A motel would've been an upgrade.
Neighborhood: be careful at night! (ps- I'm a New Yorker so not a lot frightens me)
As for the hospitality, I did not care for it at all.
Finally, My perfume went missing somewhere during one of the moves and was "recovered" a day later only after I made an accusation of theft.
Saving Grace: Should you have to stay at this hotel (for ex, because a tornado blew away all the other hotels in San Francisco), then try the Cucumber Martini at the hotel bar. Ask for it, it's not on the menu, but any of the bartenders will make it for you.
Had it not been for the conference, I would've checked out immediately. I'm never staying here again.
... if you don't believe me, then just compare the photos I've uploaded with the photos on the Hilton website.
label: negative

text:
Stay 4+1 night in this hotel in october. Overall a very good experience, as I had ambassador status I was upgraded both time to a high floor room, both time very quiete (I'm normally very noise sensitive). Room was very nice and well decorated. Bathroom it's just perfect with the big shower. Wifi was free due to the ambassador status. On the corner of the hotel you have the shake shack who server one of the best burger in town. Time square is just at one block
Now the two negative point for me. Check in was a bit long, the priority desk was closed, nothing unacceptable, but just a little bit annoying after a long intercontinental flight. The main problem occur when I left the hotel only for one night (going to DC and back to NYC at the same hotel) I ask the hotel if they can keep the luggages. They told me that for security issue (close to time square) they can't store luggage's (I will not discuss security rules, but what is the difference if I keep the room and store them inside?), and they have only a external solution (Schwarz Storage) near Penn Station open from 8 to 11 pm. I ask the concierge if they have another solution as my train was at 7am so before the opening hours, but they told me it's the only way, and I should bring the luggage the evening before. It's the first time I use concierge service, and I was expecting something else for this hotel standard (but maybe I have to high expectation). Well, I follow the advice and bring the luggage to the Schwarz location at 10pm the night before. I'm use to the european standard on luggage storage, and I was very surprise when I arrive to the location, a very strange place, dark, looks like a appartement and not like a storage room. They seems to do the pricing base on the face, and they charge me 3 days (actually it was only 48hours) because they does not count the hours but by day. I will NEVER store a expensive luggage their, and I do not understand why a hotel like IC recommend this solution, it's really not at the hotel standard, even backpacker will avoid this place.
I encourage the hotel manager to visit the Schwarz place and realize why the need definitely to find a better solution (I'm sure they often face this luggage storage request) and not sending customer their. Maybe share a storage room with the Barclay.

text: Досрочно 15.12.22 погасил ипотеку в полном объеме. Представители банка 16.12.22 сообщили, что снятие обременения с квартиры произойдет автоматически в течение 15 рабочих дней. 09.01 и 10.01 я обращался в службу поддержки банка с просьбой уточнить статус снятия обременения, ответ всегда один - в течение 15 рабочих дней, придет смс . При этом от разных сотрудников поступает разная информация - одни говорят, что ничего делать не надо, другие говорят, что нужно выслать копии документов для инициирования процесса снятия обременения с квартиры. Срок 15 рабочих дней - истекает 12.01. Общение со службой поддержки ВТБ бесполезны, они только могут составить заявку которая будет рассматриваться в течение 3 рабочих дней . Но я не верю, что получу вообще ответ на заявку (есть заявка в работе по предыдущей проблеме, которая рассматривается уже почти месяц и приходит постоянно смс требуется дополнительное время для работы по обращению -..... Результат сообщим Вам до... ) Через 14 рабочих дней я обязан предоставить банку, в котором у меня рефинансирование информацию о снятии обременения. Банк не в состоянии предоставить элементарную информацию о том, была ли запущена процедура снятия обременения или нет!
label: negative

text: This place is great. It reminds me of the vibe that you get in a Pub in Ireland. You can actually sit around and have a nice normal conversation over a beer or two. There is some music playing and there are a few TVs on but nothing that makes you have to strain to hear someone. Being in an industrial area after hours means there is nothing close to an issue with parking and I love the food truck option. We went last night and the Filipino truck \"Hey Joe\" was there. The owner brought the food inside to us which I thought was great. I honestly would not change a thing about this place. What a great way to go out a socialize over a local beer and a hip food truck meal! My only hope is that the place doesn't get too popular that it becomes insanely crowded and ruins that chill vibe they have going. Bravo Four Peaks!
label: positive

text:
I am not a fan of olives, but I am most definitely a fan of Bread and Olives!

I popped in later this afternoon for a wee brew and can report their nibbles looked delicious. Selling a range of good quality Mediterranean fillings, fresh little cartons of locally sourced milk and some chilled ginger beers, it's a great stop off for a healthy, continental snack. They sell a number of pre-prepared and create your own sandwiches, and their mix of roast veg looked lovely. Their breakfast menu looked tasty, with everything from toast to porridge on the menu. They also had a small deli selection adorning their shelves which included garlic cloves and Tea Pigs bags. I don't know where the pig in Pig Tea comes from but they sure looked nice.

The girl working today was relaxed and very friendly, a damn sight chipper than most uptight coffee shops I've been to recently! Lovely. With their rustic bread and bohemian cafe feel, I would definitely go back for lunch. They also do outside catering; a tasty option for weddings and other special occasions!
label: neutral

text:
Отсутствие компетенции среди персонала - основной минус отеля. 
Приехали в 3 ночи с дороги, уставшие, заранее позвонили, уточнили все детали. 
Парковка есть - есть, на месте оказалось, что шлагбаум никто не откроет. Если припарковаться рядом, то готовьтесь, что в 7 утра ваш телефон в номере будет разрываться от звонков ресепшен, хотя всего можно было избежать:) 
По приезду в отель ждите, что с Вас захотят взять дополнительную плату за раннее заселение, хотя мы и суток не пробыли в отеле, всего 6 часов. 
Разборки в 3 утра что, почему и как, проблемы с заселением по иностранному документу, звонки в 7 утра о парковке, уборка номеров без стука и проверки отсутвия гостей в номере, кстати, табличка «не беспокоить» на двери для них не в счет и номер в 20 кВ метров прожитый временем - все это за 5.500₽ в сутки. 
Извинений за неудобства, кстати говоря, вы тоже не услышите, лишь раздражение со стороны персонала и желание поскорее выселить вас из отеля. 
Крайне не советуем. 
Полное разочарование в отеле. 
Сомнения в искренности отзывов только усилились.
label: negative

text: 디줠트를 먹으러 할아버지 공장으로 가던 길에 좋아 보이는 카페가 여럿 있어 중간중간 계속 걸음을 멈추게 했다 그중 승리한 카페 담향 커피..! 꽤 넓은 카페인데 좌석을 널찍하게 배치해 공간 자체가 여유로운? 비어있는? 느낌이다 파운드케이크가 두 가지 있어 하나씩 픽하고 음료도 여러 가지 얻어 마셔봄 일단 모두의 이목을 끈 구름 말차는 생긴 것부터 너무 좋았다 쫀쫀한 폼이 마차 위에 한가득 올라가있어 정말 구름 같은 비주얼! 휘휘 저어 고루 섞이게 한 뒤 마시는데 말차의 씁쓸함은 거의 느껴지지 않고 달콤해서 맛있었다 히비스커스 베리 에이드는 밑에 베리 알갱이가 있다 한 입 먹으면 딸려 올라오는데 그 알갱이가 상큼 달콤해서 음료의 맛을 더 업 시켜줘 굿굿 음료 자체도 깔끔하고 좋았다 내가 주문한 건 땅콩 슈퍼 너로 위에 올라간 크림에서 땅콩의 맛이 꽤 진하게 나는 음료였다 하지만 밑의 커피와 함께 마시면 왜인지 땅콩 맛이 별로 안남 그래서 처음엔 땅콩 맛이 생각보다 안 나네... 했는데 크림만 떠먹으니 확 느껴져서 오..! 했다하지만 같이 마셔야 하는 음료인데 같이 마실 땐 잘 안 느껴진다니!! 약간 아쉬웠던 점이다 쑥 파운드는 생각보다 쑥 향이 미미. 포슬포슬한 파운드 자체는 나쁘지 않았지만 쑥 파운드라는 생각은 별로 안 들었다 곁들이는 크림은 그 자체가 달콤해서 크림만 떠먹어도 맛있었음 레몬 파운드는 약간 레몬향이 나고 위에 아이싱이 도톰하게 되어있었다 아이싱이 달콤해서 딱히 크림을 같이 안 먹어도 괜찮았음 개인적으로 맛은 쑥이 좀 더 취향 베이커리보단 음료가 좋았던 느낌. 파운드 말고 마들렌이나 스콘, 휘나 이 시에도 있던데 구움 과자류는 어땠을지 궁금하다 지나가다 그냥 들어가 본 곳이지만 꽤 괜찮았던 카페!
label: positive

text: After an unimpressive visit to Sky Bar at Trader's Hotel to celebrate my partner's birthday, we decided to visit to Marini's on 57th. Took a taxi to Marini's which is located on the 57th floor of a building immediately adjacent to the Mandarin Oriental hotel. Upon entering the building, we had to take three elevator rides (changing elevator banks twice). At the 56th floor, before the final elevator ride to Marini's, we spotted Nobu restaurant and made a mental note to come back and try Nobu's but never did. Maybe next trip? Anyway, we finally got out of the elevator on the 57th floor, and were met by a pleasant but harried restaurant staff member who asked us if we preferred indoor or outdoor seating. We replied "indoor" and she led us through the noisy and frenetic premises, which were busy with all the "beautiful people" hobnobbing and wanting to be seen. Finally we arrived at a table and were given drink menus, at which point, the staff member promptly disappeared. Only then did we look around and realize that this was actually an outdoor table. The truncated view of a portion of one of the Petronas towers immediately adjacent was interesting, and a different perspective, but we were not really too impressed. We decided on our drinks, and were waiting for a waitress to show up to take our order, when a couple of gentlemen sat at the next table and lit up cigars. Now, I have smoked a few stogies in my day, but we were just not in the mood to sit there inhaling what to us was malodorous second-hand cigar smoke. So, after about 5 more minutes of waiting fruitlessly for a waitress, and enduring smelly cigar smoke, we decided to just pack it in and leave, which we did. Not an impressive experience at all. Now that we have been to both Sky Bar and Marini's on 57th, we will not care to revisit either. "Been there, done that." Just not impressed. Maybe our expectations were too high?
label: neutral

text: I had booked the flight to and from Nassau in November for travel for March 15 to 22. The government advised people of not travelling outside of Canada on March 13. Around this time airlines began to revise their refund policy. I had completed a online form for Sunwing at their request due to a high call volume when the government made a stronger advisory about not going outside of Canada. The form was notice of cancellation. When I contacted Sunwing after 2 days of trying to call Sunwing I was advised that I would only be getting a travel voucher for future use because the flight was on the 15 and not the 17th or later. text:
For the past few years I have been getting my sushi/sashimi fix from all you can eat joints. Knowing the quality of those joints, I knew I was in for a huge treat by coming to a legitimate sushi bar. 

The atmosphere is very intimate and is great for date nights and small group get togethers. 

Onto the main course: 
- 24 piece sashimi
- summer roll 
- scallop roll
- wasabi ginger roll


All of the rolls were fantastic and the sushi chefs here are top notch!

4 Stars, though I almost wish they hadn't been so successful...I will never look at AYCE the same way ever again =P

text:
Well, that was a mistake. I thought I would just pop in for a nice and light meal, making a healthy choice for a late breakfast. It's a "bistro" so they should have light stuff, right?

Well, it turns out that on Sunday, Bistro La Bon does a huge spread for a brunch buffet. And since I simply can't resist a buffet, I ended up "forgetting" my plan for a light meal and ended up stuffing my face with a couple plates of absolutely excellent food.

I don't know if they rotate out the meals, so your spread might be different. I had hand-rolled mozzarella, Swedish meatballs, beef brisket (a little salty, but tender), smoked salmon, hand-made sliced ciabbata bread, yummy potato salad and a pile of Caesar salad. Oh, but there's more. In the kitchen, they hide the hot foods and they are all included with your buffet. So I also had some scrambled eggs (fluffy!) and bacon, a chocolate waffle (I only had half) and the topper, a slice of French toast that was topped with real (not canned!) whipped cream and powdered sugar and syrup.

So much for light, eh?

I opted to sit at the bar and so I had excellent service. A really good deal at $24 or so with tip.
label: neutral

text:
Just came back from my 2 night stay at Aria. What a beautiful building inside and out. It's modern with personality!

Unfortunately, service was terrible. We were supposed to get a sky suite, instead they stuck us in a regular room on the 5th floor with terrible view. After many calls to the frontdesk and complaints, they finally agreed to change our room the next day. Easy said than done. The next day, they apparently did not have record of anything downstairs, so we had to go through the process of asking for a better room all over again. 

Though we finally got a better room on the 31st floor, I did not appreciate the hassle. They definitely need to work on their service.
label: negative

Pretty disappointing, but maybe half a dozen straight guys reluctantly dragged there for the drag show is not their targrt market.

We got there an hour before the show began, there was no-one there, the bouncer got a bit stroppy with us, so we hung around for a little bit and then decided nope, not for us, we're off....if we had shown up later in the evening it might have had a different vibe and the end result might have been better. Ah well.

text: هل هذا معنى أن تكون فلسطينيا؟ كل ماجال بخاطرى ذلك السؤال حين استرجعت السنوات المارة بالرواية. عين حوض المكان الذى شهد نشأة درويش وحسن ،صباهم وحبهما ومرحهما أنى له أن يكون مقر أوجاعهما ؟ . مر بخاطرى وفاة باسمة ووفاء داليا لها فى زراعة الورود المحببة لها تلك الغجرية التى ما إختزلت جهدا للعبور بعائلتها صبرها . إنتقالا لبداية الغزو الصهيونى الذى ابتدأ بفطر قلب درويش لحظة ان قتلوا غنوش وفطوم وأرقدوه بقية حياته على كرسى متحرك . فتنحدر دمعتك لتفاجئك ضربة مصوبة لقلب الغجرية بضياع وليدها الصغير إسماعيل ذلك الذى أصبح دافيد ليعش الباقى من عمره مشتتا بين ان يكون مسلما أو يهوديا ؟ ليبقوا طويلا فى جنين فتأتى آمال للحياة لتروى لنا ما يعنيه ماهى مرارة الوطن الفانى ؟ فتنبت بين أحضان والدها وحكاياته ومشاغباتها مع هدى رفيقة الدرب والصبا لتنتهى أحلامها يوم ان يتآمر العالم لحرمانها من دفء الأب لتحملها الأخت ماريان للكنيسة لمداوة جراحها الجسدية لكن من له أن يعالج إنتنان جرحها النفسى وذنبها الباقى معها لحظة أن تركت أمها وحيدة وانكرت معرفتها ؟فتعود ثانية لتجد داليا وقد هامت فى اللاوعى راوية لنا كل صراع دار بخاطرها وكل إحساس حبسته بداخلها توصية لكلمة امها لحظة ان رأت يوسف عائدا فتحتضنه بإشتياق متذكرة نحيب فاطمة ورسالة أخيها بوجوب الرحيل لتعش وسط كل ذلك حتى تفارق الروح المهترئة جسد داليا فيقررون رحيلها للمنحة المعطاءة لها قاضية أربعة سنوات بين جدران الملجأ مع صديقاتها الكولومبيات ومنى جلايطة مرورا بحضن الآنسة حيدر الأول والأخير يوم أن غادرت فتستمر بتقدمها لتحصل على منحة فى الولايات المتحدة ناسية أصولها محاولة التخلص م حياة اللاجئين لتنفض كل ذلك مستمعة لصوت أخيها يوسف وقد جمعه الحب مع فاطمة طالبا منها العودة إلى لبنان فتتكبل بحب ماجد الذى لم يجف يوما من قلبها عائدة مرة أخرى لبنسلفانيا ظنا أنها الملاذ لعائلتها وعائلة أخيها محاولة الوصول لطريق لجمع شملهم فيموت العمر تحت أنقاض القصف مع جسد ماجد وبطن فاطمة المشقوقةبعيون مرتعبة ووجه فلسطين مصحوبا بصوت أخيها المرتعب والحانق على أحلامه الضائعة لتضع وليدتها سارة بانية بينها جدار الخوف لتنمو حياتها دون أن تعلم لكم أحبتها آمال . صوت دافيد العائد لهامع إبنه يعقوب إتهام يوسف بأنه من قام بعملا إرهابيا رغبة سارة فى العودة لوطنها مارين بالعم آرى ليروى لهم تضحيات صديق طفولته حسن عائدين لجنين لتتقابل آمال مع صديقة عمرها هدى فتتلاحما كجسد واحد منصور الكائن المرهف جميل النابض بقلبه براعم حب سارة لتموت قبل أن يرويها العمر ليال القصف التى إقتربت آمال بها مع سارة قاصة لها الحكايات مع هدى منتظرين من يخرجهم بعد ان أنهكهم العطش والجوع نظرات آمال للجندى حمايتها لإبنتها لتنتهى معاناتها بموت دافئا فى أحضان سارة إحياء ذكرى آمال فى قلب إبنتها شبيهة مالك قلبها ماجد لتنتهى ببقاء يوسف ناجيا ومحاولته للعودة لحماية جسد فانى . ليتنى أستطيع تذكر كل ما فى تلك الرواية لأسرده لكن اكتفيت وذبحنى كل الألم التشبيهات وصوت الناى كانوا معى بكل صفحة الدفء والحب الأبدى الموت المحيط بهم لن يمروا بمخيلتى مرور الكرام تستحق خمسة نجوم عن جدارة .
label: positive

text:
Stayed here before flying back to the UK, Saturday night and all we could hear in the room was the wedding in the function rooms below. This did finish at midnight but would have liked to get to sleep earlier. Next morning up with the sun as the LAX Kennel Club is located just behind the hotel and the dogs were barking from sunrise.
If you stay here ask for a room facing the road not the airport (there is very little noise from the planes surprisingly) just noise from everything else.
Staff very pleasant, on the way out we stayed at the Hilton across the road much quieter and a better nights rest.
label: negative

text: This airline is truly awful, and truly incompetent. They don't care. And they're unscrupulous and disingenuous, aka crooks. I flew to Vallarta from SFO via Mexico City. Outbound was an hour late. They changed my connection flight despite our arriving on time for me to make the original connection. Had a four hour layover as a result. All of that was inconvenient, but within the realm of airline travel in our times. The real issue was the return. I checked in online, had my boarding passes, arrived on time and was ready to board. When I checked in at the desk, they told me I was bumped because of a "credit card problem." The roundtrip had been fully paid for and posted two months prior so I knew that was nonsense. I argued, pleaded, used logic and my fluent Spanish. I called for the manager all to no avail. Ten stoic employees observing my rancor, nothing. Long story short, I had to buy a one-way return on another airline (no way was I going to reward bad behavior by rebooking with them). Another day in Vallarta on the weekend and another night of hotel are not the end of the world, but my nerves and usual motto of "assuming good intentions" in people took a hit. It's tragic that the flagship carrier of a nation of otherwise good and honest people should be marred by the actions of the few. Luckily, I had paid with credit card that treated me like a customer and refunded me 50% of the fare, but still. Caveat emptor.
label: negative

text:
A friend and I stopped here for breakfast prior to a hike at Red Rock Canyon. I'm glad this was a place we decided to try. 

I ordered a small portion of coconut pancakes and my friend ordered a Dutch baby. My breakfast consisted of 3 pancakes, medium size, and some butter, maple syrup, and tropical fruit syrup. The pancakes were already dusted with confectioners sugar so I just used a small amount of the tropical fruit syrup. It was very good and so were the pancakes.

My friend liked his Dutch baby. He also had two eggs and they were done nicely.

Service was very good. The server came around a couple of times to give us more coffee or freshen what we had. She was a very pleasant person besides being very competent. This is a will return breakfast place. Oh, and the hike was just over 6 miles and we survived thanks partially to the good breakfast with which we started!
label: neutral

text: I came here for dinner to celebrate one of my friends birthdays. There were 6 of us and the bill was almost $1000. I understand it's dinner and a show but we couldn't even see the show (Btw, there's a LET live entertainment tax charge). The stage was blocked on so many levels from where our table was. The performers go around the restaurant but we still barely got to see them. The entire place was also very crowded and awkward. They have these huge carts they push around to serve food and dessert. It got slammed into my friends chair on multiple occasions. \n\nAnyways, the food itself was alright. We got the beef Wellington with a BUNCH of other sides. Our waiter told us that what we ordered wasn't enough so he was going to double some of the orders with his judgement. Somehow he convinced us to agree... Which I think was a huge mistake. It ended up being waaaaay too much food. We were all pretty stuffed by the time the main course came out. Then we had dessert too. Oh well. I'm most likely not coming back here again which kinda sucks because I had such high hopes for this place after reading all the reviews :(
label: negative

text: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Roosevelt in mid March and had a wonderful stay. The lobby is spectacular and welcoming. A Travelzoo promo put us in touch with the Roosevelt; only steps from Grand Central Station, a couple blocks from Fifth Avenue and really close to Time Square. The front desk staff were great and when our room was not ready provided a complementary glass of wine and appetizer for us while we waited. Our Superior King room was excellent and when the heat malfunctioned we were upgraded to a suite on our second night. Previous reviews about rude front desk personnel are not consistent with our experience. The breakfast buffet and the staff was a pleasant way to start our days - a warm welcome each morning, great coffee, great selection of tastey choices. The rooms were great - beds very, very comfy. We enjoyed our workouts in the fitness centre every day - fresh fruit always available. If we return to New York we will definitely be staying here!
label: positive

text: Bo Derek will not go down in history as a great actress. On the other hand, starting in the 1980s, actual acting talent seemed to be less and less of a required ability in Hollywood, so Bo could very well have gone onto bigger and better things after the big box office take of Blake Edwards' "10." That is if she hadn't allowed her husband, John Derek, to take over her career. Numerous Playboy spreads and bad movies like this one (this one in particular) directed by John destroyed what momentum she had and made her the butt of many a joke. In the 1980s it was assumed that you could put a certain personality in a certain movie and it would be box office gold. John figured that putting Bo in a movie wherein she was nude for much of the running time would make people flock to the theaters after the 10 hype. Maybe if the movie had been any good perhaps. This version of Tarzan has got to be the all time worst of the many iterpretations of Burrough's lord of the jungle, a slap in the face to character's book and film legacy. Tarzan is in fact an after thought as the film is primarily a vehicle for Bo's breasts and Richard Harris' wonderful over acting (remember, the pair had worked together in Orca). His scenery chewing helps you to stay awake during the boredom of it all and yes, the film is quite boring. Nothing really exciting happens and the few action scenes seem to have been shot by someone in a trance. Bo's body can only get you so far. Miles O'Keeffe who played Tarzan at least would go onto a long and enjoyable B movie career and Richard Harris can put this behind him after his recent acting triumphs, but Bo and John Derek never recovered from this fiasco and future collaborations between the two only served to show why his directing career and her acting career died in the first place.And how did the orangutan get to Africa?
label: negative

text:
In terms of price and room size, the signature is a no-brainer. You can regularly get 900sqft 1br's for just over $100/night. This coming with full kitchen (with large fridge. Def make a drink/snack run beforehand), two bathrooms, balcony, a king size bed and a pull out queen bed in the main room. Sick. The rooms are modern and have desks, FREE WIFI and adjustable flat screens (make sure to tune to the last channel!)

You can walk to the Wet Republic (although there are 3 pools at The Signature) and the MGM restaurant area in about 5 min using the moving walkways. So, is it on the strip? Nope. But it's mighty close to the MGM. Anything else requires a cab ride. There are plenty of cabs on premises so don't be worried. 

There are 3 towers, each with their own check-in/out, valets and bellhops. Tower one has a Starbucks and a bar lounge, Tower two has an awesome deli and I've yet to venture into tower tre. This is the place to stay if you're looking to catch a good nights sleep while raging in the Vegas.

text: That is exactly what happened to me at the Radisson hotel located at 11350 LBJ @ Jupiter, Dallas, Texas 75238. On the evening of June 9, 2012 ,after going to watch my daughter graduate from college around 9:00. I returned to the hotel to find that someone had came into my room and robbed me of everything i owned. I noticed there was no forced entry so i knew that someone had a key. I walked down to the front desk and approached the gentleman at the desk and ask him who all had a access to my room he replied "no one". I explained to him my situation.then went back to my room to call the police. After I phoned the police i went back down to see if they had surveilence he replied only in the entrance/exits and front desk. Then he proceeded to tell me that he had made a terrible mistake and gave a key to my room to a young woman that he had seen me talk to in the lobby the day before. Needless to say she robbed me blind.
label: negative

text:
So far so good. I've been here a couple times, firstly because i was very hungover, wanted a panini and couldn't find the place i was planning on going so i went here.

I asked for a bacon, brie and cranberry panini, but they were out of paninis (it was about 3pm so this was fair enough), but she gave me a couple of other options and i had a toasted baguette instead. No complaints at all and it was delicious.

Second time was on my lunch break at work. I asked for the same again (creature of habit) but this time they didn't have any brie. I was a little saddened by this, but i prompted them for substitute suggestions and we decided upon mozzarella. It wasn't the same but still tasty.

It is pretty much like most sandwich shops, they the staff are lovely and friendly, prices are fair (panini was £2.85) and there is a wide selection to choose from. So far so good anyway :)
label: neutral

text: This was not our first choice for our recent trip to San Antonio. It is located on the Riverwalk which is a plus. The breakfast and the evening reception were both pluses as well. Be prepared to walk, especially if they put you in the new part of the hotel. You have to navigate a maze of elevators to different floors and then hallways to get to your room. The rooms are average with beds that are below par. We had to call to get our room cleaned on the second day of our stay. The rooms were clean though and most of the staff were very accommodating. If all of your planned activities are in the downtown area, you will not need a car and you can avoid the valet parking fees.

text:
Pretty decent. My date (a Korean BBQ aficionado) even gave an almost imperceptible nod of approval.

The service was fast and friendly. Restaurant is a little cold, but once the grill fired up and we knocked back some Hite, we were fine.

We chose the 4-meat option for the AYCE. Good, decently marinated beef and pork ribs. Avoid the shrimp which were mushy like they'd been frozen for years. gross. Most of the traditional accompaniments were there. Although no little bowl of sea salt. :-(

All in all, good value for the money. I'll go back. AND, they get an extra star for having free sticks of gum next to the toothpicks on your way out.

That'll do Pig. That'll do.

text: Beltane is a really fascinating flurry of dance, partial nudity (all very tasteful and significant in meaning of course) and general celebration. It's also a pyromaniac's dream, what with all the fire waving that goes on during the evening. I came along to Beltane for the first time last year, and had very little idea what to expect, well aside from the fact people would be swigging away at whatever potent mixture they could find, but this is of course, standard for any Scottish festivity. \n\nThe festival takes place on the striking and very scenic Calton Hill, so before the event even started, the atmosphere was set by the environment, and it got really exciting as the crowds started to build in anticipation of a bit of pagan revelry. The actual festival is a traditional procession, to welcome in the spring, and to celebrate the fertility of the earth. The procession really is something to see, and the beginning of the event, with the drum beats and obligatory lashings of fire, was truly striking. The procession then goes through various stages, of ritual dancing and celebration, which you follow round the hill, although I think it's easier to follow properly when you've been to the festival a few times, as I ended up getting a bit lost in the crowd. Clear some space for the 30th April, you'll enjoy it.
label: neutral

text:
This is a very good trail for hikers of all levels, which is why we almost always take our out-of-town guests here rather than some other trails around town. Parking is easy (except perhaps for some very busy windows), no special equipment or even fancy shoes are really required, and the scene is a very good showcase of Arizona beauty. You can run it, walk it, or take it in at a leisurely pace.

While there are just a couple of steep sections mostly at the start, the climb isn't rough at all and the trail is very well established. It's fairly wide throughout, so it accommodates a couple of people in each direction. It is a "there and back" rather than a loop, which is actually nice for people who may not want to make the whole trek or for less active hikers that may tire more easily. While you may encounter some runnners, most people know proper trail etiquette (we all know there are some party poopers out there but they are few and far between). 

The only feature I wish were different is the dog policy. With the popularity of the trail, I understand the restriction and it is easier to keep clean this way, but I do miss my four-legged friends. For being a quick drive from town, this is a terrific go-to hike.
label: neutral

text:
Qualität sehr gut, für Unterwassereinsatz bedingt geeignet
Der BlitzWolf Selfie Stick hat eine sehr gute Qualitätsanmutung. Er wirkt sehr stabil, der Griff ist angenehm ummantelt. Sowohl der Anschluss einer Actioncam ist möglich, als auch einer Kamera mit klassischem Gewindeanschluss (max. 500 g). Am unteren Ende befindet noch ein 1/4 Zoll-Gewinde zum Anschluss an ein z. B. kleines Dreibeinstativ. In der Beschreibung wird zwar die Wasserdichtigkeit angegeben und ein Einsatz z. B. bei Regen dürfte kein Problem sein, aber der Stick ist wohl nicht schwimmfähig und damit z. B. für Schnorchler nur dann geeignet, wenn man sich sicher ist, ihn niemals versehentlich loszulassen, ansonsten ist er samt Kamera weg. Deshalb nur 4 Punkte, ansonsten aber empfehlenswert.
label: positive

text: I had booked a return flight from Copenhagen to Mombasa and back. Unfortunately I missed my connecting flight going to Mombasa. I booked another flight to Mombasa and I immediately contacted Kenya Airways customer support to find a solution for my return flight. I wrote and called them for a week before I heard back from Kenya Airways. Fortunately the reply was (in writing) that my return ticket was confirmed. When I went to Mombasa airport to fly back they could not find my ticket. I showed them the email with the confirmation and the Kenya Airways lady in Mombasa agreed that it said my ticket was confirmed. Head office refused to let me onboard unless I purchased a new ticket. I did so to come home to my family and I was advised to contact customer service when I got back to get my money back. Then followed several months where I have been writing with Kenya Airways Customer Support. All sort of excuses came up claiming I had the wrong visa, to me being a student and other lies. Finally they concluded that in reality I had not purchased a new ticket, instead I had paid a penalty fee for missing my original flight. I then provided Kenya Airways with a copy of my receipt from Mombasa airport that clearly states that I had to my a new ticket. Since then Kenya Airways have ignored my emails. I am really shocked how Kenya Airways has tried to avoid taking responsibility and done so by lying, bullying and inventing stories to make me drop my claim. I followed every procedure the moment I missed my plane and I truly trusted and believed Kenya Airways when they wrote me that my ticket was confirmed. The lesson learned is apparently that you cannot trust Kenya Airways.
label: negative

text:
Professionelles Aussehen von Steckern binnen 5 Min
Man muss ich etwas Zeit nehmen, und die Anleitung lesen, wenn man das noch nicht gemacht hat. Aber nach 2 oder 3 langsamen Versuchen geht es dann zugig von der Hand. Nach 10 Verbindern sieht es so professionell aus, dass man es selbst kaum glauben kann. Ich habe damit meine Ergebnisse im Punkt Professionalität optisch und funktionell einen riesigen Schritt nach vorne gebracht. Man braucht sicherlich nicht alle Größen und es werden dann schnell die "Lieblinge" alle sein, aber den Nachschub bekommt man ja überall. Außerdem gibt es viele andere Stecker, die mit der gleich Zange gecrimpt werden können. Ich finde das Teil super und nach etwas Übung geht das schnell und unproblematisch. Man muss aber aufpassen nicht anzufangen zu schludern... Die Ergebnisse machen sich aber bezahlt.
label: positive

text:
We stayed at the hotel 15-18 September 2007 and paid £200 per night for a club room on the 36th floor.
The room was fine the beds were very comfortable the only thing missing was a mirror in the bedroom.
We had a couple of problems the main one being that the pool was closed for refurbishment while we were there and we had not been told in advance. The second was we wanted to use the business centre for online check in of our return flight which opened at 6.15pm but the business centre closes at 6pm and we were told to use the internet cafe round the corner. We did but felt the hotel should have offered the use of their facilities. The staff did not go out of their way to be helpful.
Overall the hotel was good and in a great location for sightseeing/shopping however the staff/service was at best average.
label: negative
