text: I almost saw this at an actual movie theatre (an art-house theatre, no less!) but couldn't make it there in the one whole week it played, but yesterday I finally saw it on cable and...well...I wasn't disappointed, that's for sure! Madonna has done it again: YET ANOTHER BOMB! When will this woman learn? When will the studios learn? (Or perhaps they already have, since this film was largely dumped, with little fanfare and deadly word-of-mouth.) One would hope that being directed by her talented husband, who's created some interesting and/or terribly entertaining work, would bring out the same quality Madonna showed in "Desperately Seeking Susan"; alas, it just isn't meant to be, for here she is, at her very worst: singularly convinced of her own greatness, the smugness permeating every frame she's in, made all the more unbearable by her wavering faux-British accent, an accent that only underscores the fact that her speaking voice is immature in quality and not especially pleasant. This may sound unnecessarily cruel but LISTEN to the woman, and LOOK at her films of, say, the past decade: like a latter-day Bette Davis, there is an unmistakable brittleness to not only her carriage but to her very face and body, which here, despite the warm photography displayed throughout the film (perhaps its only saving grace), are done no favors. To her credit, the entire affair is so misbegotten that one wonders if the world's greatest actress on her best day could do anything with this mess. No one involved escapes unharmed: Bruce Greenwood actually seems pained to be on-screen, though poor Jeanne Tripplehorn seems to carry herself as if she's actually in something good, which had me thinking all the while, "Denial ain't just a river in Egypt!" Adriano Giannini, son of Giancarlo Giannini, star of the Italian original, "Swept Away...", is, like his father before him, immensely attractive, and isn't altogether bad (despite winning a Razzie nomination for "Worst Actor"), but, like almost everything else about this production, it all comes back to Madonna, on whose shoulders rest the blame. Why her? Why not her husband, director Guy Ritchie? Just who do YOU think was behind this remake? What actress wouldn't want nearly every shot of a movie to be centered on her, with only a relative nobody sharing the screen? Oh sure, Ritchie deserves some blame: surely he - or someone - ANYONE! - should have, and could have, taken his lead aside and insisted on something bordering on ACTUAL FEELING in her line readings (for her performance is so wooden it's a surprise the rest of the cast didn't get splinters), or at least display a semblance of warmth...but she seems resistant to be anything but a cinematic black hole. Above and beyond anything else, this is strictly a vanity project for its star so she is ultimately accountable for it. A film like this, an "Odd Couple"-ish, war of the classes, should be light and fun, with leads who can bounce off one another with witty, even romantic, dialogue, for what else can a film whose plot involves two disparate people stranded, really be? Honestly, I don't think anyone involved knew exactly the tone they were trying for; it succeeds neither as comedy (I defy you to laugh even once) or romance (Madonna's ice-princess routine precludes ANY chemistry). It's not even bad enough for us bad-movie lovers to enjoy. A real shame...
label: negative

text:
Haven't been to too many Vietnamese restaurants, so this review is from the "average joe" perspective. 

Walked in about an hour before closing, there's a sign that says to wait to be seated, but you really just seat yourself and the waitress comes to you. The menu is very simple to read, with nice big pictures that show what your ordering. The prices are very cheap compared to some other places I've been to, but the quality was the same, if not better. My total came to around $7.50. 

I ordered the Beef and Broccoli. The food was great! The broccoli was crisp, yet soft at the same time and the beef was cooked to perfection. 

Overall, don't expect too much. It's not a five star, fancy restaurant, but a good mom-and-pop family owned restaurant. Will most likely be coming back in the near future.
label: neutral

text: Okay, I'm officially hooked. The Granite Lake Wolves actually had me at the end of Wolf Signs, but this book just reinforced my opinion.I liked Tad when he was introduced in the first book, but we really only got a quick glimpse of him. Readers found out he was a loving, over protective older brother, but that's pretty much all we got. Tad was oh so much more than that.Missy was desperate, but knew more about wolves and how things worked within packs than Tad. She felt the connection between her and Tad, but she was blinded at first by the need to escape and protect her sister. She didn't intend to find her true mate, but having it be the person she had always felt most comfortable with was perfect.Tad's sense of honor was both admirable and frustrating. He was adorable in his shyness and I loved the way he was with the rest of the pack and his sister. The relationships between all of them just keep growing stronger and I felt just as strong a connection with Robyn and Keil as I did in Wolf Signs. I like it when a series moves on, yet doesn't abandon previous characters entirely.The next book in the series is Wolf Games and it features Erik. The family connections haven't ended yet, because the female in this one is Missy's sister, Maggie. After that, we finally get to spend some quality time with TJ... that's one that I can't wait for. *sigh* Between Books 2 and 3, Vivian Arend has treated us to two novellas that are super short, but super hot. They're only 10 pages each, so I probably won't review them separately. First Howl features Robyn and Keil and Second Howl features Tad and Missy. They are worth a download though because what they lack in length, they more than make up for in heat. Just don't read them before you finish Wolf Flight.
label: positive

text: 1.交通非常方便，海烟酒店走5分钟就是大连路地铁站。非常满意！ ：） 打车去虹桥机场基本60左右就够（当然你也可以地铁＋打的）。去浦东，建议地铁到龙阳路（4元吧），然后打的过去。又便宜，又不堵车。2.周围环境没什么突出的，都是住宅，小便利店有。3.房间还算宽敞，比较整洁，赠送饮料和上网（需要给前台电话开通）。从房间可以看到部分陆家嘴的建筑。以为离外滩很近，步行去外滩结果花了1个多小时，关键好多地方在施工，根本过不去。打车回来，只要15元左右就到了。4.早餐20元，但是自助餐的种类比较少。去的晚了的话，吃的东西不多，补餐不及时。关键还是样式少。中午和晚上正餐的花样不多，价格稍稍贵了些。5.工作人员蛮热情，继续努力！：）总体性价比还是非常高的一家酒店。强烈推荐！补充点评 2008年6月26日 ： 最近还要去上海，还准备入住。不知道是不是回头客有优惠啊？！ ：）
label: positive

text: William Shakespeare would be very proud of this particular version of his play. Not only is it the best movie version of it, but it's also the only complete version of Hamlet. Kenneth Branagh's Hamlet is simply genius. Not only because it was written by Shakespeare, but also because it had the guts to do the whole thing, even if it went just over four hours.We all know the story of the Prince of Denmark and his plot to avenge his father's death, so I won't go into the details of the story. I will, however, tell you that the best part of this Hamlet version is not the breathtaking sets or the stunning photography, but the actors' interpretations of each character. I doubt you'll find a better Polonius than Richard Briers' delicious portrayal. Plus, you can't go wrong with Julie Christie and Jack Lemmon. Also, Derek Jacobi, a regular among Shakespeare adaptations is magnificent as the antagonist to Hamlet.Of course, we must talk about Kenneth Branagh. He wowed audiences when he came onto the scene with his first outing with Shakespeare, Henry V. He outdoes himself with Hamlet. Sure, Olivier's presence was captivating, but I think Branagh's performance is wonderful. When you watch him on screen, it's almost as if he knew exactly how Shakespeare wanted the role to be played. How he wasn't nominated for an Oscar is a total mystery. At least the movie got a few nominations and even an odd choice for Screenplay. I guess they know good writing when they see it though. All in all, you'll never find a more rich and lavish production of the Bard's best play. To say that the technical aspects were awesome would be an understatement. If you love this play and are a fan of Shakespeare, you definitely need to check this movie out. Even if you don't really care for Shakespeare, the visuals will keep you occupied for the duration of the film. You may not think you'll be able to sit through all of it at once, but you'll soon find out that pausing this movie will make you want to see it even more.
label: positive

text:
Great location on Central Park adjacent to Russian Tea Room. Easy access to Subway, taxis, 5th Ave, Park Ave, Fashion Ave, and a Duane Reade on the corner.
Rooms are spacious for NYC standards. This hotel makes great use of under the bed drawer storage. Another pro is the luxury toiletries - Peter Thomas Roth. Rooms were clean, with no signs of bed bugs, spacious bathroom, and a safe large enough for an 11-inch laptop (and probably also a 13-inch...there was extra room). The mini-muffins and scones in the lobby for breakfast are great to pop in your mouth before you start your NYC adventure. Wi-fi was included with my hotel rate and it was fast and functioning (not always the case in hotels!). iPod/iPhone docking station by the bed as well.
Cons: It tends to function mostly as a time share property so sales pitches are common. In addition, there are no studio rooms with balconies. And, FYI, a Studio Plus room is the same as a Studio room. Hmmmph. No restaurant which means no room service available.
label: positive

text:
Went to this hotel twice early this year. It was under construction and the hotel prices were great. The first time was in March and we chose a room with a king size bed for around 80 a night. The room was a bit cramped (an oversized chair was in the room and blocked one side of the bed) but it was in a great location. You can walk a few blocks to the El and the 151 bus is right there for you on Michigan to take you north.
The second time we came was in early April. For about $20 more ($100) we chose a 2 room suit with fridge and microwave. We stayed 2 nights. There was one issue that was never taken care of for us though we asked repeatedly to have it resolved. There was no lamps in the living room. The only light we had was from the hallway, TV (which I hate to have on), and the light above the microwave and fridge. They would say they would send someone up with a lamp but it never happened.
I will be coming to the city soon but I feel that their prices have gone up since my last stay and unfortunately I will have to find another place to go. Though there were hiccups at this location..we had a great time otherwise. Clean rooms, nice bathrooms, comfy beds, great sheets.
Thanks for the memories RR!! Cheers!
label: neutral

text: Kitch is not dead! Just Heroes date de 1989 et son véritable défaut est d'avoir très mal vieilli. Il est difficile de prendre au sérieux cette histoire familiale de triade tant la bande originale semble en décalage avec les événements qu'elle accompagne. On retrouve les ingrédients qui ont rendu John Woo célèbre avec des scènes de fusillades où les pistolets sont utilisés comme des armes blanches, où les personnages sont montrés bien au delà de leur simple rôle de gangsters mais, l'ensemble reste malgré tout très inégal. Les doublages sont mauvais et rendent les acteurs très peu convaincants. Le scénario tient la route mais il est desservi par une mise en scène qui elle aussi n'a pas été épargnée par les années. Just Heroes était surement un bon film lors de sa sortie mais il faudrait un sacré recul pour s'en apercevoir de nos jours.
label: negative

text:
I wasn't sure what to expect from the Hotel Indigo, but had heard positive comments and saw very positive reviews online. The Houston location is a little hidden in that you wouldn't see it if you were not REALLY looking for it. It is sort of hidden from the street surrounded by condos and Staybridge Suites to the south, Embassy Suites to the west, a Church and parking lot to the north and the Galleria mall to the east. It is a nice property with a unique charm. All in all the staff was extremely nice and helpful and the property is clean and cheery. The decor is very nautical and slightly unusual. The lobby has oversized (really oversized) adirondack chairs and the colors and decor are of a beach retreat. They have an explanation in the rooms of their philosophy and why the nautilus shells, etc. Felt like staying in a guest suite in someone's beach house.
My only negative comment is that the pillows were not particularly comfortable. I know that may seem small, but there were basically two kinds of pillows on the bed and I didn't find either of them to suit me (one was lumpy and the other was to spongy/springy for my tastes). The bedding otherwise, however, was very comfortable and seemed to be a good quality. The bedroom itself is a little snug, but there was a generous hallway with a wet bar that was convenient and left plenty of room for belongings.
Would definitely stay there again (but maybe bring my own pillow next time).
label: positive

text:
I've been here twice now. First time, we didn't have very many problems, we were seated quickly but the waiter messed up on our drinks. My husband asked for an iced tea, he was served an iced coffee, he let it slide and we swapped drinks. 

The second time we visited, we had children in tow, there was a 20 minute wait time which isn't that bad so we waited. After almost 30 minutes passed, I went up and asked when we would be seated, the hostess said another 20 minutes, at that point I was annoyed and asked her why it would be another 20 minutes on top of the almost 30 we had already been waiting. The manager noticed my annoyance and proceeded to seat us himself. 

Our waiter was very nice but we could tell right away that he was new and nervous, he was all over the place. He mixed up the orders and brought out someone else's food to our table, only checked on us once, completely blew off the parents sitting at the table next to us, and proceeded to clear up another parents table while they took their children to the bathroom (they weren't even half done with their meal) he assumed they had left. Our section was filled with disgruntled customers. We didn't hold it too much against him though since we knew he was new, but the customer service should have been better. Hopefully next time we get lucky with better service.
label: negative

text: Пять звёзд ставлю исключительно за развлечения для детей: игровые аппараты, батуты и лабиринты - всё свеженькое, ухоженное и чистое. Вопросики к персоналу, который прямолинейно неохотно выполняет свои обязанности. Хотелось бы более дружелюбных и отзывчивых людей в этом месте. Само заведение: место для отдыха взрослых, ресторан и банкетная зона - в явном упадке, без определённого стиля, что совсем не соотносится с названием заведения. Кухня тоже на троечку, все салаты подаются с майонезом, даже если это Цезарь, порции маленькие, а цены неадекватно завышены. Желаю руководству заведения проявить заботу о своём бизнесе, отремонтировать и продумать концепцию, заняться персоналом и поварами.
label: positive

text:
Stayed one night at the Grand Hyatt DFW as I was there on business. Overall, great experience. Hotel is quite lovely, and the staff were all quite friendly and willing to go out of their way to assist you. It's proximity to the airport was appealing. No need to rent a car, just walk on over to the hotel. Easy access for departure the next day.
The rooms were a nice size with a comfortable bed and a large bathroom where you had a choice of the shower stall or tub. Surprisingly, vey little noise from the airport. We hosted a cocktail party for customers, and everything went off without a hitch. Food and drinks were all excellent and well presented.
We paid $195.00 as a group rate, and I do think they could have thrown in wireless for free. Prices are expensive but no different than staying at any high-end hotel.
The hotel does offer a nice experience.
label: positive

いやいやいや、近年の価格破壊というか産業破壊というか、この価格でこれだけの商品が買える時代になるとは・・・。 2008年に買った大手ペットメーカーのバリカンを使ってますが、これより威力が10分の１くらいのポンコツですよ。 当時このクラスの性能だと8000円くらいのモデル相当だと思います。 ロングコートのチワワなので定期的に刈らなきゃなんですが、今までの苦労がウソみたいなくらい、楽に刈れます！ みなさん、アマゾンだと山ほど商品あるのでデザイン重視で買う人多いんじゃないですか？ でもね、この価格帯でこのパワーで防水！この商品だけですよ。他の似たようなのは全部弱いモーターです。 ペットの毛が刈れるということは、人間の髪も刈れます。(人間用じゃペットのは刈れんのよ) 予備でもう一台、買おうかと検討中。

text: The hotel and amenities were top-notch. The Staff is another story. The night I checked in, I watied quite some time for the girl at the front counter to show up to check me in, and when she did finally show, she sobbed the entire time. I inquired if she was OK, and she insisted that she was, and she kept apologizing. The following morning, I inquired about a guest laundry, and the new girl at the front desk to me that they had one, but all of the machines were out of order. I asked if there was a local laundromat (since I was on foot for this trip) and was told that there wasn't one. I figured that I would be sneaking in to the guest laundry at another nearby hotel. Luckily, I asked another hotel staff person that same evening, and was told that the guest laundry was fine. It was! I had no problem with it at all. FInally, the "Bright Side" breakfast was kind of pathetic. It was always out food, and the staff seemed bothered if you asked them to restock it.
label: negative

text: As intentional we visited this cafe due to many good reviews, I would say that it has good food. However, Staff customer service experience wasn’t up to standard. The staff just look at me with the poker face, no asking of how am I, he simply stand there like a stone, (owner, you can see from the cctv on 2 July 3pm onwards), then I wanted to go up to view the layout of the cafe, the staff said we can go, after viewing we came down, was shock that another customer took our seats and table, wow! I was pretty shock the staff didn’t reserve the table for us, we simply went up for less than 5 mins and came down with our seats taken by another customer ?The staffs also didn’t greet us when we enter.

text: Any film in the early days of Orson Welles is a triumph all the way to The third Man with Joseph Cotton. He is also wonderful in a Touch Of Evil. Please see them all! He tends to get pompous and self serving in films like F is for Fake, really stupid waste of film.Don't waste your time watching it. it is really ignorant. Orson Welles is a film icon and anyone studying film should see everything he has filmed. All his leading ladies are tremendous but in the end Welles became a fat drunk, like his character in A Touch Of Evil! For some reason Orson Welles had a way with women, I see how he could be considered attractive in his youth, not like Gary Cooper or Joseph Cotton, or Cary Grant,John Wayne, I could go on and on but I digress... and because I am a woman,I can see the attraction to him. He (Orson Welles) is one of the last true film makers and unless you count the film-makers of today: Tarantino, Scorscese, Spike Lee, most of the film makers just don't measure up to the film makers of the Forties! I know there are many more great film makers of today but in such a short amount of time I can't name them all. No Offense to any of the great film makers of this millennium! August 21,2006. Please remind me of some current up and coming film makers, I don't want to be stuck in the past! I love some of the films out now, but rarely are there any that I would put on a "100 best" list.. "Hustle and Flow" was great, so was "Fargo", and "Oh, Brother, where art thou," from a line in Sullivan's travels; another fine film from the forties! Can anyone give me a best list for the 90's and on up to 2006? I would like to know who to watch! Thank you! Also Props to this website! Where else can you plug a film or boo it! i love the ranting and raving from regular folks like me who can say what I want and I promise not to spoil any film for someone who hasn't seen it yet!
label: positive

text:
What makes The Birthday Suit unique is that THEY CARE. I have been to countless salons where you are just a number or they look at your ticket see your name and pretend they remember you. Stacy will always remember you and it makes going to your next visit like visiting a friend not just going to another appointment. 

Where do I start, have to say the customer service. I have seen Stacy every time and she is simply amazing. She is so friendly and makes you feel so comfortable (when you would think being 1/2 naked on a table baring all you wouldn't be). I have been waxing for years back in my home town but the wax that is use here much better and less painful. Stacy takes pride in her work and does such a great job even with my stubborn leg hairs, I am a challenge and she wins every time! Knowing you can go back if you ever need a touch up is great, but I have yet needed to go back. 

The children's room is such a great idea for those moms just wanting to keep up with waxing without the expense of a sitter, A+ for that idea. They have great products from the body scrub (that I use daily) to the lotion that actually moisturizes and all great prices and there is always a deal going on you can catch for a discount. 

Prices are very reasonable and no excuse to not afford it because they have countless deals and promotions, check them out on FaceBook or just call for deals. 

This Yelper Highly Recommends The Birthday Suit
label: positive

text:
Been out to Joe's Farm Grill twice.. and both times Ive been SO excited about going there and both times I have left well, disappointed. 

This place is another restaurant from the Joe's Real BBQ gang (delish). The place is actually very cool.. you can eat out under the stars if the wind is in the right direction (there are horses close by) and they have a machine that dispenses as much ranch dressing as you can use! Gotta love that! But the food has been underwhelming and on the verge of boring. Ive tried the burgers, grilled pizzas and salads. For me they are not much better then what you could get at your local mall food court. I know it's crazy for me to say that but considering that much of what they serve is organic I just dont feel or taste a difference here. 

The saving grace here is the coffee shop next door called, you got it.. Coffee Shop. They have lot of YUM-E desserts and make a some great coffee drinks. Oh get this, they hand pack there espresso machine.. no click click turbo-spresso machines here. I like the way that sounds.. I think I will steal that from myself! 

Side note.. this place is in the middle of nowhere becoming somewhere.. bring a map!
label: negative

text: 安装还是挺简单的，没有费什么劲就装好了。因为是美国电压等级，为它还买了个220V转110V的变压器。从使用来看，一档的噪音还是可以接收的，睡觉的时候没有什么影响。2档的噪音就有点大，3档就挺明显了。此款风扇没有遥控、不能摇头、风力调节只能旋钮手动。综合来看，性价比一般。 今年又拿出来，放在卧室里用还是觉得噪音大，不如国内品牌的风扇。所以 劝大家别崇洋媚外了，家电还是选国产的吧，物美价廉。
label: neutral

text:
This hotel styles itself as "InterContinental", perhaps recognising that many of their visitors are arriving after long flights. What one chiefly needs after such a trip is a shower, perhaps some food and then a quiet restful room to crash in.
The InterContinental provides all of these things except the last. On my most recent trip, I arrived at the hotel around 9.30pm. As I checked in at the front desk, I could hear a band playing loudly. I asked the receptionist if I could be put in a room that was as quiet as possible. She obliged, putting me on the 28th floor but added that "some guests still find it a bit noisy even up there". I didn't think much of this since I figured not much noise could make it up 28 floors.
Unfortunately, I figured wrong. Even 28 floors up, it was like being back in a college dormitory with a party going on next door. To make things worse, the band was playing terrible covers.
This went on until sometime well after 11pm. Now that may not sound very late, but when you're coming from another time zone, all you want to do is relax and sleep, not sit up listening to muffled covers of old pop songs.
By the way, I arrived on a Thursday night, so you can't even avoid this issue by arriving during the week.
I won't be staying here again. This hotel needs to decide if it is a music venue or a place for weary travellers.
label: positive

text: Была на приёме со своей собачкой. Были сильные боли в ноге. От боли лапка начинала трястись. Сделали рентген правой стороны,хотя жалобы были на левую. Взяли анализы. Диагноз поставлен не был. Выписали но-шпу,эспумизан. По ренгену сказали всё хорошо. Анализы вообще пришлось узнавать по телефону. В итоге собачке становилось хуже. Ужасные боли,от которых он просто падал и орал. Минут по 15 не могли успокоить. На почту мне прислали снимок ренгена,который даже не открывался. Обратились в государственную клинику на Вилонова. Замечательный врач. Провёл обследование. Сделал рентген всех частей тела. И в итоге диагноз Отёк спинного мозга. Это как???? Скажите пожалуйста, за что вы берёте деньги в вашей клиники доверия??? Как вы проводите обследование, если даже диагноз поставить не можете. Люди не нужно водить своих питомцев в эту клинику. Ходите к профессионалам.
label: negative

text:
Фирма с большим наличием магнитол в зале. Самый большой минус это найти туда вход ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ что бы войти нужно обойти здание войти в подъезд 2 поднятся на второй этаж после лестницы налево, и пройдя по длинному залу найти офис 249. Почти всё магнитолы которые продают есть на стендах. ( можно опробовать) . Ту что выбрали приносят в течении 3 минут ( при мне принесли 2 клиентам) . По первой просьбк и без напоминаний достают подключают к стенду и позволяют проверить весь функционал( поиск сетей wifi, читает ли с флешек необходимые файлы и даже звук - не на самой большой громкости но уже приятно) . По поводу магнитол объясняют . Предупреждают что если какие будут проблемы с установкой можно позвонить и проконсультироваться. Гарантия 1 год от магазина на часть магнитол гарантия от Новосибирска о чём сразу и без утайки предупреждают. Да это интернет магазин с хорошим сайтом.магазин небольшой но то что можно всё проверить, оценить и сравнить огромное СПАСИБО! Рамку переходную и подключение к штатной проводке подбирают индивидуально. Главное чтоб не испортились. Отношение после посещения сугубо положительные.
Поправка отзыва от декабря 2022 года тк купил ещё одну магнитолу но с ней вышло всё намного хуже чем с первой. 
Заказал ещё одну магнитолу приехал забрал вся комплектация полная но в этот раз попытались кое в чем обмануть. На сайте написано что рамка идёт и под машины с климатом и под машины с кондиционером при этом прям при мне пытались вытащить рамку под кондиционер ( на сайте полная комплектация) со словами а зачем вам у вас же климат. То что у меня 2 машины и одна с климатом а вторая с кондиционером их не касается и рамку пришлось под кондиционер дорабатывать гравюром тк штатные крутилки не вставали в посадочные места. 
Купил все-таки магнитолу в полной комплектации как на сайте и приступил к установке. Да всё встало разъём в разъём но магнитола не корректно работает с Кан шиной. Открыл инструкцию и читаю для настройки Кан нужно войти в сервисное меню магнитолы и выбрать настройки своей машины. Попытка войти в сервисное меню не увенчалась успехом тк прилагаемые код к магнитоле не позволил войти в сервисное меню. Найденные кода в сети так же не помогли. Без согласования с Кан шиной не работала штатная камера заднего вида на Тойоте, и постоянно вылезала ошибка открыты передние двери но двери были закрыты. Поняв что сделать ничего не могу и время уже 9 вечера решил снять магнитолу и вернуть штатную а эту сдать в магазин. Приехав на следующий день в магазин и объяснив что не смог подключить к Кан от не машины мне сказала что установщик который ставил криворукий и нужно читать инструкцию. Подключив магнитолц на свой стенд они попытались войти в сервисное меню. Когда не получилось они открыли инструкцию и воспользовались кодом из инструкции что тоже не увенчались успехом. Начав звонить кому то после 3 минут минут разговора выяснили по модели код сервисного меню смогли войти наконец в настройки и сказали ещё раз что настройщик криворукий ( сами при этом без звонка другу не смогли сделать ничего) сказали что магнитолу никто не настраивал. И вообще типа для этого есть сервис центр( в который я звонил но было 9 вечера и никто не ответил) который мне бы помог. Вернул магнитолу и получил назад деньги да продавцы были недовольны но тк платил налом отдали всё сразу. 
Когда товарищ купил у них же магнитолу тоже не смог войти в сервисное меню я связался через вотсап с тех поддержкой мне сказали что я магниттлу такую у них не покупал а точнее купил и сдал и сервис мне оказан не будет (хотя с за полгода до этого брал себе магнитолу которая слава богу работает нормально и обращаться по ней не требуется) вдруг я из пазы покупателей пропал. Очень интересно как так? 
Вторую магниттлу с товарищем настроили Найдя код сервисного меню в интернете ( благо взяли распространую модель) и сами вск настроили. Кстати у товарища также пытались вытащить часть рамки под кондиционер намекая у Вас же климат - наверное это такой прикол и потому я когда покупал не посмотрел на комплектность рамки переходной. 
 К сожалению одна и та же контора а какие разные впечатления. За вторую покупку хочу поставить 2 звезды но тк большой ассортимент оставляю 4 . Приучите пожалуйста персонал не разукомплектовывать товар даже если не нужна часть рамки зачем вынимать? И пусть в инструкции перед покупкой проверяют сервисный код. Тех поддержка пусть лучше проверяет базу а то купив магнитолу я оказываюсь в базе на поддержку а купив вторую пропадает информация о первой покупке и я оказываюсь без поддержки.
label: positive

text: We had a free night from the stay 3 and get one free BW promotion, so we decided to spend a couple of days in downtown Seattle, we live in Kent, a suburb. I was pleasantly suprised, when we checked in Michelle greeted us warmly and thanked us for being rewards members. The Hotel is a historical landmark, but the inside has been all refurbished, keeping with the style of the period. Our room was on the small side, but very tastfully done. We had a city view with a little balcony. The bathroom was very nice with gold fixtures. the airconditioning worked well. That evening after a full day in the city we came back to Pioneer Square, I purchased a bottle of wine in a store just around the corner. When we got back to the hotel I asked if they had a corkscrew to open the wine. The clerk gave me one to keep and asked if we would like wine glasses also. The next day at check out I asked if we could leave our bag until later, as we were going to spend another day intown, the answer was, "of course". When I asked what I owed, expecting to have to pay room tax at least, I was delighted to hear there would be no charge. Also, the breakfast was great, with several choices of hot items, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and more.
label: positive

text: I am at the "Resort" now. This is the 3rd room I have been in. The same ugly "painting" in each one. Not enough housekeeping staff and they are not trained. I have had broken glass on my floor for 2 days. Stayed the first night in a duplex and "upgraded" to a "private bungalow" which meant a quadraplex facing a stagnant lagoon. Puddles of water (I hope) on the floor when we checked in and the place reeked of bleach. Listened to babies crying, people fighting through the walls and the sound of the pond circulation pump grinding through the night. The same hairs were on the floor in the bathroom when we left as when we got there despite a note with a tip to the housekeeper to clean it up-she took the note and the cash, so I know she got the message. We also had room service the first night and the dishes were still on the table when we left 2 days later. Decided to downgrade if that was an upgrade. Now in a single room that is like being in a bomb shelter. Concrete block with only a door for light-no windows and definitely no view. Left a note for the housekeeper to clean up the broken glass and she just crumpled it up and left it on the night stand. I come to San Diego almost every year to see my friends and we are going back to the Mistral in Coronado next year. Sorry Dave. Hope you find a new job soon.
label: negative

text:
The hotel is very attractive, even more attractive than the website photos make it seem. The location is fantastic-directly on the beach-prime people watching location. It is definitely one of the nicer hotels in the area-some of it's neighbors are downright seedy. We were room upgraded without asking. The room was super comfortable with an ocean view, and doors out to the rooftop deck (lounge chairs, mini water fall, fire pit). We don't usually indulge in the mini bar, but they had such unusual drinks that we couldn't help ourselves! I highly recommend trying the Peels Blueberry Pomegranate...
We ate at the hotel restaurant-which faces the beach. We were there for sunset, which was such a nice touch. The food was really delicious and unique. It is not inexpensive, so be prepared-this is not burgers on the beach.
My one complaint is that the "valet" experience was not fantastic. Specifically, I think it's pretty ridiculous to charge $20.00 for parking on top of a $249.00 room rate. I'm assuming that parking is at a premium on the beach, but I still think it's in poor form to charge that much.
That being said, we would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it to others.
label: positive

text: We stayed at Hampton Inn Times Sq. North on 8th Avenue near 50th Street for 4 nights; June 8-June13. Don't hesitate choosing this hotel (tips we learned about nyc at end of review). We've stayed in big cities before such as Paris, so I knew what I wanted before we went. First, the subway entrance is across the street which means a lot less walking just to get to your destination. The area is safe and kept up well. The hotel is clean and well managed. The staff was always very helpful...if concierge was busy, we asked a dif. employee for i.e. directions and they were always helpful & correct. Breakfast was sufficient...get down there before 7:30 a.m. Our last day there, my daughter and I slept in and my husband went down and got us some breakfast. He went back down at 8:30 for something and he said it was packed and the breakfast food wasn't all replenished. We went to bkfst between 6:30 and 7:00 the other days and it was quiet and all the food was out. Nothing to brag about, but it gave us something decient to eat before heading out for the day. There was always something hot such as a cheese omelete (okay) & i.e. bacon or sausage. One morning they had western omelete and hashbrowns. Always a variety of bagels, pastries, muffins, a fruit mix, fresh fruit i.e. bananas, apples, juices, cold cereal, & coffee. I read the reviews before I reserved it and the apples are good (someone wrote they are mushy), so get some extra. Also, there are breakfast bags at the front desk (you've got to get these before 7:00 or they're gone) for people on the run. We got a few for our train ride back. We reserved a two queen bedded room and we got it(checked in after 5:00 p.m.) The room was clean (not spotless, but close) and the beds were comfortable. The pillows were average. I would definitely stay here again. As were were leaving, they were offering a two night stay starting at 299 (no taxes included). We paid $1666 for 4 nights which included all taxes(there's a lot of nyc taxes). We were in a hurry so we didn't have time to really think about it so we decllined. If we didn't want to visit some other places, I think it was a great deal. we'd love to go back and we definitely would stay at their hotel. Some tips: If you are going to use the subway and buses get a daily fun pass or 7 day metro card. We got the 7 day care which saved us a lot of money (we didn't have to decide, should we take the bus or subway and pay 2.25 each or walk a lot further). A lot of the subway runs north and south. North is uptown (this is how it is defined at the subway); South is downtown...that's used for the directions. In example, if you are leaving Penn Station and going to this hotel, you would use line E uptown. There are some subway lines that go into i.e. Queens or Brooklyn and it will say this as the direction...just figure which direction you are going and asked someone who doesn't look like a tourist. I usually asked people ages mid 20's to late 30's and they were very helpful. I have to say, NEW YORKERS ARE FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL. When we arrived from Penn Station and took the E line and my husband was carrying the luggage (one at a time) up the stairs, people offered to help us and we were glad to get the help : ) When we asked someone about how to get somewhere, most people were glad to help (we only ran into i.e. a couple of people who ignored us...maybe they were tourist from a dif. country??) We bought the New York Pass (not the city pass) which included more places. We used our whole day and part of the evening visiting many places. I checked what times they were open and the days (i.e. Met. Mus of Art open till 9:00 on Fri.) and put the places were wanted to see the most first and the others at the bottom. Without the pass it would have cost us more. Food in nyc is not that expensive. We live in OH and it was much more than what we pay here, but we didn't go to any fancy restaurants. Caruso's pizza place by Fulton and Broadway was really good and inexpensive. There are Chipotle (the one across from our hotel gave my daughter and I bathroom problems-we had the chicken burrito). But everything else there was reasonable. Check out American Eagle at times sq. They have a deal: if you purchase something, you get your pic on the jumbotron...it's really something (she also has A.E. times sq. top and others that you can't purchase anywhere else...that is cool for a 15 year old : ). I think that was the best part of her trip even though she loved everything else. Before we left I borrowed from the library & read NYC for dummies and Eyewitness Travel NYC and Eyewitness Travel top 10 NYC. I also borrowed a travel nyc dvd. They are all good books to read. They eyewitness ones have a lot of pics (the top 10 doesn't have as many pics, but you can look them up on the internet). We also took Amtrak to nyc out of Clev. After see the traffic there, we definitely would not drive and are glad that we didn't have to. We used the subway as late as 1:30 a.m. and no problems- There is an S subway train that goes into Times Square...Take it! Or at least just visit the subway area...bands playing...a man dressed as spider man and playing a saxophone, etc...too much fun to miss. Some free sights are Highline Park which is beautiful; Central Park; Metropolitan Museum of Art (they ask i.e. $10 suggested adult donation, but you don't have to give that much...this was included in our NYC Pass...to a free place??? Anyways, St. John Cathedral Divine on Amsterdam (there wasn't a charge when we went although it said there was on the internet and it was included in our NYC Pass). Other beautiful Churches such as St. Patricks by Rockefeller; walks in Little Italy Area & Chinatown---The one nice thing about having the nyc pass was that if it was included and we wanted to see it, we didn't feel like we had to stay at the place along time to get our money's worth (like at the Guggenheim...went there to walk along the hallways, but they were closed getting ready for a new exhibit...exhibits not much to look at...just wanted to see the building. Metropolitan mus., American museum of natural history; MOMA are terrific museums. I recommend getting either this pass or the city pass and mix it in with free places for an eclectic vacation. Have fun on your trip!
label: positive

text: I get that Batali likes to listen to heavy rock music while cooking but that isn't my choice, nor the choice of the majority when dining and you're popping $160 for a steak or $300 for a bottle of wine. Put a sign at the door to at least forewarn people of what they'll need to expect and tolerate. When we spoke to our wait staff about this they said they received complaints everyday and that it was really embarrassing....it's not cute or endearing Mario - grow up and don't be so indulgent. Lest you forget who's paying your bills - which by the way, won't be us again.

text: Let me say I have given the Hyatt Regency Century City a fair chance. I have stayed on three separate occasions over the last year, each a minimum of three nights. The location is convenient, the rooms are very nice, the pool and bar look great. Let me also say that I am a frequent guest at the Kimpton Palomar and the Intercontinental Century City so I know the competition. Each time at the Hyatt there have been frustrations, but the last visit was the last straw. On Sunday midnight 10/31 they had a planned electric power shutdown at the hotel from until 4 am. Yes, I said planned, not accidental. The only notification I received was a note in my room when I arrived back at 11:30 pm. No notice at booking. No notice at check in. No notice the day before. So after an extremely stressful meeting, I could not watch TV, read a book, use my laptop, or take a shower. The Hyatt provided a chemical glow stick for light. Seriously, camping at the Hyatt Regency? Yes, I did complain in person at the front desk. Even though I am a Hyatt Gold member, because I had booked through Travelocity, the front desk could not refund my room so I could move to another hotel. Yes, they did offer me free valet parking in compensation. Sorry, but that did not help me relax so I could get some sleep. The letter said they only do this once a year (lucky me) but the true issue is the management's attitude. This attitude applies to many other issues at the Hyatt, If you stay during the week, and are not part of a convention, you will find the lobby packed, a ridiculously long wait to check in, and an impossible line at Starbucks. The valet parking is incredibly congested and has not improved over a year's time. It can take 10 minutes waiting to drop off your car and over 15 minutes for them to retrieve it. And for this they charge $36 a day! Yes, I have parked in the self-park lot. This is a long outdoor walk in the dark around the corner and up/down stairs to reach the hotel entrance. Not comfortable for women who are alone. Management needs to stop resting on reputation of the hotel from 20 - 30 years ago and start addressing the current problems. I'll stick with the Palomar from now on - excellent and personal service, free wireless, wine hour each evening.
label: negative

text: I have bought new tires and was referred by Discount Tires to have an alignment done. The service took little over an hour on a Friday afternoon. I was glad there was a Dairy Queen next to the shop. They have limited seats in waiting area, especially on a busy day. The time just flew by while I was enjoying my favorite treats. \n\nWhen I returned to pick up my car, I was ready to pay for the $49.99 alignment. Adam explained that I didn't need the alignment, and was no charge for the service. He showed me the print out and the wheels were aligned. This is one shop that do follow their slogan \"affordable - honest - friendly\"! They also have coupons to print on their website.
label: positive

text:
I don't know if bad customer service is a result of being one of the new hotels on the strip, but it is certainly bad at Aria.

The front desk doesn't have one big line, it is on a first come, first served basis. I went to one of the shorter lines thinking that I scored. NOT! Apparently the couple ahead of me were having an issue with their room which took some time. I stood in line for 30 minutes (all the while seeing people who came 15 minutes after me check in before me!). 

Finally after getting up to the counter, the rep doesn't apologize for the wait, despite seeing me stand there for 30 minutes with no acknowledgment.

We get up to the room and it's really big! Relieved that I'm finally in my room, I start taking a look at all the amenities inside. There is an Audio/Video panel that has all kinds of ports: USB, S-Video, internet, etc. There is even an iPod/iPhone input...awesome! So I get out my cable to play some music, and then I realize that the input isn't compatible with the iPod USB cable. So I look through the manuals on the table to see if I'm missing something and it doen't say.

So I call the front desk to ask, and the girl said she doesn't know and transferred me to their IT line. The person answers and we have a very uncomfortable exchange until he realizes that I'm a guest and not an employee. At this point he said that they only assist staff and not guest issues...so I have to call the front desk again. Ugh......

So I call, again, and I reach another person. He said that in order to use the iPod connectivity in the panel, you have to go to the gift shop and buy a proprietary cable for $15. Are you serious?! I really hope that they haven't made anything off their little scam; I can't understand how they can expect anyone to buy a cable that will probably only work at their hotel. At the Palms they have an iPod dock that comes with the room, for free! Needless to say, I was totally annoyed.

On the bright side, their housekeeping staff is very friendly and responsive; the rooms are really big and SUPER comfortable; we had an excellent view of the Marquee as well. 

For the price, the room itself is great and the hotel is very clean and upscale. But the service leaves something to be desired for sure.

I'm not going to write off the Aria just yet, but hopefully they don't keep this up for too long.
label: negative

text:
Nicht nur lesen sondern auch anwenden

Dieses Buch gibt umfassend Auskunft, wie wichtig eine Darmsanierung ist und welche Auswirkung diese auf unsere gesamte Gesundheit hat. Mit einfachen Mitteln kann man den Darm wieder in die Gänge bringen, sozusagen, und die Resultate sprechen für sich. Ich bin echt angetan mit diesen umfangreichen Informationen, die natürlich umgesetzt werden müssen, um Erfolge zu erzielen.

text: From the time we walked in the door it was nothing but horrendous. I have stayed at 4 diamond resorts before and this place doesnt deserve its ratings at all. They first gave us a hard time about bringing in our cooler. After taking it back to our car and finally getting to our room, we noticed that there was still garbage in the garbage can, the carpet was stained and dirty, the windows had smudge marks all over them, and our toilet had blood on it! Needless to say we were disgusted and would have left but we were meeting friends for the weekend. I ended up asking the housekeeping person in the hallway for some cleaning supplies so I could clean it myself because I didnt trust them moving us to another room. We ordered room service with just a simple fruit plate and it took an hour for them to bring it up. The hotel doesnt even have a pool and the staff are not very customer service oriented. When we checked out we notice they charged us for something in the mini bar because we picked something up out of it and put it back. There are sensors on the mini bar so make sure not to touch anything or you'll be charged for it. All in all, I felt like they tried to nickel and dime us for everything in the hotel. This is fine for a nice hotel, but this place has detroit scam written all over it. The casino is full of trash as well, including the people in it. Not worth the money at all, especially because of the filth. Im never going back again!
label: negative

text:
I have tried this place twice now and both times I left extremely disappointed. I keep hearing great things about it, but I just don't get why. 
The counter that you have to order from is so high I couldn't even see over it, so when they're standing there just looking at me waiting for me to tell them what ingredients I wanted, I didn't have a clue what the options were! I know I'm only 5'3", but come on, this is ridiculous, a lot of people are my height. 
The people making the bowl/wraps didn't even speak English well enough to answer the 97 questions that I had. So I eventually gave up asking. 
Then the sticker shock comes when my total is almost $15 for just me! 
To top it all off, I finally sit down to a sticky table and crumb filled seat, only to look at my order for the first time (now that it's not hiding behind what feels like a 9 foot prison wall) to find what can honestly be a bowl of 50% lettuce! Seriously? I went through this stress and paid an hourly wage for a bowl of lettuce with tiny drops of who-knows-what sprinkled throughout? 
Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me. Cafe Rio, I'm not allowing you a third strike...
Zabbas, here I come!
label: negative

text: I really liked the food here and it was reasonably priced and not exactly ordinary. Pasta dishes made with care and small twists on recipes, and the pizzas are fired in a brick-lookin oven of some sort. I couldn't get enough of my caesar. I got the chicken dish of the day, and it was clever, saucy and delicate--I recall mushrooms and artichoke hearts, but it's been a few months so I don't recall what it was called.\n\nNot the place to take a snooty date, as it's in a nondescript strip mall. But once you're inside it's almost charming, and the food is really good, I'd say. The owners/managers were super friendly, which is always a bonus.
label: negative

text:
i would recommend Days Inn for anybody travelling to San Diego on a bit of a budget but not wishing to stay in a grubby downtown hostel!
On arrival we did find the car park a little cramped, but it wasn't a great problem to squeeze the car in. Check-in was easy and as we were staying a few days we were offered a top floor room with a view of downtown towards Petco Park.
Easy walking distance to Gaslamp and the ballpark, rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels etc.
Only downside was when we went to check out at 5-30am there was nobody on the desk, so we have to slide a note under the door and post the keys through the letterbox!
label: positive

text:
Had the ramen a while back, when they first open. It was very busy and we sat at the counter. 

It was the same today, very busy for late lunch. I didn't expect a wait list but we put our name down and waited, no too long around 10 minutes. We sat at the counter!

We ordered the gyoza, the pork belly bowl, the chashu bowl, spicy tonkotsu ramen and the shoyu ramen. It was all very good, the broth was perfectly blended, warming the noodles through and the pork belly bowl is worth a repeat, it was top of my favorites list! 

Service was great, food was great, now that cold weather is upon us, this may become a welcome spot!
label: positive

text:
NO HEATING - aparently they only put the heating on when it reaches 45F. We had to sit in blankets in the room!
DARK DINGY CORRIDORS - yes they maybe trendy for under 25's. If you are over 40 or have kids, DONT STAY HERE.
Corridors look like a prison.
ROOMS - PRISON CELL SIZE. I HAVE BEEN TO YOUTH HOSTELS THAT ARE WARMER AND LARGER.
NO CURTAINS - so you cant keep the cold out.
NO TEA/COFFEE.
IT'S A CONVERTED GOVERNMENT APARTMENT BUILDING AND IT SHOWS (THATS WHY THEY CANT PUT THE HEATING ON)
We checked out after one day. It was that bad. Book the Park Central around the corner. It is wamer, larger and cheaper.
All you are paying for at the Hudson is some 'trendy' paint and gloomy 'hip' lighting.
We also stayed in the Club Quarters at the Rockfeller centre. It was pure luxary compared to this dump, I am 45 and went with one child. I cant even begin to think what would have happened if my mother or anyone with poor eyesight booked this hotel, They probably would have fallen over or into something.
label: negative

text:
Hersteller hat aus Bemängelungen gelernt.
Auf Grund der Bewertungen hatte ich erst gezögert, mir die Maske zuzulegen. Da ich aber Ösenzange und Nieten in meinem Bastelbedarf vorrätig habe, habe ich es getan und wurde positiv überrascht. Die vorher bemängelten angeklebten Schnallen, sind mittlerweile mittels Nieten gegen abreißen gesichert. Die Maske sitzt schön eng und passt gut, der Zopf ist recht lang, werden wir wohl noch kürzen. Am Hinterkopf wird die Maske mittels Reißverschluss und Schnürung fest verschlossen. So wird ein unerlaubtes entkleiden stark behindert. In summe, für 50 Euro einen angemessenen Gegenwert erhalten.
label: positive

It was our first time not doing it ourselves. Our dog came out with shorter nails, loose hair gone, and smelled nice. Not sure how they do on other grooming aspects as our dog is pretty low-maintenance in that department. There were about 6 groomers working there at once, and the girl who took down our information seemed clueless, but the others seemed great.

text: Имела " честь" побывать в этом месте,изначально зашла на сайт и посмотрела цены,затем проходят мимо,решила записаться на лазерную эпиляцию лица,администратор насчитала в районе 5000 тысяч и вот настал тот самый день,когда нужно делать процедуру!Пришла и тут началось,заполните тут,подпишите вот на этом листе,внесите паспортные данные с местом прописки...жуть!Затем прошла процедура,косметолог была очень приветлива и внимательна,повторила правила поведения после манипуляций,после этого пришло время оплаты,оказалось,что я должна уже 7000тысяч,ладно и это проехали,потом ,когда администратор попыталась мне втюхать купоны на многократное посещение,стоически выдержав напор,я отказалась!Вот тут у админа и вовсе пропал по мне интерес,настолько...что когда я попросила чек,это вызвало недоумение!С пыхтением и недовольством,позвонив куда-то выдала мне чек!Если и вернулась бы в эту клинику,то только из-за косметолога,но так как это командная работа,то только 2 звезды!

text: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Hotel was nice but the rooms were very small. Only 2 double beds for 4 people which I find surprising in nicer hotels today and we could not get a rollaway for my teenager due to fire code (even though they list this as an option on their website). But the beds were comfortable which was a nice surprise. Furnishings were a little dated but clean and in good condition. Pool was warm and excercise area was nice with good equipment. There is a Starbucks onsite and the onsited Hertz rental car was great for renting a car for a day or two to explore the area. Room service was prompt and cost reasonable. Desk clerks were a little snooty and not terribly friendly or helpful. Location was easy to find and there is a small mall across the street with several very nice restaurants, a movie theater, and a Macy's. Easy to walk to with the family for dinner and shopping. A Denny's is down the street for a good breakfast if you don't want to pay a fortune at the hotel. Overall I would stay here again.
label: positive

text: Having seen some decent reviews, and looking at the nicely presented building from the outside, I decided to take my wife to Maison Francaise for her birthday. It was a Saturday evening and the restaurant was strangely rather empty - 2-3 tables occupied only. We sat outside on the balcony which was reasonably nice. Service was not easy; certainly considering the prices you'd expect significantly better. The team did not appear cohesive nor very well trained. But the food was the greatest disappointment. 'Fine dining' is not a label you can really apply here. Clearly that's the intention, but honestly it is nowhere near that standard. More of a pretentious attempt. Quality of raw materials is questionable - the steak, despite the price, was below average even for KL (and even for non-fine-dining places). And the asparagus appetiser was rather comically presented as though my 6 year old had tried to plate a dish. If fine-dining is what you want, there are plenty of other really good restaurants in KL with consistently good quality food and service. This place is best avoided unless you want to pay an arm and a leg for disappointing food and average (at best) service.
label: negative

text:
One thing I'm a stickler for is definitely Brazillian food. I know my Brazillian from having an ex and bf who introduced me to it. I can cook it most definitely. I was at Sushi Samba for a party and they had passed apps which were great. Great sushi, great crab cakes, awesome skewers of beef...But mind you passed apps. 
The drinks....amazing. As far as the Samba Juice. This is the only place in town I know that mixes with Acai berrys. Which give a unique chocolate hint to a blueberry flavor. Definitely high in antioxidents.
But I came here for brunch with a friend. 
Now I sat at the bar and we ordered drinks. She ordered the Pomelo...but they didnt't have any. So then the Cucumber. I had the Samba Juice again. I decided to order Churros because I LOVE HOME MADE CHURROS. Too bad I didn't get them. Grrr they took forever. I also ordered food to go. Feijoada, chorizo, linguisa(kinda portuguese sausage) and some peruvian corn which is like giant hominy. 
Well the order was wrong because I ordered sides and he asked me how I wanted my eggs. The bartender was really slow. I asked him some questions on why he was shaking a certain way and he said it was because they put egg whites in the drink. I explained a different method on how to make the drink that he won't tire himself out and he said "No it's better my method" LOL I asked him where he worked before and he said..."Grand Lux Cafe" Yea Nuff said. I didn't introduce myself to him because he was too hard headed in knowing what was right and wrong. So he fcked up my order, returned the Churros when I asked him for it to go, and then he stiffs me on eggs on the bill. Yea I'm gonna order from the table next time. I think brunch is for rookies. 
The Feijoada was very....thick....the Chorizo and Linguisa with Hominy was delicious. They don't make it home made but they get it in Cali from this spanish place I know.

text:
Would I eat here again? Most definitely. Would I make a special trip to eat here? No. However, that is contingent on breakfast cereal cravings, see below. (Also, I must confess a bias for Chef Simon just because I really don't care for Cat Cora, no flames please!)

So after seeing KGB featured on some food show for their waffle fry nachos my boyfriend mentioned that he would like to try them out. After passing through the smoke filled casino (has Harrah's always been that smokey or am I getting old?) we were greeted by the cutest hostess I have seen to date. I have to say I really did like the "Russian" uniform with the hot pants and fishnet stockings. She seated us and asked us if we were on vacation and how we had heard of them. Kudos for pleasant demeanor. The chefs in the kitchen were also wearing green "Russian" uniforms and there were provocatively dressed comic book drawings on the walls. And it is amusing to see Stoli chillin' in giant blocks of ice.

Being the little piglet I am, I had the milkshake trio. The captain crunch milkshake was the bomb! My bf had a sip and said to me, "You have to figure out how to make that at home." It was like a childhood dream come true. Memories of letting cereal get soggy, then slurping up the sweetened milk, ah, happiness. Moving on, the strawberry was very good but I kind of gave up drinking it because I couldn't get it through the straw. I mean, it IS a drink. The chunks of fresh strawberries were so big it was more like a fruit smoothie. Liquefy that sucker. Also I noticed my love for chocolate seems to be waning as I get older. The chocolate malt milkshake was good. Way chocolate. Way chocolate enough that I couldn't finish the little glass it came in. But still good. Certainly a go for lovers of the cacao bean.

As for the waffle fry nachos, I would really really really recommend this as an appetizer for a table of four. Especially if everyone plans on having an entree. The plate came out heaped a good half foot tall. The waffle fries were covered in oozing melted cheese. After attacking it from the side I managed to dig into the creamy cheese and pulled pork in the middle (yes, I deftly avoided the salsa and slices of jalapeno). So good, so rich, so taking home about three quarters of it. Our (huge) burgers arrived and we began to nosh on those as well. I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and my boyfriend had the Double Cheeseburger. My burger was good, I really liked the onion bun. I think they cooked it a little closer to medium rare then the medium I had asked for. The bacon was adequate and the fries were tasty. However, I think I will stick to Five Guys. My bf's was a perfect medium. He commented that it was good, but he would probably have liked it better if he had just built his own.

I think there were only two things I was irked at the entire meal. One was all the food pretty much arrived at the same time. The app was brought then the entrees arrived like three minutes later. The second thing is wiggle room. The plates are tiny. I know that presentation goes a long way but I would like to be able to cut my burger in half and not worry about my fries falling off my plate. I think if I were to go back I would mostly likely sample things other than burgers on their menu. Things like fried mac and cheese . . .
label: negative

text: Our stay at Residence Inn-West University was very enjoyable. All employees were very accommodating, especially Joseph & Will. text: This flight went surprisingly well. I was expecting a typical budget airline experience, filled with negatives to occur. The flight left within 15 minutes of departure, which is considered on time in the industry. We arrived on time in CLE. Contrary to recent news reports, the gate agents were not enforcing bag size/weight check at the gate when my mom and I were boarding the plane. Frontier got new seats and these a lot comfier and better than the old seats, now with a better sized tray table! It’s nice to have a direct flight to CLE from SAN for us. Far better and calmer experience than LAX. It was a great July 4 experience! Great deal too, the airfare itself excluding extras was $59, though those did add up quickly, but we know that when choosing an ULCC. Ex: Carry on was $65, seats $28/per person. Beware though , they charge $1 more for the middle seat! Why? Also not all planes have the new seating yet, but hopefully it’s coming soon. That’s why it’s not 10/10.
label: positive

text:
historisches Drama mit Action

Gerade Tom Hardy glänzt hier in einer weiteren Rolle, aber auch Shia Labeouf kann am meisten aus seiner Rolle rausholen und spielt die unterschiedlichen Facetten seines Charakters fabelhaft. Die Handlung wechselt von düsteren Szenerien zu fast schon idyllischen Landschaftsaufnahmen, bewirkt dadurch einen fesselnden Spannungsbogen, der trotzdem den Charakteren Zeit lässt, sich zu entfalten. Die unterschiedlichen Stimmungen, die die drei Brüder durchleben, wird dem Zuschauer sehr gut rüber gebracht. Fazit: Ein tolle Mischung zwischen historischem Drama und Actionfilm - Empfehlendswert!

text:
The food alone is worth five stars, but there were a few detractors in our experience that made me knock off a star. Let's review.

The space itself is really nice, although small, with gorgeous wallpaper, red lacquered tables and little stone 'pillows' for your spoons and chopsticks. It's that sort of attention to detail that I appreciate. The service was good as well, the servers were all kind and courteous. The menu is fairly extensive, with something for everyone's tastes, and a good number of traditional Korean dishes and loads of seafood. Nom.

We ordered the pork and squid bulgogi and hot pot with tofu and clams. The flavors were incredible, especially the bulgogi - tender pork, even more tender squid, cooked to spicy perfection. We cleaned that place instantaneously. The hot pot was quite good as well, although there was an abundance of onions and only five lonely clams in the whole bowl. They were so good, I wanted more of them! This is part of the reason why Shilla falls short of a five-star experience. The other reason was the banchan - I'm likely spoiled, but I'm used to plentiful, bottomless banchan and at Shilla we only received four dishes (and kimchi wasn't even included! sacrilege!) and once they were empty, they were gone. 

After we were done eating and our dishes were cleared and we mentioned that we were all finished now, thank you very much, we were made to wait for a good ten-fifteen minutes while the servers cleared tables and sat new arrivals. We finally had to ask for the check specifically. Am I missing something, or is it customary to marinate once one is finished with one's meal and sitting at an empty table?

I think once my expectations have been lowered a bit, I could definitely enjoy Shilla for the great Korean food and amazing flavors - but don't expect plentiful portions or an abundance of banchan.
label: neutral

text:
With all the resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, the Arizona Biltmore is unique having been built in 1929, well before most of the other resorts in the area. The Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture is worth a visit on its own, and the grounds are well maintained and pleasant to the eye. The conference facilities are on a par with most other resorts, and their fine dining restaurant, Wright's at the Biltmore, is excellent. The accomodations, however, are due a makeover. The furniture in our room was outdated and worn, the carpeting has reached its limit,
and the general feel of the room does not match that of the public areas. This was our second visit for a conference, and the comments regarding our room applied to both visits. Our rating of average was in comparison with other resort-type hotels.
label: neutral

text: Choosing Lufthansa with my wife to spend our honeymoon in the US. Flight was cancelled due to covid, so changed our trip to Mexico in 2021. My wife got a leg thrombosis being pregnant before the trip. They were willing to convert the amount we paid into a flight credit. They were not able to provide any written confirmation of it, but we thought we are in good hands. In 2022, our son was born with a rare genetic disease. Of course, we were unable to travel with him, and did not focus on our travel credit. Contacting the customer service this year, they informed us that the credit expired (with no previous notification, or alert). Since then, regarding the situation we are in, just wanted to extend the credit, to be able to use the amount we already paid. From department to department they are sending us. We are sending emails, proceeding phone calls without any help.
label: negative

text: Scenester, hipster, scenster, senster. That's what this hotel is. It's a shame but it feels like this hotel has given up on being a hotel and is focused on being cool. And the building is cool. The rooms are hip with black and white pictures of David Bowie. Plus, they feel historic, like apartments from the early 19th century, mine had three closets- two of which looked like they were something else at one point. The check in staff was pleasant. But the pool staff was horrible. I sat there for 2 hours without anyone coming up to ask if I wanted anything. Quite honestly I got the feeling I wasn't cool enough, compared to the ironic mullets that were lounging by and ashing in the pool; cool kids who I felt pretty confident were not guests. The location (right on Hollywood Blvd) is good if you want to do the tourist thing. But don't stay here if service is important to you.
label: neutral

text:
Enttäuschend - auch nach Produktaustausch
Die erste Waage lieferte nach kurzer Zeit permanent unterschiedliche Ergebnisse, z. T. mit mehreren Kilo Differenz. Dann ging sie plötzlich von einen auf den anderen Tag nicht mehr. Das Austausch Produkt funktionierte mehrere Monate ziemlich genau, nun geht es mit den schwankenden Angaben auch wieder los. Ich habe beidseitig je 2,5 kg zum Test auf die Waage gelegt, die wurden exakt mit 5 kg angezeigt. Bei meinem Mann und mir werden komischerweise immer abweichende Ergebnisse angezeigt, die weder mit den Ergebnissen von Arzt, noch Apotheke übereinstimmen. Ich muss aktuell mein Gewicht jeden 2. Tag kontrollieren, das geht leider nicht, wenn es Differenzen von bis zu 3 kg zur ärztlichen Messung gibt. Daher muss wohl eine neue Personenwaage her, schade.
label: neutral

text: Adoro a minha Airfryer Philips Walita! Comprei em 2012 e usei, até recentemente, quase todos os dias. A tomada sempre esquentava um pouco, mas parecia ser normal e eu tomava cuidado: não usava mais do que uma vez por episódio de uso (quer dizer, não usava 2 ou mais vezes em seguida). Em novembro de 2016, ela torrou a tomada. Mandei trocar o fio numa autorizada e coloquei uma tomada mais reforçada na parede. Funcionou bem, sempre esquentando a tomada um pouco, até maio de 2018, quando a tomada pegou fogo. Eu estava na cozinha e não aconteceu nada de mais grave. Mandei para a autorizada e a troca do fio foi orçada em R$418,00. Por estar fora da garantia, o fabricante não se interessou pelo problema. Fiquei desapontada. text:
The haircut is excellent. 

The distinguishing feature is the sense of community. When I've been there, the conversation among the patrons and barbers is lively, varied, and intelligent. Many seem to know each other. If a politician were coming to town to get a haircut and shake hands they should probably come here to set up their photo op.

There is a snacks and soda machine in the back for when the line is long. I've been there at peak times when the wait is three or four people ahead of me but since part of the point of coming here is to enjoy your community, waiting gives a little more chance to do that.

There's a graffiti mural of the Madison skyline on the wall inside the shop. Last time I checked the owner was unhappy with how it turned out and was having it re-done.
label: neutral

text:
One of the few pub grub joints in town with character. Ask for seating in intimate dining rooms upstairs for better experience and service.

Pros: The only place in Tempe, or the Valley for that matter, that I go for Ostyers on the half shell that are affordable at $12 per doz. Clam chowder and Onion au gratin soup are solid plays at $4 per cup. Great apps are the mountain of Clam strips for $6 or Cod fish and chips for $10, which are perfect when you're craving something fried to go with your brew. A surprise is the Angus quality beef - try the $22 petite filet with sides.

Cons: Parking sucks. Bouncers checking IDs at the doors are annoying. Hipster crowd smokes like chimneys and makes outdoor patio unusable for dining at night.
label: neutral

text:
We stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The GM, Jonathon is a credit to his hotel and the Marriott chain - nothing was too hard. His staff are top notch and are to be commended. The suites are a good size, although our bedroom was a little smaller than some of the other hotels we've stayed at. Our room was a bit hot, but that's my fault for not reporting the A/C at the time. The room was spotless and included a decent kitchen area, sofa etc. The hotel offers a free local area shuttle which will get you to the zoo, downtown (Gaslamp) and old town which really saved our already sore feet!
My only complaints are based on comparison with other hotels that we'd just stayed at; The breakfast selection wasn't huge, adequate but not as expansive as some of the others we'd experienced. The manager's function which we joined one night only happens a few times a week and is very basic, but at least they have one! - again just not like say an Embassy function.
I have no problems recommending this hotel, its location, cleanliness, brilliant staff, free shuttle, free breakfast and oh a great pool make it a great choice for anyone looking for somewhere to stay in San Diego.
label: positive

text:
I paid $80 for this 4 star hotel through <url> I looked on the website and it was $207 a regular night. Holy cheeto balls! That's outrageous. $80 is priced correctly for this hotel. Not worth $200 at all. I'd probably bump it down to a 31/2 star hotel not 4. Overall, not a horrible hotel. I probably won't stay here again just because I like to try different hotels everywhere I go. However, if you purchased a priceline deal and got this hotel, this is what you get.
+ Requested extra towels, they were brought up immediately
+ Check in and Check out was quick and easy
+ We got a remodeled double bed room facing the city. I was content about that because I was dreading an old green carpeted room from reviews I've read.
+ Location was great. Close to Barton Springs and Whole foods market.
- You can still tell the hotel is old from the walls and bathroom but what can you do. It's an old hotel.
- Pool was closed a bit due to the rain
- Starbucks was closed unfortunately the weekend I went. What a bummer. My family and I were looking forward to it too. Sigh.
- Self parking was $15 but they charged me $20 on my card.
label: negative

text:
Super clean hotel with a great location. You can catch the subway without having to go outside. The discounted breakfast buffet was varied enough not to get boring.
However, for a hotel like a Hyatt I was surprised about the attitude of the staff. Its not that they were rude, just completely indifferent. We spent six days at this hotel and managed to see the same host at breakfast every day. You would have thought you would at least get a hello, but like the rest of the staff just grunts.
At least it was not just us because they seemed to treat their coworkers with the same indifference. Again, we were their for six days and hardly saw the staff interact with each other.
The structure and location were great, but the staff need their daily wellbutrin, and caffeine injection. Time to send your staff and management to happy camp!
label: positive

text: I checked in, everything was fine I had a nice sleep and the next day I went out to get breakfast. When I came back my fridge was gone. I knew I had a fridge to begin with because I put my drink in there. There was only an empty space. I went downstairs and said my fridge was missing. They said they took it becuase it wasn't included in the reservation. I told them they can't give someone a room with a fridge an then take it out the next day while I'm gone, shady people. I told them that the reservation doesn't say I get an iron, coffee maker, hot water, air conditioning and internet. But nonetheless all of those are included and no one took those out. It's becuase I booked for a lower price than most when I checked out the rates the day of. text:
Poor service at check-in to start with. Made our own way with luggage down shabby corridor to an even more shabby room. Not only was the decoration of the room VERY tired it was also filthy. Carpet looked as if it hadn't been vacuumed this year, all soft furnishings very stained and in poor condition - sort of tide-mark around the valances, a sofa so stained you didn't want to go near it for fear of catching something, noisy air-con, musty smell, noisy mini-bar. Duty manager changed our room up to the Club level which superficially was a little cleaner. However, a shower was impossible that night as there was no hot water. To cap it all, when I awoke in the morning, I had insect bites on my legs from bedbugs......
Overall a very nasty experience. Not what you expect from a Radisson hotel and not what you expect at around $250 a night.
label: negative

text:
I've been to a few other Ruth's Chris's before and this one looked more like a hole in the wall. If you weren't looking for it, you just might miss it. Aside from the physical appearance on the outisde, the interior did lack some of the more romantic, dark, fine dining ambiance than other locations. 

 I came for a reception this time and found the food still very good. Our Filet Mignon's came in hot plates. The meat was tender and smelled delicious in the buttery sauce. Our sides were mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and cream of spinach. I did have higher expectations for the cream of spinach because Ruths Chris makes them the best. but this time it wasn't as creamy and it stuck like cheese a little. in terms of quality, temperature, and taste of my Filet. It was delicious especailly for a large party for a wedding banquet. 

Service was very good and efficient. Enjoyable.
label: neutral

text: This was my third visit here (first was tourist then second and thrid as a local) and I was not impressed with the food at all. This place is overrated! It is understandable for tourists whom donot know any better and always wanted to try places with longer line or impossible to get reservation. But for local folks, there are better Thai food in Vegas. My YUM WOON SEN SEAFOOD salad was salty and sour. The same salty and sour taste was presented in PLAR DOOK O-CHA (Whole Fried Catfish). The golden fried tofu was soggy, cold, and over price ($7.95). My friend ordered the Tom Yum Kai soup and he said it tasted nothing but spicy hot. My other friend got the Pad Se-ew and she was disappointed. She is a local and said it tasted better several years ago. She told us to try different places next time we come to Vegas and don't come back again. My friends got wine and they said it was OK. We skipped desert (fried banana) because there was no point after the soggy fried tofu.
label: negative

text:
Никогда, вы слышите, никогда не связывайтесь с этой помойкой! Организация поездок ниже уровня канализации в Камбодже. Контора - прокладка, причём использования и неоднократно. Никакой компитентности и ответственности. 3 дня не можем уехать с Кабардинки.
Купили путёвку в данной шашаршкиной конторе в Кабардинку. Добирались вместо заявленных 24 часов 36. В пути 2 раза сломался автобус ( на вид автобус был списан в конце 90-ых); расстояние между сиденьями на столько мало, что ноги нужно вытягивать в проход, а у окна об этом можно не мечтать. Поездка на юг, но кондей работает в два режима - либо дует на всю либо никак. Водители не знают дороги, навигатор для них диво-дивное, ЧУДО-ЧУДНОЕ. Обратно должны выехать 25 июня. Да случился форс-мажор, но решать проблему им не нужно. Через 10 звонков, как в испорчено телефоне дозвонились да главных массовиков-затейников и те любезно нам оплатили ещё сутки проживания в отеле. Но и 26 за нами никто не приехал. Просьбу компенсировать нам самостоятельный проезд на поезде отказали. Попросили подождать ещё и оплатили ещё половину дня проживания. На телефонные звонки, а их было не мало отвечают всегда по разному, то автобус за вами уже едет, то выезжает позже, то ещё не выехал.
В итоге 27 июня нас попросили покинуть номер в 17:00, а приедут за нами в полночь... Потом в 3 часа ночи, а потом и вовсе в 5 утра.
На каком самокате за нами едут уже 36 часов не понятно.
Приедем в Вязьму, а мы когда-нибудь приедем, будем судиться.
label: negative

text:
We rarely go to the movies. But we were on vacation. And the theater is so close to our timeshare. So....what the heck! Let's do it!

AMC has an IMAX theater, and the big screen was showing a just released 3D the night we went.

Loved the theater. The seats were comfy enough. It was clean. The popcorn smell drove me crazy (dammit). The bathrooms were well maintained. And the movie happened to be great. Sandra Bullock and George Clooney never looked better. Yep. Gravity.

The price for IMAX and 3D will set you back a bit more than average, but for a good hour and a half of intense entertainment, I was quite happy.

Nice theater.
