text: Хочу выразить огромную благодарность салону Ажур! За шикарно проделанную работу! Хочу подчеркнуть, что Эльмира- не просто хороший и душевный человек, но и высококвалифицированный профессионал своего дела. Я заказывала комплект штор, постельное белье хочу отметить, что работать с Эльмирой было одно удовольствие так как еще по совместительству она и дизайнер, пообщавшись со мной было предложено много интересных вариантов тканей, которые очень подошли моему интерьеру, что самое удивительное при личной встрече Эльмира привезла не только каталоги, которые были предложены, но и каталоги, которые хотелось бы дополнительно еще рассмотреть. От всей души желаю Вам продолжать доставлять людям радость и удовольствие от Ваших работ, творить красоту и не останавливаться на достигнутом.\n
label: positive

But TA focuses more on the erotica side, the tauntings from fellow players, reporters more a side issue. And it works as this man writes the sex scenes so well. Interesting main and side characters and I look forward to more in this series.

text:
Even a casual fan of Warhol will enjoy this museum. Its seven floors of exhibition space contain Warhol's art, personal memorabilia and special exhibitions. As you wander through each floor, you really get a sense of his aesthetic and his obsession with pop culture. 

I visited during the Marilyn Monroe retrospective. I enjoyed the mixture of media - the photographs were especially interesting to me. I also really loved the interactive "Silver Clouds" room. Its like the best pillow fight you'll ever have,

Overall, it's a great museum, though if pressed for time, I would head to the Natural History/Art Museum over this one.
label: neutral

text: My wife and I decided to take long weekend on the San Antonio Riverwalk for our anniversary in early November, 2012. We had heard that the Wyndham St. Anthony had been remodeled and thought we would give it a try. The lobby is fabulous. Very retro (30's-40's) with chandeliers, beautiful artwork, and very comfortable seating in the common areas. We felt we were in for a great stay for $99 per night plus fees and taxes. To our surprise the luxury ended at the lobby. Our room was supposed to have been ADA handicapped accessible. Ha! The only thing remotely close to ADA code was an oversized towel bar in the tub/shower. The doors were not wide enough for wheel-chair access. The oversized 4-post bed was so tall that my 5' 2" wife had to literally climb in using the bed rail and I scooted in after placing my rear on the edge and backing onto the bed. The bath was extremely small (approximately 4' x 6'). The tub was old with mold in several areas both at the top and bottom. The sink was pedestal-style with a dripping faucet (reported at checkin, still not fixed when we left on the 3rd day. Storage consisted of a small glass shelf above the sink. My wife could not use the mirror even standing on her tiptoes. The television was not visible from the bed unless I removed one of the bedposts. Not only that, the television was a 90's analog TV with minimal cable access. Carpet was filthy. My white socks were black after walking around the room. Our garden view room overlooked a rooftop party area. Nothing is included in the nightly fee. Parking is $10 per day across the street (self-parking), $30 + tip for valet, or take a chance on scoring a meter on the surrounding streets. An additional fee applys to internet access as well. I assumed the daily newspaper was free because I just took one of of the checkin counter. Would I stay again? NO! Not even gratis.
label: negative

text:
Un gros bof: vite lu, vite oublié
Voilà une histoire sans rien d'extraordinaire. C'est plat émotionnellement parlant: rien de palpitant, rien d'émouvant, peu d'émotions ressenties en lisant cette romance... L'intrigue est classique et sans surprise, ni suspense. Les personnages manquent de caractères et sont un peu niais, mous du genou... J'ai parfois eu envie de secouer tout ce petit monde bien trop lisse et correct. C'est gentillet et trop fleur bleue. Tout est trop simple. Je mets 3 étoiles car l'histoire est fluide, bien menée dans sa chronologie et elle a le mérite de nous faire découvrir le monde du hockey sur glace.

text: I sincerely wonder why this film was ever made. A Bulgarian-Italian co-production set in a version of Berlin where all Germans speak English with a German accent and all Turks speak English with some Turkish words in between, is hardly credible. The English vocabulary is basically limited to "fuck you, bastard" and the acting is worse than anyone can imagine. Apart from this, racial tensions in Germany can be an interesting subject but in the Germany I know there are no gangs shooting each other in the middle of the street in clear daylight. And if all that is not enough, there is also a serial killer going around who kills Turkish children and paints them white. In order to create some tension, we see the serial killer and hear him hum Schubert's lullaby but we won't see his face. I don't even believe they actually shot it in Germany. There are some street shots that are quite obviously in Berlin, but the actors are not seen in those shot. It's probably Bulgaria with some German signs added here and there.
label: negative

text: If you want to stop off to see the worlds largest thermometer and have some food, then this stop is for you. The Mad Greek in itself is an ok place. There are two locations; one in Baker (near Death Valley) and then one near the entrance to LV. It's usually packed so if you like Greek food, then this may be for you. From what I remember, the falalel balls were tasty and weren't overly fried. A creamy Tahini sauce accompanies most dishes which is perfect since the weather here is HOT! The restaurant designed with roman statues and columns on the outside so you can't miss it when you are exiting. The inside is more like a greek cafeteria and is congested with a lot of seating space and people to match. The Baker stop has an option for a decent bathroom and like I said before, if you look to the left of the Mad Greek, you will see a large pole showing the temperature. This is the only one found in America and although it boasts that it shows the right temperature, its actually off a couple of degrees.
label: negative

text:
Check in went very smooth, and took less than 3 min.
The service at the hotel is not fantastic, but it is okay, and I got no complaints.
The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. We stayed 3 people in a 2 queen bed room, and we had plenty of space. Beds were comfy, and the bathroom was also very nice. For a 3 star hotel the rooms are excellent.
Didn't use the pool, but the pool area was nice and clean.
Hotel offers free wireless internet.
Parking cost $16 per night.
Location is great if you have a car, and don't want to spend too much money on accom, however, I will stay in a different area next time.
Downtown is a very nice area, but hotels are way more expensive, but def, the best option if you don't have a car.
Pacific Beach is a great place for going out, and is a very chill area.
Overall, it is a very nice and modern hotel.
label: positive

Or a Red Bull. \n\nIt's like Old Country Buffet, basically. There were some highlights - like the mashed potatoes and jello. But...that's about it. I think the interior is exactly the same as it was when I was 9 and came here for the first time. Pass!
label: negative

text: I stayed here for one night only after reading other reviews, and after receiving a really good rate. Staff were generally friendly and helpful - special mention must be made of the doorman, who was exceptionally friendly and helpful and not the least bit condescending. The registration staff were, well, reserved and offered no help or information. The first thing I noticed on entering was the smell. The place smelled old and musty - especially in the elevators. The room seemed fine at first glance, although the sheets apparently had not been pressed or ironed and the towels were hanging skew on the rails. The worst was the bathtub, which was infested with black mold along the sides - so badly that I was reluctant even to shower. I had dinner in the hotel also. The menu seemed fine, but the food might as well have been sawdust. My steak was overcooked, even though I asked for a "medium" steak. The fries were very good, but the rolls were microwaved and had been in the microwave too long. Breakfast the next morning was equally nondescript and less than appealing. When I checked out, I mentioned the problems with the room, and was made to wait while the receptionist filled out forms and phoned people - so perhaps they have cleaned out the mold by now. Checkout usually takes a few seconds or minutes and is automated in most hotels. Not this one. I had to wait at least 10-15 minutes - and I was the only guest checking out. So - despite a great location, I certainly will not return to this hotel. If they allow bathrooms that are visibly affected, then I have to question overall cleanliness of everything else.
label: negative

text:
The hip hop culture doesn't interest me in the least. 

Mostly because it has not one ounce of finesse or subtlety to it. 
Give me Ray Charles or Stevie Ray Vaughn or Tower of Power (coming to Southpoint in May by the way) any day.

BUT...Flav's chicken joint DOES have subtlety and finesse. 
I'm not referring to the ghetto theater surrounding the place: tough-looking guys dressed in black guarding the door and letting people in one-at-a-time...(give me a break guys, it's a take-out chicken shack, not a VIP room!) 

BUT BUT....the chicken itself is excellent...full of subtle flavors and spices, and clearly made with some finesse.
The mac n cheese was ok: a little runny but flavorful. And the fries were much better than average.

BUT BUT BUT.....it's the chicken that's worth coming back for. 
They're on to something here. It's obvious that they care about what they're doing.
House of FlavOr could become a larger enterprise, and maybe one day even a chain. 
I'll be back, that's for sure.



Hmmmm.....I just re-read this review. 
Maybe I've got a little hip hop in me after all, cuz clearly I like BIG BUTS.
label: neutral

text:
There are holiday pages!
I almost ordered another book because I thought this one didn’t have pages or spaces for holidays. I was pleasantly surprised to see that there is a page for Christmas and New Year’s Day, Valentine’s Day and Easter, Thanksgiving, Special Holiday, and Halloween. Thanksgiving has it’s own page but the others share a page as indicated above. The pages are beautiful and the cover is nice. The stickers are very cute. The only reason why I’m giving 4 stars is I wish there were more blank pages. There is only one blank page at the back of the book. I love the content of the book but I think there should be at least 4 blank pages for people to use for additional writing space or photos.
label: positive

text:
En menos de un año la batería casi a muerto.

Yo la utilizo casi a diario para ir a trabajar de madrugada los primeros meses me duraba unos tres días, hora y media casi dos horas. Hoy 17 de septiembre con menos de un año no llega a los 30 minutos casi todo el camino en baja intensidad, menos mal que llevo foco en el casco si no ya me contarás a las 6 de la mañana. Edito. Me puse en contacto con el vendedor exponiendo lo que me pasaba y que garantía tenia el producto, después de verificar el fallo me a mandado un faro nuevo entero. El vendedor super pendiente y correo de hoy interesándose si me había llegado el nuevo. Todo solucionado en 5 dias. Por mi parte atención al cliente del vendedor de un 10. Un saludo.
label: negative

text: A less-than-subtle poke at the beliefs and teachings of the Catholic Church is given a darker shade of death near the end of the show. Throughout the show, dark humour plays a medium through which several commonly heard rhetoric questions are asked, especially "If God is so good, why does he allow evil to exist in the world?"Diane Keaton is excellent in her role as an exaggerated version (though some might disagree) of they stereotyped religious teacher who spouts the "company line" and condemns half the world to burn in Hell. To celebrate her school's 25th anniversary, she invites her first students to return and perform their Christmas pageant.However, when the quartet "update" their play to parody Sister Mary's "fallacious" teachings, the nun is pushed over the edge, sending the story spiralling into a chain of unhappy events. The ending finally leaves the audience with a sick feeling in their hearts.Not recommended. Go watch the play instead.
label: negative

text: I rented this movie on 20 June 2001, and watched it for about 45 minutes. I concluded that watching a blank screen would be delightful by comparison. text:
Now my dog is addicted. Let me explain before you call PETA!!! I bought my favorite Raspberry Lemon Zest cupcake from them, and went home. My pitbull, who could care less if I was being murdered and never wakes up to say hi when I come home, suddenly rose from her coma the moment I walked in the door.

I was impressed, I was like "my baby came to the door!" I was excited, but she wasn't looking at me, she was looking at what was in my hand. I sit down, I flick on the tv, there she is again, best behaved dog in the world suddenly. So I'm eating my cupcake and wondering, why is she being so good? Last time she was this good, I had to rip down "Have you seen my cat" signs and dig a hole in the backyard to hide what the mutt did. Then it hits me, the cupcake in my hand. I take my pinky, jack a little frosting off the top, let her lick my finger and tell her to go away.

Weeks later, my family comes in town and they are staying with me. I tell them about this place I loved and bring home cupcakes. My grandfather comes to check out what's in my hand, the dog starts growling, I'm thinking she protective of me. I put my stuff down, take off to my room to change, come back and she's still growling at him and everyone else, a stance between her and the cupcakes.

My grandfather says, let's test the theory (he knows if you wrestle me the dog will attack) so he comes over and kicks my ass with the help of other family members. The dog holds her ground, protect the cupcakes and not the lady that feeds her.

This was absolutely a relief, I use to be afraid of someone breaking into the house in the middle of the night and I didn't know if Zoey could rise to the occasion to protect the home. But it brings me to tears to know every Sweet Daddy cupcake will be safe while the robbers are tying me to a chair and gagging me. Never a more proud moment to a pet parent. F**king dog, F**king Sweet Daddy's, turn my dog too?
label: positive

text:
When I first moved to Arizona, I lived less than a mile away from this place, so as you can imagine, I've driven by it thousands of times. Seven years later, I finally made my way down the driveway to check it out, and I'm glad I did!

I went to meet some friends at their pumpkin patch. Since it's unseasonably hot lately, and we all have young babies, we decided to meet first thing in the morning (at 9am, when they first open). Smart move... even then it was pretty hot outside! Luckily, MacDonald's Ranch has cold refreshments such as snoballs which we all enjoyed. (Thanks Jake B for treating!)

Unfortunately though, none of us knew that the actual pumpkin patch was a hayride away, and none of us felt comfortable bringing our newborns on the hayride, even with the car seats in tow. So, we did make it to the ranch but left empty handed. I guess I'll have to purchase my pumpkin elsewhere this season. That said, MacDonad's Ranch does offer a ton of other fun activities including a petting zoo, pony rides, music, etc. They host all kinds of events too, such as birthday parties, weddings, and corporate events.

Once Baby M is a bit older, I will definitely return to MacDonald's Ranch, but I don't think I got my $8 worth (the cost of entry) this time around. Oh well... Happy Halloween all!
label: negative

text:
Although we live in Washington, my husband and I along with another married couple, which are close friends of ours, stayed over Valentine's weekend (February 12th - 13th 2011.) We booked a package for the Valentine's Day which included dancing and champagne at the hotel's club.
Unfortunately, the weekend was unpleasantly interrupted the morning of February 13th when an employee of the hotel used his all access room key to enter our friend's room even though they had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and check out time was much later. The Doubletree employee walked in on them in the middle of an intimate moment and saw my best friend naked. She was appalled and mortified and both she and her husband screamed and clumsily fell off of the bed in a panic.
We roomed next door and heard the commotion, but thought it was just someone goofing on off in the hallway. We were appalled when shortly thereafter our friends told us what was going on.
When they called the management of the hotel (the highest ranking person in management on that day was the Housekeeping Supervisor), she reported that there were no male housekeepers, so they must be mistaken. Mistaken? Really?
The male friend of the couple is a Detective in the police department, and immediately kicked into "detective mode." He had to insist they contact hotel security and do an investigation to find out who entered their room.
Much chaos ensued along with my friend in tears and my husband and me trying to console her. I ended up speaking with the housekeeping supervisor, who added insult to injury by misstating my friend's first name to me and when I told her she was incorrect, instead of apologizing and asking for her name, had the audacity to tell me that my friend had misspoken her OWN name.
Several hours later, we finally found out that the man, which indeed WAS on Doubletree's hotel staff was a "runner." He entered the room unauthorized to put water bottles in it (something that is only supposed to happen in unoccupied rooms being prepped for the next guests) and completely bypassing the Do Not Disturb, the fact that the guest list was registered to check out later that day, AND breaking many other hotel protocols.
This employee of Doubletree also did NOT report the incident to his supervisor. They had to investigate the room key access for that room to find out it had been him.
There were other minor things that had occurred during the stay that one can chalk up to "hotel anomalies." As a frequent business traveler, I get that some minor things can happen. However, this security breach and the mishandling of the situation thereafter is absolutely inexcusable.
I left a message for the Hotel's General Manager, which as of this morning has still to return my call. I will not be staying at this Hilton Hotels Doubletree property ever again. I suggest that if you want to feel safe, that you do not either.
label: negative

text:
Booked the Westin Times Square on the strength of the Westin name. The hotel was nice , but impersonal. We had a double club room on the 14th floor. The room was smaller than I expected and the charge for internet was a bit much. These rooms are not exactly budget priced . We paid extra for the club room and we got the I-Mac computer - but had to pay to get online. Our biggest issue however was that our room door faced on to an inner courtyard of the hotel - which seemed to be used as a meeting place for business. So every morning of our stay at 7:00 am it was very noisy in our room -as there were at least 150 people milling about below our rooms clanging plates, cups etc... and chatting. That was annoying to say the least. We had asked for a quiet room and we dismayed to hear this chaos first thing in the morning. Also, throughout the night there was a lot of noise from nearby construction going on - New York is truly the city that never sleeps - at least it's construction crews! Again, the hotel was nice - but not really worth the price we paid. I have stayed in many hotels far superior at a much better price - Next time, we'll be at the Affinia Shelburne or Dumont, the Lucerne or the Blakely - they have the personal touches that make you feel special.
On the upside the door men and gentlemen at the courtesy/ security desk were quite personable and helpful.
label: negative

text:
С весны этого года нахожусь в поисках двери. Наткнулась на салон «Престиж» с дверьми в ТЦ Миллион Мелочей. Сначала все шло более, чем хорошо, и обслуживание и сами двери, НО! Когда пошел вопрос по заказу и формированию заказа начались интересные моменты.
Повышение цен по доставке, подъему и сбору. Видимо потому, что я снизила общую цену путем отказа от гарнитура магазина с накруткой в 200% (те же самые ручки на озоне в 2 раза дешевле). Не долго думая, консультанты решили компенсировать свой минус за счет повышения цен на доставке, услугам замерщика и тп. Разница казалось бы везде незначительная от 100 до 500 рублей, но общую картину производит отвратительную. На вопрос «почему у вас повышение цен происходит за неделю?» мне ответили, что «вы бы еще месяц походили и повыбирали». После такого ответа все сразу стало понятно, вежливые только тогда, когда на кону заказ. А если заказ не очень выгоден и клиент что-то выбирает сам, они компесируют это накруткой сверху.
ДАННЫЙ САЛОН НЕ РЕКОМЕНДУЮ от слова «СОВСЕМ». 
С такими «менеджерами» далеко они не уйдут)
label: negative

text:
We stopped in here last night for dinner before First Friday. The place was pretty busy, and we were told we'd have a a 30 minute wait. However, it was closer to 45 minutes.

There's a big couch in the waiting area decorated with sombreros. The wall was covered with pictures of Frida Kahlo. I liked the look of the place and was looking forward to a good dinner.

I ordered a chile relleno and tamal with pork in red sauce. My wife got a carne asada taco, chile relleno, and tamal with chicken in green sauce.

While we were waiting for our food, we were given chips, salsa, and bean dip. The salsa wasn't very flavorful and the bean dip was lukewarm. 

It took a very long time before we got our order. Once we got it, the food was lukewarm. The chile relleno was fine but nothing special. The tamales were okay, but again, nothing special.

The only thing I really liked was the carne asada taco. My wife got an order of flan. She's a flan snob and said it was one of the better flan she's had, second only to her favorite at Frank and Fina's Cocina.

While we were waiting to be seated, I saw that there was Groupon available for Casa Don Juan. I bought it hoping it would be available to use by the time we were done eating. It wasn't, so I guess I'll be back. I'm hopeful that we'll have a better experience if we go when it's not so busy....I'll let you know!
label: negative

text:
The first time I visit this store will be my last...but not for the reasons that you may think. 

Located next to a very popular candy & ice cream store, until last night I never knew this store existed. Which is a sad thing once entering it. This is a unique store that sells individualized furniture mad from such materials as cement and wood. I sat in one of these chairs and it is amazing comfortable! This store prominently features local artists with painting, jewelry, wood working, and so much more. 

 The owner greeted us as we entered and was extremely personable and provide details and history of any items in the store. My husband bought a wooden cell phone case that both looks ruggedly manly but feels amazing. Made by a local high school student. :)

This store also has some fun novelty items. Ladies if you miss that rugged manly smell from you guy, stop by and pick him up some manly soaps and beard supplies. With fragrances like whiskey, tobacco, and pine how can you go wrong. What about a bison leather flask, I totally want one of those for myself. 

In talking to the owner he advised that this fun store would be closing in a couple of weeks and while he plans to relocate in the future for the time being online sales will be the only way to acquire these amazing items. So sadly my first visit to this place will have to be my last.
label: neutral

text: 10.11.2022 мне заблокировали онлайн банкинг, я пошла в отделение, мне сказали предоставить какие-то документы, подтверждающие законность зачислененных средств! Я написала заявление, сказали ждите 5 дней, через 5 дней пришел ответ, что нужно ещё 5 дней, я за это время несколько раз ходила в отделение и всё бесполезно, я перезжала из Донецка и перевела деньги через обменник, для этого специально открыла карту, но мне её заблокировали, так ещё и деньги не отдают уже почти месяц!!! Я попросила скинуть мне скриншоты обменов, там, как мне объяснили, проводили операцию через п2п Гарантекс прямо мне на карту, эти скриншоты не хотели брать, но с 3 раза взяли, писала на снятие средств, сказали одобрено, на 900 - одобрено, можете снять с кассы, прихожу в отделение - нет, нельзя, только с закрытием счета, написала на закрытие счета, срок был до сегодня, но обещали процесс ускорить, по итогу, ждите, сроков нет! класс!!! Т.е. мне 2 недели не выдают мои деньги даже в кассе с закрытием счета, это как называется? Мне нужны были эти деньги для оплаты квартиры и учебы нужно было отправить родственникам!!! Очень не советую, одни говорят, что всё хорошо, в офисе - нет, нельзя, я устала ходить и звонить!
label: negative

text:
unPhogettable
Mekong Plaza
66 S. Dobson Road
Mesa 85202

There are as many styles of the ubiquitous Vietnamese dish pho (pronounced PHA) as there are people that eat it, and of course, everyone has their favorite. Having eaten pho from one end of this country to the other, this is my favorite place to eat this wonderful dish.

We were seated immediately, and our drink order was taken. This isn't a fancy restaurant, but you wouldn't know it by the attentive service and spotless tables.

Companion and I started out with the Goi Cuon ($3.45), which are soft spring rolls filled with shrimp, pork and veggies and served with a delightful peanut sauce. If it were not for the fact that we were there for dinner, I'd probably have made it a double order and had just that, they were so good. Being made with soft rice paper brought a whole new texture to the party, and I loved the peanut sauce with it.

For main courses, companion ordered Pho Dac Bjet Bo Vien ($8.25) which is a soup tureen sized bowl of wonderful broth, filled with noodles, rare steak slices, flank, brisket, tendon, tripe, and beef meatballs, and asked for the tripe to be left out, since companion isn't fond of it. It was no problem for the kitchen to prepare it the way companion wanted it.

I ordered the same thing but with extra tendon ($3.00), since I love the texture of this item. 

In making their broth, it is simmered for a minimum of 24 hours, which results in a hugely flavorful base for the pho. For those that don't care to have some of the more esoteric ingredients in their pho, there are many choices on the menu including a pho made with chicken breast and another one that is vegetarian. The pho is served with a plate of fresh Thai basil, bean sprouts, lime, and jalapeno's for those that like to add to the bowl. I always add some fish sauce which is on the table because I love the flavor of it.

It's hard to describe a bowl of pho except to say it is a meal in a bowl that is huge! If I eat this for lunch, my meals for the day are taken care of, since it is so big. (Yes, they will provide a take out for the rest if you need one.)

For those that prefer something other than pho (there are 16 varieties of pho), there are also 15 other types of soup on the menu, as well as 11 types of salads, 6 vegetarian selections, and a number of steamed rice items as well. Kids are welcome and have their own selections.

Restrooms have always been clean when I have been there, and service is so friendly you feel almost like your eating in a friends house.

I give them 4 stars for service, quality of food, and cleanliness. (And a big YUM for flavor!)
label: neutral

text:

Los materiales son de buena calidad y la diadema no le queda tan ceñida por lo que cumplen con su cometido principal. En cuanto a la cancelación activa de ruido, no esperéis demasiado por este precio y más si habéis usado Bose o Sony.

text: My husband and I have lived in Kuala Lumpur for almost a decade. We already have a few favorite Italian restaurants (Nerovivo, Nerotecca, Sassarosso, etc. for non-hotel Italian restaurants) but we were invited to a wine pairing dinner at Ciao recently so we thought it was a good opportunity to try yet another well known in-town Italian restaurant. The ambience both inside/outside is lovely. It's obviously a well known venue for weddings/celebrations with a separate glass room outdoors adjacent to a manmade pond; very pretty indeed. Outdoor dining is possible (with strong overhead fans I noticed as well) and there is a very nice bar inside with a large seating area to choose from. It's a combination of rustic, romantic and upscale design.As we were part of a large group of about people, I am not sure we had the best offerings from the kitchen and later I checked and they were indeed not on the usual menu. With this in mind, the food was only average. The starter was a fresh crab salad but the crab was a bit soggy and it was nothing special. The middle course was a beef cheeks ravioli of which I found the sauce to be quite floury and the meat tasteless (the pasta itself was well made). There was a choice of fish, chicken or lamb for the main course; I had the lamb (rack of lamb) and my husband had cod. Both were nice but again nothing I would order again. Dessert was a chocolate covered mousse which was not appealing to me at all but my husband enjoyed it (tasted mass produced to me...). I see some excellent reviews so if we lived near by we might give the restaurant another try, but as we already have some superlative choices closer to where we live, I doubt we'll be coming back. I'd still say the venue would be lovely for an event but I would probably stick to the regular menu and do a full tasting ahead of time. (Wines were provided to us but also wouldn't have been ones I'd select if offered by the restaurant.)
label: neutral

text:
We arrived at the Peabody and were thrilled when we saw the elegant lobby with the ducks swimming in the fountain.
However, when we were taken to our room, as soon as the door was opened by the porter a very strong smell of damp came to meet us. We asked for another room. The porter contacted reception on his radio and we were instantly given another room. The new room was fine, large and furnished beautifully. The bed was comfortable and we looked forward to our stay. We slept well on the first night but in the morning when my husband was having a shower he was joined by a cockroach. We were horrified and rang down to customer services and asked for someone to come to sort it out. No-one arrived, so I went down to the lobby and spoke to the receptionist and said we needed someone to come to the room immediately and that we wanted a different room for that night. A janitor came to the room and dealt with the cockroach, and we were given a new room on the Club floor. Although the hotel staff voluntarily gave us the upgraded room they did not tell us how to reach the floor in the elevator, and we were embarassed that we could not get to the twelth floor. Eventually a gentleman in the lift showed us how to use our room card to access our floor. We were not told that there was a complimentary breakfast either. So although we were upgraded we felt that it was not done with good grace. When we checked out of the hotel our parking charges were cancelled as an apology for the problems we experienced which we thought was a nice gesture.
The hotel is well situated and the staff are helpful and polite. It was the unwanted guest in our room that spoiled our stay slightly.
The ducks are fab, by the way!!
label: positive

text: Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney, Australia, following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old Jimmy, (Heath Ledger), who bundles a job for a local gangster and needs to make amend before they get to him. The gangsters, (led by Bryan Brown), are a menacing bunch with a humorous streak in them. That's what makes the film work, because we always view gangsters as a rough bunch out to screw you badly. But this mob tickle your funny bone as well. A clever structured script by Jordan has characters crossing paths and getting caught in the web plot.

text:
Estuvimos con mi familia durante 5 días en Enero de 2010,. Lo bueno de este Hotel es que está emplazado en el corazón de la isla de Manhattan, y estas equidistante de todas las atracciones de la ciudad con el Subway que tomas en la puerta del hotel. Respecto al hotel propiamente dicho les comento: que lo mejor que tiene es la habitación compartimentada, es decir que tienes un dormitorio con una cama grande de dos plazas y un living con un sofá-cama, que es ideal si vas con hijos. Posee un baño realmente grande y un área donde tienes una bacha para lavar menaje de “cocina”, cafetera, horno microondas y una pequeña heladera (refrigerador).
Esto es fantástico ya que puedes programar hacer tu propio desayuno en la habitación, dado que los del hotel son muy caros y cualquier desayuno en bares y/o en MacDonals, no baja de u$s 10 /12 por persona.
Esta comodidad que te ofrece es rarísima en la Ciudad de New York, que se caracteriza por habitaciones muy pequeñas y baños diminutos y a lo sumo solo te colocan una cafetera.
Además posee un caja fuerte que programas vos mismo para poner tus valores, y tiene un tamaño que incluso podes gardar tu laptop o notebook.
El servicio de habitación es bueno y el servicio de mucamas también, ya cuando vuelves de tu paseo por la ciudad encuentras la habitación limpia y ordenada. Ademas posee una mesa-escritorio que se puede ampliar y dos TV de plasma de 42 pulgadas, una en la habitación y otra en el living.
Hay que tener en cuenta algo, a la puerta del Hotel se encuentra Times Square, eso quiere decir que siempre tienes ruido, gritos y mucha gente (a la hora que sea), así que si buscas algo mas tranquilo… elije otra zona de la ciudad. Pero como dije antes estas en el centro propiamente dicho de la isla. Estas a 10 cuadras del Central Park y a 8 de Macys, por lo tanto puedes ir caminando.
Secretos a la hora de reservar el Hotel: 1) Inscríbete en el programa de la cadena (Hilton HHonors), y así conocerán tus gustos de habitación de antemano (por ejemplo, lejos del ascensor, no fumador, pisos altos, etc.) ya que si tienen disponibilidad priorizan los mismos; 2) Paga y/o reserva la habitación mas barata, ya que luego de la registración y/o pago con tu tarjeta de crédito te aparece la opción de un “Upgrade” de habitación. Estas opciones comienzan en u$s 5 (que con mas los taxes e impuestos rondaran los 8). El sistema funciona así: vos pagas y/o reservas la habitación mas abarata y luego pedís que te consideren un upgrade de existir disponibilidad al momento de arribo al hotel.
En nuestro caso pagué por adelantado una habitación normal económica (que son las que están hasta el piso 4 o 5) y luego por esa poca diferencia me subieron al piso 33, con lo cual tienes una vista impresionante de la ciudad.
Como ‘contras’ puedo comentar lo siguiente: 1) que el sistema de “early check in” es una verdadera porquería. Nosotros arribamos alrededor de las 10:00 AM y no pudimos ingresar a la habitación hasta las 15:00 PM. A pesar de haber informado esta cuestión y no daba la sensación que el Hotel estuviera ‘a full’. Si bien nos tomaron las maletas y las colocaron en una bodega, esto no quita que tuvimos que esperar mas de 6 horas para ingresar, luego de un vuelo de 10 horas.
La otra contra es que el acceso Wi-Fi de Internet en la habitación te lo cobran u$s 15 mas impuesto por día !!!, solo es gratuito en el Lobby del Hotel, pero tienes que tener un laptop con buenas baterías, ya que solo hay tres enchufes de electricidad, así que si hay tres pasajeros utilizando esos enchufes, solo podrás utilizar el acceso a Internet gratis, el tiempo que te duren tus baterías (que para una adolescente eso es un dolor de cabeza jajaja)
Así que solo por estas dos ‘contras’ no lo voy a calificar como ‘excelente’ a este Hotel.
Por lo demás… volvería a elegirlo incluso a recomendarlo.
Ah! me olvidaba… las galletas de chocolate que te dan de bienvenida, son riquísimas… y un secreto… nosotros cuando volvíamos al hotel al finalizar el día, pedíamos una para cada uno y las comíamos en el desayuno !!
label: positive

text:
We stayed at this property for the first time prior to a cruise on the QM2. As frequent travelers to New York, we had overlooked this hotel. What a find! It will now be our New York hotel. Location is great for theater going. It is far enough away from Times Square to be out of the tourist bustle, yet convenient to all. Upper floor rooms have great views. Ours on the 31st floor even had a small view of times square, but with an open city view. The room decor/design was sophisticated and great style. We particularly liked the bathroom with indigo glass tile shower. The credenza that ran the complete length of the room was very functional as well as stylish. Beds were phenomenal. Linens soft and cushy. Service was stellar. We had married in New York and comp bottle of champagne and strawberries were sent up, along with a nice message. We ate at Todd English in the lobby with friends and the food was amazing. Once again, great food styling and delicious. Creative selections. They offered a three course meal at lunch for 30.00 that was a great buy for food of this quality.
This hotel scored a perfect 100 points with us. As seasoned travelers, this is rare. Congrats to the staff and others making this a great place to stay.
label: positive

text:
Leider zu instabil am Rechner.
Am Anfang fand ich den Adapter ganz nett, weil er nicht irgenwo herum hing. Leider lockern sich mit zunehmendem Gebrauch die Steckverbindungen und vor allem wenn mehrere Kabel angeschlossen sind, zuppeln diese in harmonischer Gemeinsamkeit den Adapter aus dem Mac. Das ist ärgerlich, wenn man eine externe Arbeits-Festplatte darüber laufen lässt. Das mache ich also nicht mehr, aber das Tablett fällt alle halbe Stunde aus, denn dann hat sich der Adapter wieder gelockert. Ich habe einen zweiten Adapter mit nur einem Kabel zum Mac, der ist sehr viel weniger Störungsanfällig, auch wenn es nicht so schick aussieht. Schade! Der Adapter ist in der Höhe minimal schmaler als die Höhe des Macbooks, darum kippt er immer unter Vollast von vier Anschlüssen ab, was sicher zur Lockerung der Anschlüsse an den Mac beiträgt. Vielleicht hätten ihm 2mm zusätzliche Stärke nach unten gut getan. Wenn die Anschlüsse sitzen, dann läuft alles ordentlich.
label: negative

text: For dinner, I opted for Tepian Tebrau due to many recommendations from FB friends. We arrived around 8pm and parking was quite limited, so I dropped off my family and found a spot 50 meters away. Food choices and prices were basically the same throughout this food court. If you sit in front of a certain stall, they will insist that all food and drinks are only ordered from that stall. Seafood is generally the best option, and most are quite fresh. You can basically ask them to stir-fried with sambal, soy sauce or oyster sauce, deep-fry, steamed or boil your orders and most stalls have very able cooks manning them. We ordered Siakap Masak Tiga Rasa or 3 Flavours Seabass which was lovely. Stir-fried Mussels or Kepah Goreng was delicious. Tomyam Campur or Mixed Tomyam Soup was delicious but you can ask them not to make it too spicy. Vegetables we opted for Kangkung Goreng Belacan or Water Spinach stifried with Prawn Paste. For drinks we ordered fruit juices that came in giant tall glasses, and you can ask lychee with watermelon or Air Tembikai Laici which was refreshing. For 4 people, the price charged was reasonable. A visit to JB won't be complete if you don't have a meal here.
label: neutral

text: Why do movie makers always go against the author's work? I mean, yes, things have to be condensed for the sake of viewer interest, but look at Anne of Green Gables. They did a wonderful job of combining important events into a cohesive whole that was simply delightful. I can't believe that they chose to combine three novels together for Anne of Avonlea into such a dreadful mess. Look at all they missed out on by doing that . . . Paul Irving, little Elizabeth, the widows, Windy Poplars . . . and Anne's college years, for heaven's sake!!! Wouldn't it have been delightful to meet Priscilla and all the rest of the Redmond gang? Kevin Sullivan should have taken things one movie at a time, instead of jumbling them all together and combining characters and events the way he did. This movie was good, if you leave the novels out of it!! But L.M. Montgomery's beautiful work is something that should not be denied. This movie was a let down after seeing the successful way he brough Anne of Green Gables to life.
label: negative

text: Заключила автокредитный договор номер 0 529 от 22.01.2023. Прикрепила СТС с регистрацией авто согласно требованию Договора в личном кабинете - 27.01.2023г. Трижды отправила по форме обратной связи СТС на сайте банка, а так же по Почте РФ с уведомлением, копию СТС оставила менеджеру дилерского центра, где выдавали кредит. В итоге сегодня 31.01.2023 получаю смс, что нужно направить СТС во избежание штрафа в 10 тыс.рублей. В виду отсутствия работы специалистов банка по направленным документам и обратной связи по достаточности представленной информации, банк целенаправленно двигается в сторону выставления в мой адрес штрафа в 10 тыс рублей за якобы непредоставление документов вовремя. Хотела бы обратить внимание банка за неправомерность действий и нарушение законодательства РФ в случае выставления штрафа. В случае выставления штрафа, будет начато судебное делопроизводство.
label: negative

text: Walk in the gorgeous gardens smelling the roses or hike 2-3 blocks to an excellent mall. It is clean and manicured like the grounds of Disneyland. I bought stunning silver and gemstone jewelry (on sale) in both of the upscale gift shops on site. I have stayed at the Town and Country 4 of my 6 visits to San Diego and it is by far my favorite. If you stay in the tower you have an amazing view of the pool and grounds. If you are on the ground level you can't resist walking through the rose gardens and sitting in the sun outside the coffee shop. Next time I plan to use the spa, and really feel spoiled! Staff make you feel like home, and tend to your needs immediately. Staying at the Town and Country is instantly relaxing.
label: positive

text:
This yoga studio has a ton of classes. Unless you have a really bizarre or super busy schedule, you'll always be able to make a class. The variety of classes is also great and not all of them are 90 minutes, which is nice. I highly recommend hot pilates (60 minutes) or Vegas Hot 90X (60 minutes of hot pilates, 30 minutes of yoga). I took advantage of a groupon which gave me 60 days unlimited for $45. Groupons are for new customers only. They are good about taking the groupon and don't single you out in any way because you are a Groupon customer.

All hot yoga/bikram studios should have their flooring. It looks like a bunch of rubber bands. It doesn't smell bad and is never wet, even when a class just sweated all over the place. So much better than carpet. A little tough on the feet, but stay on your mat and you should be fine.

The check in system is pretty cool. They give you a little plastic card for your keychain with a barcode. You scan that everytime you come in and then select the class you want on the screen. Then you need to sign in on a sign in sheet as well (for liability reasons?). 

They have free water from a dispenser, which is nice. Just bring your own bottle. This probably should be a requirement in all of these hot yoga studios. You don't want someone passing out because they didn't want to pay $2.50 for a bottled water or a monthly fee for "water service." 

Classes can get pretty crowded in the evenings. Mornings are much better. They play music in a lot of the classes or before and after the classes, which is different. Some of the music is pretty strange. I swear I heard a rock version of Hare Krishna. The clients are pretty noisy, especially in the evenings, so don't expect a peaceful environment. It's like a crowded coffeeshop before and after class with all the chattering.

The instructors don't really get on your case if you have to skip a pose or exercise. They encourage the class in general, say inspirational things, and given one-on-one corrections as needed. But they don't get in your face, which I appreciate.

They use some poses that are similar to Bikram but for the most part it is a lot of dog poses. Make sure you know your basic poses and what they are called. They have you do them over and over again and again. And they don't really walk you through it. They expect you to know down dog, up dog, child's pose, etc. without explaining it. You can always look around and copy someone, but sometimes your neighbor will be just as confused as you. 

Between the locker rooms, there is a box with different slots for tips for the different yoga instructors. I've never seen such a thing in my life and I'm not sure what to make of it. I only tipped a few bucks if the class was amazing. You can also tip online so they are definitely big on the tipping thing.

The locker room is a decent size with nice showers. Still not big enough to handle the onslaught after a crowded class, but still. They have blow dryers and a vanity area to use. And three restrooms! Hallelujah! Most yoga studios only have one.

It's pretty far from my house and pretty expensive without a groupon so I'm not sure I can make it consistently. Another issue is that there is always some drama going on. If you want to keep up with it, follow the yoga studio on Facebook. Every so often an employee will freak out, post something on Facebook, get all the followers and clients riled up, then apologize. Or just quit. They lost a bunch of good instructors recently. Plus they keep changing the schedule so check the schedule online before you go. This was the main reason for freakouts.

Parking and entrance are located in the back. They did offer kettlebells and Zumba (not hot, thankfully) but those classes are suspended until October while they redo the room.
label: neutral

text:
My husband and I stayed here from the 18th to 22nd November 2012 to celebrate our anniversary. We had visited NYC before however had never stayed in this particular hotel. On arrival the foyer of the hotel was quite busy with guests checking in and out, however our attention was distracted by Gregg the concierge who presented us with a map of NYC and set about detailing the exact location of the hotel also giving us a note of the hotel telephone number should we get lost. By the time he had done this the receptionist was free. We checked in no trouble at all and were informed that we had been allocated a "very nice room" in view of it being our anniversary. We had in fact been upgraded to a suite room 201 "the Roma Downey suite" It was quite lovely! The staff throughout our stay were extremely helpful and friendly. Every morning as we exited the elevators we would be greeted with a "good morning" and "have a great day". Nothing was too much!
I have stayed in a number of hotels in midtown as this is our favourite area of NYC including The Waldorf Astoria, The Roosevelt and The Intercontinental and I can honestly say that none of the hotels match The Fizpatrick for the friendly, personal service offered.
The staff, standard of room and the general ambiance of the hotel made our anniversary stay a very special one!
label: positive

text: I can barely find the words to express how utterly utterly awful this film is. I was sold on the promise of action, with Segal and stealth aircraft, which normally make for an entertaining action movie. I can honestly say I'd rather gouge my eyes out with a cocktail stick than have to see this film again. The acting was so awful that it was almost funny. The story was insanely weak, with plot holes so cavernously wide you could fly an F117 through them. The script was so poor, if I found out that a 10 year old wrote it I shouldn't be in the least surprised. The direction and production is so amateur, I wouldn't even hire these people to shoot my worst enemies wedding video. Utter Utter drivel. Those responsible for making this movie have cheapened the art, and they should be ashamed of themselves. Steven Segal should never ever show his face in public again, I can't imagine what made him agree to star in this, the worst film I have seen in my entire life.
label: negative

text: Signé Michael Mann, "Public Enemies" retrace le parcours de John Dillinger, braqueur de banque des années 30 aux Etats-Unis, et décrit comme l'ennemi public n°1 par le FBI. Emmené par une distribution impeccable (Depp, Bale, Cotillard), c'est un film de gangsters avec de l'action comme je les aime, dosé juste comme il faut. La reconstitution et la mise en scène sont parfaites. Un très bon film à voir (et à revoir).
label: positive

text:
Sorry to say, but I cannot give this hotel a glowing report, other than the location. You can not get much more "in the middle" of Times Square. If I were excited about walking the sidewalks with mobs and hoards of people who frequent this tourist area, I might consider staying here again. But crowds of this size are not my thing!
My room was comfortable enough. Two double beds. Lots of pillows. For the most part, a comfy sleep. The AC works well. The view was looking down onto 7th Avenue and not directly onto Times Square. The bathroom is adequate, but I wish it had a separate shower from the tub. Plenty of towels on hand. The soap, shampoo, etc. amenities were lacking when I arrived, but they got somewhat replenished when my room was cleaned (on the SECOND day). My room was not touched the day after my first (of 3) nights here. I had been out for pretty much the whole day and was very disappointed to find that nothing had been cleaned or replenished. It was late in the day, and I had plenty of towels and coffee for the next morning, so I did not bother to call anyone. I am typically not a complainer. Some people might try to get some extra Marriott points out of the situation.... not me. I looked for a wall mirror and finally found a full length mirror on the inside back of the closet door. A bit unhandy. The closet is big enough and there is a good supply of hangers. Tea and coffee making facilities are here. Ice is delivered in the evening, along with turn-down service and chocolates, if you want them.
Don't move anything in the mini bar because you are automatically charged, even if you did not take it! There is at least a warning sign to let you know this. I hate those fridges like that. There are times when I like to place small bits of cold food in the fridge, but when the mini bar socks it to you, I don't even try to make space for any left overs I might have in hand!
The internet in the room is fast, and is free for me as I am an elite with Marriott.
The Executive Lounge on the "L" level (one floor above the street) has a fantastic view of Times Square. But I can't wrap my mind around an Executive Lounge that ISN'T an exec lounge after 10 in the morning! I enjoyed having breakfast with a view. The food was pretty basic 'continental' breakfast items, but tasty. Scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, cereals, some fresh fruit, hot oat meal, juices, and coffee.
There is no private executive lounge in the evening. I love having a place to go for a glass of wine, some hot dishes, finger foods, maybe dessert. This lounge, however, opens to the public at some point in the late afternoon and throughout the evening. Elite members have vouchers which are good for 'purchasing' some, but not all, of the items on the menu. Alcohol is not free. The menu is appetizers and finger foods for the most part.
I am not sure why this Renaissance ranks a category 8 with Marriott (if you are using points). I expect a lot more when I'm paying the price I paid to stay here!! Not worth the money, in my opinion, unless location is your primary concern.
label: negative

text: My friends and I planned to eat at Cheesecake Factory but seeing that it was a 30 minute wait and we were starving, we ventured to go eat somewhere else. We found planet hollywood and gave it a try. \nService was friendly. Our waitress was nice and asked if this was our first time. She kindly explained all of their signature dishes. My friend and I ordered the L.A. Lasagna, one of their signature dishes. The picture on the menu looked delicious, unfortunately the food was not. They were little lasagna rolls and the outside layer was fried. It just tasted really cheap, especially for a $17 dish. My other friend ordered chicken (i dont remember the specifics) with mashed potatoes and spinach. Now that was good. If I ever did come back I definitely wont be getting the LA Lasagna again.
label: negative

text: Im Juli 2010 verbrachten wir 1 Woche im Best Western Dragon Gate Inn und waren maßlos enttäuscht: Schon der Check in war eine Katastrophe. Obwohl wir allein an der Rezeption standen wurden wir nicht beachtet, weil die beiden Mitarbeiter zu sehr mit sich selbst beschäftigt waren. Beim Check in wurde uns dann nichts erklärt, alles mussten wir von uns aus nachfragen ( Frühstückszeiten etc.). Das Zimmer war der einzige Lichtblick, denn es war groß und geräumig, jedoch ließ hier, wie im kompletten Hotel die Sauberkeit zu wünschen übrig. In den Gängen des Hotels standen ständig Reinigungswagen, Staubsauger und Zustellbetten, welche die Wege versperrten. Das Personal war sehr unfreundlich und man fühlte sich nicht willkommen. Das Schlimmste war das Frühstück. Dies war im Innenhof des Hotels und das Schrecklichste was wir je erlebt haben. Es gibt keinen Frühstücksraum, sondern nur ein kleines Cafe mit 2 Tischen. Das bedeutet man hat nur die Möglichkeit draussen zu sitzen. Die Tische und Stühle im Innenhof sind dreckig. Alles war sehr unhygienisch. Brot und Toast lag offen ohne Vorleger/Zangen am Buffet. Säfte waren grundsätzlich leer und wenn sie aufgefüllt wurden, dann mit 80% Eiswürfeln. Besonders belastend waren die lottospielenden Stammkunden, welche das Cafe besetzen und auf einem Flatscreen ihre Lottogewinne prüften. Als am 3. Tag dann nichtmal Obst angeboten werden konnte beschwerten wir uns bei einem Empfangsmitarbeiter, welcher sich dann nicht verantwortlich fühlte und uns nach langem Hin - und Her sagte, dass die Info an den General Manager geht und dieser uns am nächsten Tag anrufen wird um das zu klären. Wir erhielten bis zum Tag der Abreise keinen Anruf und sind gefrustet abgereist. Nie wieder!
label: negative

text: Несколько лет назад были здесь зимой и вот наведались летом. Чудесная тропа сказок. Фигуры настолько реалистичные, что кажется сейчас оживут. Дети лазают , садятся верхом, что только не делают, но нигде не заметила сломанных участков, потертостей. Все как будто новое. Очень понравилось. В самой усадьбе было много активностей для детей, но , кажется, мы попали на праздник. Афишу видела заранее. Также есть расписание бесплатных занятий и нужно регистрироваться заранее. Побывали а Мега песочнице. 200 руб на целый день. На фуд-корте половины из меню нет , все только что на витрине - роллы , сэндвичи , сладости. Думаю, лучше взять что то с собой и перекусить с чашечкой кофе. В целом, впечатление очень хорошее. Хочется вернуться еще не раз.
label: positive

text: The lobby of this hotel is historical and beautiful. It's not really a high-class hotel though. The rooms are far from high class. The carpet is dingy and old-looking. The room did not have a coffee maker. I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel that had a coffee maker. This hotel does have a Starbucks as many hotels do of this type. The rooms are also small. There is little room between the beds and the tv and the bathrooms are small. You wouldn't be able to close the bathroom door if you were sitting on the toilet. You would have to get up so your knees would not hit the door. There was no room to put anything in the bathroom. The bathroom door had peeling paint. The lobby had a lot of people and the ceiling was beautiful. I booked this through hotwire at $79/night ($189.30 with taxes and fees for 2 nights). I asked for a room with two double beds and they said no such rooms were available. They asked if I wanted a rollaway bed for $35/night, and I declined. As with most hotels in Chicago, parking is very expensive, so if you drive in, call some places around and you can get overnight parking at less than half the price of the hotel. The Millenium Park garage is nearby and is much cheaper. The room had virtually no view other than being able to see part of the Jersey Boys sign from a theater.
label: negative

text:
We stayed here for 2 nights during an Army conference. Overall the hotel is very nice. The lobby is huge, nicely decorated and has ample seating. In the evening they set out flameless candles for mood lighting. They have a restaurant, a bar/coffee area, a gift shop, and valet parking ($51 per day). We assumed the prices we saw for all those things are considered "normal" (expensive!) for the Chicago area.
The conference rooms were nice, but the air was too cold in one thereby causing everyone to freeze all day. We were told that the hotel staff was working on it. I am still wondering if they figured out the problem. Our gov't contracted meals were acceptable, but probably not a good representation of the skills and quality of the hotel kitchen staff.
The hotel staff was nice, friendly, efficient, well trained, quick and focused. Valet parking was a bit disorganized when picking up in the AM. We called ahead and waited maybe 5-10 min downstairs, which was great, but we over heard other people complaining that they were still waiting and others had their car already, even though they got down there first. Maybe they didn't call ahead....or maybe they couldn't find their car! Otherwise, valet parking was awesome!
Domestic services was good, they always said hi and told us to enjoy our stay. My only complaint in this dept is that they only put the bare minimum number of towels in the bathroom and when it's 90 degrees outside, it's not unusual to need 2 showers after walking all over the city.
Our room was kind of small, but clean and comfortable. The wall paper was a little loose at the seams and there were a few other minor cosmetic issues, but nothing too terrible. The one thing we really disliked was that the windows were dirty!!! Such a beautiful view, but it was nearly impossible to see due to the dusty windows. They don't open either, so that wasn't an option.
The TV was big, the phone and all the lights worked, but it would be nice to have a smaller wattage bulb near the beds for reading or just softer light while watching TV.
There wasn't a fridge or microwave, but there was a one person coffee maker, blow dryer, ironing board, small wall safe and bar fridge filled with exceptionally overpriced wines/soda/alcohol. A small, highly overpriced snack bar was provided on the desk. We were told that the items are sensored so if you remove them for any length of time, you'll be charged immediately. Not sure if that's true, but if so....that's pretty advanced technology for making sure someone doesn't steal the snack sized Pringles (priced at $5 a can). If they would have priced that stuff somewhat reasonable...such as $2 for the pringles...I might have undulged in those items, but they are priced unrealistically.
The feather blankets were nice, a bit of an overkill during the summer, but much nicer than any other hotel I've ever seen.
I wish they would have put some printed info about the hotel in the room. Such as, checkout time, how to call valet for picking up a car, parking for visitors, and other info about things the hotel offers. I'm sure we didn't take advantage of all the things they offer. For people that don't travel much, they might not know where to find this info.
label: neutral

We loved the location of the hotel. Center of Midtown and close to subway but still on a little bit more quiet street. We didn´t hear much street noice in the room.
We had a one king bed room. Room was big enough for two people and luggage, and the whirlp0ol at the bathroom was nice. Only we didn´t like the glass wall between bathroom and the actual room as the glass was making noice everytime air flow came from somewhere. But that´s a minor thing.
Fitness center was small but adequate. Overall hotel was always really clean and we didn´t see any bugs or anything. Breakfast was crowded and food quite basic, but it gave you start for the day.
New York hotels are expensive and this wasn´t cheap either, but I think we got our money´s worth.

text: Very good 1939 film where John Garfield plays another boxer who becomes a victim when everyone thinks he has committed a murder. Trouble is that the killer and Garfield's girl, Ann Sheridan, in a brief but good performance, get killed while trying to elude the police.A crooked attorney persuades Garfield to flee N.Y. He lands in Arizona and meets up with the Dead End Kids.. They've been sent there by a funding program to keep them out of further trouble.Of course, Garfield finds a new love interest but must conceal his identity as everyone thinks he was not only the killer but was the victim in the car crash.May Robson is fabulous as the grandma type running the place for the wayward youth. Claude Rains is also effective in the role of the detective who suspects that Garfield is still alive and pursues him when a picture is snapped of him in Arizona.The film really deals with Garfield's relation to the boys. While the ending is good, you want to see Garfield go back to N.Y. to proclaim his innocence.
label: positive

text: I could not believe the unprofessionalism of the cabin crew on this flight. I am frequent flyer and often do 1 or 2 round trips between North and South America per year, usually through Air Canada. This was my first Air Canada rouge experience and I hope to never have another like this again. I found it a little strange that the flight attendants stood at the door as passengers were boarding but they were not greeting anyone, just standing and watching people board. The flight was 4.5 hours from Kelowna to Toronto and it left at midnight so passengers wanted to sleep. I was shocked when I woke up partway through to the sound of loud laughing and women’s voices talking and swearing. I thought it must be passengers in a nearby row. However, I glanced toward the back of the plane and saw all of the flight attendants standing together chatting with no regard for the passengers trying to sleep. I’m sure the whole back half of the aircraft could hear them. Again, as passengers exited the aircraft, the attendants stood at the door but their attention was on each other as they continued chatting to one another and ignoring the departing guests. I’ve never seen a cabin crew act this unprofessional before. I would recommend avoid booking with Air Canada rouge.
label: negative

text:
I got stuck in the Charlotte airport and was forced to spend the night. I first called the Spring Hill Suites directly to request a room and was told that no rooms were available. Because of the lack of availability at other hotels, I called the Marriott 800 number. The Reservationist with Marriott told me that they showed availability at the Spring Hill Suites; therefore, I booked a room.
On the ride to the hotel, I told the shuttle driver my experience with the front desk clerk. He informed me that this happened a lot and that I should not expect to have a room upon arrival at the hotel…..
Fortunately, a room was available. In summary, the room was clean overall; however, I did not care for the décor. The refrigerator did not work nor did the toilet (you had to hold the handle down for a couple of minutes to make it flush). The breakfast was nice with eggs, sausage, cereals, and waffles.
Because of its convenience to the airport, if I got stuck in Charlotte again, I would probably stay here, but I would not stay here otherwise.
label: negative

text:
When we first arrived at the Phoenix, I must admit to having reservations. We arrived late at night after a bumpy plane ride, an even bumpier taxi journey and the realisation that my partner had left all of his laptop gear in the cab (we got it back though). The area looked mean, and we were dismayed at how thin the walls were.
However, come the morning and things seemed a lot brighter. the rooms are very big, the bed comfy, and the courtyard supremely funky. It was without a doubt the coolest place I have ever stayed. However, cool does not always guarantee a good night's sleep and on our third night, we weren't quite drunk enough to block out the all-night pool party taking place. We had an early plane to catch so it wasn't ideal! But if you don't mind a bit of noise and plan to party a lot in SF, then this is THE place to stay. No doubt about it!
label: negative

Sadly if that chick is working I will not be back a second time. I came to shop and not argue about a piece of fabric.

text:
I was in Houston this past week on business for a conference in the Galleria, an area which has quite a few Starwood properties around it. I settled on the Westin Oaks, a hotel I had stayed at previously a couple years ago that was still undergoing renovations at the time. Back then, my experience was mixed, with the elevators having a mind of their own, the older rooms looking worn out, and the service level was just a hit or miss. Could this time around be any different?
Arriving a couple hours before normal check-in time, I was informed of a room being available and had been upgraded to an Executive King Corner room on the 17th floor. The check-in experience itself was quick, and the agents at the front desk were pleasant to deal with. A couple years ago, the lobby area was only limited to the elevators and the front desk while renovations were going on and the changes were noticeable and quite nice I have to admit. The one big thing one will notice is the major improvement in the elevators, they no longer have a mind of their own and you simply enter the floor number you'd like to be taken to and off you go. The lobby bar area was available this time around, and it had a nice upscale feel to it which was rather enjoyable.
My room itself was a large corner room, with new furnishings that were very similar to other new Westin properties. The bed was indeed "heavenly", and I was impressed with the overall look and feel of the room. No longer did these rooms have that worn look to them, and it was obvious that Westin has really done a good job with the room upgrades. The corner Executive King room is very similar to a suite, and is very spacious - one will not be disappointed with it!
Throughout my three night stay, I was able to use in-room dining which was good and much better than my previous stay and the front desk was able to take care of any of my needs. Danny Ruiz, one of the guest relations coordinators had contacted me ahead of my stay asking me if there was anything I would need and made sure my stay was as enjoyable as possible. One of the best things about this hotel is that it's right in the Galleria, so you basically have the mall available to you during business hours and it's very easy to get a quick meal at the food court, walk down to a decent sit-down restaurant, or just pass the time with some shopping or even a bit of ice-skating! As my conference was in the same area, I hardly ever had the need to step outside other than going out to events in the evening. I also had a chance to experience the Business Center which helped me out greatly.
Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by this stay and it's great to see the changes that have taken place at this hotel. A couple years ago, I had the kind of experience which was OK at best and I didn't really know how this time would turn around. I'm happy to say though that this hotel has improved greatly after the renovations, and you might even think you're at a completely different place if you've stayed here before. The rooms have been upgraded and are definitely on par with the newer Westin hotels, the service level has improved greatly, and elevators I'm thrilled to say now take you to where you want to go! The staff was wonderful to deal with, and every need I had was taken care of without hesitation. It's amazing how things change after a renovation, and this property has definitely been upgraded. Other Starwood hotels exist around the area, but I'll be staying at the Westin Oaks again as my choice of hotel in Houston.
label: positive

text:
We were drunk, partied out, and by the time we were done gambling, it was 5:30am! I love Vegas.

Anyway of course we were hungry so with our winnings we decided to go to Caesar's. This spot was the only place open that early so we checked it out.

The wait for a table was pretty long, about 15 minutes. They said it was because it was so early and their staff was low. 

Once seated though, service was good. I had the pancakes with eggs, home fries and sausage and the BF had a NY steak and eggs. Pretty good and their portions were HUGE. I didn't finish mine. The waiter also was attentive and kept refilling my drink as I was super dehydrated and drank like 8 glasses of water.

The cutest thing is they give you these little jars of jam and A1. I took one home to show everyone. I like to take things from restaurants as souvenirs.

$50 for breakfast but hey, it was paid with money won.
label: negative

text:
Die Anfahrt war schon ein Erlebnis! Erst die vielen Einbahnstraßen macht das erreichen des Hotels nicht einfach. Der Wagen wird vom Hotel für 20 Dollar pro Tag plus Tax geparkt. Ist auch die einzige Möglichkeit den Wagen in der Nähe des Hotels unter zu bringen.
Die Zimmer sind auf vier Etagen verteilt. Es gibt einen Pool auf der dritten Etage. Die meisten Zimmer haben zum Flur ein großes Fenster in der Größe eines Schaufenster mit einer Öffnungsluke! Das Zimmer ist modern eingerichtet. Es war sauber und ohne Makel. Die Lage in der Seventh Street ist in SoMa (South Market.) Ein ehemaliges Armenviertel. Dieses kann man in den Nebenstraßen erkennen. Geht man rechts aus dem Hotel hinaus kommt man zur Market Street. Hier geht man ca. fünf bis zehn Minuten in rechter Richtung und man kommt in ein Bereich mit guten Geschäften und auch zu einer Entstation der CableCar. Von hier kann man zum berühmten Endstation in der Nähe von Fishermans Wharf fahren.
Ach Ja, Im Hotel ist noch eine Burger-Bude. Wo man auch Frühstücken kann.
label: negative

text:
I would love some "Mexican" food please!!! 

No seriously, this is was just not good. Just another fancy overpriced restaurant on the strip that serves what they think is Mexican food. 

I came here for a work lunch so alcohol was out of the question. Maybe if I had a few drinks, the food would have tasted a little better. I ordered the tortilla soup and chipotle Cesar salad. The soup itself tasted like a can of chillies blended with a can of tomatoes. I probably got about 3 table spoons of actual pieces of tortilla, chicken and beans. I couldn't even get half way before I just have up. The salad was wilted and not fresh. And I don't know about you, but I don't think Cesar dressing is supposed to be sour. A few people at my table ordered chicken enchiladas and burritos and they all agreed the chicken was a bit dry. I tried the cilantro rice and it was complete mush. The consensus at my table was that the food was just ok. Highlight of the meal was the chips and guacamole. Pretty sad I would say.
label: negative

We were seated right away, but our server never refilled my juice. Studio Cafe has a variety of food choices, gives you the entire pot of coffee in a thermos and is opened 24 hours a day. However, given the many other choices at the MGM Grand, I would not eat here again.
label: negative

text: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza at DEN and on the surface, it's a pretty nice hotel. However, when I pulled back the sheets, there were bugs in the bed. I called for someone to come and look at them to see if the problem could be remedied. The housekeeping staff sent a delightful person with limited English skills to offer to change the sheets. I tried to explain that I wanted someone to look at the bugs to see if the problem was more involved than the sheets. After the second trip to my room, she actually observed the bugs. She then asked, "You move?". At the late hour it was and with an early shuttle, I asked, "Do you have something nearby?" Of course, the only appropriate answer was, "Don't know." I slept on the couch. When I checked out, the front desk staff was completely unaware of the drama. They were horrified and asked for my email. She was certain I would receive an apology from the manager at the very minimum and quite likely, a refund of the room charge. Three weeks and counting - no communication from the hotel. As a Priority Club Platinum member, I can'texpress my disappointment. I will not return to this property.
label: negative

text:
We were traveling with all of my husband's family - 8 adults and 5 kids in all. I booked four rooms at this hotel based on our experience at the Embassy Suites in Louisville, KY. Well, I now know after this past weekend that not all Embassy Suites are the same!
We arrived at 4:40 on Saturday - check in time is 3pm. Three of our rooms were ready, the fourth was not. The lady working the front desk killed time by checking around the hotel to see if she had four rooms together on the same floor elsewhere, and then said she didn't. By the time she was done checking her computer, apparently the status of my room had changed to "Vacant Ready," so she checked us in. Let me also point out that she told me housekeeping may be finishing up their "quality check" - some quality check, as along with the issues I'm about to list, I also found an empty tube of toothpaste in plain view on the bathroom floor.
Got to our room, and the first thing I had to do was call downstairs for a Pack 'n Play - absolutely fine, even though I requested it on my reservation, rarely does a hotel ever have it in the room when we arrive, so this did not bother me. What bothered me was phone call #2 that I had to make because we had no hand towels, and no wash clothes in our room. Then there was phone call #3 after I realized the housekeeping staff had been so generous as to leave us only 1/4 of a roll of toilet paper, and no extra roll.
Meanwhile, my inlaws had moved into the room next door. They were unloading their stuff, and a housekeeper took it upon herself just to swipe her key and let herself in to deliver some towels. Not even a knock first?
Thank GOD the people in the other two rooms had no problems, or I would have been embarassed, after we talked up what we thought was going to be a great hotel.
Now the pluses - the poor housekeeping lady that had to come to my room three times to deliver items that should have already been there was sweet as can be. The bartender working Saturday night was great! And the breakfast was fantastic. The kids also enjoyed the pool.
I'm in no hurry to return - we actually have reservations at the Cambria on Polaris this weekend, and although we have to pay for breakfast there, My room has always been stocked with the usuals upon arrival. I guess what upset me the most was when I arrived 1hr 40 mins past check in time, and our room wasn't ready. The front desk lady's excuse was "We had a full house last night and they're running behind." Well, that's fine and dandy, but if you have a full house, schedule enough employees to get the place cleaned up by check-in time! I would've been ridiculously upset had we arrived at 3pm with a cranky 2 year old needing a nap and we weren't able to check in.
We're planning another COSI trip next fall, and if the rest of our group wants to stay here, I will reluctantly book again. But if I have a choice, we'll go elsewhere.
label: neutral

text:
耐久性に問題あり。その根源は縫い合わせ部分の布の重なり範囲が狭いことと思われる。
家内用として2箇月前に買ったパジャマです。 サイズ・色合い・風合いも良く、家内も気に入っていたのですが、このところ、布地の縫い合わせ部分にほつれが生じ、（見掛け上）孔が空いたような状況が複数箇所で発生しています。修繕に心掛けていますが、「新品なのに、不都合発生が早過ぎない？」と不満に思っています。 よく観察した結果、縫い合わせ部の縫い代の幅が「極端に」狭く、かつ、「布の裁断部（端部）にほつれ止めがされていない」ことが主原因であろうと考えるに至りました。 とりあえずは自家で補修するつもりですが、今後の購入を検討される方に「お知らせしておく必要がある」と考え、レビューを投稿することにしました。 不都合な投稿でも掲載するフェアな会社であって欲しいと思い、レビューを書きました。 これが公表されるようであれば、次も貴社製品を購入することでしょう。
label: negative

text: In the recent update so far the app has been really good.My girlfriend is currently with some family overseas and its been great to be able to still talk and message with her. The second problem I keep having with it is that her active status and last active times keeps vanishing completely even though she has the app open in the background and its only been minutes since the last time we messeged each other. With the exceptions of these two things, the app has been great and I am really happy its around.

text:
We booked On The Ave after lots of consideration for our Honeymoon, as we liked it's close proximity to Central Park. After a long flight and taxi ride, we were greeted by helpful staff who took our bags, and checked us in.
Our room was very spacious, massive bed (bigger than kingsize) with clean modern decor, aircon, and great facilities. Good view across Upper Westside and beyond, the hotel is right near a Metro Station on Broadway to take you wherever you want to go.
There are lots of places to eat nearby, including a fantastic deli on the other side of Broadway (next to Big Nicks Diner), or go behind the hotel, towards the Museum of Natural History and you'll find Crumbs Bakery and Shakeshack Burgers - if you go, you'll find out why they have queues miles long!!
Room was cleaned daily to within an inch of it's life, and staff were courteous and helpful.
We were at the front of the hotel overlooking a building site on the corner of Broadway, and for 2 of the 5 days we stayed, the JCB's started up at 7am....we did wonder why there were earplugs left at the side of the bed, but this is really the only criticism we have, and I'm sure the building works will cease soon.
There are also some lovely sun terraces (including a rooftop one), which we did have a look at but didn't have time to use. Free internet in the lobby and business center too.
This was a holiday of a lifetime made better by a hassle free stay in a great location. We will definitely return.
label: positive
