text: Ужасное место. То ли именно этот парикмахер ужасно стрижёт, то ли что, я не знаю. Обратилась к ним, перед началом стрижки мы обсудили, какую длину я хочу, я сказала, что пусть будет чуть ниже плеч. По итогу мне сделали каре! Каре, блин! У меня волосы нормальные были, не сильно короткие, у меня до этого уже было каре и я их так долго отращивала, а сейчас мне хотелось состричь немного кончики. А в конце, когда она мне показала окончательную длинну в зеркале, ещё говорит: "по моему, надо ещё немного состричь". Куда состричь? Налысо что ли, блин! Я очень сильно расстроилась, не могу всё ещё свыкнуться со своей новой прической, очень обидно. В общем, никому не советую, если только вы туда уже ходили и знаете определенного мастера, а так, лучше туда не соваться, иначе останетесь без волос.
label: negative

text: Great "suite" hotel. Traveled with 2 younger nephews who stayed on pull out sofa bed. Great buffet breakfast included. Clean newer hotel with small kitchen area and refrig that allowed us to keep water and left overs cold. Outdoor pool was small but heated and enjoyable at the end of the day. Located in Gaslamp district - just 2 blocks to Petco park and easy to walk to waterfront - Seaport Village along with all the restaurants in the local area. Great value given the free breakfast and wifi. Only downside was cost for valet parking.
label: positive

text: Ce documentaire essentiel semble être un épisode de la remarquable série « Treme » (HBO). Ou plutôt, on pourrait croire que Minervini est allé rencontrer les personnes ayant inspirées David Simon pour sa série. Notamment cette femme qui s’efforce de maintenir son bar ouvert - véritable sosie spirituel de LaDonna dans Treme ! Treme esquissait en couleurs l’état de la ville de La Nouvelle-Orléans juste après l’ouragan Katrina en 2005, au moment où il fallait tout reconstruire en profondeur, les bâtiments comme les institutions. Minervini arrive plus d’une décennie après pour le constat, en noir et blanc, à l’heure où les crimes haineux et les tensions sociales atteignent un niveau alarmant. Après deux ans de vie au sein de la communauté il délivre un documentaire d’une très belle pertinence.
label: positive

text:
Sadly, in its many years on the Corstorphine high street, Heaven looks to have slipped down in quality and professionalism. 

Firstly, the prices are steep. And this would be fine if the salon had a quality feel to it. But the treatment rooms are very small, the place needs a lick of paint and looks quite tired, and it's not very tidy. The shower also needed a scrub and rooms were really cluttered and tight. I had nowhere to put my clothes so just had to dump them under the treatment bed.

I was pretty disgusted to see that the treatment bed had a dirty plastic covering on it that I was meant to sit on, complete with used wax from another treatment. Eww! The salon could do well to bin that idea and go with the disposable roll that every other place I've ever been to has. Icksville on the plastic sheeting!

The girl that did my legs did an ok job, but when she moved onto eyebrows they were the worst shape I have ever seen. She left them looking like two hairy slugs and told me she shaped them that way because I "wasn't used to a more defined shape". Err, excuse me?! I had to pluck in the shape myself when I got home a whole £35 lighter on the cash front and still plenty heavy on the ol' eyebrow hair front.

There are better salons in the area and I'll only be back here as a last resort. Shame, as Heaven used to be the "go to" place for me and my friends in the local area. Think they need to up their game a bit to be honest...
label: negative

text:
This was our last leg of our flights home to Brisbane.
We had a 12hr layover in Singapore Changai due to the connecting flight out JFK NY being 3hrs late and Singapore airlines rebooking us due to this.
They emailed us the morning before the flight to let us know. Noy good having a 12hr layover but they did there best to get us a connecting flight which is good.
The flight left a few minutes late as they didn't open the lounge / gate until 40mins before the flight and everyone had to be screened to get through to the gate. We got off about ten minutes late but this was made up in the flight so we landed on time.
We were allocated seats 58A&B and were one of the last groups to board. It was a full flight but we still had some space for our bags above us in the overhead luggage bins. We had someone next to us so we couldn't spread out.
The crew were excellent and served the meal after taking off. After the meal, the lights were dimmed and I then accessed the excellent inflight entertainment system and watched some movies on it.
The staff were on the ball and were constantly bring water and juice around for the whole flight.
The only downside to the flight were some inconsiderate people sitting in front of us and putting seats back when you were trying to eat. The crew were excellent and pulled them up on this. Some people just need to be more aware of what they are doing and respect other passengers.
Overall, the flight was good with little turbulence only.
I love flying Singapore airlines as the planes are clean and well serviced, the crew is fantastic, always polite and courteous and ensure the comfort of there guests.
this was highlighted by the flight stewardesses cuddling a baby when the mum was trying to get ready to get off the plane. The genuine care you could see from the staff was excellent. I cant recommend Singapore Airlines enough.
label: positive

text:
I attempted to stay here while in town for a quick wedding this summer. The wedding was downtown, but my flight home Sunday was early, so I thought an airport hotel would be more economical. Well, I'm sorry I ever did business with this horrible, despicable establishment.
I arrived there at 11am (after waiting about 20 minutes for the airport shuttle to arrive) and requested to check in early. The front desk attendant said no, they could not accommodate an early check-in unless I wanted to pay for a second night (!). How extremely rude! I explained that I would be leaving the hotel at 4am the next morning, so I wouldn't even be staying there for a *full* night's stay, let alone *TWO* nights. I had flown in on an early morning flight and was tired and wanted to rest up before the wedding I was to attend that night downtown, so could I please check in? "No, sorry, the rules apply to you just like they do any customer" - that was their response. I asked to speak with management, who said THE SAME THING. There is *nothing* around this heap of junk hotel, so I'm not sure if they wanted me to sleep in the lobby or what (??). Also, the official check-in time on my Priceline receipt was 2:00, and the hotel said they would not check me in until 3:00. I was *fuming* mad, and asked them to take me back to the airport terminal, where I took the $7 shuttle into downtown and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn (which was lovely) instead.
Yes, I lost my $50 to this horrible, no good, poorly managed junk heap of a hotel, but I promised to write them a very "honest" review on Trip Advisor for all the "trouble" they went to for me. Do NOT stay here under any circumstances; the management are swindling pennypinchers who have no interest in hospitality or accommodating their guests. The hotel is also dark, dank and icky. Give it a miss, even if it means spending more.
label: negative

text:
The menu here is really unique... This is not an IHOP! 

The first time I went was for breakfast and I had the corned beef hash. It was pretty really good because it was "real" corned beef hash. (You will see what I mean.) There was so much of it that I had to take it home. It was a complete meal though because it also included eggs and fruit. I did not like the lemonade they served. It tasted gross, but oddly, I think it was supposed to taste that way...

My most recent visit was for dinner. I had the sage chicken with the penne pasta. I did not like the pasta, but the chicken was pretty good. My boyfriend got the sage fried chicken and waffles. He thought it was amazing and so did I! 

As far as food presentation goes, they do that very well. The food (during breakfast) is served on these large, heavy skillets. Dinner is served on large (and I mean large) plates.

I adore Hash House. They not only make food good, they make it fun. I love this "twisted" farm food.
label: positive

text:
Really, this should be 2.5 stars. 

Right before I ate the food I was going to give this business 1 star....here's my story.

I have been craving Chinese food and since I have an hour for lunch (I work right down the street) I figured I'd use my handy dandy Yelp app to find a good Chinese place. Well, this place popped up and the reviews seemed good, so I figured I'd give it a whirl. 

When I walked in, I was greeted by a lady that said, "How can I help you?" I responded with, "Well, I'd like to place an order..." In looking at the lunch menu, it didn't seem like there were many options for vegetarians except tofu w/ mixed vegetables and tofu w/ broccoli. BORING! So I asked, "Is there a way to have Szechuan tofu instead of beef?" She replied, "No." I was like, "You can't substitute tofu for beef?" "No." Kind of annoyed, I said, "Ok, I'll have tofu w/ mixed vegetables." Then I noticed that the lunch special comes with pork fried rice so I asked if I could have veggie fried rice w/o the egg. She told me that it would be extra. Extra?!?!?! You're going to charge me to take OUT things? That's dumb. So I told her that I just wanted the tofu with vegetables....not the lunch special. She then said, "Well, we have tofu with eggplant in a garlic sauce....a lot of vegetarians order that. So I said that it would be fine. I was quoted a 10 min. timeframe. I asked if I could eat there and she said that it would be fine.

I went and sat in a booth, which was broken. I leaned back on the back rest and it pushed against the person behind me. That's kind of annoying. 

The waitress then brought me some water with lemon, which wasn't filtered water...it was just normal Chandler city tap water which tasted awful. Good thing I got lemon to kill the awful taste. 

My food then came out 15 minutes later (I timed it). I must say that the portion was plentiful and it was delicious! I was going to give this a 1 star review but since the food was really good I bumped it up a few. I'll give this place another try and see if they're still going to charge me extra to take things out of their fried rice. I honestly think the woman working was new and wasn't familiar with things.....we'll see.
label: negative

text: En passant devant la boutique, vous penserez qu'il s'agit d'un magasin de jouets. D'ailleurs, qui pourrait vous le reprocher?! Un Casse-noisettes g\u00e9ant dans la vitrine, des jouets de toutes les couleurs, des guirlandes, des paillettes,... Ouaip, \u00e7a ressemble \u00e0 un magasin de jouets, \u00e7a sent le magasin de jouets et m\u00eame \u00e7a go\u00fbte le magasin de jouets... Mais non! Ce n'en est pas un. Enfin presque pas. M\u00eame si c'est vrai que vous trouverez tout de m\u00eame quelques jouets \u00e0 l'int\u00e9rieur (rhoo, il font tout pour nous tromper!), il s'agit plut\u00f4t d'un magasin de paquets cadeaux. Alors oui, je sais, c'est un concept qui peut surprendre. En fait, ils vous proposent tout pour des emballages de qualit\u00e9, et m\u00eame ils peuvent les faire pour vous, ce qui du coup donne carr\u00e9ment un c\u00f4t\u00e9 artistique \u00e0 vos paquets. A tel point qu'on aurait de la peine \u00e0 l'ouvrir!\nBon et sinon, vous trouverez des nappes et assiettes jetables dans de jolis couleurs, quelques jouets, des bonbons et des gadgets.

text: Before this made for TV movie began, I had relatively low expectations. That's because it was made after the final episode of the series had aired and many of the series originals were gone. There is no President Sheridan, Delenn, Lennier, Londo, Vir, G'kar or Lyta. If you remember, on the second to last episode of the series, all the regulars except Zack, Vir and Captain Lockley left B-5 permanently. Now for this film they did bring back Garibaldi (who was not in the last B-5 movie) to join Zack and the Captain and the Doctor makes a brief and irrelevant appearance. But because so much is gone of the old chemistry, this film already is severely handicapped.The movie is about a Soul Hunter (Martin Sheen) who is led to Babylon 5 in search of a globe filled with souls that had been stolen from a hidden repository by an archaeologist (Ian McShane). A lot of spooky mumbo-jumbo stuff occurs but frankly it was all pretty silly and pointless. Yeah, yeah, the station nearly blew up but was saved and all, but frankly I felt like it was a case of "been there done that--and done that a lot better in the past".The secondary plot, provided more for comic relief, was much more interesting, as an entrepreneur installed a holo-brothel and those in command weren't sure what to do about it and when they tried to pressure them to close, they were slapped with a lawsuit. This was fluff, but it did provide a few laughs--something the other dreary plot was surely lacking.By the way, Sheen at first did a good job playing the Should Hunter--with his wild eyes and bizarre delivery. However, repeatedly throughout the episode he fell out of character. This should have been spotted and corrected.So the final verdict is this is only for total die-hard B-5 nuts (like myself). Others seeing it might assume the series sucked--which is a great injustice. This is a great example of a show not knowing when to quit.
label: negative

text: Enfin un film qui parle des portugais ! On en oublie trop souvent qu'il n'y a pas que les Arabes et les Africains qui sont étranger, les portugais aussi malgré l'Europe. Étant fille d'immigrés portugais, j'ai été très touché et très ému pendant tout le film. Il résume totalement les portugais, ce qu'on vit, l'acharnement au travail et le grand coeur qu'on fournit pour la famille et pour ceux qui en ont besoin. Ça fait beaucoup de bien de voir ça, ça nous remémore nos souvenirs au pays. Ce film est magnifique et il mérite d'être vu et revu. Dès les premières minutes il m'a donné les larmes aux yeux, c'est tellement d'émotion de voir ce qu'on vit au quotidien, tout ce qui nous fait rappeler nos racines nous fait du bien. Je remercie celui qui a réalisé ce film en hommage à ses parents, j'ai été le voir et j'y retourne avec toute ma famille cette fois ci pour qu'elle ressente ce que j'ai pu ressentir durant TOUT le film. Et la petite phrase "c'est ça qu'c'est bon" c'est ce qu'on dit chaque été tout au long de l'été avec mes cousins ! Eu adoro este film. Un film formidable, faut le voir ! Viva PORTUGAL
label: positive

text:
My husband and I eat Indian food on a regular basis. Usually we go down to tempe to the numerous awesome Indian restaurants down there but yesterday we were kinda lazy--and it was raining so we decided to order take out closer to home. I found Haweli on yelp and placed our order: karabi paneer, fish curry, garlic naan, plain naan and EXTRA rice. 

They left out the plain naan and the rice was about 1/3 of a cup which is unacceptable for two entrees--even for one. Definitely no extra rice.

Too bad cause the food was really tasty--not as good as tempe but good enough that we would have gone back on a regular basis considering the amount of Indian food that we eat and that is it so much closer to home. 

They lost two customers that would have spent a lot of money just so that they can save a few pennies on rice.
label: negative

text:
There's whole lot going on here. You've got the main bar, bowling lanes to the left, a dance floor behind the bar, pool tables down the stairs, and video game room. Oh, did I mention the drag queens galore and go-go dancers? The place is pretty big inside; it felt very spacious.

We went this past Tuesday night and they were hosting Tight N White Tuesdays: strip down to your underwear and you get to bowl and play billiards for free and get 2 free drinks. I won't mention if I partook in that activity (I didn't) but there were definitely some takers. 

The scene is fun, dark, and different. I wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but if a group was doing something there, I wouldn't mind. The lounge did have a smokey odor since it's all indoors, and I'm not a fan of that.
label: negative

text: Let me begin with a personal note as a film and television buff, more on the enjoyment side of life: I love what James Woods can do and has done, and I always love Melanie Griffith, and Natasha Wagner was very good in this awful, miserable, stinking "true crime" essay.Whoever really wrote this film apparently never spent any time talking to real criminals with real criminal talents: yes, some thieves are junkies but they have very short careers as thieves. Truly successful thieves are seldom caught because they don't do "junk" or any drugs before going on a score ( job ).The James Woods character was true to this paradigm in the beginning of this film, and then the script fell apart completely. He turns into a raging, alcoholic lunatic .... nice work for a high-strung guy like Woods, maybe, but not in the least bit believable.Most criminals are lazy. If they wanted to work they would work.These people in this film are beautiful, self-indulgent, drug-addled narcissistic losers. They couldn't pull off a real score in the real world, the real world where a big and beefy security guard who beats the living hell out of a skinny kid ( as happens in the early scenes of this "DOG" ), keeps him beat down and doesn't let him up. Ever.How many ways did I find to hate this film ? Many. Even totally vulgar people -- like most sneak thieves and junkies -- have a larger vocabulary than these cretins. And the 'rip-off' scenes with the neo-Nazi bikers ? Puhlease. All rednecks ain't neo-Nazis and those who are neo-Nazi speed dealers just ain't that dumb !!This film earned a two because Natasha Wagner was extremely good in her role as Rose and because Melanie Griffith still has 'that something special,' or at least she had it for this brutal and offensively stupid film. I'm not one to sing praises of real criminals for any reason, but the reality of these criminal types in this horrible film is that they'd all be dead or in jail by Act 2, Scene 1. Watching a lousy Zombie movie would be time better spent than this .... thing ... and I hate zombies.
label: negative

text:
We stayed here for a business trip when our usual corporate hotels were sold out and we could not have been happier. The hotel either has been newly renovated or the upkeep has been fantastic. Every inch of the hotel was extremely clean and the service was friendly, fast and very pleasant. The rooms truly are suites with full kitchens and plenty of space to lounge and relax.
The complimentary internet was super fast (didn't lose the connection once in 3 days) and the complimentary buffet breakfast was just the thing to help us kick off a couple of busy days. The breakfast is the usual selection of hot and cold items. There is also a complimentary Happy Hour Monday-Thursday with free beer and wine and light snacks (they had fajitas the night we were there). The location is very central to the 16th St. Pedestrian Mall and the rest of downtown Denver. Excellent value for the money. We would absolutely stay here again.
label: positive

text:
The hotel occupies a 100 year old building, which is not a problem. Their website proudly advertises that they have AC throughout the hotel. And this is generally true, all hallways are kept at a very comfortable temperature. My room, however, lacked an AC vent and became very warm during the few days when the daytime temperature reached well into the 80s. Normally, I would open the windows, but I decided against it because right outside my window was a huge swarm of flies, which stayed there at all times. When I complained, they apologized and said there's nothing they can do about it.
A few other notes. The staff was generally helpful, but for some reason everyone was very surly all the time. My queen bed did not have a headboard, which normally wouldn't be a problem if you are under 5 feet tall. The hotel serves surprisingly good coffee and muffins every morning.
label: negative

text: Aurigny Customer Service staff must be the worst in the world, the recent fog caused some delays at U.K airports, whilst still on the island having a meal before my flight at a local restaurant I heard that there was flight delays so I telephone Aurigny to find out how long etc, I was told no all is well get here on time. Turned up for my 5.15pm flight at just before 4pm and was immediately told story five hour flight delay nothing we can do, went to customer services - who were useless. Whilst I was speaking to a man there, a lady in the back ground put a leaflet on the counter in front of me and said "its all in there" and went back to her seat and sat down, the leaflet was about delays, great customer service. We went upstairs and ordered some snacks and drinks and just as I paid, tannoy announced that our flight was now leaving ASAP and was going to Liverpool, not Manchester and that a coach would be there waiting to take us to Manchester. We left everything, checked in and then sat for over an hour in departures. Finally arriving at Liverpool guess what no coach and no one aware of this arrangement, eventually a Liverpool airport member of staff said she was arranging a coach for us, some people asked if a taxi would be paid for by Aurigny and they were told no, now near 10pm and most of the passengers now left making their own way to Manchester the member of staff returned and said she may have a coach for us, and then said where is everyone. Well they have all gone was the reply and we are off too, thanks for the help. Aurigny`s objective was just to get shut, thanks to them I had to make my own way to Manchester at 11pm collect my car and then drive back through the thick fog getting home at near 1am, it would have been safer for all just to get the next safe flight out. When I telephone Aurigny for a refund for the taxi I was told no chance, not our fault and once off the island not our problem and that they are not part of the EU rules. When I tried to put my point I was then told by the young girl on the phone that she was now terminating the call. After a couple of calls I have now been told that I am getting my Taxi fare back but thats it, no compensation for the delay at Liverpool as we were off the island and not their problem. Customer services at the airport and on the phone score nil, urgent training required nothing complex just the art of communication would be a good start, how to talk to people.
label: negative

text:
The Club Quarters located in the Financial District of New York ended up being the perfect spot for our long weekend in New York. At first I was bummed that we were not staying in a more culturally interesting area but it all turned out for the best. Since the financial district is so quiet on the weekends, it ended up being an oasis in the city. We love walking in New York so each day we used the hotel as our base and walked to Chinatown, SOHO, etc. We also took the subway when necessary.
We also got what I would consider a fabulous deal on this hotel. It only cost 175.00 per night on Priceline. Somehow (without asking) we got assigned the Diplomat's Suite. It had two rooms, two flat screen TVs, a pull-out couch, King size bed, kitchenette (though we did not really use it). The bathroom just had a shower which was fine with us. This was a fabulous deal in my estimation for New York City.
To boot, we had excellent service from all members of the staff.
Unrelated to the hotel, we ended up getting two parking tickets when we parked near the hotel because we did not read the signs properly, so that is a little heads up.
If we could ever score such a deal in the future I would definitely be up for staying in the Club Quarters again.
label: positive

text:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about In-N-Out Burger? Probably nothing.

I ate here knowing it was going to be my last gluten and dairy inclusive meal for a very long time, so I totally splurged, ordering a burger animal style (minus the cheese), fries, and a strawberry milkshake.

The burger was awesome. You can get it protein style, wrapped in lettuce instead of a bun, and that's probably what I'll get the next time I'm in town. The fried onions and the special sauce, as well as the obvious freshness of all the ingredients, proved In-N-Out to be worth the hype and well above Five Guys.

The strawberry milkshake was grand. The fries were eh. I'm told they are usually made to order, but I am pretty sure I didn't get a fresh batch. They were good in that they weren't too salty, but they could have been hotter and crisper, for sure. 

In short, animal style, animal style, animal style. I see now why people are obsessed with this place. I can't think of a better hangover cure.
label: neutral

text: So glad I had a chance to try Craftsteak. The good parts: Setting is fabulous, very posh and yet comfortable. The Parker house rolls were so good that I ate way too many. Crusty tops with salt and pillowy soft insides. The Wagyu beef tartare was as good as others here have said. And yet... The frisee salad was majorly overdressed. Yes, it is a warm salad so the frisee won't be as crisp as normal. But the egg, bacon, and cheese used for the freshly tossed dressing should have been used on three times the amount of greens. Then it would have been an enhancement instead of glops of saltiness that hid the taste of the greens. So sad. I'm sure Chef Colicchio didn't know it was that way because, after watching him so long on Top Chef, he would not have stood for it. Wish I had been hungrier so I could have tried other items. \n\nOn a side note: All throughout my dining in Vegas I was confronted with soup spoons given to me for my dessert course. When the sorbet scoops are the same size as the spoon I'm to eat them with it is not a good match. Craftsteak was one of the offenders. Find smaller spoons for diners to use for dessert please!
label: negative

text:
This is a funky boutique hotel in a great location in Union Square. We made our reservations late and were lucky to get a room here - a very small but comfortable room. This room is best for one person. The bed was comfortable with nice linens. The decor is cool and modern, cobalt blue carpet with contemporary furnishings. There was no place to store bags.
The bathroom was very small with a tub/shower, toilet and sink with no counter space and a very small mirror with poor lighting for make up application. There was a glass shelf for toiletries. Amenities were very nice and included a hair dryer. Check- in was very good and efficient. Free internet access - The elevators were out of order for one of the days but we just used the stairs.
Suggestion: Add another glass shelf or two in the bathroom. We would stay here again but would pay the extra money and get the Executive King or Salon King room.
label: positive

text:
Geht so!
Die Bankauflagen sahen beim Auspacken ganz ok aus und erfüllten ihren Zweck bei der Geburtstagsfeier. Die Tischdecke ist recht dünn und die Farbe eher Schlamm als grau. Nach der Benutzung musste ich feststellen, dass die Bankauflagen nicht waschbar sind, nur die Tischdecke. Da die Auflagen Flecken hatten, mussten sie trotzdem in die Waschmaschine. Nach dem Waschen wurde auch klar, warum die Auflagen nicht gewaschen werden sollen. Der Schaumstoff war komplett verdreht und mir blieb nichts anderes übrig, als den Bezug aufzutrennen, um die Auflage wieder glatt zu bekommen. Nach einigem Gefummel und Bearbeitung mit dem Bügeleisen, kann man die Auflagen nun wieder benutzten. Da es sich um eines der teureren Sets handelt, hätte ich definitiv mehr erwartet!
label: negative

text:
Leichte Risse auf dem Stein erkennbar.
Heute ist das obige Set bei mir eingegangen. Als ich den Karton aufgemacht habe, war ich sehr erfreut, dass die Ware ordentlich verpackt ist. Beim näheren Betrachten des Pizzastein ist musste ich jedoch leider feststellen, dass vereinzelt Haarrisse darauf zu sehen sind. Dies deutet für mich darauf hin, das nach kurzer Benutzung der Stein reißen wird. Da ich ihn als Geburtstagsgeschenk für morgen gekauft habe, werde ich ihn nunmehr auch so verschenken mit diesem Hinweis direkt darauf hin. Ich hoffe, dass hier auch seitens der Verkäufer vielleicht eine kulanzweise Lösung gefunden werden kann. Ansonsten sieht das Set auf den ersten Blick gut aus. Bei der Benutzung wird sich herausstellen, wie gut das Set tatsächlich ist.
label: negative

text: Booked the st francis through Thomas Cook holidays - was told it was an fabulous san fransisco hotel, and we were really looking forward to a relaxing stay there. when we arrived in our room i was very dissapointed in the size (there were no draws to put clothes away, and no room to store suitcases) but more importantly the smelll! it was as if a wet dog had slept in there the previos week, we rang down straight away and were told to come to reception - after waiting approx 30mins in line we were told the hotel was full and we could not be offered an alternative. and that the reason our room smelled of dogs was that the hotel accepts dogs - (i am a dog owner but i do think that if a hotel allows dogs it should let guests know if they are sleeping in a dogs room). after a while we were told there was one other room available which had no window!! we decided to stay in the doggy room but i have to say it tainted our holiday there.
label: negative

text:
When you mention fast food, Boston Market is never one of the places that comes to mind. In that respect, it's like Wendy's. It just never enters into the equation, though it's generally at least as fast as other options (and probably about as healthy in many respects).

I think part of the problem is that I can never decide what to order. When I can't figure out what I want, I don't like going there. This is true at places that have massive menus, or places that just don't tickle my fancy, and it's true at Boston Market.

I think they were one of the first places I noticed where they tend to obscure their menu choices somewhat. Now lots of places do it (see McDonalds), but at those places, I know what I want, so it doesn't really matter.

In any case - I never know what I want, so I end up panicking in line and ordering something I don't really want, and end up unhappy. The good news here is that the staff is nice, and the food is fresh. It's just not what I wanted, which leaves me unhappy spending what I did for the food.
label: negative

I had the carbonara which looked on first appearance authentic as at last I found an Italian that doesn't use cream. However rather than lovely tasty pancetta the meat content was some insipid mince of unknown origin and full of gristle!As for the place, it has great potential and the waiting staff were really good. The drinks menu is very limited and the house red is best used for putting on your fish and chips.Such a shame.

text: Had to stay at this small but nice hotel. Had to break my stay as Hyatt was booked during the period I wanted. The hotel is relatively small, but very nice. The rooms were clean, the staff were excellent in helping the traveler.They were very warm. Check-in and check out were handled quickly. The bath rooms were also very clean. They had some nice bath robes also, and I was tempted to buy one. The room I had just a street view and was in second floor. Funnily, I could see the office across the street and make faces at them also. They are used to such cranky cases I suppose but views are not that great unlike Hyatt which is a tall building. This is three ( may be four ) floor building.. Not much of a good view that way. But rest of the stuff expected from the hotel was excellent. Pricier than Hyatt Regency Did not try their breakfast or dinner. The place is close to many bars and eateries and hence not really have to depend on the hotel restaurant. Overall, I would say excellent place to stay.
label: positive

text: I always butcher the word nigiri even though sushi is my fortay and I was born in Japan. Finally got to stop into this charming little Japanese bistro for a quick lunch. I must say I do like the place. It has a very attractive decor that reminds me of the Pacific Northwest ( Seattle , Vancouver ect ) and I knew immediately that it would be tasty. I was greeted by a lovely waitress and was allowed to pick my own table . The menu is a good size , not to small not to big. I ordered a simple lunch of Tuna nigiri , salmon Maki and a sweet potato tempura hand roll. I do prefer the simpler rolls because usually if the simple rolls are good at a place the rest of the food is bound to be . I especially liked the tuna nigiri . It was a different cut from the fish and was a bit firmer but also melted in your mouth. Usually your tuna cut is very soft and easily comes apart but having a bit firmer cut that has the characteristics of the normal sashimi cuts was very refreshing! I am told by the owner that it is cut from the belly of the fish and that they buy a whole fish from the market and the chefs prepare it and cut it all themselves. Note, most sushi places do not buy the whole fish they buy specific cuts and then take from there. This is very unique to a place like Edinburgh that doesn't have your sushi places like Seattle or San Diego or of course Japan. I'd stop in just to try different cuts from the fish and promote places that do this. The salmon maki was also quite good and the salmon was nice and buttery in terms of texture . I quite enjoyed it. The tempura hand roll was also yummy just a little to much rice for me but that's ok. The tempura itself was perfect. I do wish the wasabi was a bit hotter but I know it's hard to find real wasabi . I did get to chat a bit with the owner who told me about their up coming plans and a little bit about the business and such. Nice gentleman . I will be coming back to try some more of the dishes. Just remember this place is a Japanese Bistro not a sushi restaurant so there is more to try here then just sushi, and I have a feeling it will be just as good if not better!
label: neutral

text:
Wir waren für Shopping und Sightseeing in New York. Dafür war dieses Hotel ideal geeigent, wenn man bei der Unterkunft sparen möchte und nicht bei den Einkäufen.
Das Hotel liegt unweit einer U-Bahn-Haltestelle. Somit ist es problemlos möglich, die Stadt schnell und einfach zu erkunden. Am Times Square ist man in wenigen Minuten. Auch liegt das Hotel nur zwei Blocks vom Central Park entfernt. Rundum gibt es viele Lebensmittelgeschäfte und Restaurants.
Das Hotelpersonal ist freundlich, die Lobby ist klein aber zweckmäßig. Wir hatten ein Zimmer zum Hinterhof. Das Zimmer war sauber und von normaler Größe. Wurde erst vor kurzem renoviert, deshalb soweit alles in Ordnung. Das größte Manko des Hotels: die Fenster! Diese schließen überhaupt nicht! Fingerdicke Spalte lassen die kalte Aprilluft problemlos herein. Ein Zimmer zum Hinterhof ist bestimmt ruhiger als in Richtung Broadway. Jedoch bekamen wir die ganze Zeit über das Surren der Klimaanlage mit...
Insgesamt aber ein empfehlenswertes Hotel mit tollem Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis!
label: positive

text: This place used to be my favourite café for Sarawak Laksa as it was excellent, a 10! But sadly it was not as good when I last visit. It was a shock to me! Very disappointed and would not go again unless they can assure they will bring back the good old laksa paste.Place is not as crowded as it used to be. Maybe the idea of charging customers for every little things like extra sambal belacan, lime, gravy is a turn off. Sometime it is pleasing and winning the hearts of customers which are the most important. Once you lose a customer, it is very hard to win them back so Madam Tang, try to please your customer more, win them back and most of all bring back the superb Sarawak laksa that I used to love and I promised you, I will be back (literally fly back to Kuching) and it is not only me, but all your previous faithful customers. So go for it Madam Tang!

text:
HELLOOOOO new cravings....

I love tacos (of all kinds but soft corn is the best)!

My wife went to high school with the manager so she dragged me in for lunch today on our way home from the children's museum. Located on the east side of 7th street in a used to be house. A line to the door usually means it is good and it was! 

We had to take the food togo so I was already thinking that it was going to be sub par. I was so wrong.
I had two asada tacos and a bean and cheese burrito. The tacos were perfect with the lime and the smokey salsa that came with them. The tortillas were soft but not soggy, the meat was smokey and tender and packed with flavor. The burrito was creamy and rich with melted cheese everywhere and beans that were not too heavy. 

I can't wait to go back... and soon.

Thank you America's for making a no fuss slam dunk taco shop!

text:
The first visit, I was intrigued. The second, I became a fan. From that point on, I could not help, but tell people about this place. The concept of taking something as simple as a classic meat pie and filling it with some extravagant ingredients might just work. Well, of course it would work. The important thing is perfecting the crust that allows the fillings to shine. 

For the most part, this does happen. Some of the pies are overshadowed by strong or overpowering spices, but overall they are delicious. The Porky, for instance, is overcome by sage. All of the other ingredients are taken over by this one spice. The Royale with Cheese is one of my favorites though. To have all of the best components of a cheeseburger in a handheld snack is amazing. My only complaint is the lack of consistency in their menu. Instead of doing such a large selection, maybe to offer specials on certain days or setting specific days for each pasty would make it easier to keep plenty. The soups have all run salty every time I ordered one. The sides are hit or miss. The oven fries with jalapenos and garlic are always delicious.

The beer selection is reasonable and affordable. Although it is not a huge variety, it is enough to over all of the bases.
label: neutral

text:
I. LOVE. RETRO. Hands down best service, creativity and taste in Vegas. I have had the pleasure of eating two beautiful birthday cakes from Retro and both experiences were wonderful. If you are traveling from out of town Retro makes the process so easy. They will deliver to the strip and even to your favorite restaurant while coordinating everything between themselves and the eatery. 

Brian was great to work with -- he answered all of my questions and made multiple revisions to my cake to ensure my husbands surprise birthday was unforgettable. He was extremely responsive and open to my ideas while recommending options to consider. 

My birthday cake was a chocolate cake with cookies and cream filling. It was moist, flavorful while being classy and gorgeous. My husbands was a custom chocolate cake with peanut butter icing. Delicious! When the waiter brought the surprise cake to the table he complimented on how this was one of the coolest cakes he had ever seen. Retro is our go to place while partying in Vegas. You will not be disappointed!
label: positive

text: 起動する度に音量がリセットされるので、毎回設定しなおす必要があり、それを忘れて音楽を流すと耳が痛くなるレベルでの大音量に嫌気がさす。 iPhoneを使った場合、使用するアプリによっては、iPhone側からの音量調節が出来ないこともある。 音量３０%以上では明らかに音質が変わり、安物のテレビ用スピーカーをキンキン鳴らしているような質感になる。 ある程度の音質を保ったままボリュームを上げたいなら、ウォークマンなどの音質を細かく設定出来るプレイヤーを使った方がいい。 最小の音量でもそこそこな音量が出るのでアウトドアには向いているかもしれないが、自室で夜間に寝るまでの間音楽を流す的なことには向いていない。 いずれにしてもプレイヤー側で音量 音質共にかなり変わるので使い道を選ぶスピーカーだと思う。

So frustrating. Also annoying was the $50 charge to use the refrigerator or if you bump the in-room snacks. So, $50 + the cost of the snack to consume, $50 to use the fridge or to bump something. Thankfully, free and easy-to-use wi-fi in the rooms.

Decent for attending a convention at convention rates ($190/nt.)

Meh food.

Smelled relatively clean any place aside from the common floors where people walk around smoking.
label: negative

text: I can't believe that those praising this movie herein aren't thinking of some other film. I was prepared for the possibility that this would be awful, but the script (or lack thereof) makes for a film that's also pointless. On the plus side, the general level of craft on the part of the actors and technical crew is quite competent, but when you've got a sow's ear to work with you can't make a silk purse. Ben G fans should stick with just about any other movie he's been in. Dorothy S fans should stick to Galaxina. Peter B fans should stick to Last Picture Show and Target. Fans of cheap laughs at the expense of those who seem to be asking for it should stick to Peter B's amazingly awful book, Killing of the Unicorn.
label: negative

text:
Bon.
Produit rapidement livré, et emballé par les soins d'Amazon, donc parfait à ce niveau. La bouteille est comme sur la photo, avec son plastique de protection non ouvert. Le produit lui-même a une texture assez agréable, que pour ma part je trouve un tout petit peu trop liquide. Mais ce détail n'enlève rien à son efficacité. Attention! : ne pas en mettre trop. Une noisette suffit. Le gel ne colle pas, ne fait pas de boulettes ni résidus, sans odeur, est agréable à utiliser, et remplit bien son rôle de lubrifiant. Compatible avec les sextoys en silicone. Pas de réactions sur la peau ni d'allergies. Pas de taches constatées sur les tissus. Et si vous ne pouvez prendre de douche immédiatement après (ça arrive), un gant de toilette mouillé suffit jusqu'à la prochaine toilette. Dernier point : n'appuyez pas trop fort sur la bouteille quand vous l'utilisez, sinon vous allez trop en avoir, ce qui ne servirait à rien.
label: positive

text: 这个一星是打给派送公司的！亚马逊的服务没话说，客服人员各方面都很好就是在解决反馈问题时间上不快速，每次买家很着急，客服就机械式回答并且一再客观强调24-48小时回复！这一点真的要学一下淘宝客服人员的办事效率！在任何有关于买家的问题上，优先保障买家权益！对于亚马逊合作的配送公司多次配送私自延迟，无故取消配送，随意延迟这一点极其不满意！屡次反应此问题未解决，而且并未督促其改善增进服务质量！严重影响消费者购物体验！对配送公司时效多次延迟，投诉均未对他造成惩罚，监管力度不够！

I'd have to say I'm pretty satisfied with my experience at LensCrafters at the Camelback colonnade. I've worn contacts for years, but wanted to glasses just as backup. I didn't like the selection at Costco, so I came here for a wider variety.

I don't with Maureen. She had an excellent grasp of what would look good on my face and what kind of style I have.

We found the pair I wanted and got them ordered. I went and grabbed a bite to eat by the time I got back they were ready.

They were running a 30% off sale so I got a chance to save some money.

Hopefully I won't need glasses anytime soon, but if I do I'll be looking for Maureen at LensCrafters.

text:
if i have paid for this meal, i'd be pissed, period!

but since i was among work colleagues, i faked my smile, i toasted my glass, i ate my meal in small bites, and filed just a little tiny complaint to our waitress at the end of my meal. 

Me: "I understand you are a improvisational cuisine restaurant, so you pretty mudh dictate what is being offered to my 4-course meal. yes?"

Waitress with smile: "Yes"

Me - afraid my colleagues might hear my complaint and judge me as hard-to-please bitch - wispered in my best manner: "not that i am complaining, but i clearly indicated on my direction list no veggies. Can you please explain to me why i started up my meal with a salad and ended it with a carrot cake?"

Waitress still in smiles: "I am sorry, we should have paid more attention to it. Here is some chocolate."

suuuuuuure.. 

and that frigging chocolate bar is something to compensate for my goddamn 4-course $100 bucks meal??! I have had Salad! some Veggie mixed crap, more veggie mixed beef, and at the end, CARROT cake! you gotta be effing kidding me!!

and let me tell you, that foie gras tasted GAMY! GAMY!!

I have decided, this is the perfect place to bring a much-hated-but-you-can't-say-no-date, storm out and stiff him with the check!
label: negative

text:
My partner says that I should only give the Andaz 2 stars: she says the only thing she liked was the service. The furniture was cheap and not attractive, no coffee in the room, no iron...
I thought it was moderately ok. The lobby was very uncomfortable with sitting areas mixed with the reception area, no bar, no gift shop, no driveway to park while unloading luggage. The breakfast was far below what I'd expect at a Holiday Inn: muffins and coffee and apples? no eggs, toast, meats, cereal, etc. Cocktail hour included wine and sugared walnuts and cookies, even then it lasted only 2 hours whereas other hotels we've stayed at recently had 4 hours. Fortunately there is a good NYC diner a few blocks away.
There was one server for wine and coffee causing a lineup of guests waiting for a beverage.
I particularly disliked the room decor. At first it seemed cute to have a transparent glass door to the bathroom and a glass panel between the tub and the bedroom. Soon I realized that when the glass door was open it blocked the halllway between the front door and bedroom, causing me to crash several times. The rotating full length mirror, added to the clear door, created a kind of fun house enviroment.
I especially didnt like not having a top sheet under the comforter. I hope they wash the comforter cover every day!!!
I did like the proximity to the Seaport, Ground Zero, Battery Park and even walking distance to Tribecca.
On impulse we got on the State Island ferry which was a few blocks away and had a wonderful one hour round trip for Free, across NY Harbor and past the Statue of Liberty.
On this trip we've stayed at Marriott Renaissance, a Hampton Inn and a Hilton. The Andaz was the least enjoyable.
label: negative

text: Мурадымовское ущелье - красивейшее место! Вход для прогулок платный, но недорого. Много разных тропок для прогулок. Пещер здесь много, но для посещения открыта Новомурадымовская. Она относительно небольшая (и маршрут по ней небольшой совсем). Экскурсии проводят где-то каждые два часа. Сама экскурсия не особо интересная, но важно именно пройтись по самой настоящей карстовой пещере! Конечно, там прохладно, нужно взять какую-то толстовку. Выдают резиновые сапоги и фонарик или каску с фонариком. Экскурсия длится около 40 минут. Тропа к Новомурадымовской пещере несложная. Конечно, это не бульвар! Надо обуться собственно, не рекомендую всякие шлепки.

text: Arriving for a Sunday brunch, the place as buzzing, though not packed. However, even with the number of workers around, service was slow. The orders came in really odd moments even though it was ordered at the same time. The signature pasta (The Wolf's Favorite) was far too sticky and the yolk, while enhancing the flavor, contributed more to the stickiness which ruined the pasta slightly. The Eggs Benedict was equally disappointing, perhaps I've had expected more looking at the price (RM17), but two eggs and some sad bacon strips on two pieces of burned toast was not it.Considering the portion, taste and price, the value for money here is quite poor. The service didn't help improve the experience, food was largely dissapointing, environment was bustling though I've expected that and the location could be a bit weird, though being familiar with the area there was no problem faced there.I can't say I will come back again though this is not a bad place by any standard, just perhaps I came with an higher expectations. Perhaps dinner and being able to sample their Pork Ribs might be a better experience next time around. For breakfast / brunch though, there are far better places nearby for now.
label: negative

text:
Просто рекомендую, а почему? Да тут всё на десятку из пяти возможных. 
BaBaBar - это про уют, атмосферу и душу.
Бар с душой, с такой советской, винтажной душой. :)
Тут замечательно всё, начиная с интерьера, который располагает провести в баре часок другой за стаканом/стопкой/чашечкой (нужное подчеркнуть) чего-то вкусного, заканчивая этим самым вкусным, что будет у вас налито, будь то чай из самовара. Да, он там есть и не как экспонат.
Цены приятно удивят, а домашние настойки никого не оставят равнодушным! А под отличную закусочку и в шикарной компании… Вообще с ума сойдёте и не захотите уходить, а место станет частым пристанищем. Главное в меру, с желанием попробовать всё, будет очень сложно вставать из-за стойки. :)
Пиво. Есть крафт, а есть не крафт. Его достаточно и оно свежее, можно найти себе что-то по душе. Выбор небольшой, и опять же обращаю Ваше внимание на настоечки и домашнюю уютную живую атмосферу, это более важно, нежели дюжина холодильников с тонной сортов. Приятно, но не первостепенно.
Обязательно вернусь сюда ещё! И далеко не раз. :)
label: positive

text:
丁寧に調べて、解説されています。
中世の出来事（事件）を時代ごとに、並べて、（代表的な説に、問題点がある場合は、鋭く、根拠を述べて）解説されています。 呉座さんは、「応仁の乱」と比べて、軽いタッチで書いたと書かれています。 しかし、私は、読みごたえがある文章だと感じました。 一つ気になったのは、「呉座さんは最近の歴史に関する本や、テレビ番組をよく思っていないのか」とこの本をよんで感じました。 作家、文化史家がろくに、調べもせず、推測や願望で本をかいたり、テレビに出て、一般の読者に益がなく、害を与えていると。 そうすると、１次資料の読める歴史家以外、本を出せないなと私は、感じました。 推測で本を書いて出していると一部の読者にいわれる二代目ミスター日文研はこれから本が出しにくくなると考えるのは私の思い込みでしょうか。
label: positive

text:

I was told they'd check. Brought pancakes & 3 bacon (not 4). Bill came & pancakes & bacon were charged separately. Not real pleased by that, but otherwise good place!

Nice place & staff! :-)

P.S.,
The bacon was pretty thick & crisp, which is how I like it, so that was really good! Even minus a piece :-P haha

text:
Best spot for Chinese noodles in Las Vegas! The wait can be insane on weekends during lunch time. I've waited 30 min to an hour on Sundays for a table...usually if this is the case I'd just leave but my grandma absolutely loves this place. 

This is not the nicest chinese restaurant that you'll find in Las Vegas but the food is great! They serve the usual entrees that you would find in most Chinese restaurants but their specialty is their delicious noodle soups and BBQ entrees. 

My go-to order here is a bowl of wonton egg noodle soup with the thin noodles with a side of chinese brocolli that is served with oyster sauce. These items sound simple but always leaves me satisfied and happy as can be. Their roast pork is delicious as well. I usually would avoid eating the skin of pork but that would be a sin here.

Most of the employees speak both Chinese and Vietnamese which I found pretty impressive. Their English is for the most part...broken..so be patient...you won't regret it. The food and affordable prices will have you coming back time and time again.
label: positive

text:
Talk about fun. I first heard about this through a friend. He went to an event about a month ago and kept raving about it on facebook. When he mentioned that he was going again, I jumped at the chance to check it out for myself.

I bought my ticket online and saved a couple of bucks. In any case, this is cheap entertainment and they're supposedly not-for-profit. It's all in the name of fun so I'm down to support them. I mean, girls just wanna have fun!

I knew nothing about the sport coming in. One of my friend's coworkers tried to explain it to me, but I figured I'd learn better by watching it. They also do a dry run to give new crowd members a quick primer. Honestly, it's a pretty simple sport. There are some nuances that are still confusing, but it doesn't take long to get a feel for the game.

Incidentally, the hometown Notorious VIP team crushed the visiting Inland Empire Derby Divas. It wasn't even close (something like 185-83). How did they score so many points? I don't know. I understand the basics of scoring, but it all happens so fast.

I'm definitely going again.
label: neutral

text:
I made my reservation using our company travel agency. The confirmed daily rate was for $117.00 per night. However, the hotel charged me $126.00 per night. Speaking with the assistant manager, the printed confirmation number and rate is not valid. He refused to honor the confirmd $117 rate by making the adjustment at the time of check out. He instead offered to process a refund which would take 7 to 10 days. I'm a priority club member, platinum status and for the last five years all of the confirmed rates have been honored by the hotels I have stayed in. I'm on the road 80% each month...I have earned the platinum status.
In respect to the accommodations, the drain in the shower was clogged ...needless to say a major inconvenience. Within seconds I was angle deep in water in the shower. I had to rinse....turn off the water.....lather...wait for the water to drain...rinse...turn off the water...lather....repeat. There was only one remote control for two incompatible TVs. Some of the channels in one TV were not accessible on the other TV. The carpets are very very dirty. I never walk barefoot in a hotel. The whites socks were dark grey within an hour just walking around the room. Luckily, I carry extra socks with me for those hotels that dont wash the carpets regularly.
The staff were courteous ....however, issue with the rate and the clogged drain in the shower is major turn off. Forunately there is a Candlewood Suites a few miles south. On my next business trip scheduled for next quarter, I will try that hotel.
label: negative

text: The first half hour or so of this movie I liked. The obvious budding romance between Ingrid Bergman and Mel Ferrer was cute to watch and I wanted to see the inevitable happen between them. However, once the action switched to the home of Ingrid's fiancé, it all completely fell apart. Instead of romance and charm, we see some excruciatingly dopey parallel characters emerge who ruin the film. The fiancé's boorish son and the military attaché's vying for the maid's attention looked stupid--sort of like a subplot from an old Love Boat episode. How the charm and elegance of the first portion of the film can give way to dopiness is beyond me. This film is an obvious attempt by Renoir to recapture the success he had with THE RULES OF THE GAME, as the movie is very similar once the action switches to the country estate (just as in the other film). I was not a huge fan of THE RULES OF THE GAME, but ELENA AND HER MEN had me appreciating the artistry and nuances of the original film.
label: negative

text:
The reason for my rating: I don't appreciate paying for wifi and I don't like to pay surcharges on already over-priced room service. Other than that, I found the location and appointments worth the discounted price that I paid.
I used a discount website to book this hotel - one of those "secret savers" deals. The property was revealed after I paid my $86. It was worth that price to me as I was attending an event 2 miles away at Mile High/Invesco/Sports Authority Field. I wasn't driving, so I knew I wouldn't have to worry about the parking charges, and after reading other reviews I requested a room in the main hotel rather than the tower and they accommodated me with no hesitation.
The 4-star qualities: location, service, property amenities, room comfort. I had a great night's sleep even though I was the first room by the elevator. I am a light sleeper, so I was pleasantly surprised by the lack of noise at night. Also, the air conditioning is quiet, which is why I often look for 4-star properties on discount websites. The room was large, the bed and pillows were very comfortable, the bathroom was roomy (needed more light though), and the desk and TV appointments were good. The air conditioner was quiet - and this is a very big part of why I seek 4-star properties at a discount.
The 4-star cons: as I mentioned right up at the top - charging for wi-fi and $3.50 surcharge on top of inflated room service prices. (the $12 mediocre quesadilla was a $20 item after tax, surcharge and tip) I find this ridiculous, but I tolerate it because the quality of beds and air conditioners in 4-star properties provide for me (a light sleeper) a much more restful stay.
I know the company line is "our wi-fi charges are comparable to our direct competitors" or something along those lines. But we all know that they charge for it because much of their clientele will simply put wi-fi on their expense account. It seems that 4-star properties don't mind that the message is that the average tourist traveler who scrimps and saves for a little luxury during their vacation is not as important, and they can either pony up the daily internet charge, or they can sit in a busy, noisy lobby to use the free wi-fi. It's ok, 4-stars. We get it. It's an easy $15 a day x1000's with almost no extra work or capitol expense required on your end. Even though hotels like this probably pay a little for someone to spend time rebutting the same complaint hundreds of times on sites like this, that cost is worth the investment. We get it. But it still stinks.
If this (or any other) 4-star property would stop charging for decent wi-fi, I bet that they would get much happier reviews instantly. Maybe someday they'll get that message and be bold enough to go against the 4-star grain. In any case, I paid for wi-fi so I could access the internet in my quiet room. There are 3 speeds of access you can pay for at the price points of $10, $12 and $15. I went for the middle one.
label: neutral

text:
Hübsche, stabile Kleiderstange mit viel Platz
Die Kleiderstange haben wir uns für den Flur bestellt, um Ordnung für sämtliche Jacken zu schaffen. Die Kleiderstange wurde schnell geliefert und ließ sich leicht aufbauen. Sie ist größer als gedacht und wir bekommen wirklich viele Jacken unter, vor allem auch dickere, schwere Winterjacken. Unten befindet sich eine große Ablagefläche, auf die wir ein großes Körbchen mit Schals, Tüchern etc. gestellt haben. Platz ist wirklich jede Menge vorhanden. Bisschen schade fand ich, dass die Kleiderstange etwas wackelt. Doch das haben wir damit behoben, indem wir eine der mitgelieferten weißen Schutzkappen an einem Bein befestigt haben. Das sieht man kaum und nun wackelt nichts mehr. Die Kleiderstange ist stabil und sieht optisch toll aus. Klare Weiterempfehlung, denn wir sind sehr zufrieden damit!
label: positive

text:
This place has decent food but I am surprised by the people who gave it 4 or 5 star rave reviews. It's not bad, but it's nothing special either. 

I went in on Sunday for a late lunch with 3 other people. We all liked our food but agreed that it was pretty much the same as any other Mexican restaurant. I was a little disappointed since the menu did not have a lot of choices and what was there was pretty basic. One of the people at the table ordered the combo plate they were told that they were out of tamales so she had to sub another taco. So, the four of us got chicken rolled taquitos, beef fajitas, carne con chile, and tacos. Wow, real exciting stuff. 

The pluses for this place are the variety of salsa that come with chips before the meal and the free sopapillas. Again, nothing really wowed my taste buds, but both were a nice touch. 

The waitress was very friendly but the service was spotty. She refilled our drinks before they were even empty but failed to notice that we did not have napkins or silverware until we pointed it out to her... after our meals had been brought out. 

Overall I didn't hate it; but I will not be back again since there are other Mexican joints closer to my house that have the same boring food so it really is not worth the drive for me.
label: negative

text:
Ended up here after trying to take my parents to Noodle Palace (they are closed for remodel apparently).

Since it was still early (about 10:30am) my dad was starving and my mom wanted wonton noodle soup- we ended up here since they were close by, OPEN, and had a lunch special, $5.95 for most of the dishes!

My mom and her cousin had the wonton noodle soup, I had the duck wonton noodle soup and dad had a pigs feet noodle dish.
My mom didn't complain, which is a good sign cause nothing is as good as her's. 
My dad enjoyed his but I thought the noodles needed more flavor. He had some type of stewed pigs feet with egg noodle dish- the noodles were a little bland but nothing a little soy sauce didn't cure. The pigs feet was flavorful and soft, fell off the bone.

I had the duck wonton noodle soup. The soup was a little bland and the wonton was also a little bland but the shrimp in the wonton was firm and fresh. The duck was the winner here...it was moist, thick and just the right amount of fattiness.

The duck was so good we ended up leaving with a whole duck to go!
so glad we stopped in, the duck alone will bring me back...
label: neutral

text:
This was an impromptu trip, no planning, set up by travel agent and GoGo vacations, had no idea what to expect, and did not read reviews before going. It was our 30th anniversary and had no kids involved. We are not Hilton regulars and had no extra incentives. We wanted a relaxed atmosphere, spa treatments, and good food. We requested a balcony room for privacy which was unavailable due to the Memorial Day weekend crowd. Was given a room with a "patio" which was less than 3 ft wide and was regularly occupied by children from other rooms.
The spa was excellent, use of the spa gave us access to the spa pool and all other facilities which was wonderful. The pool area was much better than the other pools and we practically had it to ourselves. The treatments are expensive but worth the cost.
Dinner at the Antlers Lodge had the distinction of being the most expensive meal we have ever had. However, my compliments to the chef. The food was excellent. The atmosphere was also excellent with enough space between tables for privacy. The service was flawless. I can recommend the bison steak and tomatillo soup.
The breakfast buffet was good but expensive at $21 a person. Drinks were also high at $10-12 each so we didn't have to worry about getting drunk.
The place is great location for a family vacation/Seaworld trip. It is 20 minutes and $50 plus tip cab fare each way to the Riverwalk. There were lots of kid oriented activities this weekend. There were very few adult oriented activities.
The rooms were comfortable but the walls were thin. The fighting kids next door woke us up at 6:30. The shouting mother trying to control them was even louder. I could have complained but that wouldn't have gotten us more sleep.
One of the worst problems I had was lack of Internet access. Neither my iPhone nor my iPad would work in the room. I called Internet help desk 4 times. I finally was able to log in outside. However, nowhere inside the room could I get service. My regular cell service didn't work either due to the heavy limestone walls. One call to the help desk netted me a curt "It's because you have an iPad." I used it outside until I had fed half the San Antonio insect population. I spoke about the problem to the concierge. I was surprised that I wasn't offered even a token of compensation for this. We spent over $1200 on food and spa services alone this trip. You would think they would want us to come again.
We tried our best to just have nice memories for our anniversary. It was tough, tho. My overall impression of this hotel was disappointing.
label: negative

text: We haven't been here in awhile so we decided to go last Sunday to see if it was as good as we remembered. It was pretty busy, and busier than their norm, so the service was lacking, but the sushi was amazing! Definitely on par with the sushi restaurants on the strip. I heard before that the owner was the head sushi chef at nobu and it definitely shows. A lot of the menu items are almost identical to nobu's menu. But I didn't mind that at all since nobu is my fav! However, soj goes further outside of the box with their menu. For sushi lovers I would definitely recommend the shin's special plate. It was amazing! Delicate, beautiful, fresh pieces of assorted sushi each topped with a special sauce. I would also recommend the yellowtail and salmon in spicy ponzu sauce.It was beautiful and delicious as well. We also had the Hawaiian style edamame, too salty for me, uni, not the best I've had, but not the worst! Spicy tuna handrolls, amazing. Oysters with salsa, amazing. Tempura, really good. And chocolate cake with green tea icecream for dessert, identical to the bento box dessert at nobu! \nOverall a great meal, will go back again soon.
label: neutral

text:
評価を２に下げました( ﾟДﾟ)
決して気に入らないわけではないんです。 バンド部分の塗装が適当だとか、金具が少しずれてくっついているとかは まぁ値段が値段ですので。 ただ、つけて３日目でバンドの部分はボロボロ剥げてきて、 途中時間を調整するところが戻らなくなったりはもう少しもって欲しい。 時間はそれなりにあっているし、針はあきらかな安物感がでてますが、 青の文字盤は結構綺麗で気に入っている分、壊れるのがちょっと早いです。 ★３つをあげてもいいかもだけど、到着もかなり時間がかかったし、 これからどれだけ長く使えるかで修正するかも知れませんが 現段階で壊れてきているのでこちらで。 追記です。 上記は購入して３回目の使用の時の感想です。 そして事件は４回目に起こりました。時計は元気なんですが、手首を動かしたところバンドを固定している根本の部分が壊れました。 修理は難しいようです。ただもう少しもって欲しかったかな~。 まさか普通に使ってて根本からとれるとは^^; 自分のがたまたまそうだったからなのはわかりませんが、予想外にもろかったです。 いや値段相応って言われればそうなんだけど。 まさか時計よりも先に固定部分が壊れるとは…。
label: negative

text: 8 декабря 2022 заказал дебетовую карту . На сайте написано про доставку на следующий день, но это ложь, такого варианта выбора не оказалось, ближайшее число было 11.12.2022. Но и 11 декабря никто ничего не привез. Только лишь 12 декабря 2022 приехала курьер, которая даже из машины поленилась выйти. Серьезное вроде дело, договор , как можно в машине изучать, ведь не та же обстановка. Ладно, я согласился, думал опытный банковский работник и в такой обстановке всё прояснит. Но это был не работник банка. Просто курьер, которой вообще все равно что везти. Я задавал вопросы, довольно естественные, потому что договор (который почему-то называется не договор, а анкета-заявление) я увидел впервые и эта анкета вызывает вопросы. И получал стандартный ответ я не знаю, зачем мне это знать, я курьер . В числе прочего в анкете , прямо открыто напечатан логин и пароль электронной почты (вида . . , пароль ), для уведомления и подтверждения операций по карте. Курьер связку логин пароль видел, начальство курьера (и это тоже не банковские работники) тоже всё видели, неизвестно ещё кто логин-пароль видели до меня. И после тоже эта анкета - договор тоже не сразу ведь в банк попала, то есть опять неизвестно как строго секретные данные путешествовали. И это ведь не персональные данные, это именно строго конфиденциальные данные, которые должны быть только у меня. Как утверждает сам банк ( . . - - - - ) Электронный почтовый ящик от ПАО КБ УБРиР - это бесплатный канал получения информации о совершенных операциях с использованием банковских карт, предоставление которого осуществляется на основании ст. 9. федерального закона 161-ФЗ . То есть банк организовал почтовый сервис только для того, чтобы не обеспечивать клинтов бесплатными СМС. Но распространив мои секретные данные среди всех желающих, банк УБРИР вот именно меня в мою почту и не пускает. 13 декабря 2022 (то есть в день снижения ставок по вкладам) банк карту активировал, и я даже зашел в интернет банк. И в разделе оповещения по карте действительно обнаружил то самый адрес электроннй почты . . . Однако по адресу . . пытавшись войти в почту я получил лишь сообщение неудачная попытка входа . И до сих пор все попытки оканчиваются так же. По всей видимосьт, кто-то уже вошел до меня и поменял пароль и ждет теперь возможности манипулировать моим деньгами. 14.12.2022 я задал вопрос на портале Банки.ру в разделе вопрос-ответ ( . . - 462810), сообщив (в приватной части вопроса) банку всю возможную информацию о себе и ситуации. (Под другим именем задал вопрос, но это благодаря администрации банки.ру и их постоянным улучшениям). В тот же день получил ответ Мы проверим информацию и вернёмся к вам с ответом, пожалуйста, ожидайте . На этом реакция банка закончилась. Ещё что-то там про персональные данные, из чего следует что по мнению банка строго конфиденциальные сведения (связка логин-пароль например) относит к простым персональным данным (а персональными данными клиентов банк щедро делиться с партнерами). Я изначально хотел открыть вклад, для этого и карту заказывал (иначе не стал бы), но сейчас я просто боюсь перводить туда хоть какие-то деньги. Банк завел почтовый сервер не по доброте, а лишь чтобы формально соблюсти норму закона. Но по факту ничего не соблюдается, этот бесплатный канал получения информации обо мне банк предоставил не мне, а неизвестно кому.
label: negative

text:
First, the positive. This is a fairly new hotel, so it's still well maintained and clean (except the carpet, which was pretty stained in my room). It has hip/modern decor, which I suspect a lot of people would be in to. The suites are roomy and had a large desk/workstation that was very handy for getting some work done. The fitness center had nice, new treadmills with TV's onboard. The location is handy to the airport and major highways, but that advantage is also part of its major disadvantage
Now, the negative. The planes taking off and landing late in the evening and early in the morning rattled my bed like we were having an earthquake. Trucks driving by on the road rattled the windows. The walls are so thin that I laid awake all night listening to the guy in the room beside my snore. HORRIBLE night's sleep. I even tried to get up and sleep on the couch to get away from the snoring, but it was so narrow that even a pretty small person like myself (I'm 5'3) had to lie flat with my arms crossed across my chest to fit. NOT comfortable. The thin walls also made it sound like there was a track meet going on in the hallways and stairwells (sounded like a family with kids moving in) I got maybe 2 hours of sleep. Terrible experience.
label: negative

text:
Checked in late Friday night on a very busy weekend -- Graduation and NASCAR Speed Street. Our first room had two queen size beds and was very spacious. It was also marked as a handicapped room and had a lovely shower without glass doors. Unfortunately we discovered fecal matter sprayed around the toilet (toilet was clean) attempted to clean it with shower and a towel but had no bleach so when housekeeping didn’t clean/disinfect it (twice) -- (left a note) -- we asked to be moved to another room. I Tried to give our housekeeper a chance to rectify the situation. But Scott, at the front desk, figured that they probably didn’t understand the note. He very apologetic and promised to contact the manager. Our stay was for 4 nights and when asked what they could do since they couldn’t offer us a meal (no restaurant) we asked for one night complimentary. There was a message on our home answering machine after we checked out and flew home that we would receive a 50% discount on our first night’s stay for the inconvenience.
During our stay housekeeping also were not consistent in replacing coffee packets, washcloths, or bath mat, and crumbs did not get cleaned off the table in the room. In hindsight, we should have contacted the manager immediately (I was trying to be nice to the housekeeper) and we should have asked to move to a different floor with a different housekeeper!
I won’t be returning or recommending it.
Other hotels offer 100% guarantee – if not 100% satisfied room is complimentary – and I will be booking those from now on.
label: negative

text:
Gut aber nicht TOP
Ich habe dieses Teil für die Firma bestellt, weil immer mehr Konferenzen via Skype und Co statt gefunden haben. Mit einem kleinen Personenkreis funktioniert diese Freisprecheinrichtung gut, aber wenn viele >4 Personen im Raum sind, dann schwächelt die Box. Everything you'd expect from a W: sheek environment, quality comforts, lush bar, and outstanding service. We recently stayed in the W SF for our wedding anniversary, and every time I spoke with someone at the hotel (whether reservations, the concierge, housekeeping, in room dining, etc), they wished me a happy anniversary! They even brought a cheese and olive plate with a bottle of wine up to our room after we checked in.
On top of the wonderful W experience, the hotel is in a great location: within walking distance of so many of SanFran's great downtown attractions.
We will definitely be coming back again soon!

text: 4.5 stars from me!\n\nThis yogurt place is sort of hidden in Summerlin but it's the best frozen yogurt place in the Vegas area although I do have a few little suggestions to make this place a little better. First of all I love the old school games here! It's so cool to feel like a kid and eat ice cream (frozen yogurt actually, whatever- tastes the same to me) and play pacman. The QUALITY of the toppings here is what makes this place better than the rest. The toppings taste fresh, candy isn't stale like some of the other places I've been. You pay more for quality here, the prices are higher than most other frozen yogurt places, I got a little sticker shock when I paid at the counter. Overall this place is super cool, I'll be back here again for sure, and I'll still load up my cup with the yummy togurt flavors and toppings!

text:
SUMMARY: My Dad and I wanted the old-school, real-deal Vegas steakhouse experience. We got it!

THE SETTING: Red leather seats, crisp tablecloths, some Sinatra drifting by in the background. Waiters in bowties dressed better than the patrons. DO NOT LET THE CHINTZY FACADE OUTSIDE FOOL YOU - this is serious business.

THE SERVICE: My father has recently had a stroke, and as such has had to seriously limit his salt intake. This was noted when the reservation was taken, and the hostess took great pains to make sure that everything was setup to accommodate his needs. If we needed water or bread or anything, a waiter was right there to provide it.

THE FOOD: First and foremost, the tableside caesar HAS to be gotten. Anchovy, raw egg, the genuine article. I do not exaggerate when I say that we ate the salad one slice of Romaine at a time, as each piece had its own unique combination of elemental flavors.

'Elemental' was the watchword for the steaks, as well; simply beef plus time for aging in a controlled environment. Cut like butter, melted in the mouth, crisp on the outside and perfect-rare inside, sitting in a pool of savory juices.

The salad and steak were so filling we split only a potato on the side, with butter and sour cream. It was good, not great, but hey, it's a potato - it can be done poorly or decently, there is no 'amazing potato'. 

The only slight miss was the creme brulee; the texture was a bit lumpish and it had clearly been kept in the fridge, then quickly blowtorched to melt sugar on top.

The coffee was excellent.

THE DRINKS: 2 martinis each, well-prepared, no complaints.

THE BILL: For four mixed drinks, two salads, two steaks, one potato, two coffees and one creme brulee, $200.
label: neutral

text: J'attendais beaucoup de ce film, précédé par la réputation avantageuse qu'entretenaient les admirateurs des deux premiers oeuvres de Roy Andersson. Vous connaissez peut-être le principe : 39 plans fixes, présentant des personnages tous lamentables, tristes et figés. Au rayon des points positifs, il faut reconnaître que la capacité d'Andersson à dessiner de véritables tableaux vivants est remarquable. Les perspectives, les personnages qui se meuvent dans les seconds plans et les mini-histoires qui irriguent certaines scènes parviennent parfois à captiver. Au rayon des points négatifs, le problème n'est pas tant que le film est très pessimiste sur la nature humaine (comme c'est aussi le cas chez Franco, Haneke ou Seidl), mais plutôt qu'il l'est sur un mode un peu niais. Oui, la guerre c'est moche, l'esclavage c'est pas bien, la solitude c'est triste, et la mort c'est pas cool. Mais on le savait déjà. Le film est bourré de tics qui m'ont aussi dérangé par leur caractère répétitif : la phrase que plusieurs personnages disent au téléphone, la musique qui revient tout le temps, le sketch des deux représentants de commerce qui se répète plusieurs fois. Une curiosité donc, qu'on peut voir comme l'illustration d'un univers très personnel, intéressant mais pas captivant.
label: negative

text:
I had driven by and seen the sign for this place a few times since reviewing some other Thai places, but just got around to trying it a few days ago. 

Corner Thai Kitchen is, fittingly, located in the corner unit of a strip mall. 
Despite the wall of windows, there is nothing great about the view -- parking lot and auto shop. But the interior is cozy and pleasant with a gurgling fish tank separating the entrance area from the seating area.

As usual, I ordered my favorite Thai dish, panang. And sticking to my vegetarian diet, I got the tofu panang -- along with my first iced Thai coffee. 

The Thai coffee arrived in a tall glass full of ice and my first impression was that it had a smoked flavor -- as if the coffee beans had been smoked. It was also sweet and creamy. The more I tasted it, the more I enjoyed it.

The tofu panang arrived in a boat-shaped ceramic dish. Unlike other panangs I've had, this one had no peas or carrots, just red and green bell peppers, basil leaves, tofu, and the spicy coconut sauce. While I've never had a panang I didn't like, I can't say I've ever had a version I liked more than this one. It was delicious. 

The waitress and the other staff were very friendly and helpful. The wait for the food was typical and the prices were reasonable. I'd recommend Corner Thai Kitchen to any lover of Thai food.
label: neutral

text:
Upon check-in, my husband was greeted by grumpy staff. They placed us NEXT to the elevator, when we had specifically requested to be away from the elevators. We stayed here with my two 2 1/2 year olds, and a 10-year old. The room was rough - carpet was visibly dingy and gross. Granite counter tops had been placed over warped, and visible 2X4's holding them up. The refrigerator in the kitchen area had huge spaces between appliances, and cheap, well-worn linoleum flooring. My husband and I were afraid to let the kids touch anything. The TV was lousy and probably the most blurry I've tried to watch in years. The breakfast room (right next door) was scary - mold showing on the base of two walls - at least 1 foot in diameter. The "Free" breakfast looked like it came out of the vending machine in the parking garage. It was sparse, to say the least. We ended-up eating out on the second day. It was a joke amongst us guests in the breakfast room on the first day. Many who came in to check-out the breakfast were appalled at both the size of the offerings and the huge gobs of mold on the walls. Some were repulsed like me and quickly left.
The pool was okay, but had some debris in it. The location was right off the freeway and within 15 minutes of Sea World, our destination. There were plenty of nice restaurants and a lot of shopping within a few miles' drive.
My advice - pay the extra $50 and stay closer to the beach or Sea World, if that's your destination, but don't stay in this hotel!!! What a ripoff!
label: negative
