text: I stayed two nights at the Hilton in Boston's Financial District. Over all I had an ok expericence (although I would strongly advise everyone to stay well away from the rooms next to the ice machines!) but given the fact that this was a Hilton Hotel, I expected more. Perhaps too much. The hotel has everything a four star hotel is supposed to have. Just don't make the mistake of thinking you can have any of it for free. Nothing is included in the price for the room, which means you pay for breakfast, internet and also I had to pay 10 dollars to print out one(!) copy of my train ticket. I don't know if this is standard for Hilton Hotels in the US, as this is the first I've stayed in, but I have to admit that I felt somewhat ripped off.
label: negative

text: Рожала в мае 2023 года это ужас, легла на до родовое постоянно пытались стимулировать без видимых причин. Всё же привели доводы что без стимуляции никак я согласие подписала, после випитых таблеток мифепристон, а их пьют через сутки были схватки все время на протяжении двух суток. В родовое отделение не спускают так и мучилась со схватками в палате где помимо меня ещё лежало две беременных. Родить самой не удалось экстренное кесарево у ребеночка острая гипоксия. Конечно все правильно оформлено подписываешь согласие на стимуляции родов там прописано острая гипоксия возможна у ребёнка. Не рекомендую. Конвейер настоящий.
label: negative

text: 해방촌 용산동 노아 노력하는 아이 노아 1. 백 명이 한 번 먹는 음식 보다, 한 명이 백 번 먹는 음식을 만들고 싶다 2. 해방촌 이탈리안 레스토랑인 노아의 간판이다. 식사를 하면서 사장님께 식당 이름을 왜 노아라고 지었는지 여쭤봤다. 바로 나온 대답이 노력하는 아이의 줄인 말이라고 한다 3. 노아 Noah라는 이름은 구약성경의 노아의 방주 노아를 말한다. 최근에 노아라는 이름의 레스토랑이 종종 보였는데, 2000년 초반 생의 남자아이 이름 인기 최상단에 놓아가 있는 것과 우연의 일치는 아니다. 예전에 연남동에 노아의 집이라는 레스토랑에서 꽤 맛있게 먹은 기억이 있어 해방촌 노아도 꼭 가고 싶었던 레스토랑이다. 본인이 생각했던 성경의 노아 이름은 아니지만 오히려 더 멋진 한국말 노아라는 이름의 레스토랑을... 4. 이 집의 리뷰들을 살펴보니 2014년부터 이어져 있다. 생각보다 꽤 오랜 업력을 가지고 있는 곳이다. 리뷰 속에서 이 집의 처음 모습이 보인다.아주 작은 공간에 오픈 키친, 그리고 테이블이 다닥다닥 있었을 것이다. 예약제로 운영하면서 맛있는 피 짜와 파스타, 그리고 가격 좋은 와인을 서빙하셨던 것 같다. 지금은 그 옆 공간을 함께 운영하면서 완전히 독립된 키친과 꽤 넓은 다이닝 공간을 보유한 레스토랑의 모습을 보유하고 있다. 5. 사실 메뉴나 맛 정보 없이 즉흥적으로 방문했는데, 꽤나 인상적인 요소들이 있다. 그중에 제일 재미있는 것이 셀프서비스가 많다는 것. 물과 실버웨어 이외에 소스와 피클, 그리고 신기하게도 피코 다 가요가 셀프다 셀프존은 참 예쁘게 구성이 되어 있다. 얼음 채운 박스에 예쁜 텀블러가 물병이고 병조림 통어 피클과 피코 다 가요가 정갈하게 정렬이 되어있다. 6. 주문은 기본 피자인 토마토 피자 마가리타 정도가 되겠다, 그리고 꽃게 파스타와 버섯 파스타로 부탁을 드렸다. 피차가 아주 예쁘게 나왔다. 도톰한 꼬르니쵸네에 예쁘게 부풀어 있는 차르의 모양이 좋다.사실 부풀어 터진 부분은 아쉽다 발효도 잘 됐고, 돌려가며 잘 구웠다는 증거다. 정통 나폴리탄 피자의 모습이 확연하다. 7. 피자 중심은 얇고 부드러우면서 토마토소스의 산미와 단맛이 치즈와 기가 막히게 어우러진다. 특히 산마자 노 토마토로 만든 소스를 마지막에 올린 신선함은 피자의 맛을 배가한다. 크러스트인 꼬르니쵸네도 쫄깃하면서 적절한 고소함과 짠맛이 느껴진다. 피자 정말 맛있다 8. 파스타는 가정식 느낌이 물씬 난다. 아쉽게도 버섯 파스타와 꽃게 파스타 모두 링귀니 노 해주셔서 파스타 식감이 단조로웠는데, 대단한 맛보다는 가정식으로 푸근한 맛이다. 버섯 파스타는 간장으로 맛의 포인트를 주고 마늘종으로 식감을 준 독특함에 들깨로 풍미를 돋우었다. 잘 만들었지만 조금만 덜 달면 좋겠다. 꽃게 파스타는 크림 베이스라 조금 느끼하다. 그 느끼함을 따로 주신 토마토소스로 중화시키며 먹는다. 좋은 구성이고 맛도 있지만 꽃게의 풍미가 약하고 청키한 살이 없는 부스러기 살만 있는 것도 단점이다.파스타보다 피자에 더 감흥이 산다. 9. 이 집은 토마토를 잘 쓰는 집이다 고수가 거의 느껴지지 않으면서 연한 매운맛이 잘 조화된 피코 데다 요는 꼬르니쵸네와 함께 먹으면 환상적이다. 스테이크 메뉴가 있다면 더욱 완벽한 콘디 먼츠가 됐을 것 같다. 게다가 신선하고 산뜻하면서 풍미 좋은 토마토소스는 이 집의 내공을 알려준다. 기본이 잘되어 있으니 맛이 없을 수 없다. 10. 참 좋은 레스토랑을 방문했다. 사장님의 열정도 멋지고, 음식의 품질도 훌륭하다. 잘 갖추어진 기본기를 바탕으로 적합한 메뉴와 레시피를 개량해 가면서 해방촌에서는 유명한 레스토랑으로 발전을 하고 있어 보인다. 이런 기본기와 열정이 그대로 유지되는 멋진 곳으로 발전하기를 바란다. 식당의 이름처럼 노력하는 모습이 느껴진다. 마음을 움직인 점심 식사였다 PS 식사를 현금으로 계산하면 인근 공영주차장 주차비 1시간을 지원해준다. 봉투에 담아 주시는데 봉투를 받는 느낌이 재밌다 동네 식당 응원 프로젝트
label: positive

text: Booked a return flight for my partner and I to Amsterdam for a family wedding and personal holiday. London City Airport is bliss no queues just relaxing we arrived 45 minutes before our flight and had time to sit and have breakfast before our 9.25 flight. Even though the flight was only around 40 minutes in the air the flight crew still managed to give out drinks and snacks. The Avro RJ 85 was comfortable and more than suitable for the flight cabin crew were attentive and authoritative while still remaining pleasant. Cityjet is a full service airline and well worth the money. Since I was travelling in August all airlines charge summer rates (200%) but as Cityjet is not a holiday airline their fares don't change in the summer meaning they actually became competitive with Easyjet and KLM. Luggage and food is included flying from London you get to experience the world's best airport and they really do take all of the stress out of flying. Cityjet only cater for short haul business flights so offer no entertainment but on a 40 minute flight what could they do? I will definitely use them again and am recommending them to everyone!
label: negative

text: Well, It's an excellent hotel for the price. It's especially good for business travelers. For family, they have nice facilities, pool, sauna, and gym. The rooms are pretty much the same size. Try to get room with balcony it's nicer view. I will come back to the hotel for the price i paid for. Go to priceline to get a good deal. I think i got a deal. Remember, you have to pay parking fee each day if you drive, which is kind of pain, it's $13 + tax each day. I wish the parking was free so you would really get a good deal. The front desk staff in early morning wasnt really nice i dont know why ( i think maybe because they work in graveyard shift, they are tired, it happened to me too in Chicago, It was a Fairmont Hotel, WoW They are not nice) The Morning front desk around 8-10 Pm were wonderful. They were really helpful and trying to get the job done. Concierge was great. The room service guy need to be improved. Well, I will come back for the price i paid for. Overall A-
label: negative

text:
3.5 stars rounded to 4 stars! Aloha Specialties Restaurant is the popular one-stop shop for local Hawaiian food when you visit Las Vegas. The restaurant is located in the California Hotel and Casino. You need to time your visit here (i.e., go early) because this place gets crowded! I always wondered why Hawaii people would rush to a Hawaii restaurant in Las Vegas. Don't we get enough local food at home? It's all about comfort food.

Prices are reasonable, but the food preparation can take a while. Be sure you have some good topics to talk with your table mates about. Employees here work super hard to ensure you have a good experience.

Large Saimin Noodles: This dish was just like eating local noodles at home in Hawaii. The portions are quite large. The saimin tasted like S&S saimin. Although the noodles were a bit too soft and smooshy for me, it reminded me of my childhood. Nice. Grade: B

 <url> Curry & Rice: This dish wasn't my favorite. Period. The flavor was right on, but the texture was a bit starchy and thick. Not my style of local chicken curry. Grade: C+

Pork Tofu: This dish was like home cooking! Slices of pork cooked with onions, tofu, and served in a mirin, shoyu, and hondashi sauce! WINNER! Grade: A!

 <url> Korean BBQ Chicken: The highlight of my dish was the grilled Korean BBQ chicken. Three thighs were served with a whole lot of rice and a side of macaroni salad. Well prepared, well cooked, delicious flavor. Grade: A-

 <url> Grade: B
Service Grade: B
Worth The Money Grade: B
Overall Impression Grade: B
label: neutral

text:
I stayed at the Marriott Copley Place for two evenings in Jan. 2011. The hotel location is ideal to get around Boston. It's close to the Green and Orange lines and in a central part of town, Back Bay. It is close to many restaurants and lots of shopping.
I was a little disappointed by the amenities offered by the hotel. No robes, no bath gel, etc. My bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows and mattress were great. Our conference facilities were nice and most of the staff were excellent. We did have one conference staff member that was very rude, but that was the exception. The meeting rooms needed more frequent changes of trash and the conference restrooms needed to be checked more often to be cleaned.
Overall, the stay at the Marriott Copley was pleasant and comfortable. I would recommend staying here if you can afford it!!!
label: negative

text:
I love the happy hour here! 
This is a cute wine bar in Chandler. It is on the smaller side, but cozy. We sat at the bar and ordered our drinks. They have great drink deals during happy hour that starts at 2pm! 
The food options are $2.00 of all Tapas and 1/2 off the bruschetta menu. I love their bruschetta. There are like 6 different flavors to choose from. You get to pick three different kinds and you get two of each. One order is huge and its only $4.50. I do suggest that you stay away from the salmon bruschetta, not very good. My favs are the brie with apples and almonds, and the artichoke hearts with goat cheese and red pepper pesto. Yummo! 
I have had dinner here once awhile ago and it was good, but I have not been recently. I stick to their happy hour, it is a ton of food! 
Enjoy!
label: neutral

text: Spent an entire week in Chicago at this location. The hotel is also close to several choices of coffee shops: Starbucks, Caribou, and Intelligentsia. The rooms are spacious (Rm# 908) including the bathroom. The room did have a flat screen tv. text:
My recent 2 night stay at the Westin could be separated into to very different room experiences. I originally checked into the Westin for a one night stay. I was put into a great room (4005) on the 40th floor. The room was clean and very well appointed as I've come accustomed to with most Westins. Had my stay ended in that room, I would have given a 5 star rating for this hotel. However, my business meetings required me to extend my stay in NYC (not a bad thing) so I asked to extend my existing stay. The front desk staff member was great and with special permission, she was able to honor my existing rate to another night. The only hitch was that they could not keep me in the same room since it had been already assigned for another guest checking in that day. Not a big deal to me. The only request I made was to keep me on the same floor so that I can move my things with minimal effort. The wonder staff member was able to meet that request. This is where the 2 stars fell off...
I walked into the room (4037) and upon first inspection, the room look clean and we well appointed like the previous. I noticed a slight mildewy smell in the bathroom but chalked it up to maybe the room having been recently cleaned. The smell persisted during the entire stay. The A/C unit was also an issue. While it did a fine job of keeping the room at a comfortable temperature, every time the A/C unit turned off after getting to the desired temperature setting, a startling and VERY loud thud would signal the end of the heating/cooling cycle. The 3rd strike came with the remodeling project right outside my door at 7:30 to 8:00 AM in the morning. First I thought it was housekeeping being loud, but when I checked it was a couple of guys putting up new decorative pieces in the hallway. Not sure why they would start work so early in the morning since most of the guests are dealing with jet lag and would appreciate the ability to sleep in. Seems to me a project like that could be done in the late morning or afternoon when you can assume no one's sleep is being disrupted.
All in all, this is a great hotel. The hotel doesn't show that much age and is in a great location. had my experience stopped with the first night, I would have given them top ratings. Too bad the next night showed me the other side of this fine hotel.
label: neutral

text:
Do Not book A room with a 12 after the floor number ie 212 or you will have a room with a view of brick walls. The room itself was fine. It was large enough for a king bed and it was comfortable.
The bathroom was good sized and had a magnifying make up mirror and a full length mirror. The odd thing about this was you could see yourself full length when seated on the commode. There were Q tips, cotton balls and a sewing kit tucked away in a covered container. The two club chairs in the room were very soft and uncomfortable. TV was good sized flat screen with HBO. Lighting, as always in hotels was dim, except in the bathroom. The Hotel itself is very convenient.
Service was good at the front desk. However, there was no turndown service and no chocolates on the pillow.
label: neutral

text:
Located in Manhattan's Hell Kitchen the 414 offers the best value for your money.
The rooms are well equipped with 37"-Flatscreen and are spacious compared with other hotels in NYC. They are all clean and quiet, one the other hand the Times Square is only a five-minute-walk away.
I was there for the New York Marathon and at the day before the race I found a complimentary race pack in the room with bottles of water and Gatorade as well as Energy Bar. On the race day the hotel offered a breakfast at 5 a.m.
To describe the Hotel 414 in one word, I would choose "perfect"
label: positive

text:
Sofia L. Vandaele, general manager of W New York Downtown, sent us an email upon reservation. “We're looking forward to your arrival," she wrote. The W may have a well-meaning GM, but delivering consistent service isn’t one of its strengths.
“Do you have a bell boy here?” we asked a en employee lounging by the entrance “I’m the bell boy!”, he replied, but showed no intention of helping with our luggage until we urged him to do so. The check-in process was pleasant enough, and the concierge was both congenial and chatty. This, however, can’t be said of the bar staff, our next stop. Deeply engaged in conversation when we approached them, the servers didn’t let our presence interrupt their chatting. The bar tenders didn’t seem acquainted with the menu, and couldn’t tell the ingredient of a standard cocktail it contained. And their conversation continued even as they served our drinks.
After an enjoyable night at the well-appointed yet quirkily decorated room, we attempted to check out. A humdrum event in most hotel properties, this checkout was a weary experience. It required four or five iterant revisions to our bill, a quest to recover luggage we left earlier, and then multiple phone calls to the hotel after our departure due to mysterious charges to our credit card. Before leaving, we asked to be contacted by the front desk manager. We are still waiting.
label: negative

text:
I'd have to say that Zipps lived up to my expectations, as I was greeted promptly and was seated to a comfy booth. It seems that every seat in the place has a view of at least a dozen screens, and whoever has the biggest party gets the BIG screen and sound...but really now, are you there to listen?

I ordered the Golden Wings, as they seemed to be one of the specialties, as are the burgers, but I was here for the wings! The lovely Miss Chelsea cautioned against going with the scorcher and suggested I get the mild sauce, but get the hot on the side. Nice move, but learned that for this gringo anyway, I survived. No problamo! Note: the side cost me $0.50.

Are you kidding me?!

I'll do it again tho, for the extra sauce was needed for these very meaty little wings that could pass for quail legs!! Got the cheese sticks for a cool down, which reminded me of eggrolls; nice change from the typical battered numbers. 

Wrapping up, the lovely Miss Chelsea asked if I wanted desert. WHAT?! I couldn't resist the Brownie, but also couldn't finish it...so good! I'll be back.
label: positive

text: I went to the Oakland location of 3 guys optical last week (corner of Forbes and Atwood). I scheduled for the free eye exam and contact lense fitting (not free), and I did not need to wait at all, which is super nice. The eye doctor (Christie?) was very friendly and professional, and I got my trial contacts right away. I don't know much about eye exam fees and stuff, but for 40 dollars I got an eye exam + contact lense fitting, without having to wait or travel to some random faraway places (in Pittsburgh that is such a pain when you don't have a car), so I thought it was worth it. Plus it's really close to CMU (and UPitt) so I found it very convenient. \nI took one star off, because the frame selections weren't very big. And the good ones cost a lot, especially when you need high index lenses for your glasses. I heard there's a special that's $99 for 2 pairs of glasses, but that offer does not apply to high index lenses, only the regular thick lenses. So if your power is high, be prepared to pay more.\nOverall I had a great experience at the Oakland store, and I would definitely recommend it to students.
label: neutral

text: مبالغ فيه . كل ما في الرواية مبالغ فيه. إحتفاء البطلة بالبطل الأناني المتعجرف مبالغ فيه. البطل نفسه مبالغ فيه. حتى الاستعراض اللغوي لأحلام مبالغ فيه. البطل ... تارة يحبها لأنفتها .. و يغضب و يخرج الوحش المحبوس داخله لأنها رفضت ماله . و لماذا تصر أحلام على أن الغني وحده هو من يستمتع بالحب. لماذا تحتفي بالرجل الغامض ؟. حقاسؤال يحيرني .. ما المثير في رجل غامض ؟. و كل شيء مبالغ فيه في هذه الرواية. لا المشاعر الإنسانية تقاس بهذه القسوة. و لا أحترم أنا الرجل الذي يتصرف بهذا النحو تجاه محبوبته إن كان يحبها . تعال أخبرك عن الحب صغيرتي لا أخاطب أحلام علي كل أخاطب كل فتاة ظنت أن هذا هو الحب. تعال أخبرك. عن السكنى. تعال أخبرك عن آدم الذي ملك الجنة و مع ذلك استوحشها في نفسه فخلق الله له من ضلعه حواء .. ليسكن إليها .. ليشاركها فرحه و حزنه .. ليحتويه صدرها و يحتويها حنانه. الحب يا صغيرتي ليست مبارزة .. عليك تكبد عناء إشهار أسلحتك في وجه حبيبك. الحب يا صغيرتي أبسط من هذه العقد .. أبسط من أن يكون له لون واحد فهو في ذاته من يريك العالم بلون آخر. الحب يا صغيرتي .. أن يعود ليلا و برغم تعبه يقول لك أوحشتني بسمتك دون تكبد عناء حساب تلك الحسبة المضنية هل إذا قلت ذلك تخالني ضعيفا ... الحب يا صغيرتي أن تكونا أقوياء سويا .. لا أن تتبارزا في إضعاف أحدكما الآخر . في قاموسي .. هذا البطل ليس سوى غبي آخر خيل له أنه ملك الدنيا لامتلاكه مالا هو فيه كالكلب يلهث كي يجمعه و يحافظ عليه. في قاموسي هذا البطل ليس سوى مزيج غريب من عيوب الرجل الشرقي و عيوب الرجل الغربي .. يقنع هذا بذاك. مزيج يجعلني أشفق عليه. فهو تارة يزأر لكرامته أمام رفضها ماله. و تارة يقنع نفسه بالتحضر و احترام المرأة و كيانها و ال . و بالنهاية .. لم يعجبني تغيير هالة للونها .. قد كان هذا لونها من قبله و لطالما سيظل لونها. انت لا تحتاج لتثبت لغيرك أو لنفسك أنك نسيت .. لأنك إن بذلت مجهودا لتثبت شيئا ما هذا يعني أنك حقا لم تنسى . في عالمي .. لو قابلت مثل هذا الرجل لعلمته درسا لن ينساه. . ربما أنا متحاملة على الراوية. حسنا سأكتب عنها ما أعجبني. أعجبني رفضها لماله. أعجبني حديث أحلام عن ضحايا المجازر .... ربما لأني أكبر في نفسي ذكرها. أعجبني حديثها عن علاء و كيف أنه أدرك أخيرا أنه يكره أصحاب البذات و أصحاب اللحى. . إمضاء :. مجرد فتاة في بدايات العقد الثالث من العمر .. خبراتها في الحياة تساوي عدد الشعرات البيض في رأسها
label: negative

text:
重い切ない映画です
始めは高レビューだったので軽い気持ちで見始め、ボクシングで世界一を目指す映画なのかなと思っていました。しかし、ストーリーが進むにつれわかってきたことはこの映画は「死」という非常に重いテーマを題材にした物語でした。主人公の女性はめでたくボクシングにおいて好成績を残しますが、大けがに見舞われ一生病院での生活（酸素吸引も必要）を余儀なくされてしまいます。家族にも見放され、床ずれにより足も切断してしまいます。そして、最終的には亡くなってしまうのです。自分が同じ状況下に立たされた時、いっそのこと死ぬか、苦しいながらも生き続けるか本当に究極の選択を迫られたとき、彼女と同じ選択をしてしまう気がします。本当にいろいろ考えさせられました。

text:
I'm not too sure about why there are so many 5 star reviews about this place. Yep, the sandwich is decent, and is definitely worth the money, however, this is far from the best hoagie or sub I've had.

I got the 20 inch Turkey sub. For 12.99 that's a phenomenal deal. You definitely get the value for your money.

However, when you break down each of the components, the sandwich itself is just average. The turkey wasn't sliced turkey, but instead kind of like the same chopped up consistency you would find in a cheesesteak. I have no issues with that, but the turkey was a bit dry. 

The bread is a very soft bread, with no crust whatsoever. I'm spoiled by the great bread from the Northeast, where it has a nice crust on the outside and very chewy on the inside. The bread here is still good, but I wouldn't call this a hoagie.

All in all, the sandwich itself is really average; it's the value that you get for your money that drives it up to 4 stars for my review. It's a decent substitute, but no match for a real hoagie.
label: neutral

text: Ce dessin animé est un authentique petit chef d'oeuvre. Plein de magie et de poésie. Décidément, les dessins animés des années 90 étaient plus enchanteurs et intéressants que ceux de nos jours. Je l'ai en cassette vidéo, mais j'aimerais beaucoup qu'il sorte en dvd. Espérons que quelqu'un aurait le projet de le faire. Il serait temps. Les enfants en ont bien besoin, surtout en cette époque où une bonne partie des dessins animés sont de qualité médiocre.
label: positive

text:
Ottimo hotel situato nel centro di Seattle. Camera superlativa, dotata di tutto.
Dentro l'hotel si trova anche uno Starbucks, dove il wi-fi è free, mentre in hotel è a pagamento.
Fate attenzione a controllare ogni giorno il mini bar automatico, perchè a noi è scomparsa una bottiglia d'acqua. Dopo discussioni al check-out (personale molto poco gentile), la situazione si è normalizzata. Mai mi era capitato una cosa simile in un hotel a 5 stelle lusso.
label: positive

text: Держал на НС средства, со вчера потихоньку выводил, сегодня забрал остатки и что-бы счета не болтались, написал в чат просьбу о закрытии НС. Не понятно для чего оператор пыталась это сделать, что бы банку не отдавать раньше? Или счета числились открытыми на начало года

text:
Friends pick this hotel because of the price.
The location couldn't be better, central to everything. There is a sign at registration stating that you have 10 minutes to check out your room after that you will be charged for the night even if you don't stay. That sign alone says it all!!!!! Very old hotel, which doesn't bother me but it is a very dirty hotel and broken down. Smelly, dirty, bathroom door if you shut it, you had to get someone on the other side to let you out. No remote for t.v., phone doesn't work, dresser missing drawers, bedspread had very large holes,no washcloths, no soap. Overall the room looked like it needed a good cleaning. Didn't find any bedbugs and believe me we did pull the bed apart and look. You don't go to NYC to stay in the hotel room however it is nice to go back to a clean room at the end of a long day!!!!! Spend a little more money and you will be happier!
label: negative

text: Food - 5; STARS!! Service - 3.5/5; Price - 3.5/5; Atmosphere 2/5.\nThis place serves up the best French pastries in the valley. The macarons are to die for, I always go for the chocolate and carmel flavors. The other desserts are great too. I read an article on this place and the owner was taught by a French pastry chef. She is so meticulous when baking the croissants that she sets the room temperature to suit the fussy dough, and on top of that the butter is imported from a special farm in France. The traditional French breakfast was just alright. The baguette was old and took some serious muscle to chew but I couldn't believe how good the raspberry jam and butter was. So good that I savored every bite of the stale baguette. The turkey club (w/ fresh sliced Thanksgiving style turkey) and Dijon potato salad is my favorite lunch item.\nThe whole place is small, fairly cramped, and loud if busy. We were lucky enough to score a table outside that was nice. I can't wait to go back.
label: neutral

text:
This is my favorite hotel in Boston. It deserves ever star I can give it. The staff is courteous and friendly. The atmosphere is not stuffy in the least. It's warm, gracious and welcoming, from the friendly doormen to the concierge to the front desk clerks to the bellmen. The rooms are beautifully appointed, comfortable and spacious -- plenty of room to work. I love the water views and they are mesmerizing.
It's an easy walk to the North End for Italian food or an easy and quick cab ride to other parts of the city. For me, the waterfront is also a big, big plus. The Meritage Restaurant is as good as it gets.
I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.
label: positive

text: Dreadful film about a doctor who goes fishing and winds up catching a mermaid when he is thrown overboard. She traps him into bringing her back with him.Glynis Johns, in the title role, is really a silly individual with a tail hanging out.Margaret Rutherford is the nurse who is supposed to be so eccentric but we see no eccentricity here. In fact, Miss Rutherford was not allowed to use her true comedic gifts.Nice to see David Tomlinson in the film. He would get together with Johns in the far superior "Mary Poppins," 16 years later.Miranda causes mischief in that two guys, a neighbor's fiancée and chauffeur (Tomlinson) fall for her.Ask any mermaid you happen to see, what's the best tuna, Chicken of the Sea! As for this film, forget it.
label: negative

text: Great food, awesome teppanyaki chef, but ridiculously unacceptable wait time despite making a reservation. I would have left had it not been a birthday and involved so many other guests who made arrangements to be there. Wretched wait. Out Chef, Jon, was the best. I totally acknowledge his skill, humor, and entertainment...in essence, he saved the night for us there.

text:
Where else can you freeze your @$$ off on the strip?

Excuse the pun, but it's cool to go. You can go and pay for a certain special (nicer/warmer suits, including pictures, number of drinks included). I had to get the one that included a picture to remember the happy memories of our drinking night. They have clear liquors when doing the shots off ice statues and specialty drinks.

Depending on when you get in there is how busy it'll be. Depending on who else is there, will greatly result on how fun the place will be. We were there when a bunch of girls were there for a party, so of course it was more festive. 

Word of advice: when knee deep in drinks, DO NOT leave, wait it out. My friend learned the hard way that you can not go into a cold room (when already drunk) and then leave and try to come back. You'll see why in the next morning.
label: positive

text: Okay, I haven't been here for dinner or lunch, but a Sunday brunch at Paris? Can't go wrong! Anything you could possibly want for breakfast, it's there: mini waffles, pancakes, bacon, eggs, fresh fried potatoes, sausage, croissants...they even had cold crab legs and shrimp (they're not huge or particularly bulging with meat, but they're edible)...plus, when I went, this one lady was handing out scoops of fresh berries to go on your pastries or pancakes...plump, juicy raspberries, strawberries and blueberries...oh man it was SO GOOD. I never ate so much at brunch before...we left full and happy. Too bad we had to wait over an hour, and then we had to wait half an hour for our beverages...there goes 1 star!

text:
う～ん、おもちゃレベルかな
電極10個の腹筋ベルトは パワー最大でも ほとんど感じません。 腕用の電極2個タイプのものは それなりの刺激があるので 腹囲の上下や左右に2個タイプを 貼り付け使用した方が（効果があるかはわかりませんが）かなりましです。 購入前も 小さなコントローラで 多くの電極にパワーが行き渡るかは疑問でしたが 失敗でした。 値段を考えれば こんなものでしょう。 コードレスの低周波治療器と考えれば 電極2個タイプは使い道があるかもしれません。

text: LOVED this place!! They are no hassle, laid back guys that made my frantic car-buying experience much less hectic! I also really appreciated that they weren't all up in my junk when I showed up to scope out their inventory. My favorite part, though, was how accommodating and relaxed they were about everything! I put a deposit down on a car that I was interested in and due to being ridiculously busy with school and work, they let me take the time that I needed to get all of my ducks in a row and finalize the sale (I took over a week). I also had asked if a few things could be done to the car before everything was finalized and I was surprised that I was never given a counter offer or a raise in the price of the vehicle or anything! There was just NO haggling, NO sleazy business tactics, and NO pressure to buy anything that I wasn't incredibly happy with; this made me feel very comfortable. I absolutely loved my experience here and I'm sure I will be back in the future when I am ready for a new car!
label: positive

text: 原版非常好，中文版很差，错别字不多，前后不一致的译名时有发生，不同册中译名有变化，封面彩图不知所云，没有塑封，内文插图经常有重影，原来的版本内文每页还有花边，现在也没有了，行间距变宽算易于阅读的改进，觉得没校对过，和之前的版本没什么提高，还有所降低。唯一值得称赞的是快递比较准时，但这是亚马逊的功劳和出版社无关。有钱的去ebay或国外amazon买吧，前几天有套原版的才49.99镑，虽然加了运费会贵不少，但质量更好。硬皮封面，纸张大一倍，中间插的小故事都是彩页。
label: negative

text:
Checking in was fuss-free (I booked through hotels.com) and all the staff from the front desk to the bellmen were helpful and friendly. The front desk reception even showed us on a city map areas to visit and areas to avoid (for 3 females travelling alone).
The room we got was spacious and well-equipped with a microwave, fridge, coffee-maker, cutlery, crockery and glassware. It even had a large safe in the wardrobe that I could keep all my valuables and more!
Location is so convenient - it's a 3-min walk to Union Square - the centre of shopping, transporation etc. We walked almost everywhere and took the trolley from Powell to Hyde and back.
Would definitely recommend this hotel to families and guests who value close location to Union Square and convenient transportation. Just a note.........Only thing is if you get a room facing Post Street, it can get fairly noisy as the windows aren't double-glazed.
label: positive

text: I like Amy Bloom, but the lectures dont provide the explanations or the processes for creating characters. In the Craft of Plot, Skyhorse gave us the tools we need to develop plot and structure, and even how to start to develop characters. But in this course, the lectures dont do that. They seem more philosophical than instructional and all of the lectures go right over my head. Craft of Plot gave me hope, Craft of Character confused me.
label: negative

text:
Très bon diffuseur
Ce diffuseur d’huiles essentielles est très simple d’utilisation. Il fonctionne très bien, il suffit de verser de l’eau dans le réservoir et d’ajouter 3 à 5 gouttes d’huiles essentielles. Il humidifie bien ma pièce et diffuse les odeurs agréables d’huiles essentielles que j’ajoute. Il s’arrête automatiquement dès qu’il n’y a plus d’eau dans le réservoir, ce qui est bien pratique. Il est joli et peut être mis en mode veilleuse avec le choix de 7 couleurs led. Il est plutôt silencieux, on entend à peine la diffusion de la brume. Il est aussi facile à nettoyer. C’est un bon produit, j’en suis satisfaite et ne regrette pas mon achat, il fait très bien le job. Merci. ++++
label: positive

text: I found this book to be very childish in its deliverance. I had to skip so many pages to stay on course with the plot. Finishing the book, I thought, geez, what a waste of time. This went nowhere as far as I am concerned. Just another author using cliff hangers to get people to buy buy buy. I cannot even fathom reading anymore of this garbage. Very bad form. A good author doesn't need to use cliff hangers to captivate their audience. Getting sick and tired of this writing 101 tactic. Do not recommend this author.

I snagged some dog treats for my pups too!!!

And last but not least Gelato! So many flavors, again, ask for samples... but pistachio is the best!!!

text: Last night was our Anniversary and Indian is our favorite so on a strong recommendation from a co worked we celebrated here. \nThe place is big and nice inside and it was very clean. It was 8:30 when we arrived so the buffet was pretty empty so we just ordered off the menu. we both got Indian beers and they came in frosty mugs so we loved that. we ordered veggie samosa and they were straight off the buffet so they were heat lamp warm, disappointing since we ordered them off the menu we figured the would be hot and fresh. I ordered the vegetarian dinner with paneer tikka masala, the paneer had been sitting in the sauce a long time as it was orange all the way through and was as chewy as a rubber ball, didn't eat it. the rest of the meal was good but the temp of everything was like it had come off the buffet, we also like our Indian HOT so we ordered accordingly and there was NO heat in anything we got so they brought us some hot sauce to add to it and that was super mild as well :( my dinner also came with dessert and coffee or tea I ordered tea but it never came and my dessert again was brought off the buffet. Our bill came to $51 +tip so kinda pricey but we did have a beer each.\nThere was a strong language barrier between us and the waiter we kinda felt like we were on a customer service call and we had been patched over to Indian and couldn't quite get on the same page. the rest of the people that worked there were nice and helpful but I don't think we will make the drive out again as we live in Arrowhead .
label: negative

text:
По работе меня все устроило. Приезжала на замену лобового. Стекло заказывали для меня из другого города. Мастера приветливые, на месте отзывчивые, по другим стеклам авто тоже обстоятельно поискали и дали инфо. Я считаю, что квалификация достаточно высокая. Работа качественно сделана, езжу уже 3 недели. Со стеклом мне тоже повезло, фуяо оказалось не кривое. 
Есть моменты с записью и заказом - звонила раза 4, то не брали трубку, то меня забывали и не перезванивали, вспоминали, потом перепутали с другой машиной, но дальше заказали уже мое стекло, потом сказали, что живая очередь, а на четвертый звонок сказали, что нет, и записали на конкретное время и день. Меня это устроило. 
И в целом самой работой я довольна, приняли меня точно вовремя, замену сделали хорошо и за приемлемые деньги. Пообещали гарантию. 
Помещение бокса чистое, перед ним маленькая парковка. 
Есть оплата картой. И пока стекло меняют, приятно ждать в комнатке с живым аквариумом)
label: positive

text: The hotel is nice, however we had problems with 90% of the staff we came in contact with. Upon arrival we had to go inside and ask for someone to come valet our car, the front desk staff were very unfriendly the three times I was in contact with them, and then upon departure we had to wait 30 minutes for our car to be brought to us (they brought the wrong car first). However, our main complaint is with the night manager and the hotel's claim to be "pet friendly". My husband and I booked this hotel because it allows pets. We had an evening event and there was a problem with my dog while we were away. The frontdesk received a complaint at 10pm from another guest that my (7lb)dog was barking. The hotel called my husbands cell at 10:15 to alert us to the problem. I was back in our hotel room by 10:25 to attend to my barking dog. I was then called by the night manager to inform me I would be charged $100 due to my pet disturbing another guest. The night manager, was very unprofessional in handling this. He would not rationally discuss the situation nor acknowledge the fact we reacted immediately (within 10 minutes) and took care of the situation. My complaint is not with the $100 it is with the way the situation was handled. Be weary of this staff.....they are not professional.
label: negative

text: Perhaps Disney was hoping for another Mary Poppins but this is a very different story and while Angela is delightful she was a very different performer to the great Julie Andrews. Having said that Lansbury is perfectly cast and delivers a magical performance. There is something deliciously dotty about her character and she is given wonderful support by David Tomlinson. Tomilinson can carry a tune but he is certainly not much chop as a singer. It does not matter he was such a gifted actor you hardly notice. There are some great cameos from much loved stars of another time like Roddy McDowel who gives a winning performance and the much loved Tessie OShea who does very little but its nice to see the old gal again. Its also lovely to see Sam Jaffe and the king of English television Bruce Forsythe in small roles. The score has a couple of beautiful songs especially The briny sea and The age of Not Believing. The big number Portabello Road is stretched to the limit but it has plenty of theatricality. The effects look a bit cliché today but the scene with the German invaders being attacked by the wildest army in film is pretty impressive. The kids are not as annoying as other movies but one does struggle to understand what the youngest boy is saying. I loved the marching song of the home army. The home guard were very important to Britain and this is a warm tribute. The animation is delightful, much better than Pixar which I find grotesque. A warm happy film and its a wonder its not done on stage.
label: positive

text:
We liked it but probably not enough to come back. 

We got El Presidente, which is a green chili and carne Asada burrito. It was spicy and a good flavor, but I wasn't loving the carne asada texture. And although the flavor was pretty good, it needed pico or guacamole or something to give you a break from the spice and the flavor. 

The carnitas burrito was better, and the carnitas texture was great. Love that. But again, it needed something to mix it up a bit. It was just meat and spice. 

Next we got the green chile tamale. That was very good. But usually tamales aren't enough alone for me to love a place. 

Really what Espo's needs is a salsa bar with limes, different kinds of salsas, but especially some pico. 

Finally, the folks at the counter were nice. However the table was sticky and there were several flies buzzing me. It had an interesting smell that wasn't Mexican food. Not bad, but didn't make it more appealing either.
label: negative

text:
I don't typically write reviews like this, but I'm so torn about how I feel that this may help me to organize my thoughts.
Ambiance/Decor- 2/5. The decor was just alright, more like a food court or a very nice fast food restaurant rather than a celebrity chef restaurant.
Service- 4/5. Our server checked on us throughout our meal several times and was quite pleasant. She initially put in the order for the wrong burger but came out right away and apologized. The correct burger was a bit delayed, but we were prepared thanks to her quick catch and explanation.
Food- Here's where things get dicey... I guess I'll go with 3/5
We started with the "un-fried" mozzarella. I did not really like this. It was not at all what we were expecting. It essentially was toasted bread with a tomato and mozzarella dipping sauce. The bread was burned in many places, and the sauce was mostly tomato. 
The fries... Not good. I'd have preferred fast-food fries, to be honest. Thin cut, salty, not remarkable, and not good.
 However, I really enjoyed my "Morning After" burger. The flavor of the meat was great, as was the egg on top. I also really liked the mushrooms. The only downside was that I wish there were just a tiny bit more sauce on it, as it got a bit dry as I ate it. The bread was soft and delicious as well. 
Nutella shake- pretty yummy! It was thick, creamy, and had Nutella sauce and little crumbles on top. They also gave us a shaker of the "overflow", so there was plenty to share.

One other note- there is another B&B Restaurant inside the Venetian, which made things confusing. This one is located near the sportsbook.
label: negative

text:
On one of the ice/snow days this winter, this place was one of the few places open. They only had a limited menu consisting of mostly fried foods, which we weren't into. So, I can not comment on the food.

Carolina Ale House has a great beer menu as well. But, for some reason they didn't actually have a lot of the beers. I just wanted an IPA. I asked for Bell's 2 hearted, the server came back and said they were out. Same thing happened when I ordered a Hopsecutioner. I finally just asked him, what do you have and it was a good IPA at a reasonable price for downtown Charlotte.

I don't feel I got the true experience because of the inclemate weather, so I'll have to try again.
label: negative

text: My wife and I have stayed at many JW Marriott hotels in varied destinations. We've stayed at the Cherry Creek (Denver) location three times and have been consistently disappointed in that particular JW. For instance, during this last four night visit, an unidentified VIP was arriving and the hotel staff locked out the elevators of floors 8-12. We were on the 8th floor and weren't notified that our room key was to be required to take the elevator to our floor. At our inconvenience, we had to have our card keys reprogrammed to allow access to our floor. After three attempts, the front desk staff couldn't get it right and we couldn't get functional keys made for hours. We were staying in one of the premier, mountain view rooms, but were treated like second class security risks due to the unnamed VIP. Hey, if you don't want my non-famous business, say so up front. We also arrived to find the previous occupant's dirty laundry in one of the drawers...nice! On day two, a housekeeper who didn't understand our native English allowed us to enter our room without checking for an ID or a room key. My wife retrieved her iPad but she could have easily been a thief. Sorry service and poor customer service. Shameful for the JW line.
label: neutral

text:
Wonderful experience at W San Francisco again! This is one of my favorite W Hotels in the World, from the service, room conditions and the designed all utilize the space well.
Lobby - Last time when I visited the hotel it was still under renovation, now it is completely different, added more elements of local SF theme into it while it still looks very cool and modern. The SF downtown sculpture and the refreshing strawberry lemonade at the check in made my wait very enjoyable. They also added a new restaurant called Trace, which focuses on local sustainable foods.
Gym & Pool - still in very good condition after all these years. Its nice to have a nice jacuzzi pool within the hotel (and indoor) that opens late for guests. Talking about the sore legs after all day of walking!
Room - This time I received the high floor corner room (Fabulous Cool Corner) which is obviously, at the corner of the hotel facing the park. It is more quiet and have a bit more space. I love the couch area by the window, perfect to sit there enjoy my day a bit while surfing online. The room is still in very good condition with Asian (Chinese) theme in it. Wonderful Beds, Great Shower Pressure and fluffy towels. Sheets are crisp as well. The buddha lamp is cute but if you find it annoying you can actually turn off at night. TVs are full of HD channels too. I love the ipod stereo next to my bed so I can rock my favorite music in it.
Service - I had great service overall. From pre arrival arrangements, check in, house keeping and the Acura experience. I had no issues at all. Thanks so much for all the people that works there.
The only thing that I wish they can bring back is the turn down service. That will make my stay even better.
See you next time! W San Francisco!
label: positive

text: The front desk people were not so freindly first of all and gave us the impression that they did not feel like dealing with us, the decor was nice its modern and everything appeared to be in good shape, on the way to the room we entered a dirty elevator and all the doors to the rooms were dirty and smudgy looking, the halls smelled odd. Entering the room everything looked good but apon further inspection we found it quite dirty, the bathroom floor has stains & hair on it and the toilet didnt work right, the carpet in the bedroom area had a nasty red stain on it , it looked like it could have been an old vomit stain. We were very hungry & it was late so we didnt have enough energy to go out & get food, so we chanced it & ordered food to pick up downstairs. I ordered a simple grilled cheese and it tasted horrible ( how does one manage to mess up grilled cheese?) and chocolate cake..the cake was ok but tasted a little on the stale side. The next morning we went to see what they offered for breakfast and it seemed like it should have been a days inn for what they served...mini plain bagels and toast that didnt look so good...we didnt even attemt to taste anything. Overall the hotel was decent but very dirty & I was very surprised. I was very dissapointed because for $120 a night I think it should have been much much better.
label: negative

text: Заехали 13.07.2023 на сборы молодежной хоккейной команды, за размещение ответственные организаторы. Со стороны организаторов было предоставлено исчерпывающе количество информации, как и где мы хотели бы расселиться. С учетом, что у нас набралась компания более 30 человек, мы особо и не претендовали на отдельные условия, поэтому регистрацию проходили группами по 8-10 человек. Но дальше начался абсолютный "очень плохо", такого треша я не встречал нигде за 25 лет активного отдыха. Нас отправили на регистрацию в отдельный корпус, машины пришлось бросить "как есть" так как никто не смог вразумительно объяснить где можно припарковаться, спасибо maps me, нашли парковку у административного здания. Дальше хуже, заселение перенесли на час, ссылались, что номера не готовы, и ждать придется в порядке очереди, хотя группу за нами заселили почти сразу. При этом нам еще повезло, друзья прилетевшие к 6 утра все еще сидели на ресепшн, и все еще ждали заселения. Класс! Что тут еще сказать. Опустим подробности, заселили всех куда и как попало, лишь бы заехать. Ресепшн положить на комментарии организаторов, на предварительное бронирование. Дальше еще веселее, у многих карточки не открывали номера, отдельные карточки не реагировали на выезд с парковки... Вопрос, зачем делать отдельные карточки на вход, въезд и проход в столовую? Ходим обвешанные карточками и браслетами, в итоге ничего не работает)) Мы забили, на вопрос "вы кто?" отвечаем, что мы с соседнего отеля, пришли на халяву потусить и поесть, на КПП толпой ломимся по любой карте у кого сработала... ибо надоело бегать и звонить, пытаясь хоть как-то улучшить условия размещения.
label: negative

text: This is a nice place for a no fuss group lunch/dinner. A group of 7 of us went on a sunday around 7:30 and we didn't even have to wait for a table. The menu provides a few salads, a variety of burgers, and sides. It's a little pricey for what it is, but by vegas standards I would say it's decent; with most burgers ranging from $12-$14. I also like that they have fun milkshake flavors including nutella, oreos, etc and they even have spiked ones with rum, baileys, etc.\n\nI tried a few of the things my friends got like the tex mex burger, chicken wings, and sweet potato frieds. Those were just okay. I really really enjoyed what I got, but I did have to do a little customization. I ordered the black n' chicken burger, but i substituted chicken for a burger patty. I also got it without a bun to offset the damage I did at buffets. The burger was cooked medium rare like I asked and the toppings were delish. It came with provolone, horseradish cole slaw, and tobacco flavored crispy onions.
label: negative

text:
色の選択がポイント
私はいびきがすごくその改善のために横の姿勢で寝ることを試してみた。商品は圧縮されていて、中身を取り出したらしばらくすると通常の大きさに復元される。少し直径が大きいのと長さが長いような気はする。それ以上に色が問題であった。寝るときは寝室を暗くする。だから色は目で違いはわからない。しかし寝る直前の赤色を抱いているというイメージが寝入りばなに思い出され何か違和感を感じてしまい3日後には使用を止めた。人によるとは思うが、色は白がいいのではと思う。

text:
I picked a wrong day to visit the Valley of the Sun, it was May 22, and they issued excessive heat warning for the area. The temp reading was 108 degree at noon, so there went my plans for outdoor activity that day. I landed in PHX in the morning, although the check in time is 3pm, I called the hotel and let them know I have no where to go in this weather except for sitting in a restaurant or shopping mall. Ken was the person I talked to and he let me checked in at noon. Awesome!
The room was clean with your typical Radisson decor, although I am not a fan of sleep number bed, that did not bother me at all. The lobby, restaurant, hallways and rooms were nicely appointed as well.
Overall this is 3-star Radisson property in my opinion, it was the service that made it a 4-star hotel!
label: positive

I love this place. Truth be told - I love diners in general. But Hubbard is great - I've tried it for brunch, for dinner, and for pie of course.

Brunch - I'd have to say you can get better brunch other places in Madison. But they do a decent job.

Dinner - comfort food. Definitely not fancy. I like the chicken pot pie.

Pie - is to die for. Especially the peanut butter silk/french silk one. Oh my god - instant food coma.

Service - always really friendly and attentive.
Environment - feels like a diner. Not too retro, but definitely still diner with booths and stools. It also has a tendency to be cold - at least in my opinion.

text:
We've eaten at Chipotle several times before, but never at this location. And never again at this location. The entree items we got were just fine. The chips were cold, but that is far from the problem. 

The issue was the 20-something man who appeared to be the shift manager. First, he was wearing Man-dex. Yes, that's what I said. Spandex. And they were cropped to boot. Somehow, I don't think they were a uniform option. Then, as he weirdly danced around the dining area, doing what, I don't know (certainly not wiping off the filthy tables), a vision came to me of Jame Gumb. I'll give you all a minute to shudder. Then there was also the patronizing and borderline racist interactions with his largely Hispanic staff. He loudly announced to us that he had just learned the Spanish word for "turkey." Then he turned to the man making our food, said the word, and then made a turkey sound. Yes, he gobble-gobbled at the poor man. He did this again and again. It was clear that the staff was embarrassed. 

My husband and I were flabbergasted. It was hard not to stare at him in awe of his assholery. Was he high? Could be. Was he a loser who had no business being in charge of a store? Most definitely. 

Chipotle, call us when you've replaced this jerk.
label: negative

text:
Yummy! I came here with Blair B., her hubby Mike, and Eric R. for a delicious dinner! We had a $25 off $35 restaurant.com coupon and ordered 4 dishes to our delight. The other 3 had beers and are non-spicy eaters. I had Thai tea and asked for the spicy goodness on the side since we ordered all dishes a "1 of 10"

We ordered: 
Beef Massaman Curry (rich, stewy and somewhat sweet sauce, tender beef, potatoes and peanuts with steamed rice) - melt in your mouth, very flavorful
Pineapple Fried Rice with shrimp - tasty, garnished with cucumbers
Chicken Pad See Euw - with Chinese broccoli (we were offered American but turned it down) - very tasty (and good with the hot pepper powder!)
Angel Duck - duck with black mushrooms, broccoli, green onions, baby corn, zucchini

This was a smorgasbord of varied flavors and dishes....curry, rice, noodles, and duck/veggies. My faves were the curry and the noodles. I have a feeling my leftover pineapple rice will be amazing as a second-day dish. The table polished off the noodles and duck fast!

Service was mostly attentive - we had 2 alternating waiters so when I asked one for something and he didn't come, I asked the other, but he didn't come back, so we asked again...but the original waiter refilled water glasses regularly just in time (Eric R. is a thirsty guy and the glasses were small), and the food definitely came out hot and as the dishes were ready.

For vegetarians/vegans, Komol has a completely separate menu for you and it is huge. I highly recommend this place (this was my second visit and the first was just as good) and I prefer it over Lotus or Pin Kaow, and most other Thai restaurants in town have been below expectations.
label: neutral

text: I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference in June. My aunt who is a Sheraton Platinum member was travelling with me. At check in, we were upgraded to the Illinois Suite free of charge, which had two bathrooms, a bedroom and a parlour - plus, access to the Exec Club Lounge. The beds were really comfortable and we had a gorgeous view of the marina and river. Rene who works in the lounge was awesome and was definitely a highlight of our stay. He kept our glasses full and shared stories about his life in Chicago. The hotel is centrally located downtown and is within walking distance to the Mag Mile, Navy Pier and other attractions. There is a hop-on, hop-off bus stop right outside the hotel and is a great way to check out the city on a short stay.

text:
What an incredible meal I just had last night at Tuck Shop! 

After a long wait to finally try this place out, I managed to snag a table for four just a couple of days before we wanted to come by. 

For starters, the team at this resto is probably one of the friendliest, most hospitable I've found in Montreal! The service was perfect: approachable but professional.

Taking a look at the one-page menu I spotted starter items like beef tartare (a must), market salad, fresh burrata, cured salmon with homemade tzatziki, crispy pork belly, just to name a few. Reading over the mains: Rib Eye steak, Ricotta Gnocchi, Duck Magret, Arctic Char, Hanger Steak, all served with fresh, seasonal sides -- a very tough decision! 

Our group decided to start with the Beef Tartare, Cured Salmon, and Crispy Pork Belly. Boy, did we clean off the plates! The beef tartare is served with a type of celeriac slaw and matchstick fries with aioli. Incredibly delicious! The salmon was oh-so delicate, served with paper-thin crisps and veggies, and the homemade tzatziki was just right. The Pork Belly (an obvious hit at the table) was out of this world! A cube of perfectly crisped pork belly served in a creamy morel sauce -- a dish that will remain in your memory.

On to the mains. Dishes ordered around the table included a 16oz Rib Eye steak, the Duck Magret, and Arctic Char. As I couldn't decide which main to order since it all sounded incredible, I let our waitress surprise me. 

The Rib Eye was a beautiful cut, cooked to perfection (medium), and served on a creamy bed of mashed potatoes with a side of grilled Quebec Asparagus. I'm not a big meat lover but this dish was perfect! I could not say anything less about the duck that my friend ordered. It was served with a sort of fresh, citrus salad which balanced out the gaminess of the duck amazingly. Also, cooked to perfection. My first time actually trying arctic char, and definitely not the last, this dish was not lacking in taste. My surprise dish was their homemade Ricotta Gnocchi served with a very hearty vegetarian "bolognese" sauce consisting of carrots, mushrooms, etc. -- meat was not missed on this dish! The portion was spot on as gnocchi tends to be very filling. Fresh shaved parmesan was a great addition.

Of course, a meal this flawless must include dessert -- especially if said dessert is homemade by "la maman de Theo"! One of our party was celebrating a birthday. The waitress brought out an incredible platter of brownies, apple pie with vanilla ice cream, and a pot of (if I remember correctly) caramel cheesecake. We enjoyed these desserts with some dessert wine and porto. 

Honestly, this whole meal was so perfect and I'm certain that my dinner mates would agree. I cannot encourage anyone more to dine at Tuck Shop as it really is an experience -- from the service to the atmosphere to the perfect food reflective of what is in season....Go! 

I must add that I am a big fan of creative cooking with ingredients that reflect local produce and seasonal ingredients. All over each of our dishes we could spot in-season asparagus and fiddleheads (or têtes de violon as they are called in French) -- loved it! 

Please, do yourelf and someone special a favour and go eat here if you haven't been yet. And, if you have, go again since the menu changes often! 

(Note: I would say that the price range is about $$ - $$$ depending on how many dishes you order & wine. For our group of four with one bottle of wine @ 44$, four starters, four mains, dessert and digestifs, the total was about 80$/person w/ tip. I would have gladly paid more than that for the meal that I had! The dishes are well-priced as is the wine list.)
label: positive

text: OK, this movie seems to have been pretty well covered by earlier comments, but there are a couple of items I wish to add. The mad scientist is producing a serum from the blood of a caged animal in order to turn a man into a werewolf. If we suspend our disbelief enough to buy into that, fine. But the animal in the cage is a coyote. That would make a werecoyote. Did audiences in 1942 not know the difference between a wolf and a coyote? They're easy to tell apart. That's weak.Secondly, this movie was covered in the third episode of MST3k (on the Comedy Channel). It took Joel and the bots a number of episodes to get up to full riffing steam, and they weren't up there quite yet on this one. They DID add enough to this snoozer to keep you awake until the end, but it was not one of their better episodes. They never even mentioned the glaring omission of an actual wolf, and THAT joke was just hanging in the air waiting to be smacked.
label: negative

text: My 3 year old loved it. I loved it, my wife loved it. So 10 out of 10 from our family. As for violence level? Not really that violent, mostly of the slap stick variety. Nobody truly dies, no gore, no blood, no torture, so it certainly is appropriate for children, much more so than many Saturday morning cartoons.This movie really takes the idea of CG movies where it should go.First of all beautiful graphics, textures wonderfully done, with true depth, not trying to be realistic, but forming an artistic whole. The moss on the stones, the rust on metal, the reliefs on the wood and the stone, everything adds to the whole.Character modeling, unlike many contemporary CG movies, is quirky, not cute, again within an artistic whole. The faces may look less malleable than in some other movies, but the characters are more puppet-like than human-like. I think that is a good thing, it lends veracity, how strangely it may sound, it is easier to suspend your disbelief.Hair, fur, clothing, on par, at least with the likes of Pixar. Just note in the opening scenes when Lian-Chu is fighting the giant slug; Gwizdo is in front of some farmers, and all of them have detailed clothing which caused me to pause the movie just to admire it.The setting. Far beyond the likes of Cars, and even WallE. Space has been done many times, but the fantasy environs of Dragon Hunters are only comparable with some scenes in Never Ending Story and Lord of the Rings, but again it is an artistic whole, and with lots of good ideas thrown about effortlessly. Magnificent vistas like the scene in Monsters Inc. where they ride all the doorways through its storage facility, or WallE where we see the immense trash towers he made, abound in this movie, everything is grand, yet never dwelt upon; it is just the background the whole way! The interlude where they walk through the area with the fantastic falls. The Chinese wall, the islands floating in the sky. The Broccoli in the sky? That is truly where I believe CG should go, make something which takes your breath away, and do it again and again.The sound is good, the music is varied and not only epic, and thankfully without any vocals, and purely original for the movie.Animation is quite good. Lending its inspiration to cartoons, especially some good use of stretch and squeeze. Sometimes not that realistic, but the 3d models are not realistic either.Characterization is well done too. Lian-Chu the gentle and uncertain giant is gradually growing in confidence basking in the attention of little Zoé.Gwizdo the wily manager of Lian-Chu redeems himself in the end, while Zoé isn't really changed at all, but who wants that cute child to change anyway? I at least loved Lian-Chu more than any other recent character since Sulley in Monsters Inc.The internal strife in the group gets ironed out by the external pressures, just as it should in a proper fantasy story.The story is mostly reminiscent of the Never Ending Story, especially how the world brakes apart. The monsters are pretty standard fare, except the flocking one. It lacks the emotional impact of WallE, which is the really strong point of that movie, but it is a much more fun ride, and lacks the annoying musical scene replaying in the former one, and has action from the first scene. This movie is what you want to watch for a fun and exciting time.The whole movie has, as I've mentioned a whole vision, which seems to have been followed rigorously throughout.It seems, that the setting is ready for more adventures, and I for one would hope so.One side note, the French actor doing Lian-Chu sounded a bit like Jean Reno at first, but I'm happy it wasn't him, though he is one of my favorites. Nice to hear a new, to me, voice.I give it a max rating, a bit surprised at the mediocre and low ratings by some; I have tried to address some of the concerns made by two of the reviews with the lowest vote. Approach this movie as an adventure, and as a European movie, not opposed to Hollywood, but different.
label: positive

text: You don't expect much from a PRC picture, and with rare exceptions--mainly from Edgar G. Ulmer and a few by Joseph H. Lewis or Lew Landers--that's exactly what you get: not much. This "epic" about Nazis in Africa trying to incite an Arab revolt against the British isn't much different. The script, by longtime PRC hacks Arthur St. Claire and Sherman Lowe, is trite, laughable, full of unfunny "wisecracks" and plot holes the size of Outer Mongolia. The direction, by longtime PRC no-budget specialist Al Herman, is semi-comatose at best. The performances, though--except for spectacularly incompetent and irritatingly hammy lead Walter Woolf King--aren't really half bad. Veteran comedian Parkyakarkus is actually the best thing about the film. He plays a guy from Brooklyn masquerading as a razor-blade salesman and brightens up the screen considerably when he shows up. He's got great comic timing, charm to spare and seems to be having a heck of a good time. Duncan Renaldo is fairly convincing as an Arab sheik--despite his Spanish accent--and veteran bad guy George J. Lewis as Renaldo's Arab rival does his usual fine job of villainy, even if he goes a bit over the top sometimes. Joan Woodbury is quite pretty and has a nice light touch, and she and Renaldo have great chemistry together, although--like the rest of the cast--she has none at all with King. H.B. Warner, whose career stretched back to the silent era, lends a shred of dignity to the low-rent proceedings, even though he blows his lines several times and, PRC being PRC, they weren't cut out. There's a great deal of stock footage spliced in from a big-budget silent movie with a similar Arab theme--although I have no idea which one it is--and, PRC being PRC, no effort was made to try to make it inconspicuous: I've seldom seen stock footage that was so blatantly obvious."A Yank in Libya" isn't very good, of course--well, OK, it stinks--but it would be worth a look just to see Parkyakarkus in his prime. I had heard of him and knew that he was the father of actor/director Albert Brooks and Super Dave Osborne, but had never actually seen him in anything before. It was worth watching this tenth-rate PRC "extravaganza" just to see him in action. Otherwise, forget it.
label: negative

text: Sydney to Melbourne and was impressed - great cheap ticket. As I was using auto check in kiosk at the airport a professional Tigerair check in staffer approached to assist me even though I did not need help and she put me in an exit row with extra legroom and directed me to check in counter for bag drop and instantly issued a new boarding pass. Well groomed warm professional supervisor pulled me out of line as he was free and line was busy with a family and he took me to another counter to quickly check my bags and complete check in - everyone called me by name very friendly. On Flight cabin crew were all well groomed, great uniforms - men in vests and long sleeve, women with scarves and wedding worthy hairdos - great for a low cost carrier - friendly smiles and very professional looking us in the eye and calling us by name. Flight on time - boarding was completed early. Actually liked the cloth seats - most seats are leather on low cost carriers. Liked A320 over 737 - it feels more spacious. Liked how they use front and back stairs for boarding/de-planing as it is much faster than the long slow que on other airlines which only use one door. Simple menu - but perfect for a low cost airline - you can pre order bigger meals too. Low cost terminal at Melbourne is brand new - simple and slick - very efficient - what more can you want for the price. Airline has massively improved since problems a few years ago.
label: positive

text: There are some movies that are loved by almost everyone who you come across and yet happen to be box-office failures. Andaz Apna Apna, an intelligent and hilarious comedy falls in that catogory. For once, an Indian director has kept in mind the sensibilities of the audience, and not churned out a Kader Khan type stereo-typical hoax. The movie is about two guys who dream of riches, and try to accomplish that by wooing a millionaire's daughter. A humorous drama unfolds while a lot of complexities surface in the story. The complexities add to the sheer comedy of the entire plot. Aamir Khan plays the a street-smart guy, while Salman Khan gives an unexpectedly good performance as the dumb guy. The villian played by Paresh Rawal,and his henchmen, Junior Ajit and "Kaliaa" make you laugh in your sleep. Although the movie borrows from a lot of other movies, despite shoddy camerawork, and despite being "loud" at times, it remains one of the scarce "funny" movies Bombay has come up with after movies like Padosan, Golmal and other Amol Plaekar movies. It is sad that it didn't do well at the box-office, for that means producers turn back to formulas and creativity is abandoned.
label: positive

text: Ordered an iPhone 8 plus new contract using the online option to be delivered to my chosen store. Soon after I received an email to confirm. Received 'phone call to confirm the order and checks to ensure I was happy with everything etc and that an offer was available of an extra 5 gb of data, which I accepted. 15 minutes later another 'phone call stating that a mistake had been made and I would not get the extra. Then I receive an email saying my order had been cancelled because I hadn't collected within the time scale. So I had to ring back to sort out. The next morning I get an email from the courier indicating that the delivery was coming to me, not the store, the expected time and even the drivers name. Only by checking the tracking number which shows where the vehicle is in relation to me did I realise that my order was on the way to the store. On collection I was only required to give my name and within minutes I had a new phone. No identification was asked for, which surprised me. The phone by the way is brilliant, much faster than my previous one with fantastic features and looks. Does everything as expected. Very pleased with it. Have used CPW before without any problems and recommend, and yes I would use them again.
label: positive

text:
There are a great many LAX options, and all serve one purpose: convenience for those late-night/early-morning flights.
This hotel is no different really. It is convenient, and it will not impress you particularly with anything else.
1. The room will be small-but-serviceable.
2. The toilet paper holder may come off the wall just like any cheap hotel.
3. The sheets, pillow and duvet will be nice.
4. The tepid breakfast buffet will be $16.
5. The "updated" decor will not impress you, though it will be clean.
6. The shuttle bus will take you to another hotel before it takes you to yours in the middle of the night when you're exhausted after flying 6 hours.
7. If you open your window, you'll be able to hear the nice lady at Budget Rental Car talking over the loudspeaker at all hours.
8. You will get free internet.
9. You won't be able to park for free.
10. You can walk to Budget or Avis quite easily.
11. You collect SPG points.
So weighing all that:
If a clean, convenient room is ALL you want, pay less for a comparable LAX hotel. One, perhaps, that has a dedicated shuttle, directly to and from the hotel to LAX, and free breakfast.
BUT MY SUGGESTION is to spend the extra 20-40 bucks and get a nicer hotel. There are many of them right there. Hell, you're there for ONE exhausted night. Get a great rest in a comfortable room, with a service staff that gives attention to details.
label: neutral

text:
I stayed at the Hyatt for a week in April 06, and I have to say it was a mostly negative experience.

The good:
1) Location. You are above a mall/underground walkways that can take you to the conference center, and many other locations. You can easily walk to old Montreal. There's a grocery store and food court in the mall that's right downstairs (well, two elevators away!)

2) Water pressure. You can't see yourself in the dark washroom, but the hot water has lots of pressure.

3) Soaps (when you get them) are not bad quality - not the best, but certainly usable.

The bad:
1) Housekeeping. They don't refill empty shampoo, conditioner, etc etc. I am staying here a week, and went a couple days without roomservice, and only took down the "do not disturb" sign when I needed refills, as I'm in and out of the room for a conference. So I'm completely out of shampoo and the bottles are left empty in an obvious place - and they don't refill anything. I had to call for refills. They also don't replace toilet rolls, or the tea/coffee in your room. As I'm paying $200 per night, bit annoyed not having tea/coffee in the morning... I phoned and an hour later someone arrived with some items.

Also, the fitted sheet issue others mention here -- so true. I cannot believe that they use a flat sheet on the beds. Woken up every morning on a bare mattress - ew.

Other things were tidied up at least.

2) Room Service. Costly room service menu, limited hours. I guess I'm used to the Hilton that's open really late (the only reason I order room service is when I need to eat odd hours due to conventions!). But the price - huge price tag on the food, and then they tack on $3 service fee and taxes on top.

Also, service was LATE both times -- they said they would bring my food at a certain time and were late by at least 10 minutes each time. (Not bad, but when you're on a schedule for meetings, it can throw things off.)

ALSO - they advertise "freshly squeezed orange juice" on the menu (at $5), which is worse than Tropicana. It's seriously generic-brand concentrate grade. Stay away, or set your expectations low.

Other than that, the people who brought the food were friendly.

3) Elevators. They were out of service at times, which meant long waits. Oddly laid out too - a separate elevator takes you up from street level to the lobby. A different elevator takes you up to the rooms. A third elevator takes you down to the mall.

More inconvienent is that the stairs seem to be for emergencies only. I am on the first floor above the lobby - so I've had to take the elevator just to go down a single floor (before getting on a second eleavator to go anywhere else). Very annoying.

4) Bathrooms - The lighting. Not bad if you're there for a night - but a whole week it gets on your nerves. One small light over the mirror. Oddly placed so it's awkward to put your make-up on (awkward in that you get shadows all over your face and cannot see.) That's a minor inconvienience. It's the fact that it's completely dark everywhere else in the bathroom. I guess this helps hide any grime anywhere else...

5) No full-length mirror, no safe, (and naturally, no fridge). No mirror is annoying on a business trip for sure. Attending a professional workshop and conference, you want to make sure you look presentable - but it's pretty difficult as there are no full legnth mirrors anywhere to be found (in the room or halls, etc). A safe is a big one for me though - for business I have all kinds of gadgets with me I want to lock up when not in the room all day. Every other hotel I've been in over the past few years has had in-room safes - not here.

First time I've felt the need to search out a review site to vent. I can't see returning here ever (looks like some nice smaller hotels in old montreal - think I'd consider something like that next time), and don't think I'd go to another Hyatt without some research beforehand.
label: negative

text:
Laut Homepage des Hotels soll man vom Holiday Inn New York City-Midtown-57th St eine einmalige Aussicht auf den legendären Central Park haben.....Ich frage mich wie das gehen soll? Ich habe zwar ein Zimmer im 9. Stock / von 18 gehabt, aber selbst von oben dem Dach aus sieht man den Park nicht sondern nur kleinere Hotels vor einem bzw, höhere vor einem. Also wegen der Aussicht bzw. wegen der Lage brauch man dieses Hotel nicht aufzusuchen.
Genau genommen brauch man dieses Hotel gar nicht zu besuchen. Es ist nicht wirklich schlecht, es hat alles was man braucht nur leider kein Flair, keine Atmosphäre, kein Wohlfühlfaktor. Es hat große (wirklich große) saubere Zimmer, mit Schreibtisch und 1 Stuhl , einem altem TV, wo wenn man nicht aufpasst schneller einen Film gekauft hat, als man lesen kann, 1 Sessel und einem guten Bett. Das Badezimmer ist etwas seltsam. Badewanne und WC sind in einem schummrigen Räumchen, davor quasi im Flur befindet sich das Waschbecken mit einer winzigen Ablage und eingebautem Fön und dem Becken gegenüber ist ein Einbauschrank der mit einem Spiegel verkleidet ist.
Also putzt man sich die Zähne oder der Mann rasiert sich nach dem Duschen, steht man im Zimmer auf dem normalen Teppich und blockiert den Weg ins Bad und an den Schrank kommt man auch nicht, so eng ist dieses Flürchen..... Ich brauche auch nicht zu beschreiben wie der Teppich an dieser Stelle aussah.... Im allgemeinen ist das Hotel in die Jahre gekommen, abgenutzt ...teilweise schon schäbig (Tapete löste sich von der Wand, teilweise eingerissen, verrostete Armaturen und was das schlimmste war Schimmel.
Der Schimmel saß leider auch in den Lamellen der Klimaanlage und war permanent zu riechen. Sowas darf selbst in einem 2 Sterne Haus nicht passieren. (siehe Bilder)
Da nützt es auch nichts, dass eine Kaffeebereiter, ein Bügelbrett und ein Bügeleisen vorhanden waren.
Zur Freundlichkeit des Personals schreibe ich nicht mehr viel, das wurde ja zu genüge getan. Die Rezeption erledigt ihre Arbeit, nicht mehr und nicht weniger. Die Kofferboys usw. sind hilfsbereit und nett, schließlich leben sie von dem Trinkgeld, was natürlich mager ausfallen würde, wenn sie nicht nett wären :-) Das Kofferaufbewahren kostet pro Koffer, wenn man um 12 das Zimmer verlassen muss und der Flug erst abends geht. Essen und Trinken ist in der Lobby beim Warten nicht erlaubt...da sie ihr teures Zeug von der Hotelbar verkaufen möchten.
Das Hotel verfügt über 597 Gästezimmer also gehen wir mal von 600 Gästen aus was wenig wäre.... Der Pool mit seinen ca. 35 Liegen auf dem Dach bietet leider nicht genügend Platz, insbesondere sind die Liegen "vorreserviert". Ich wollte nach einer anstrengenden Shoppingtour bei 29 Grad schnell eine Runde im Pool drehen und mich in der Sonne trocknen... doch die 3 freien Liegen waren RESERVIERT!!! Ich durfte mich in den Schatten auf die Mauer setzen! Und es kam und kam keiner für die freien Liegen...unmöglich. Ok, wär brauch schon einen Pool in NY....es wäre halt nett gewesen zur Abkühlung....der Pool schließt auch um 18 Uhr und am Abreisetag darf man sich dort auch nicht mehr aufhalten um die Zeit zu überbrücken.
Zur Lage, relativ am Ende der 57. Straße ist ein Stück zu laufen bis zur Subway. Keine besondere Aussicht, nichts besonderes in der Nähe, unspektakulär.
Solltet Ihr das Hotel billig buchen können, schlagt ruhig zu. Wie gesagt es ist sauber und große Zimmer mit guten Betten. Mehr als 100 Euro am Tag für 2 Personen sollten aber nicht ausgegeben werden.
label: negative

text:
This particular location helped me out of a potential issue related to closing on my Madison home; the teller, Shaun, was as professional, helpful, and friendly as they come - he's definitely an asset to Summit.

Gritty details:
36 hours before I was due to close on my Madison home, the title company called me to "remind" me that I needed to have a cashier's check at closing to cover the downpayment and closing costs. That was the first I had heard of needing a cashier's check... when I bought my house in AR, I just wrote a check and things were good.

Apparently this title company doesn't accept personal checks, which put me in a bind, because my primary bank account is still with a bank in Arkansas. There was absolutely no way I could get a cashier's check from them in less than 36 hours. Eeek!

I have a savings account, a Visa credit card, and an auto loan with this Summit location, so I visited them to ask for ideas/help. They suggested using my debit card (from AR) to do a cash advance into my Summit savings account, at which point they could generate a cashier's check for me.

I called my AR bank and asked them to raise the daily debit limit; they did it immediately. Summit then ran the cash advance, and presto-changeo, things were golden. Total cost? zero-point-zero! So cool.

I've had nothing but great experiences here, and today continued that streak. I was truly stressed, because I stood to lose my earnest money deposit if the closing would've failed. Shaun and Summit saved the day for me. Thanks!
label: positive

text: C'est une super salle de spectacle qui peut sembler un peu difficile \u00e0 trouver vu son emplacement mais qui est facilement accessible par m\u00e9tro ou m\u00eame en voiture. Quand j'y suis all\u00e9e, pour un \u00e9v\u00e9nement mis en place par Ignite Montr\u00e9al, la salle \u00e9tait plac\u00e9e de mani\u00e8re \u00e0 y avoir quelques tables et chaises vers l'avant et beaucoup de place \u00e0 l'arri\u00e8re et sur les c\u00f4t\u00e9s pour se tenir debout. Pour les petites personnes comme moi, le fait que l'arri\u00e8re soit \u00e9lev\u00e9 d'un pied environ me permettait de bien voir la sc\u00e8ne m\u00eame si je me tiens normalement sur le bout des orteils pour voir quoi que \u00e7a soit.\n\nLe service au bar \u00e9tait tr\u00e8s rapide et tr\u00e8s bien. Si ma m\u00e9moire est bonne, il y avait des bi\u00e8res \u00e0 4$ et 5$ avec une petite vari\u00e9t\u00e9 qui saura plaire \u00e0 plusieurs. \u00c7a ne rivalise pas du tout avec les autres bars de la ville, mais pour une salle de spectacle comme Il Motore, une s\u00e9lection simple et \u00e0 bon prix est appr\u00e9ci\u00e9e.
