text: I've always wanted to visit this hotel since its opening but never managed to and last night we went to celebrate our anniversary at Thirty8 restaurant, located on the 38th floor, overlooking the twin Towers. We were placed in a booth and I like the intimacy of a booth but it was so dark. Could hardly read the menu....what a pity! There were many birthdays being celebrated as well so it was a joyous place. We started with a Beetroot salad, arugula, goat cheese, pecan nut, balsamic dressing (RM47). It came with very few leaves of arugula and a little bit of goat cheese and big pieces of beetroot and hardly any dressing....very disappointing. I can make better salad presentation and better tasty dish than that one. My husband had Hot and sour seafood soup (RM35), he said it was OK. Then I ordered Tasmanian salmon trout, fennel, lemon, cedar wood (RM105). The salmon was really very tasty, and moist but hardly any fennel and really nothing else, on a piece of cedar wood!!! (another disappointment). My husband ordered Tiger prawns, lemon, garlic butter (RM99) and again, hardly any butter and it certainly did not taste garlic butter and very dry and pretty tasteless. We ordered some Roasted pumpkin, reggiano parmesan (RM30) and again no taste and dry. When the head waiter asked us about the food we told them the truth, how disappointing it was. He was kind and offered us desserts but we declined or coffee/tea and we also declined. We did not come for freebies. We wanted to have a nice meal to celebrate a special event and ended up extremely disappointed. We ordered a bottle of Australian red wine and it was fine. The total bill came to RM462 and I can honestly say I have eaten far better meals for very much less. It is very expensive but the food is not worth it.I would not recommend this restaurant nor would I want to go back.
label: negative

text:
My travel agent asked me to go for this Triton Hotel because the neighbouring Marriott hotels were found full 2 days before the start of my business trip and I settled for it accordingly, as it was only for one night "transit" stay.
The hotel location is convenient and the staff friendly, the common areas and the rooms are slightly worn out but acceptable.
The main problem is that the rooms are equipped with "window-type" air-conditioning units which are noisy when operating, and gives no fresh air. [N.B.: Travellers who read this review may trust my judgement as I have been belonging to the property discipline for many years.]
After switching on the units at night for 2 hours, the room becomes nothing but noisy and stuffy, lacking oxygen. To open the windows for fresh air means 2 other problems: firstly, my room (and may be half of the rooms in such hotel) faces the side lane where the refuse rooms of the hotel and other adjoining buildings are located and can catch such "unforgettable" smell; secondly, the service vehicles and refuse-collection vehicles in US operate at nights, with their dumping and travelling noises throughout the night-time.
So, the result is: "shallow-sleeping people" like me cannot sleep.
Fortunately, it was only for one night stay, and I presume I would not be returning again unless they install some centralized ventilation system with treated air.
One point worth mentioning: the hotel's web-page didn't show any "window-type" air-conditioning units in any of their rooms' interior photos, and "experienced people" like me would return to the website and find from the exterior night-view photo some ideas of the "window-type" air-conditioning units along the dim facades. I wished I had noticed those "window-type" air-conditioning units before I agreed to my travel agent's former offer.
label: negative

text: Watching this odd little adventure movie, it's hard to believe that it was directed by the same man who brought us such high quality Giallo classics as The Strange Vice of Mrs Wardh and The Case of the Scorpion's Tail, but it has to be said that despite it's low quality production values, Island of the Fish Men is an entertaining ride and one that surely deserves more praise than it's getting. Like many Italian films from the seventies, this is one is a rip off of a successful American film, the one in question this time being the critically panned Island of Dr Moreau. Sergio Martino's film takes ideas such as mutation, greed and adventure and moulds it into one slightly compelling film, which makes up for what it's lacks in coherency and logic with a load of mostly intriguing ideas. The central plot follows a boat which crashes on a small island. It quickly becomes apparent that not everything about this place is normal, and it soon transpires that half of the population has been turned into "fish men" - a cross between a man and a fish, which exist for purely selfish reasons...The truth about this movie is that it's a lot more fun if you ignore the trashy production values. The central monsters look completely ridiculous, and much of the movie takes place on sets that look like they cost someone a few pennies - but the movie is well shot in spite of this, with the underwater photography being a particular highlight and the pacing of the movie is well done in that the film never becomes boring. The way that the plot comes together isn't exactly genius, but it takes in a lot of ideas and I've seen films made on plots with much less thought put into them than this one. The biggest location standout in the film is definitely the lost city of Atlantis. To be honest, I'm not a massive fan of adventure movies, and therefore don't see this lost city get mentioned much - but it is always nice to see it in a movie. The central island location is good in that it provides an apt setting for the story and also provides the movie with the right amount of mystery, as Martino makes good use of the voodoo theme. Overall, this isn't exactly a classic and there are certainly a lot worse trashy adventure movies out there than this one.
label: positive

text: This hotel was convenient, nice breakfast for a quickie, reasonable cost and close to the hospital where my mom was staying. I was in NYC for family medical reasons and the hospital had a listing of several hotels in the area. I called every one of them and finally picked this hotel. I got a price quote for the five nights and it was faxed pretty quickly. I arrived on a Friday and before I went to my room, I asked Ela at the desk how much it would cost to upgrade the room to two beds. I was told $20 dollars. I said fine when my Dad comes to NYC he can share a room rather than getting his own. By Sunday I asked Preya for the room upgrade and the price went up to $60 more. I said that is not I was quoted and thought to wait the next night. Monday I asked the nice guy Henry or Harry and he gave me the upgrade for $20. Tuesday went to the hospital for the day and came back with my dad. Went to the room and it was locked out. Came back to the desk and Preya said I didn't sign out in time and they were holding my bags. I asked for the manager and she said she was the manager. She said the price is $60 more. I told her I was quoted twice by two others and the extra cost is $20. She said since I am signing in without reservations the price went up. I told her she increased the price two days before and I had reservations. She eventually got me the real manager and he was not helpful either. I paid the difference since I had no where to go with an 82 year old parent standing in a hallway waiting to get our belongings. Ela and Henry or Harry whatever his name was, was nice and polite. I will never forget the rude and uncaring manager(s) and I will contact the hospital to let them know about the inconsistencies within their own group. I understand prices change every day but to change and flip flop on charges every other day with the same person is rather suspicious.
label: negative

text: Случайно зашёл. Увидел внешний аккумулятор. Буржуи, портящие наш язык ангицизмами, придумали для него буржуйское корявое название, «пауэр-банк». Цена 567 руб. В 2 раза дешевле, чем везде. Гарантия 2 недели. У меня уже был такой. Старый. Покупал в ДэНэЭсе. Примерно 10 лет назад. Вышел из строя. Покупал за 1 тысячу. Тогда гарантия была 1 год. Сейчас везде во всех местах тоже 2 недели. Цена самого дешёвого 900 руб. Купил, рискуя. Боялся, вдруг сломается. Тьфу-тьфу. Пока работает. Доволен. Перед Новым Годом покупал светодиодные лампочки. Вначале за 50 руб. Нигде такой цены нет. Везде дороже. Через неделю подорожали — 55 руб. Так каждую неделю у них дорожали и дотянули до 70 руб. Всё равно дешевле. Качество хорошее, хотя боялся, что обманули. Купил у них аж 10 штук. Обошлось гораздо дешевле, чем везде. Персонал как и везде. Нормальный. Расположение неудобное. Я старый. Для меня далеко от остановки. Молодёжи пойдёт. Они или на авто подъезжают, или пешком. Ничего. Пусть пройдутся. Кассы работают относительно быстро. У меня в этом плане никаких замечаний нет. Не знаю, как у других покупателей.

text: While movie titles contains the word 'Mother', the first thing that comes to our mind will be a mother's love for her children.However, The Mother tells a different story.The Mother do not discuss the love between a mother and her child, or how she sacrifice herself for the benefit of her child. Here, Notting Hill director Roger Michell tells us how a mother's love for a man about half of her age hurts the people around her.Before Daniel Craig takes on the role of James Bond, here, he plays Darren, a man who is helping to renovate the house of the son of the mother, and sleeping with her daughter as well. Anne Reid, who was a familiar face on TV series, takes up the challenging role of the leading character, May.The story begins with May coping with the sudden loss of her husband, Toots, in a family visit to her son, Bobby. While she befriends Darren, a handyman who is doing some renovation in Bobby's house, she was shocked to found out that her daughter, Paula, was sleeping with Darren. At the same time, May was coping with life after the death of Toots. Fearing that Harry and Paula do not wanted her, May starts to find her life going off track, until she spends her afternoon with Darren.Darren was nice and friendly to May, and May soon finds some affection on Darren. Instead of treating him like a friend, she treated the man who was about half her age with love of a couple. Later, May found sexual pleasure from Darren, where he gave her the pleasure she could never find on anyone else. And this is the beginning of the disaster that could lead to the break down of a family.The Mother explores the inner world of a widow who wanted to try something she never had in her life, and solace on someone who is there for her to shoulder on. This can be told from May buying tea time snacks for Darren to fulfilling sexual needs from a man younger than her, where it eventually gave her more than she bargained for.Anne Reid has made a breakthrough for her role of May, as she was previously best well known for her various role on TV series. As she do not have much movies in her career resume, The Mother has put her on the critic's attention. Daniel Craig, on the other hand, had took on a similar role in his movie career, such as Sylvia (2003) and Enduring Love (2004). If his reprising role of James Bond fails, film reviewers should not forget that he has a better performance in small productions in his years of movie career, and The Mother is one of them.The Mother may not be everyone's favorite, but it is definitely not your usual matinée show to go along with tea and scones, accompanied by butter and jam.
label: positive

text:
作为Spring入门将是一个不错的选择
适合Spring初学者和项目经验不是很丰富的从业人员阅读，可以对Spring框架有一个快速了解并可以立即上手实践，关于Spring的各个技术特点都有涉及，但大都是点到即止，没有就实际开发中可能碰到的各种实际问题做较深入的阐述和指引，以实战为名的技术书籍应该能够帮助开发者尽可能规避一些技术陷阱，在这点上本书做的不是太好。但作为一本入门书籍，而且在国内对国外经典技术书籍的中文译本翻译质量都不是太好的大环境下，该书还是值得初学者购买和通读的，但作为提高和进阶，本书能起到的作用还是有限。

text: comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality. Instead, it challenges it and the viewer to think strongly about what the word "normal" means. It also gives you the insight to personally think about what the ending means, I can say that I loved how it turned out and I'm happy for Mithi.

text:
Stayed at the W for two nights during our weeklong trip to San Francisco. We were given a high floor as requested which was very nice. It was a pain to have to swipe our key cards every time we got on the elevator though.
The lobby/check-in/bar area is weird and funky, dark with loud music thumping from the bar. I am 43 and too old for this place I think. We visited The Living Room bar for drinks, which were outrageous. We have the same bar at the Dallas W, and are used to high drink prices, but still thought the prices over the top (i.e. $15 for a cocktail, $12 for a Jack&Coke). Unlike the bar at the Dallas W, this one was not packed, even though our stay was over the weekend.
The room was fine, with a nice shower and Bliss amenities as well as a nice sized single sink. The layout was a little weird but I kind of liked it. I thought the bed was comfortable but hubby could swear he felt feathers or something sticking out making it "bumpy." I woke up the first night with my nose burning and eyes streaming tears so I do think there is down or something in the bedding (I took a Benadryl the second night). I wore earplugs both nights but I don't believe noise was a factor.
The pool and hot tub were a joke. The pool was full of little kids and the acoustics were terrible so every scream was ear-piercing. We got in the hot tub and turned on the jets but nothing happened so we were left just sitting in a tub of hot water with splashing kids. There wasn't much seating around the pool. At the very least the hot tub should be adults-only. The pool and hot tub was a factor in choosing the W for our stay so this was disappointing. We didn't use the fitness area but it looked to be nice.
We got massages at Bliss spa and they were great, perfect for the end of our long trip. My therapist, Dennis, was great. The women and men have separate lounges, which contain tea, water, cheese and delicious brownie bites. However, the lounge area is brightly lit and a little noisy, not relaxing. Again, the hotel having a spa onsite was a factor since we chose this hotel for the end of our trip.
We had breakfast at Trace and service was very good and I had the Chilaquiles which were delicious and hubby had the french toast, with a side of sausage and juice, the bill was around $52.
The surrounding area was a bit dead. We had to walk several blocks on a Saturday afternoon to find a restaurant open or anything to do. We had spent the first part of the trip in the financial district and liked that area better.
Overall, it was just an OK stay, not a hotel I would come back to if I visit San Francisco again.
label: negative

text:
Affligeant
Scénario totalement décousu, histoire tellement simpliste que c'est à se demander si l'auteur nous prend pour des idiots finis (ah oui, quelles révélations, que le Judaïsme, le Christianisme et l'Islam ont un point commun, que les premiers viennent d'Afrique, que Colomb n'a pas découvert les Amériques, quelle érudition ! Tout ça dans de prétendues chroniques qui pourraient bouleverser le monde ! Psychologie des personnages vraiment limitée. Référence au moins une dizaine de fois à Dan Brown au cas où on aurait pas compris que ca se veut de la même veine. Et une vraie agence de voyage Google Map du Quebec et de la pub pour les voitures. Et en plus limite raciste. il faut qu'on m'explique comment reconnaître un Juif rien qu'à sa tête sans jamais avoir rencontré le personnage avant !
label: negative

Für diesen Preis hätte ich mehr Qualität erwartet.

text:
Gute Anlage, grottenschlechte LS-Kabel
Hier wird eine wirklich ordentliche Anlage geliefert. Schnell aufgebaut kann man schon Musik hören. FM Sender hören wir fast gar nicht mehr, sondern freuen uns auf 26 Digitale Sender die wir mit der mitgelieferten Wurfantenne bekommen. Gut funktioniert auch Bluetooth. Es ist richtig klasse, seine Musik vom Smartphone oder Tablet über diese Anlage zu hören. Aber ein Witz bzw. schon eine Frechheit sind die Lautsprecherkabel. Diese sind ca. 80 cm lang und sehen aus wie Klingeldraht. Was hat denn da die technische Abteilung bei Panasonic geraucht. Mit so einem Mist macht man den wirklich guten Gesamteindruck kaputt. Fazit: Gute Anlage zum vernünftigen Preis. Aber die LS Kabel sind für die Tonne. Die entsprechenden Kabel also gleich mitbestellen und man erspart sich eine große Enttäuschung
label: positive

We are exceedingly angry about the fact that many thousand passengers loose their money and some thousand well working employess lose their job. Many many thanks and good luck for the crew and all the other employees of AB/Niki.

text:
Lovely looking Hotel with very good rooms and facilities. There is plenty to do on site as the gym, pool and steam rooms are all available to guests. We have no complaints about the facilities at this historic Hotel. We are working class people and the booking was a treat to ourselves and we did feel a little out of place. Some of the staff were less than polite to us and asking questions was a problem to a couple of them on a couple of occasions. I guess we didn't fit the bill of the kind of customer they expect. Having said that, Bar, Restaurant and Coffee Bar staff were without criticism. They were fine polite and helpful at all times.
The area around the Hotel is not safe after dark and at weekends it dies as all the surrounding offices are empty. We went out to look around on our first day and found two blocks from the Hotel to be intimidating and this is just off of the Jewelery District, so an easy mistake to make. We were here for 4 days only and will not be returning. If you are going to LA for the first time, then look at Santa Monica, Anaheim and Pasadena as alternative places to stay. They are tourist friendly and near to all you will need to do whilst in LA. Avoid the Downtown at all costs. Not only for your safety, but just for strolling out at night to find things to do.
label: positive

label: positive

text: If you don't want to wait nearly an hour for your luggage, pack light and carry on, because you will be at baggage claim LONG before your luggage arrives there. Compared to LAX, O'Hare and even Miami (which is terrible), LAS has to be filled with the rudest, most self-centered people. You literally could be limping on a sprained ankle, carrying a purse and carry on bag and between you and your husband, have another 3 suitcases to maneuver, and still you should not expect anyone to be courteous enough to move for you. What you can expect is to walk 100 miles to baggage claim, wait for 30 minutes or more for the 1st piece of luggage (which will not be yours) to drop onto the carousel, fight mean stares and rude people to get out to the Taxi line, just to round the corner and see you will be getting a taxi just about in time to catch your flight home, in three days.\n\nHere's a tip: Either schedule a car service to meet you at the airport (yes, it will cost you $65 and YES, it is worth not having to wait in a taxi line) or look for a dude in a suit, pushing a luggage cart around, who you can tip $1 per bag and he will help you cut in line to get a taxi. Do not, in an circumstance, rent a car in this \"traffic from you-know-where\" city. I lived outside of Philly for two years and cannot imagine driving in this place.
label: negative

text: We were at the Venetian for brunch and my friends, who are fans of the show (I have never seen it), wanted to stop by and check it out. I had been warned before that the line to order is always long. We waited in line for about 30 minutes or so. The staff was very friendly and everything looked amazing. I did think the prices were high though. However, I thought I would get some things to try (see if they were worth the price). I ordered an eclair ($2.50 and it was very small), 2 peanut butter cookies ($1.95 each) and an individual red velvet cake ($9.95 which is way overpriced for one small cake). In my opinion I don't think they were worth the money. With those prices I expected it to be absolutely amazing. They weren't bad, I've just had better else where at half the cost. If you don't mind waiting in the line and want to check it out do so. I just don't think I'll be back again.
label: negative

text: We went here to see the Sox lose. The seats are well-shaded and comfortable but the stadium was like a ghost town...they were probably at 30% of capacity. As a result, about half the vendors were closed. This stadium does do neat things like letting the kids run the bases before the games and allow senior citizens to \"stroll\" the bases afterwards. Parking was easy in, easy out, probably because there were so few people there. Views were GREAT and I was able to get some great shots from right behind home plate.

text:
Not a problem for me, but...
...the broom is just a tad too wide for the scoop. Easily remedied by simply cutting of some of the outer bristles. Otherwise, I especially like the ability to set the angle which makes it really nice for sweeping steep, narrow stairs that you have to sweep from a step other than the one you're sweeping. I don't find it to be particularly "cheap", as the other reviewers who apparently likes it but only gave it two stars? I only knocked off a star because the width might annoy someone who is prone to complain. It's not an overbuilt $60, professional cleaner's r commercial, theater set - it's for less heavy use, obviously, and it's cheap but it's worth every penny of the price, to me.
label: positive

text: We went here primarily due to the fact that the bar we wanted to go to was closed for remodeling through mid december (Fat Tuesday). We took two trips into here within a few hours of each other with two somewhat different experiences. The first was at 3 for the happy hour drink specials which was as advertised except the fact that we had a VERY un-attentive waiter which resulted in delayed drinks each time we got his attention. The second time we asked to be seated outdoors which was half full yet appeared to have adequate service staff. WRONG! We were there for 17 minutes with only a menu and a glass of water which was delivered promptly by the hostess when seated. When we left as we were walking down back onto the strip the hostess stated \"you weren't helped yet?\" which sounds like is fairly typical and my answer was no and she apologized. The appetizer of catfish nuggets were pretty good for bar food as was the artichoke dip that was great. Food however takes people to request it from and to deliver so get your stuff together and this would be a good bar right on the strip.
label: negative

text:
I've known Dr. Lykins socially for several years. When my allergist told me I needed to see a ENT and that surgery was probably inevitable, I broke my rule of not seeing friends for care or services. 

He was extremely thorough and went through my CT scans with me to show me what was going on. He also described in detail what the surgery would entail and what I could expect in regards to recovery. 

They were able to schedule my surgery relatively quickly which was a relief because I had to be on antibiotics until I could get this procedure done. 

Surgery was yesterday and as far as I can tell, it went great. My pain levels are surprisingly low (about what they were pre-surgery which is exactly what Dr. Lykins said). 

It's too soon to tell how successful this will be in addressing the chronic issues I've been having but all in all, the experience was great. I would highly recommend Dr. Lykins and his staff.
label: neutral

text: Cheap and cheerful. What is all the fuss about? Well, read to the end of this review :)Lamb shank curry, chicken curry, and Chai tea were all fine, as was the nan bread, but they didn't change my life, just cheap Indian food. This place is popular, so be prepared to queue, which I think is out of proportion to the food. Also, they have a sign indicating they are short staffed with apologies - you have to write down your own order and get your own cutlery - not sure if they are really short staffed, or if this is their business model? I would be happy to pay more and see more people employed. However, making it all worth it......the Banana-cheese!!! Banana fritters covered in cheese were amazing (see pic)! Who knew the combination would taste so good?!!Go for the banana-cheese, it is worth it, other than that, just cheap/basic Indian food.
label: neutral

text:
DOUBLE CHARGED...and was lied to by management.
I booked this hotel "On-line" for my wife and myself Friday, Aug. 12, 2005 for one night. The hotel is nothing better than 1-1/2 stars. We reserved a non-smoking room through their official site, but received a room that had ash trays. Do ash trays equal non-smoking? The room had a odd smell, but we did not complain to front desk...as it was only one night. The neighborhood is not a place to take your kids, nor yourself. There are not any restaurants, grocery stores, within walking distance. We had pizza delivered to our room from Dominoes. During the night there were many loud noises and people yelling once in a while.
NO PARKING...We ordered in because we didn't want to lose our parking spot. There are only about 20 parking spots for the 3 floors of motel rooms. People started parking in the two handicap spots as the side streets were full. The area just did not feel safe.
We booked this hotel a few weeks in advance to go to the Dodgers and Mets game on Saturday Aug. 13, 2005 then planned to drive back to our residence in central California after the game...HOWEVER...
THREE WEEKS LATER...I received my credit card bill and was charged $82.02 for Aug. 12, 2005...AND then another $82.02 for August 14, 2005. We had only booked for one night and only stayed for one night.
...I called the hotel to get reimbursed for the extra 82.02. The first time I called, I spoke with the night worker (Rafael, I think)...he looked up the paperwork and told me that I called to add a day to my stay. I explained to him that I reserved for one night and it was on-line only. He proceeded to tell me that I was wrong. I even have the receipt from the one night with ONLY Friday checked off (beyond the fact that I never called). Anyway, he told me to call back the next day to speak to the manager.
I spoke to the manager (Adrianna) and I received the same exact response. She even said I spoke to her about extending the stay (I never made any calls to the hotel or Super 8). I got really frustrated at this point. She said she would have to talk to the owners about the situation. What is the point of a manager if they can't take care of simple errors like this one.
...I have also called the main Super 8 phone number and all they said they can do at this point is submit a complaint which goes to the same hotel (not much sense in that is there?...even when I explained the hotel has not cooperated). Super 8 billing said that I would have to wait at least 7 days before they could butt into the situation (that I may add was not my fault or error, but instead the hotels).
I am going to call the hotel back today to see what the owners will say about the situation. I will update my review when the 82.02 is credited back to my account.
...If they cannot cooperate and solve a simple problem like this, I will submit my complaint to the District Attorney and copy it to the Better Business Bureau and get it solved myself. Who knows how many other people they have tried to DOUBLE CHARGE.
Next time I will stay at La Quinta or Baymont Inn. I am done with Super 8 after I get my 82.02 back in my wallet.
Respectfully,
David
label: negative

text:
Our family arrived at 9pm and were immediately welcomed enthusiastically by the bellhop (Eddie). He showed us to the front desk where check-in was quick and easy. Eddie brought our luggage to our room and we realized the room was a bit small with a crib and all of our luggage- but that is to be expected in a downtown hotel! However, within minutes we received a phone call that the front desk had found a larger room for our family for our stay. The staff went out of their way, without being asked, to accomodate our family- that is the kind of service you won't find in other hotel chains!!
The room we stayed in was quite large and had a nice view of the inner harbor. Some parts of the room/hotel are older, but everything is clean and well kept. The A/C was weaker- maybe 73 degrees when the thermostat said 65, but nothing to complain about.
The breakfast buffet was good- they have different menu items each day- from omlette's to french toast, and seem to always have a make-your-own waffle station available. The pastries and bread were fresh.
The location of the hotel is good- I didn't see anything to be concerned about in regards to safety-there are several hotels within a block of the area so there are many tourists walking around. It is about a 5 minute walk to the inner harbor.
Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel because of the excellent service from the hotel staff.
label: positive

Considering that there are other restaurants in the area that also offer happy hour deals, we probably won't be back here anytime soon.

text:
賞味期限が6ヶ月でした
Amazon's choiceだったし、タイムセールで安くなった瞬間に注文しました 翌日すぐに届きました よく見ると賞味期限があと6ヶ月でした！ 安い理由はこれだったのかと思います 容器はガラスでではなくPETボトルです 品質劣化を気にする方はガラス製で賞味期限が長い商品をオススメします これがきっかけで調べてみるといろいろわかりました 輸入元の企業のHPでは、賞味期限24ヶ月をうたっていますし、他のショップでも賞味期限まで残り240日以上という記載があってAmazonよりも安い価格設定になっています だから決してお得な買い物ではなかった可能性があります 他のオンラインショップのセール品では賞味期限が短い商品が半額で販売されています すぐ消費される場合はこちらのほうがお得かも知れません 味や香りは良いと思いますので

text: Wasn't aware that Ipoh is famous for their Salted Chicken until I did a search online.This shop is apparently the longest standing shop in Ipoh that sells the best salted chicken in town and is a must buy for every person who visited Ipoh.It's as traditional as you can get. Basically, it's whole chicken baked in rock salt for hours so you get that salty taste on the meat without losing the essence. On top of that, you get the benefit of the smoked scent.You have the option of either getting a fresh packed, ready to be eaten in 2 days or a frozen one, for you to keep for no more than 6 months.To say the least, the salted chickens were decent.It's definitely a great item to buy as souvenir for relatives.

text: Great atmosphere, delicious food, friendly service, and affordable pricing all contributed to my 5 star rating of Spotted Donkey Cantina. I have been here with friends multiple times for dinner and happy hour and we keep going back. \n\nTo date, my favorite dish is the marinated chicken fajitas but I have yet to scratch the surface of this vastly creative menu. Modern adaptations of classic Mexican fare make this place stand out from other Mexican restaurants. Donkey Dusted Agave Chicken Wings served with Jalapeno Ranch dipping sauce, Dos Equis battered Fish Tostadas, and the Arizona Mac & Cheese made with rigatoni, fresh hatch green chiles, applewood bacon and Mexican cheeses are only a handful of the many eclectic menu choices at this casual-classy hot spot.
label: positive

text:
We had business in Houston, and wanted to catch the Astros at Minute Maid Park. This upscale Embassy Suites was perfect. Could walk easily and safely to Minute Maid. It's about 4 blocks, Through Discovery Green, an energetic city park with cafes, water fountains and playgrounds.
Four Seasons across street, as is House of Blues, The Grove. Many walking food options.
One odd thing, which would have been awkward if we had third person staying in living room sofa bed whom we didn't know well. The bathroom door was a modern sliding door, heavy door, but there was a two inch gap,at bottom and side ( it hung down from overhead slide.) So you didnt have complete privacy in bathroom. And door to bedroom from living room was frosted glass, so you saw light through door when closed.

text: The Yard House at Town Square is packed like sardines! I have always liked Yard House because they have an entire Gardein section (fake meat dishes) on their menu that I just go nuts for. I started hyperventilating the first time I went to Yard House. I always end up ordering the Spicy Chicken Gardein Sandwich, which runs me about $12-$13. For some weird reason the Spicy Chicken Sandwich is not on the menu but it is online. Regardless, the waiters know exactly what I'm talking about when I place my order. The portions are always overwhelming, which takes me to my happy place. \n\nThe menu and beer section at Yard House is ridiculously huge. I think that's why Yard House is so popular - it's great for groups! The vibe at Yard House is great. People are buzzing and if you don't mind talking loud, you'll be fine. The dim lighting makes everyone prettier too lol. The prices sneak up on you though. It's one of those restaurants where you get the bill and you wonder how it got so high. Sneak attack!!
label: neutral

text: This was the first time I have stayed at a Hilton hotel. It was great. I found no issues at all with the A/C. Sisco and Primo the shuttle driver was great. My 8 year old son lovef it there. The pools were clean not cloudy. The overall service was great. I left our dirty clothes in room and did not realize it until I got back to Houston. I called and was told by housekeeping, that I would have to wait 24hrs before I would know if clothes were found in room. I called back the next day and got the general manager Alex. He called housekeeping and my clothes and my Childs.clothes was in their possession. Alex asked how I wanted clothes sent and was very helpful. He was great and I didn't have to wait 24 hours to get confirmation that they had found clothes. I would definitely stay here again.
label: positive

text:

The rooms were comfortable and we didn't notice too much noise from the street or bus lot nearby. Taxis were plentiful and it beat paying to park a rental car. (pretty much anywhere you go is a $10 cab ride)
I would recommend this hotel for location and comfort, but it was nothing too special.

text:
Just returned from our second stay at the Hotel Monaco over the last few years. Our first visit was impressive - great staff, sparkling room and exquisite service. This time the visit was a little more humbling. While the staff remains very friendly, there seemed to be gaps in communication between the front desk and housekeeping, valets, etc. In addition, our suite was showing distinct signs of wear. The furniture was a little stained and tattered, and the trim was looking a little worn. For most places, this would be expected, but our expectations for the Monaco our always very high.
The Monaco continues to offer their complimentary evening wine and cheese hour (now featuring tarot card reading and neck/shoulder massages). The little extras do make the Monaco unique, but those expecting a well-equipped fitness facility will be disappointed with the cramped, almost dangerous, workout area.
The location is great, the staff is wonderful, the rooms are small. If you can accept these conditions, the Monaco is for you. While we are very fond of the Monaco, we will probably look elsewhere next time we visit San Francisco. For the price, the rooms need to reflect the taste and charm that made the Monaco unique. During our most recent visit, the charm was missing.
label: positive

text: Avec Shakespeare, Dostoievski est l'autre grande influence occidentale d'Akira Kurosawa pour ce qui est de l'écriture. Et une fois de plus Kurosawa transcende l'oeuvre de départ en l'adaptant, respectant l'esprit d'origine tout en lui insufflant une vision nouvelle connotée par le destin du Japon au sortir de la guerre, qui fait état de ses nombreuses victimes physiques et psychologiques. «L'Idiot» est le récit de la prise de conscience d'un homme de la valeur de la vie, après avoir frôlé de très près la mort. Cet homme miraculé devient alors la bonté même, inévitable victime de la cruauté des autres dans une sorte d'apathie qui lui vaut le mépris de ceux qui l'entourent, ne voyant en lui qu'un simple "idiot", à l'exception d'une jeune fille innocente qui l'aime secrètement et d'une femme meurtrie qui trouve en lui la compassion et la compréhension qu'elle n'a jamais pu recevoir par ailleurs. Bouleversant les personnages et leurs rapports avec son arrivée dans leur vie, « l'idiot » sera bien sûr celui qui en subira les conséquences, comme si la bonté pure était insupportable pour les hommes. D'une mise en scène magistrale, «L'Idiot» est un drame déchirant et intense, porté par des acteurs d'exception au sommet de leur art : Masayuki Mori, Setsuka Hara et Toshirô Mifune. Un chef-d'oeuvre. [4/4] <url>
label: positive

text:
Hotel Molto bello,la reception ben curata e molto elegante..sembrebbe di recente costruzione ma in realtà non lo è,è tenuto molto bene.Le camere sono complete di tutto.Molto carino l'arredamento con al posto della testata del letto un enorme cuscino,il lampadario zebrato.In camera il condizionatore faceva un gran rumore,e nonostante lo spengevo c'era il canale dell'aria installato nel cavedio dell'albergo che faceva ancora più rumore.
Al decimo piano,c'è una visuale bellissima di New York..si vede l'empire,il Crysler e il Gramcery..Ci sono due pc con Internet Gratis,in quanto in Wi-Fi costa US$10 al giorno,e il personale dell'albergo ci ho sconsigliato di comprare il Wi-Fi.Il servizio dell'albergo e cordialissimo.Sono rimasto colpito da un ragazzo dell'albergo, Thomas,simpaticissimo,disponibilissimo e di originale italiana,simpatizza la lingua italiana!!!La posizione è abbastanza centrale,è vicino a tutto,piccolo supermercato (Wallgreens) dove potete trovare di tutto per fare colazione,spuntini,panini,sigarette,gelati,acqua..Tutto!!La fermata della metro è sulla 23°(L'albergo è alla 24°).Inoltre proprio sotto l'albergo c'è un ristorante(Inoteca) “convenzionato” con l'albergo che se uno vuole si può far portare la cena in camera(non ve lo sconsiglio,i prezzi sono molto alti).All'inoteca si mangia cibo italiano,un po caro ma la pasta che abbiamo mangiato era buonissima.Sulla traversa,3rd Avenue potete trovare diversi ristoranti,pub e discopub per uscire la sera..Inoltre ci sono diverse tavole calde tipiche americane dove potete fare colazione all'americana!!Insomma Hotel consigliato, peccato che, per errore o ci hanno provato, mi hanno scalato circa 950 euro dalla carta,540 addebito reale dalla carta, altri cinque movimenti che non avevano nessun legame a me, abbediti strani di euro 50,poi 90,poi due da 132 euro, nonostante non avessi consumato nulla. State attenti, alla consegna della carta mi avevano detto che non mi avrebbero scalato nemmeno un dollaro, invece..Mi hanno reso, per fortuna prima della fine del mese così non sono andati a pagarli nell'estratto conto di Agosto, prima circa 520 euro, poi altri 20 euro il 17/09/2012. Ho contattato l'albergo per avere spiegazioni sui vari addebiti/congelamenti(che mi hanno fatto bloccare la carta e il conto!!!),ma ad oggi non mi hanno dato risposta,se non lo storno sulla carta.
L'albergo ha dimostrato di avere grossi problemi di gestione ed affidabilita', non mi era mai successa una cosa del genere, tra l'altro non hanno mai voluto spiegare l'accaduto, ne' di questo addebito ne' degli altri che poi non sono stati confermati..rimarrò con il dubbio. A mio parere ci avevano provato,ma mi sono accorto in tempo dell'addebito..Un'altra persona,tipo il mio babbo o il mio fratello non se ne sarebbero accorti. Mi raccomando, se andate al Marcel state attenti!!!
Avrei diverse foto belle dell'albergo,ma dopo quello che mi hanno combinato non ho nessuna voglia di fargli pubblicità!!!
Ciao a tutti!!
label: negative

text:
This specialty wine and cheese shop is everything it should be. I have never been when the owners weren't working, and they know their craft! You can walk in and browse the wine selection (they have everything from $13 bottles on up the ladder) or you can come in saying I'd like to find something to go with "this" meal, or what kind of cheeses best compliment a Hefeweizen and they will know. And I mean they KNOW, it's not guessing, it is a wealth of knowledge and a love of the craft of small family run cheesemongers and an amazing taste for wines to pair (they also offer beer to if you're not in the wine mood). The best part, you tell them your price range for the wine and they will meet it.

The cheese isn't cheap. They come from family farms, and the owners know all there is to know about how each cheese was made. It is well worth it to buy 75% less than you would in the grocery store because you get 500% more flavor out of each bite! When requesting cheeses for pairing (or just to munch on) the owners ask what you're wanting and give you tastes of everything then they modify what they offer you based on your tastes.

The amazing cheeses paired with a bottle of wine and some good bread makes an evening of staying in watching a movie feel like a relaxed deluxe catered event.
label: positive

text: I booked a flight in the summer of 2022. They modified my 3-day flight 3 times to the point in which I was not even going to stay there for a full 24 hours. I wanted a refund, and they asked for my American bank's swift code to process such refund. I hung up to call my bank and retrieve it. I then called the airline back, and they said they could no longer refund me and they had sent a voucher for both me and my daughter. I was upset, but called again in September to book the flight and use the voucher for new year. The man I spoke to, booked my 5-day flight for us both, round trip and said I even had a $200 balance, since January is cheaper than the summer. I just checked and there is no scheduled flight and no credit or voucher. I spoke to another agent who said on his end, he can see the credit I have but it only covers the flight to Cancun, not the flight back, and I had a $100 balance, and that in order to fly back, I would have to pay an additional $300! I had already paid $600 back in the summer just for the flight. I have the original email with my round flight status and $200 extra balance, yet they can't find it, so unless I fork in more money, I can't fly back.
label: negative

7泊の最後１泊だけ泊まりました。
帰路の飛行機が11時だったためその３時間前には空港着するため
近くて安いホテルを検索。
行くまでは空港周辺というのはどこでもゴチャゴチャしているので大したことないと思っていました。
ところが、行ってみると空港のすぐそば。
最終の泊まりなので荷物は沢山、大人２人と３歳、６ヶ月の子と４人の荷物はスーツケース４個とスポーツバック１個。さらにその日の買い物袋。何回往復かと覚悟していましたが、ホテルマンが運んでくれました。「ありがとう」子供連れだと結構大変なんですよ。
チップを余分に渡しても助かったあ。
駐車場もすぐ裏で満車にはならない。私はアラモレンタカーだったので返却場所も近かったです。
さて肝心な部屋ですが、泊まった部屋は３２階だったかな
冷蔵庫は付いていませんでしたが、氷が近かったので良かった。
ベッドが、空気圧で調整出来るマット付きで最高でした。
もっとゆっくり泊まりたかったです。
　すべてが良かったです。でも日本語は通じません。現地人ばかりでした。
label: positive

text: I've stayed at Club Quarters in reveal cities including London and always found them to be very hospitable and the added features of having a small kitchen added to their value. However in Philly the hotel is located on Chestnut which is very busy and noisy. Thus we were regularly awakened by sirens, Cinco di Mayo celebrations ( at 3am), a fight ( two groups of Sixers fans) and garbage trucks. It might have been that an upper floor ( we were on six) or double pane windows would have mitigated the noise but alas neither was our fate. If you come get a room on ten and plan to be there when there is no celebration.
label: neutral

text:
The exterior of the building might be unappealing but once you step in it's whimsical and cheerful. This is a Family Owned Sinaloan Style Seafood Restaurant that is open every day for lunch and dinner.

Right away they gave us house made chips , the daily made green guacamole style salsa and the spicier red salsa. They are delicious and differ from other salsas I've tried elsewhere and I only tried a few and then they presented Mini Complementary Tostada Ceviches and gosh they were excellent and were better in taste (not quality of fish) than some I've tried at high end dinning destinations paying maybe the same as my whole meal here and these were FREE here. 

I always enjoy the fish veracruzana with vegetables but this time tried the fish with poblano peppers , onions and tomatoes. Both these dishes I can tell you are as tasty as can be. The fish filet is mild and fresh with a feather light batter that is not oily being the lightest batter I have ever seen on a delicate fresh fish. For me what makes these dishes so great is the delicious well made light sauces they are in. Also included are very soft fresh tasting tortillas and on the platter was salad , refried beans and a white rice with mixed vegetables that is yummy from the sauce of your dish. All this food I got was only $13.00 It was not good but very good.

While we were dining I noticed most people were ordering what looked like a steaming large cauldron of mixed grilled meats and fish , I found out this dish is called Malcajete and it looked great to try.

They offer many variations of fish , steamed , grilled , battered, and breaded with a variety of sauces. Very little in the way of chicken or beef but they do have some.

It's a small family run business so when they get busy sometimes they go down a bit I noticed on a visit after I wrote this Yelp.

3.5-5 stars
label: neutral

text: Deseret is a nice little thrift store from our Mormon neighbors. The clothing reflects this. Nice clean good boy button shirts at good prices. I did notice a crap load of white church shirts here still wrapped in plastic & black slacks that looked perfect for a bike ride with a backpack full of bibles. As for the women's clothing, my girl only found 1 blouse she was interested in.. The furniture is mostly wooden & oak, yeck. The furniture is in decent shape yet is probably the only thing that is overpriced in the store. As for housewares appliances & such, those are the most reasonably priced items compared to Epic and Savers. There was a used Dyson for 10$. I found a little treasure trove of vintage Fostoria glasses in amber and smoked colors. Don't go buying them now. They will be MINE!! The employees are very friendly and helpful. Years ago I found a vinyl record that had Bettie Page lioness with cheetah cub on the cover. I like this thrift store!
label: negative

text:
We stayed three nights at the Hotel Chandler in March and had a great experience! We booked through Redtag and got a really good price. If you have the time and energy, it might be to your advantage to shop around because regular nightly rates are quite pricey in NYC.
CONSTRUCTION was taking place in the hotel lobby at the time, but it didn't affect our stay in any way. We never heard a thing when we were in our room. Upon completion (this summer I believe) they will offer a 70-seat restaurant and approximately 600 square feet of meeting space. That being said, during our entire stay, they compensated each guest with complimentary morning breakfasts and Wine & Cheese events from 5-7PM located in a suite on the second floor.
THE LOCATION was great (31st St and 5th Ave). Walking distance to the Empire State Building, Penn Station, Madison Square Park, Flatiron District, Grand Central, Times Square, etc... What's also wonderful is that even though you are near everything, it's a very quiet neighbourhood.
OUR SUPERIOR DOUBLE DOUBLE ROOM was very clean and looked exactly like the picture on their website. It wasn't very spacious (225 square feet) but for NYC, it’s a fair size. We had all that we needed: really comfortable beds, a flat screen TV, free Internet access, an iron and ironing board, an electronic safe and a mini-bar. If you have an iPod, you will really like their iPod docking station and radio. The view from our window was of the fire escape, which wasn’t very appealing, but our friends in another suite had a nicer view. NOTE: There are no coffee machines in the room, but we would just walk a few minutes and get our coffee at a nearby Starbucks.
OUR WASHROOM was clean. We really did appreciate the comfortable bathrobes and the Aveda products. The only thing that we didn't enjoy as much was the rainfall showerhead because if you wished to take a shower without being completely soaked from head to toe, it was close to impossible. TIP: If you absolutely need a bathtub, please contact Reception because not all suites have them. Ours didn't have one, but we didn't mind.
THE STAFF was fantastic! We felt at home the minute we stepped in. The staff was very courteous, friendly and attentive to our needs. When I thought that I had left a valuable item in the room (after check-out), a nice gentleman searched the entire room with me, to no avail, but it gave me peace of mind to know that I hadn't left anything behind before heading back home. The item in question was later found at another location.
PARKING was available for $40 per day. We didn't have any in-out parking privileges; they took our car at check-in and gave it back at check-out. Definitely not cheap but parking is a luxury in NYC. Anyhow, who really wants to drive in New York? If you can't walk to your destination, it's cheaper and less stressful to take the subway or a taxi.
We would definitely come back and would recommend Hotel Chandler for its location and wonderful staff.
label: positive

Our seats were just by the entrance to the plane and next to a galley.
The standard of service was exceptional. Nothing was too much bother and the food was wonderful and plentiful.
My only criticism was that my husband was served his special meal ( he is diabetic) first and I was served last of that sides service. Surely it would not be too much to serve a meal to the accompanying passenger at the same time.

text: 독특한 분위기보다 맛에 주목할 식당. 도산공원 인근에 먹을만한 곳을 찾아 돌아다니다 발견하였다. 독특한 외관이 눈에 띄는 곳. Oriental Cuisine이라고 되어있길래, 다양한 아시아 음식을 맛보길 기대하며 들어가 보았다. 내부는 좋게 말하면 왕가위 감독의 영화에 나올법한 분위기. 어두운 조도에 빨간 소파. 미국에 있는 중식당 느낌도 있고, 힙스터들이 좋아할 것 같은 분위기다. 음악도 시끌벅적한 힙합이다. 중국 어딘가에 있는 정육점 같은 느낌도 있다. 사실 식사를 편하게 할 분위기는 아니다. 식사를 하기보단 한 번쯤 경험해볼 분위기. 메뉴를 보니 중국 여러 지역의 음식이 있다. 아시아 여러 국가의 음식을 다루지는 않는 모양이다. 사천식 돼지고기튀김, 소고기 타면, XO 볶음밥을 먹었다. 사천식 돼지고기튀김은 적당히 매우 싹하고, 고추, 땅콩과 함께 먹었을 때 느껴지는 고소함과 매운맛의 조화가 좋다. 겉은 바삭하고, 속은 부드럽게 잘 튀겨졌다.소고기 타면은 육수를 잘 우려내 적당히 진해 육수의 풍미가 인상적이다. XO 볶음밥은 XO 장을 적당히 사용하여, 볶음밥의 고슬고슬한 식감과 XO 장의 은근한 풍미를 느끼기 좋다. 여러 메뉴를 맛보고 싶은 곳.
label: positive

text:
My husband, handicapped brother, and myself stayed here for six nights a few weeks ago. This hotel worked very nice for us, since we used public transportation everywhere we went while on vacation. Front desk staff were always very helpful directing us to the correct bus stop. One right across the street, and the other one we used was about a block away. With these two stops, the bus took us to where ever we wanted to go including the Giants stadium, and to the subway to see an A's game in Oakland. Breakfast was at a little cafe next door, there were muffins, and coffee or juice. If you'd like more than that, there is a Safeway that the bus took us to, and we stored our
purchases in the in-room refrigerator (a nice surprise). Our room was cleaned each day of our stay, and everything was always in order when we returned after a day of sightseeing. All in all, this hotel/motel was very good for the price, and we would stay again if going to SF. Good restaurents, and a laundramat within a block of hotel also.
label: positive

text: I dined last week with friends looking forward to what is marketed as 'KL's best fine dining restaurant'. Early for our reservation we made our way to the bar to have a drink while waiting. It took 5 mins for our drinks to come even though there were only 6 people in the bar including the two of us. Anyway, a slight delay I can forgive. When seated in the restaurant I have to say I was very impressed with both the interior and the menu. The food is what I would expect from such an expensive establishment. The attention however was not. I ordered first, speaking quite clearly but more importantly slowly so that everything was taken down. Was disappointed to find that two of my side orders did not accompany my steak and other side order. I had to ask twice for them to be brought to me. By that stage I had more or less finished my meal and was bitterly disappointed (even though the food was very good), that it had been brought out in drips and drabs. Still an impressive restaurant and would definitely recommend people visiting to try. It is a little overpriced though and given the lack of attention my order received I wouldn't really be in a rush back.
label: neutral

text:
My first buffet experience in over eight years, and I loved every moment of it. All kinds of meats, including baked salmon, and a sushi bar were available for those who like to get their money's worth. Me? I tried it all, but I especially liked the Thai dishes, fried cod, and the creamy mac n' cheese. 

This place also has an extensive dessert and gelato bar. My personal faves were the cream puffs and creme brulee.

And of course...what really warrants a 5-star rating...all-you-can-drink bar with beers, red and white wines, and cider! The lady serving the alcohol was even kind enough to card me at the ripe old age of 25. 

If you have a car while in Vegas, make the trip out to try this buffet at the M resort. Completely worth your time and your money!
label: positive

text: Personally I think it is overrated. Over the years I always go another nyonya restaurant which makes me fall in love in nyonya food. Ayam ponteh which is my favourite nyonya food is not well presented by them. The gravy is not smooth and not fragrant enough. Don't wan to comment kangkung because the flavour is not what they usually cook. The cendol cost rm5 per bowl. It's really a small bowl. Only telur cincaluk is accepted. There are better nyonya food out there, if you don't stay long at Melaka, probably could skip this.

text:
If you are looking for a genuine cowboy to teach you a thing or two on the dance floor this may be your best option within city limits. There is no flash or flair about this joint, but it delivers a good ole' country time.

It's been awhile since I have been to a place that charges a cover and has drinks in test tubes, but it all evened out with dollar beers before 10. Right when you walk in you notice the eclectic crowd, and I was for sure that this was going to be the night that I finally realized a lifelong dream to witness a dance off, but no such luck. 
 
Daisy Train, the live band consisting of a guy, girl duo was very engaging and played a good mix of "couple" songs and "dance in a group" music. Don't be scared of the dance floor when the 2 steppin' songs come on though, just make eye contact with one of the many cowboys huddled around the perimeter of the dance floor. I chose an older gentleman who knew something about boundaries, but you can have your choice of younger or older, taller or shorter. Just make sure to watch their style and level of attachment before you commit because you could be stuck with a cowboy that moves more like a chihuahua in heat. Didn't happen to me, but it's real and consider yourself warned!. 

Daisy Train does about 3 sets and while they take a break to wet their whistle, the DJ comes on and plays a mix of hip hop and group dancing favorites like the electric slide. My one complaint is that they had more than one disc that seemed to be skipping and didn't have good recovery time. 

Besides that though, there is plenty of space so come with a group, be prepared to dance with a couple of cowboys if you are so inclined to master the 2 step, and wear boots not heels. Overall, it t was a memorable night with a great group of ladies and one lucky guy. Thank you for the invite and insider info on how to spot a genuine cowboy, Ms. Dottsy! Learn something new everyday.
label: negative

text: Extremly comfortable, excellent food and drink. Plenty of films to choose from. blankets and pillow supplied. also head set fro watching films or listening to music
label: positive

text:
Note: This review is for the pizza (and mac and cheese!), since I'm not a (beef) burger eater.

I came here in April with several friends before seeing a musical at the Byham. None of us had been here before, but we came here based on the convenience and the good reviews. I ordered the sweet Georgia Brown pizza, which has BBQ chicken, pineapple, red onion, and cheddar cheese. It had an interesting sweet-savory flavor profile, and a nice crispy texture. It was pretty good, as pizzas go, and definitely an interesting departure from typical pizza fare. I recommend it.

One of my friends ordered the shipwrecked burger, and found it delicious, if a bit over-the-top fatty. Another of my friends ordered the macaroni and cheese, per the waitress's recommendation, so I had to try it, as the resident mac and cheese connoisseur. I wasn't expecting to be impressed, but the sauce, which was on the milder side, was surprisingly creamy and well-seasoned, and complemented the tenderness of the shell pasta nicely (score: 9.0). If you go there, try it--this has to be the dark horse of mac and cheeses in PGH!

The atmosphere of this place is dark and kind of cave-like, with weird decor. Like another reviewer, between the place's logo, the decor, and the waitress's "uniform," I felt that it came off as trying a bit too hard to be hipster. It definitely has character--though I don't know if it's quite the right type. Service was fine--no problems there. Overall, an interesting place worth trying if you happen to be downtown.
label: neutral

text: I had always wanted to try Fogo and I saw that they were on the list for AZ Restaurant Week so I made a reservation for 3 and never looked back. I arrived first and the rest of our party was running late so I was offered a seat at the bar and looked over the menu while my friends joined me. I was asked by staff passing a few times if I needed anything and was eventually brought out a basket of fresh bread while I waited. Once we were seated, our server gave us the run down and we made our way to the salad bar. It was sizable, but not as huge as I expected. Knowing what was ahead of me, I just sampled a few things, all of which were very fresh. I was more than ready to start with the meats. Lots and lots of meats everywhere you looked. My favorites were the parmesan crusted pork and garlic beef. The servers were very kind, offering numerous times to go back for a different cut or cook of meat if we wanted. The sides were also good, loved the mashed potatoes and crispy polenta. I do wish they had bigger containers of the sides as they were quickly gone. I had a caipirinha in the spirit of things, which was a great drink. We ended the meal with dessert, the cheesecake was rich and delicious. \n\nIt is definitely a special occasion type of place, but I would absolutely recommend it to others and will keep it on my short list for when I win the lotto :)
label: neutral

text:
This has definitely become one of my favorite spots for an evening of wine! 

I've been here a few times and have loved it ever since the first day. There are so many great things about this place. I love the atmosphere and the way the place is set up. When you walk in you can grab a table or sit by the cozy little fireplace that they have. I love their outdoor patio. It's big and they have two fire pits outside to sit by. Another plus is they also have live music there every night I believe. 

As far as the food and drinks. I love me some Pinot Noir so I always order the Ramsay which is delicious. For food I've tried a majority of their bruschetta which is really good and have also had their Italian flatbread. They also have a happy hour everyday from 3-6 which I haven't been able to take advantage of yet. Their staff is also really great. Everyone is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and they really take care of you. 

All in all, it's such a great place to hang out with some friends for some amazing wine or also the perfect date spot. Take your ladies here fellas! They won't be disappointed. =P
label: positive

text: C’est la confusion des sentiments pour Woody Allen, d’amour hésitant entre le feu d’une diva, la sécurité d’une mère ou la jeunesse d’une étudiante déjà éprise. C’est aussi le quotidien sous les sunlights, acteurs qu’on ménage, fans qu’on veut contenter, producteurs sûrs d’eux mais malgré tout pleins de doutes, smala familiale envahissante. C’est encore la culture juive omniprésente, et puis la paternité naissante : il y a sans doute en Marie-Christine Barreau et les deux bambins qu’elle trimbale le foyer que le cinéaste construit alors avec Diane Keaton. Et puis enfin, il y a le roi proclamé des arts, vénéré grand cinéma, jamais très loin derrière l’histoire du film. Noir et blanc évocateur, cadrages toujours inspirés, prouesses du montage et direction d’acteurs, tout se combine pour donner lieu à quelques scènes franchement splendides, comme celle montrant les questionnements silencieux devant son miroir d’une divine Charlotte Rampling. Plus encore qu’ailleurs dans sa filmographie, l’impression est forte d’assister à une psychanalyse de ce frêle newyorkais qui aura redéfini l’intellectualisme moderne. Le scénario est égocentré comme rarement, à tel point que les différents personnages paraissent tous comme diverses extensions de l’auteur. Mais il y a là aussi une incroyable maestria, qui rappelle qu’après tout ils sont rares les artistes détachés du nombril.
label: positive

text:
We stayed at the Hyatt for three nights for a weekend girls volleyball tournament.
The hotel looked very nice at the first sight, but the stay was not so pleasant for several reasons. The main one is that the rooms
are very noisy in that I could hear people talk and even snore in the next door room. Whenever someone talked in the hallway walking to their rooms, it sounded like they were standing right next to the door. In other words, the rooms are not well insulated from the outside noises. No noise came from the street, however, so windows are good. In the three days I did not have a single good night sleep.
Amother annoyance is that the Internet access was not free - $10 for 24 hours. This is crazy! It is free in a $40/night La Quinta. A bottle of water
in the room is $6.00, parking - $21 a night, breakfast - too expensive at about $20 with coffee. I did not feel like we were welcome there. Very disapointing.
The staff was very nice, but somewhat inexperienced, almost too young. For example, on the first say they did not clean the room because it had taken too long to do the rest of the floor.
label: negative

text:
I originally came in because I bought a Groupon for this place a month ago and the lady working there wouldn't take it because she said it was for another Tropical Smoothie in Gilbert. There's not another Tropical Smoothie and I let her know. When she still refused to acknowledge my Groupon I asked to speak to a manager and she rolled her eyes and said she was the manager and she was not going to take my Groupon at all. I called Groupon and they had said there was a misprint on the Groupon and that I did go to the correct store. However I was too pissed to go back. 

Came back a month later with my guard up. I didn't need it, because that horrible woman wasn't there and apparently it was happy hour! The guy behind the counter convinced me to save my Groupon because my order was cheaper on happy hour. He was just all around friendly and helpful. It made me glad I gave this place a second chance!

Now about the actual food - it's not exactly paleo friendly. Everything is pre-processed including the smoothies which are just a bunch of powder and juices mixed together. The sandwiches are nice but not amazing. If your looking for something sweet and refreshing I would try the cranberry truffle and if you like pesto then you can't go wrong with the Chicken Pest flatbread sandwich.

Will I come back? Yes - only to use up the rest of my Groupons and only for Happy Hour. The food isn't good enough for full price.
label: negative

text: From the moment Christopher Lee puts on a pair of punk sunglasses and tries to sneak into a punk rock club, you know you've got a stinker on your hands! This film had potential. Beneath all of the sludge there are the remnants of what could have been crafted into a decent film, if not an interesting one. The final product is a real mess, however. Aside from the gratuitous nudity and some very attractive women, Howling II winds up being a laughable excuse for a horror film. Christopher Lee gives it a nugget of credibility, but even he cannot raise it above the level of crap.Having never seen any of the other films in this series, this critic will be forced to accept on face value that this is a genuine continuation of the events in part one. We start off at a funeral for one of the characters from the original, and within the first ten minutes we find ourselves in Transylvania with a small group of heroes ready to battle a coven of werewolves. The film is paced fairly well, and there are not too many dead spots. The action is there; it just isn't filmed well. One bright spot is the music of a punk band called Babel. Though their song is played quite often, it is rather catchy.The problems with this film are great in number. First off, the acting is worse than pitiful. Christopher Lee is good enough, but that's where it ends. The two leads Reb Brown and Annie McEnroe are lacking in just about everything you'd want for such characters. The writing is wretched, the editing redundant, and the direction amateurish. There are a couple nice special effect gimmicks, but the cheesy ones far out weigh them in number. Sybil Danning is nice to look at, but her acting performance is less than satisfactory. Judd Omen looks the part he plays, but his voice and acting are unconvincing to say the least. Much of the dialog is in an unintelligible language that may or may not be Latin.I liked the general idea for the story. I always enjoy stories of true believers out to battle seemingly invincible forces of evil. One scene where a small group of good guys are trekking through a dark forest and shooting down a bunch of werewolves is even kind of exciting. Kind of. Maybe a bigger budget or a better director could have made the rest of the film a bit more compelling. 3 of 10 stars.The Hound.Side note: As of this writing, the censors at youtube.com have still not taken down the ending credits with Sybil Danning ripping off her top several times while the Babel song is playing! Catch it while you can!
label: negative

text:
１回目注文したものと２回目注文したものの厚みが違う
最初に注文した２０ガロンは厚みが十分にあり、自立するくらい丈夫なものでした。 土を入れてもがっしりしていてキュウリもトマトも元気に育っています。 追加で同じものを注文したら、高さが２センチほど足りず、厚みも前回のものより薄いぺらぺらのものが届きました。２０ガロンなので流石にこれでは破けてしまうだろうと思い、返品させていただきました。 小さいサイズは薄くても大丈夫ですが、高さ３０センチ以上のサイズは厚みがないと土の重みですぐに破けてしまいそうで使えません。同じ商品をリピートしたかったのですが残念。。。 しっかりした厚みのものは高さの部分が倒れてこないでしっかりと自立します。そこが厚みの目安です。

text:
We chose this hotel largely because of the proximity to Minute Maid Park, and because it was very good value. I was not expecting anything much from it, it is a long time since we have stayed in an Embassy Suites, but I was really pleasantly surprised. The hotel lobby was as fancy as any upmarket hotel, and the room itself was impressive. The decor was modern and the furnishings were obviously new. There was a large living area, and a larger bedroom. We were on a high floor and had a great view.
We were to see the Astros and it was a really easy walk through a park. There was a festival of sorts on while we were there, and the place was buzzing with groups of children and parents all enjoying their day.
Breakfast was just okay for me, but I have no complaints.
I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites and I can't wait to go back to Houston. We had a one night taster, and I want more!
label: positive

text: A very engaging documentary about Scottish artist Andy Goldsworthy, whose work consists mostly of ephemeral sculptures made from elements from nature. His work is made of rocks, leaves, grass, ice, etc., that gets blown away when the tide arrives at the beach or the wind blows at the field. Thus, most of Goldsworthy's works don't really last, except as photos or films of what they were. Now, one can argue that Goldsworthy's works are a reflection of mortality, or words to that effect, but isn't it easier to say that what he does is just beautiful art. And at a time when the stereotype about artists is that they are mostly bitter, pretentious, often mentally unstable people who live in decrepit urban settings, Goldsworthy seems to be the opposite: a stable, unpretentious, family oriented person who loves nature and lives in a small village in Scotland (of course, I'm sure those are the same reasons why he's shunned by some people on the art world who found his works fluffy or superficial).
label: positive

text: The story: Young-goon is a girl whose family has a history of mental illness. She ends up in a mental institution after she starts believing that she is in fact a cyborg. In the institution she meets Park Il-sun, a young man who develops a bond with her.If you're reading this you probably already know how talented Chan-wook Park is. But 'I'm A Cyborg...' is a big departure from familiar, and (sadly) stronger territory. I'm a big fan of any film or story which is attempting to do something different. God knows, we all get subjected to enough crap at our local cinemas. The main point about the movie I need to say is, that it fails to say anything about mental illness, or create a characters that you care about.This story has to be one of the weirdest things I've seen in years...but weird isn't enough. There's no heart to the movie...just surrealism and confusion. Confusion does seem to be the main theme of the movie. The characters all try to make sense of their own problems, but it's Chan-wook Park himself who proves to be the most confused of them all.
label: negative

text: This was just telecast here in the U.S. Others have commented on the faithfulness (or lack of same) to the novel; the 1983 BBC version is far superior on this and all other counts. Given the scope of the novel, it should not have been condensed to 85 minutes. Key sections have to be rushed or alluded to, or omitted; there barely enough time just to get in the chronology of events, so character development has to be sacrificed: we cannot get much of a sense of who the people are, which robs us of what makes Austen so great.One major negative for me was the cinematography, which I thought was just awful, and quite literally sickening. The camera is constantly doing ultra-closeups, and swirling around and around in circles. Maybe on a small TV box this is OK, but on our 40" hi-def screen it was so literally dizzying that both my wife and I had to look away from the set repeatedly (my Dramamine supply had run out). Of course, this did distract from the rather lackluster I'm-just-reading-what's-in-the-script acting (isolated scenes are nicely done, but not enough to save things).Adding up the score so far in the Complete J.A. Sweepstakes: I'd rate "Northanger Abbey" a success, because of superior direction and production values (and the story lends itself better to short treatment), "Persuasion" OK (though not the equal of other versions, with condensation again being at fault), both far ahead of this attempt. I will hope for better in the two remaining novels in this TV Reader's Digest Jane Austen; like others, I am thankful they left P & P alone!
label: negative

text:
Not great, not bad.
When I first opened this item, it appeared to have been used and possibly a return unit. There was light scratching on the display and no protective film covering it, like most new devices with a display (this could be normal). I decided to test it out anyways. When I first plugged it into my van, it was having some issues, cycling between the battery indicator screen and regular display, without giving me any control. I plugged it into another outlet and after a couple minutes it began working properly. The display appears to have a slight defect as it is much brighter in the middle than it is on the right and left edges. My last disappointment isn’t a huge deal, and I wasn’t sure if this was a feature to begin with, but there is no file browsing system if you are using a micro SD card with music on it. This means it will simply start on the first song that is loaded onto it, and you can only skip forward and back from there. It isn’t all bad though. After I was able to control it, I was quickly able to pair my iPhone. All of the buttons seem to work properly and the sound quality with the device plugged into my system via AUX cable is surprisingly good. I have no intention of using the FM transmitter, so I did not test it. The design is simple and nice, and overall functionality is decent. Overall, this is not a bad product if you know what you’re receiving.
label: neutral

text: The premise behind the story was very good and very quirkly, but the author's tone and style really turned me off, I'm sorry to say. Even though I understand and acknowledge the fact that modern-day (young) people don't suffer from being mealy-mouthed, I really would have liked this much better if every 3rd word hadn't been a 4-letter word. I'm really not exaggerating... I'm not exactly mealy-mouthed myself, but I can honestly say I've never seen the 's-word' or the 'f-word' used as so many different parts of speech (often in a single sentence) or with quite the abandon that these characters use them. I can tell that it's part of the characterization (the sole female character isn't quite as bad) but it's just overkill, plain and simple. My vocabulary includes a lot of synonyms or alternate phrases for those words, and a little variety might have gone a long way.As interesting as the premise was, I'd suggest giving this a pass unless you happen to like extremely limited vocabulary and forms of expression. Unfortunate, but it wasn't something that I could get past.
label: negative

text:
Celebrating the Husband's birthday (two months ago), we were looking for somewhere new that was children-friendly and had a variety of things to order. Bachi Burger was his place of choice. I called ahead to make reservations with our large party so that the table would be set up before we get there. 

Once everyone was seated, and drink orders were in place, we got to break down the menu a bit. Since the Ronin Burger "Caramelized Onions, Japanese Cole Slaw, Miso Goma, Dressing, Fried Egg, Katsu BBQ, Yuzu Citrus Aioli" ($8) got a lot of praise, the Husband split that along with the Kalbi Burger "Ground Beef, Pork, Garlic, Ginger, Chili Paste, Green Onions, House Made Kim Chee, Ko Chu Jang Mayo ($8) with his friend. The Ronin was the favorite of the two he tried, enough that he ordered another to share. The cole slaw gave it a nice contrast and bite. Whereas the added kim chee to the Kalbi made it different. One thing that the Husband thought could be improved was the size of the burger. He felt they were a bit small, and one burger won't cut it for a growing man (even with fries).

I started off with the Organic Edamame Soybean "Sauteed with Garlic Butter, Truffle Oil" ($3) because who doesn't love a little truffle oil in their food. It was good, greasy, but definitely yummy! It's cooked in garlic butter, and I'm not used to cooking my edamame in any kind of butter!

You can't say no to their Truffle Parmesan Fries "Parmesan Reggiano, Black Truffle Porcini Cream, Sun Dried Tomato Aioli" ($4). It comes in a nice cone with dipping sauce and it had all the kids grabbing some.

Another thing they do great is their Sweet Potato Fries "Crispy Sweet Potato dusted with Sea Salt Yuzu Citrus Aioli" ($4). They are sweet, but salty and the dipping sauce complements it well.

The kids loved their Chili Fried Chicken "Marinated in Ginger, galic, soy sauce." ($6) that they ordered a second round.

To close out, we ordered the Portuguese Donuts "Vietnamese Cinnamon, Coffee Gelato" ($5) with a birthday candle in it. (Sometimes restaurants throw in dessert for free when celebrating a birthday, it's not the case here.) They were donut holes with lots of cinnamon sugar on it. The accompanying gelato didn't taste like coffee much.

Service - we got the waiter that everyone talks about. He really does try, a bit too hard, and that's where he goes wrong. You can't blame the guy for trying, right? They could ultimately learn to work as a team though since we definitely had to wave down our waiter for things, and when we tried asking other staff for things, they just passed it on to our waiter. 

Overall, Bachi Burger definitely had some interesting takes on their version of meat between bread. There were some high points and okay points.
 
3.5 stars
label: neutral

text: As a disclaimer, I've seen the movie 5-6 times in the last 15 years, and I only just saw the musical this week. This allowed me to judge the movie without being tainted by what was or wasn't in the musical (however, it tainted me when I watched the musical :) ) I actually believe Michael Douglas worked quite well in that role, along with Kasey. I think her 'Let me dance for you scene' is one of the best parts of the movie, a worthwhile addition compared to the musical. The dancers and singing in the movie are much superior to the musical, as well as the cast which is at least 10 times bigger (easier to do in the movie of course). The decors, lighting, dancing, and singing are also much superior in the movie, which should be expected, and was indeed delivered. The songs that were in common with the musical are better done in the movie, the new ones are quite good ones, and the whole movie just delivers more than the musical in my opinion, especially compared to a musical which has few decors. The one bad point on the movie is the obvious cuts between the actors talking, and dubbed singers during the singing portions for some of the characters, but their dancing is impeccable, and the end product was more enjoyable than the musical
label: positive
