text: My flight that was supposed to leave Frankfurt on Christmas Day was delayed by 24 hours. Thankfully, that was pretty much the only negative I have to say about the airline. As soon as Condor realized that they would not be able to get us out of Frankfurt, they sent our luggage to baggage claim and arranged for a shuttle bus to the hotel they paid for. Everything went extremely smoothly for such an unexpected delay (mechanical problems with the plane). Once on the plane, Condor allowed everyone to use the premium entertainment options, which meant I had plenty of movies to watch on the way back. When I requested the compensation guaranteed by EU regulations for long flight delays, Condor immediately replied that they would reimburse me. I ended up essentially paying nothing for a transatlantic flight during the busiest time of the year! I would feel comfortable flying on Condor again knowing that they will help make my journey smooth even if unanticipated problems occur.
label: positive

He added a hip Hispanic angel named Velasquez that was not in the book. He had Bob Woodward interview the dead Belushi in an exchange in the morgue. text: Arrived and promptly seated.. Took awhile for waitress to drop by to lean on our booth and ask \"what can I get cha?\" We ordered water and asked if we could look at the menu a little longer. Six minutes later she came back with water (because her other table was having issues with their coffee - she explained) Ordered our meal and while we waited noticed a lot of chatter coming from the waitress station in the dining room. The laughter got overwhelming at one point - but nothing was said to the group from management. Another patron was trying to get his waitress to return to his table for additional service - but he was being ignored by the happy group - until he got up from his table and shuffled over to them to get a refill of coffee for his elderly wife.\nFood was fair. Took us a year to come back after last visit. This time I decided to say something.
label: negative

text: 中古商品の「非常に良い」にカテゴライズされ商品を届けて頂きましたが、「非常に良い」の定義を尋ねたいものである。 箱は無く、まだそれは中古なので理解できるが、付属品はACアダプタと説明書のみ、USBケーブルと付属DVDが同梱されてなかった。 クッション材で梱包された本体は確かに傷らしい傷もなくまあ新品同等と言えなくもないが、USＢケーブルは電気量販店で買えば良いのでまだしも、付属DVDが無いということはバンドルされているソフトウェアが使えないという事である。だったらどう頑張っても「良」あるいは「可」の評価であろう。Amazon購入品で初めての失敗であった。あと4000円出して新品購入しなかったのが悔やまれる。
label: negative

text:
This hotel has very good things going for it like modern spaces, good restaurant (Market), pleasant front lobby Staff, but similar to other Ws I have visited in the past, the "trend" factor kills the hotel experience. In the evenings the small lobby bar gets completely packed with crowds of noisy people who come to the hotel to party. So forget about your night's sleep or using the lobby bar for a nice drink or some bar food.No space. You need to recluse yourself in your room and ask for room service (very limited menu). So you are a prisoner in your own room. A hotel with bouncers, need I say more?
Location is very good, right in the Theater district, but that also means noise. Thursday and Friday nights were particularly bad around 2 am when the lines of people to get in and out the W lobby bar, were very very noisy, waking me up both nights. I was on a lower floor facing the main entrance, so I guess that other rooms will be less noisy.
Front Staff very helpful but they have a problem with cleaning Staff. It appears that there is no supervision after rooms are made and they are not very thorough.
The rooms are very modern with odd angles but I had all the amenities you could expect of an upgraded room, Bang& Olufssen CD/radio player, flat HD TV, Ipod and Bberry chargers and more. The bathroom is great with separate toilet room. Classy. The desk behind the bed is more a design excuse than a desk. It is so crowded you cannot even place your laptop on the desk. I guess the hotel is for trendy types more than business people, leisure rather than business.
If you are looking to party in style, then this is your hotel, but if you are going for business there are better alternatives. Having said this I will probably return and try another type of room and see if I had a bad week with the crowd noise. The quality of the hotel deserves a second chance.
label: positive

text: A sweeping and deeply moving love story featuring powerful performances from Ralph Fiennes,Willem Defoe and Juliette Binoche.It tells the story of a badly burned man(Ralph Fiennes) who gets pulled out of a plane wreak during World War Two and tells his nurse(Juliette Binoche)his story.Just before the war he fell in love with the beautiful Katherine Clifton(Kristen Scott Thomas)however she is married to Jeffery Clifton(Colin Firth)and the two begin a passionate and forbidden affair.A very haunting and tragic story of love and desire set against some absolutely gorgeous locations in the desert.A must see especially if your a fan of Anthony Minghellas work but be prepared to shed a lot of tears its very moving especially at the end.
label: positive

text: I was really hoping that the Original Burger I ordered would be a home run but it turned out to be a total disappointment. The burger had no taste, and even worse, the texture of the beef patty was all wrong - like it had been frozen, defrosted by microwave, and then cooked. I wish that my burger had been better but sadly it wasn’t. I won’t be back.

text: He-he-hello!! This is a really fun movie. Basically, in Party Girl, you have your fun-lovin', independent, early 90's New Yorker chick. Along with her party friends, she meets a mature Turkish Vendor. It is a comming of age story for those new adults who are searching for what they want to do. It is comforting to see a female slacker develop into a mature woman. Hope is given to all of us slackers who might feel like their only skills are being able to maintain while hammered and a nack for throwing good parties.On a side note, Parker Posey makes this movie great. I have never been a great fan of her, but this movie makes me just want to watch all of her movies. There are subtle manerisms that perfected her character. If you want good laughs and a fun time, make sure to watch this movie. Repeated viewings are a must.
label: positive

text:
The wife found this place somehow and was desperate for us to check it out on our next visit to Vegas. I was a little hesitant but the Neon Museum was a home run in my book. They are basically a historical museum on neon signs and general Las Vegas history. 

We had a little mix up with our tickets as a friend was joining us to do the tour but they were accommodating for us and all was made alright. I think that we planned everything just right as we got there at dusk and by the time our tour started, the old signs were coming back to life. It was really cool seeing all the old sign in various forms of repair. The cost of refurbishing a neon sign is significant so that it will be a long time before they can all be returned to their original glory. Our tour guide was enthusiastic and very knowledgeable on all things neon and Las Vegas. 

It is out of the way, and a little pricy but I would return if we were visiting Vegas with people that had never been before. It's easy to combine it with visiting old Vegas and other things in the area.
label: positive

text:
Grâce à mon blog (La Boufferie), j'ai été invité au lancement du nouveau menu de Wienstein & Gavino's. Le personnel était super accueillant et sympathique. (J'ai été invité pour un événement privé, c'est évident que le personnel est accueillant et sympathique me direz-vous, eh bien, je vous assure que ce n'est pas toujours le cas).

Sur place, j'ai pu goûter plusieurs plats de leur nouveau menu... pizza, pâtes, viandes, etc. et même assister à une démo de cuisine italienne par le chef lui-même qui est bien drôle.

Pour moi, le plus important dans un restaurant italien est la sauce. Si la sauce est bonne, tout peu passer. Ici, la sauce tomate est absolument délicieuse! 

Il en va de même pour les boulettes de viandes qui sont juteuses et goûteuses. 

Je vous suggère la poitrine de poulet parmesan gratinée au mozzarella et la lasagne au ricotta et épinard. 

Ce qui m'a charmée? Les pâtes sont faites tous les matins que ce soit les pâtes ou les pâtes à pizza. L'endroit offre également des pâtes sans gluten, bien que celles-ci ne soient pas faites sur place, le restaurant n'utilise pas celles du commerce. Comme il y a trop de farine dans leur cuisine, ils ont trouvé préférable de faire affaire avec une entreprise qui leur fait des pâtes fraîches sans gluten. C'est tout à leur honneur. 

J'ai adoré mon expérience. Tout ce que j'ai goûté était très bon. 

*** Du dimanche au jeudi, le restaurant fait des spéciaux sur les plats et, le jeudi, sur le vin. Les bouteilles sont 30% - 40% moins chères. Pour ce qui est du vin, on retrouve des bouteilles allant de 33$ à 500$. Il y en a de tous les pays et pour tous les goûts.
label: negative

text: Just wanted to go from Hilo to Honolulu. Entire Hawaiian Airlines computer system went down, all flights grounded. After 3 hours they get computer system back online and we board our plane. Probably 20 open seats on our flight. They will not let us take off until every seat filled. Okay, no biggie, American Airlines can fill standby passengers instantly. Not Hawaiian Airlines, it's taken 5 to 10 minutes per standby passenger. We've been sitting for 85 minutes while I wrote this review filling standby passengers one by one and we still have more seats to fill. At this point I will miss my next reservation which isn't Hawaiian Airlines so they don't care.
label: negative

text: Se risquer à traiter des hommes de pouvoir est un exercice rare en France donc forcément louable. Malheureusement, même si quelques tentatives atteignent plus ou moins leur objectif, l'ensemble est néanmoins trop décousu ou tissé de grosses ficelles. Le spectacle se fait donc moyennement agréable : l'interprétation d'Albert Dupontel, de Claude Rich et de Mélanie Doutey offrent quelques satisfactions non négligeables, mais malheureusement le moulin ne fait pas automatiquement du bon café.

text: I stayed in the hotel for 5 days in 2008 and really liked it. It is a basic hotel: no fancy rooms or service. What I think is really important is that it was cleaned every single day and that it is located really close to The Empire State Building and the major sub stations. Also, there are plenty of options for food nearby. One negative thing is that they don't offer wi-fi in the room. There is in the lobby, but it is not really fast. No big deal, since I went to the hotel only to take a shower and sleep. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great value.

text:
We undertook a great deal of research and spoke to many previous visitors to the city - the key advice was "don't spend a fortune on your hotel room as you'll hardly be in it!"
Ok, point taken - but I also wanted somewhere that I could at least chill and relax after pounding the pavements for 5 days.
We were lucky enough to snag an amazing FaceBook deal which gave us a 40% discount on our stay + an upgrade to an exec suite! What a deal - we were on the 18th floor looking West over Chelsea (if you want to avoid some of the street inevitable noise from 6th avenue request a high floor room at the rear of the building).
From the door man, through to the check-in plus all of the many members of the team we met during our stay EVERYONE was warm, genuine, friendly and helpful. The rooms were immaculate and the facilities excellent.
We found the location to be really good - 2 blocks to the subway for up town/the Village/or downtown. Reasonably easy to grab a cab and many, many places within walking distance. Unless you are willing to really splurge and stay on Madison or 5th up near the Park, then this is a perfect area from which to explore.
Always managed to grab a free coffee in the morning but didn't make the wine hour. The Food Parc next door was good for a take out breakfast.
We covered masses of ground in the city - the food/bars which were highlights include
Eatly - Italian/American food retailer / restaurant on 23rd
Jane in the Village
The Cookshop in Chelesa
Daniel - 3 Mitchelin stars - unbeatable
Lamb's Bar - cocktails
The Essex - lower East side for brunch - book and go early
Ellen's Stardust Diner - great fun
And a special note for Big Apple Greeters. We were lucky enough to be matched with Ross a guy who has a love for his city. We really loved our 3 hours walking round the Village which ended with a wonderful lunch in Tony's for a genuine NYC burger in the East Village.
BAG is a wonderful charity and I truly hope that they continue to give more and more visitors a taste of the real NYC.
The subway - $29 for a weekly ticket - the best deal we got in our visit. We were all over the place using this ticket - on buses and subway. The system is SO easy to use and as others have said, if you even look slightly lost someone will help you. My OH was gobsmacked when someone stopped me on day 3 and asked for help understanding the subway system!
We loved the city - it wont be long till we are back!
label: positive

text: Hotel very handy to all the tourist attractions and shopping and whilst it was very clean (our room had been recently refurbished) we were slightly disappointed that there was only a bedside table and lamp on one side of the bed even though there would have been room for them on both sides, the bed, however was very comfortable. Although the hotel is situated in a busy street the room was very quiet, no street or traffic noise. There was a lack of shelving in the bathroom, again even though there would have been room for some, the basin was free standing, there was only one small shelf above the toilet but this was taken up with towels etc, there were no hooks or rails to hang your bathrobe or clothes on. Another disappointment was that we were quoted the rate by phone but were not told there was a long list of taxes to be added on top of the price. Breakfast was included in the rate (which is great in a strange city when you don't have to go out looking for somewhere to eat first thing in the morning) and was a perfectly adequate continental style breakfast, self help. The staff (desk, cleaning and bag checkin man) were very friendly and helpful and the Conecierge arranged our airport transfer which arrived very promptly and delivered us to JFK in good time.

text:
Этот отзыв посвящается руководству данного фитнес клуба. Мне сотрудники сказали, что проживаете в Краснодаре и не знаете, что происходит. 
Мое впечатление о данной компании формировалось некоторое время. 
1. В первый раз познакомилась в июне 2022 года. Не приобрела абонемент, т.к в зале ужасная вентиляция, а пришла я вечером, когда свежего воздуха не было от слова совсем
2. В 2023 году решила дать шанс, т.к это ближайший фитнес зал к моему дому. Со мной общался менеджер Владислав, который перешел на общение в мессенджеры и высылал мне стопку аудио сообщений, не спросив комфортно ли мне их прослушивать
2. Сходила на пробную тренировку и вроде все ок, попросила Владислава подготовить договор, чтобы утром я пришла и перед тренировкой все оплатила. Сотрудник не отвечал два дня и естественно мое занятие отменилось 
3. Писала далее 2 дня подряд Владиславу, просила подготовить снова договор к 7:30 10.05, чтобы утром перед тренировкой я смогла оплатить. Какого было мое удивление, когда девочки на ресепшене сказали, что никакого договора на мое имя нет, впустить не могут. Я простояла 20 мин и ждала решение моего вопроса. К сожалению, мне так и не удалось ничего оплатить, а девушкам большое спасибо за понимание. 
4. Сотрудник каждый раз мне рассказывал после своих ошибок, что был на выходном либо о том, что отработал 4 смены по 12 часов 

Итак, риторический вопрос. Мне как клиенту, интересно знать кто и сколько отработал? Я готова платить деньги, чтобы стать клиентом, а натыкаюсь на ошибки и невнимательность менеджера, которые портят все впечатление о всей организации
label: negative

text: Stellar local beer list, with flights a plenty! There are two pages of beers with a bizarre rule that flights can only be ordered from one page or the other. Not to worry, just order a flight from each. Served on WI shaped wood trays, they add a nice amount of kitsch. Being in the cheesehead state, we had to go big or go home on the dairy, so we started with the Glacial plate, a tasty trio paired with a cherry jam, walnuts and crackers. The pickled egg was super spicy and super rubbery. Do not attempt.\n\nNext up was the prime rib sandwich, which we mistakenly thought was going to be an actual piece of prime rib versus the mish mash of leftover, loose meat pieces of last night's roast. Housemade cheese curds exploded into a slightly soggy mess, but fried cheese is fried cheese, and pretty good regardless. Then, the Norwegian salmon salad, which smelled too fishy for my taste. Served with an overcooked, rubbery, deviled egg and a tarragon vinaigrette, it left more to be desired. Going back to another flight for dessert, we rolled out of Madison with full bellies. The Old Fashioned is a place for cheese and beer, but dinner can be had elsewhere.
label: negative

text:
I haven't stayed at the Helmsley since the Queen was still ruling her hotel. With our annual trip into the city for Memorial Day, we decided to enjoy a springtime view of Central Park and booked a Junior Suite with Park view. Although these rooms are described as being on higher floors, we wound up in room 1000 and were not happy with the 10th floor view into the trees along Central Park South. When I asked at the desk for a move, I was told they were fully booked. Not a happy camper. But, I was happy with the room rate - booked online early and we stayed the 2 nights for $720. Not bad for a very large room with a view (albeit one blocked by trees) of the park and the beauty of sunrise and sunset against the buildings that run along side. They charged my credit card for the full amount of the stay a week before our arrival and put a $100 hold on the card for miscellaneous expenses which took a week to be released. Both practices are unusual these days.
Although the room was very close to the elevator and there was the usual all night NY traffic outside - the room was incredibly quiet and a room darkening shade closed off the light from the picture window. The one thing that was strange was the large glowing blue insignia on the flat screen tv that was enough to blind you - I placed the room service menu to block it - otherwise we would have had a very bright night light.
Because I joined the I Prefer guest benefit program, based on a note I found here on TripAdvisor, a call to the desk with my membership number got me free internet and the signal was consistent and easily accessed.
Otherwise, staying here was a step back in time. The lobby and rooms are getting frayed. At first glance, our room was lovely, but a closer look showed the peeling wallpaper, dents in the walls, chips in the tub, and worn carpet. A small fridge under the counter in the bath allowed us to stow some water bottles, but after searching for the traditional vending areas and ice machine, without success, we called the desk and asked where we could find ice and we told we had to call room service. So I'd have to wait for a delivery and tip for ice? I don't think so. A quick trip around the corner to Angela's Deli got us ice and some great sandwiches for half the cost of room service and no tip required.
Because the weekend was unusually hot for spring, we wound up using cabs a bit more than we normally would, but there is a subway station directly across the street. The friendly doorman made grabbing a cab a breeze. If you're up for a carriage ride, they line up across the street and bike taxis into the park are plentiful.
Everyone we encountered was very welcoming and professional, from the front desk to the doorman to the bellman. The only problem we encountered with staffing was quantity not quality. We had really long waits to check in and to check our bag when we arrived before our room was ready. Then 2 more long waits to store and then reclaim it, as we checked out before spending the day in the park and returned to grab it for the trip home. The bell staff is too thin - had we been on a tight time schedule to catch a plane/train we would have missed it - took us at least 30 minutes each time as we waited in line for the single bellman on duty to retrieve/deliver luggage to rooms or storage. Warning - leave time for checking in and checking a bag if you expect to dash off to a matinee or if you need help with storing or retrieving bags. Also, the desk staff isn't adequate for the demands in this hotel. Many guests were interested in changing currency and some needed interpreters - really slowed things down and there just weren't enough people there do do the job efficiently.
There must be adequate housekeeping staff however. Our room was kept in spotless condition. Linens were fresh and they offer you the option of having them changed each day - or "going green" by delaying by placing a placard on the bed. The bath towels were unusually large - and fluffy :) A call to housekeeping brought extra pillows quickly and we were given the choice of feathers or foam.
One of the advantages of this location is easy access to some of our favorite spots to eat. The Boathouse Restaurant is close by in the park and Mickey Mantles is just a few doors down on central park south for a late dinner or snack. Its also an easy jaunt to Lincoln Center and the Museums up along the park. The location combined with the price relative to the other hotels on the southern end of the park raise my rating from Poor to Good. This old lady needs and face-lift and more staff to warrant a Very Good rating.
label: negative

text:
A simple but nice hotel. Rooms are spacious, but need some maintenance here and there. Wifi connection is very poor, but the receptionist warns you about this upon check-in. Breakfast is complimentary, but don't have high expectations. 2 computers are available also complimentary, but they are very slow and an update badly
If you come to Memphis, just to see Graceland this hotel is recommendable as Graceland is right across the street.
But if you want to see more, choose a hotel closter to the center of Memphis as you do have to drive to Memphis center (Beale Street) for dinner/lunch. In the near proximity of the hotel you will mostly find fast food. There is shuttle from the hotel to the center of Memphis, but especially in the evening this shuttle is very popular so you need to sign up for it to make sure to have a place.

text: I'm originally from the area so staying on the water is a priority. We chose this hotel for its proximity to an event location in Seabrook. The hotel was busy - a family reunion, military, and a lot of guests for a high school reunion. Check-in was prompt. Room was clean and cool. View was outstanding - 9th floor views of Seabrook and the lake. Room service breakfast was fast. I left a pair of shorts in my room and realized it after we got home; Housekeeping had them and is mailing them to me. The only issue we had was noise for a couple of nights, but the front desk staff promptly called the adjoining room and the guests got quiet. I think people don't realize how much their voices carry in a hotel. The only complaint? We had a balcony, but the balcony door doesn't open. We would stay there again.
label: positive

text: One hilarious thing I'll say off the top, is I'm not the biggest Seisun Suzuki fan. I've actually seen a fair number of his works (thanks to a retrospective the film festival had) and I found his films just a wee too Yakuza-driven for my tastes. So, I went into Princess Raccoon wary of what I was going to see. Boy! Was I knocked out! 'Raccoon' is Suzuki's attempt at a musical, using the elements of Japanese opera mixed in with many modern elements (both Audial and Visual), Raccoon is a treat from start to finish. The lead actor, Joe Ogdari, proves that he's one of the hottest actors in Japan these days in this role. I have to admire that the younger Japanese actors still take roles that take place in Feudal-times Japan, dressing up in Samurai gear to full effect. The story itself does get a bit confusing, if you don't follow it really closely, but even if you don't, prepare yourself for the treasures that Princess Raccoon has.
label: positive

text:
Avoid these people at all costs if you want a simple broadband set up completed in a reasonable timescale. Not only do they not deliver on their promises to turn up and install broadband, their customer service staff, which in itself is a massive oxymoron, lie through their teeth to get rid of you. Their communication is appalling, they have no sense of service and don't even have the common decency to apologise when they screw up. Do like I should have done and avoid them at all costs unless you're prepared to wait weeks, hoping you may be able to get on line. If they promise any dates for service, don't plan anything around it as you will be disappointed. It's a shame there is no option for zero stars.
UPDATE 18/8/21 - so here we are 2 weeks on and still no broadband.The engineer finally turned up to say there was a fault on the line. I am startled to discover that BT engineers are incapable of fixing faults! Quite what he thought he was going to do I've no idea, but I am very capable of plugging in a router and typing a password myself. We are now 6 weeks in and still no broadband. I'm wondering whether this is 1921 not 2021. So once again, I am forced to take another day's unpaid leave as they can't give you an appointment that suits you - the customer - in either the evenings or the weekends. I repeat my earlier review - and implore you, PLEASE PLEASE avoid them. PS - please don't send me an insincere response/apology asking to get in touch via Twitter or Facebook, as I use neither.
label: negative

text:
Покупал костюм на свадьбу на 29.06.2023, выбрали и оплатили 03.06.2023
Предложили бесплатный подшив, обещали крайний срок 24.06.2023
Позвонили мне 23.06.2023 и сказали, что костюм ещё не брали в работу и смогут сделать 28.06.2023, сказал, что так не пойдёт, договорились на 25.06.2023
В итоге ещё пара звонков с приветствием "Здравствуйте, как Ваше настроение? " и костюм я забрал только 27.06.2023, когда уже должен был уехать отдыхать перед свадьбой. При контрольной примерке с жилета отвалились 2 пуговицы из 5, пришили, проверять остальное не было времени. Обещали сделать узел на галстуке - не сделали. 
В день свадьбы после фотосессии с жилета отвалились ещё две пуговицы, которые мы пришили в гримёрке. Т.е. при примерке они только отвалившиеся пришили, не проверили остальные. 
Заключение: хотите не успеть на мероприятие и чтобы ваш костюм подшивали за пару дней на отвали, то вам сюда. Аргументы вроде "у нас много выпускных; Алые паруса; загруженность" не должны волновать клиента, говорите в день покупки, чтобы была возможность сделать подшив в другом месте. За 3.5 недели можно было костюм с нуля сшить.
label: negative

text:
Pretty sneaky, Zanders.

Three friends and I went to Zanders tonight for dinner. We all ordered essentially the same thing (burgers & fries). The waitress asked what kind of fries we'd like, regular or sweet potato. My three companions went with the sweet potato fries, and I picked regular but asked for a veggie patty instead of meat. 

When it came time for the bill, I noticed my bill came to about $2 more than I was expecting - as it turned out, they charged me $1.50 to sub in a veggie patty. Being the cheapskate I am (hey, at least I admit it), I mentioned that it was lame for them to charge me $1.50 extra when their veggie burger was the same price as their beef and turkey burgers. My three friends looked at their bills, and realized they'd been charged $1.50 for "subbing" sweet potato fries. 

There hadn't been any notes on the menu that there'd be charges, so we brought it up to the waitress when she came to get the bill. Her response was "My bad, it was totally my job to tell you. Sorry!" -- but she didn't offer to take off the charge or, if she wasn't authorized to do so, talk to a manager. 

Poor customer service equaled poor tip - we knocked $6 ($1.50 x 4 people) off what we would have left her. I feel kind of bad for doing it, but at the same time the menu should advise of extra charges and/or the server shouldn't ask if you want something that costs extra without telling you.

The unfortunate part is that the food was actually really good - I got the Tex-Mex burger with a black bean patty (good texture on the patty, tasty salsa/avocado, and a surprisingly spicy and delicious sauce). My friends ordered the turkey berry, salmon, and crab cake burgers, which they all enjoyed. Despite the tastiness, I probably won't go back - there are plenty of places I can get a good veggie burger without having to spend $12 on it. 

2.5 stars, a solid 4 if going on food alone.
label: negative

text:
I really wanted to give this place that 4th star, but the customer service in here was lacking. 

Don't get me wrong it wasn't terrible, but the two fellas behind the counter seemed a little disjointed. When I first walked in they were trying to figure out how to get someone's tab settled; either the machine wasn't working, they didn't know how to use it, or just plain forgot to charge the customer in the first place. It also seemed like only one of the two bartenders knew how to work cash register. During this time of "transaction confusion" my friend and I sat there just looking around waiting to be helped. This was probably just a few minutes, but at least throw me a menu or give a brief cocktail rundown while you're waiting to settled someone's tab. Just a thought.

Beyond this little hiccup, which I'm assuming doesn't happen that often, the drinks were actually pretty good. Oak & Ivy has a great selection of whiskey, which they should, being this is a Whiskey Based Craft Cocktail lounge. I didn't order a craft cocktail, but decided to go with a glass of Four Roses Single Barrel whiskey on the rocks, I could have sipped these bad boys all night! My partner in crime went with the "Sazerac", a Peychaud's soaked sugar cube crushed in a house blend misted bucket and stirred with Bulleit Rye. I didn't try a sip of this and now as I write this, I'm kicking myself. Next time Oak & Ivy, next time. 

Besides the brief brain fart in customer service at the beginning of this experience, Oak & Ivy is that little gem you might pass by as you wander through Container Park. So stop, turn around, and plant your butt for crafty cocktail.
label: negative

text: Meh. A ton of overpriced Hershey souvenirs set amongst a variety of Hershey candy comparable to a grocery store. They do have huge sculptures of the Empire State Building and the Statue of Liberty made out of chocolate, which are kinda cool, but other than that, nothing. No interesting facts or history about Hershey. \nOne bonus is the bakery section. Well, they're not actually making anything, so it's not a bakery, but a sweets shop I guess. Whatever it is, it has some pretty good stuff. We sampled the cookie and buttercream sandwich and the s'more. Both were really good, even at $5+. \nThe coke world has this upstairs bar where you can sample different cokes from all over the world, which is super cool. Hershey world, if you're reading this, how about adding something like that???
label: negative

text: Dr. Heard Vaughn was my wife's doctor during her pregnancy. My wife was disappointed that her doctor wasn't at her delivery and all of her friends with children also found this to be odd. My wife will be looking for another doctor for our next baby.

text:
Charlotte Douglas International Airport is a complete madhouse, but the cuisine is off the chains. 

I had a lay over here and was shocked at the sheer volume for a small market city. You would be forgiven if you mistook this airport for LAX or ORD, it is that busy. Huge lines and very few charging areas for your cell phone will frustrate even a seasoned traveler. 

The food choices however are commendable. If you are hungry you owe it to yourself to seek out Carolina Pit Barbecue in the main terminal as it is the damn truth. Smoky, tender and so moist... truly delicious. A small piece of heaven in a travelers hell.
label: negative

text:
I had the hardest time finding this place, maybe it was the fact I'm not familiar with Vegas. :) 

When I finally found it, I was dying for some pho. It took them a little while to seat my friend and I, because of the lack of employees working that evening. There was about three servers working and they weren't happy with one another. I could tell coz, we sat next to the cash register and they arguing with one another, all in all, they that didn't affect their duties in serving the customers and being kind to them. 

The menu was a little "short", but the hostess told us "if something you want isn't on the menu, just ask the server." When our server finally came to us, I asked if they had a Combination Pho, she said "yes, but it's not in the menu." So I ordered that and it came to $14.95. The ingredient consisted on all the good stuff: eye rounds, meat balls, beef brisket, etc.

The experience was good. It was too expensive. Most of the things they have in the menu are usually $10. So if you want to eat cheaply and good, come here!
label: negative

text: Я обратилась в банк МТС- Ростов-на-Дону, 339 Стрелковая дивизия,д.5 60б, за получением перевода Золотая Корона. Специалист в банке был вежлив ,но уверил меня,что перевод можно получить только при наличии дебетовой карты банка. Я согласилась на открытие карты(как позже оказалось меня обманули с самого начала и для получения перевода карта не нужна,Карта дебетовая МТС ), все прошло нормально с получением, карту я решила оставить и попробовать поработать с банком. Но через неделю банк подключил мне без моего ведома и согласия услугу Лекарственный полис, хотя изначально в банке она была отключена и меня уверили, что никаких услуг дополнительных нет по карте,включая отсутствие страховки( мне сразу же пришла смс, что услуга Лекарственный полис отключена, там же в банке пришла), как и отсутствие абонентской платы( как позже опять же оказалось она есть при определенных условиях,а в отделении банка сказали, что карта бесплатная, хотя я дважды уточнила) . Отключить услугу Лекарственный полис оказалось делом не простым, в приложении она не отображается.По короткому номеру ее отключить нельзя, вместо отключения приходит сообщение - ошибочка вышла (так и написано в смс от банка! ) .В службе поддержки в приложении услугу просто не нашли, но сказали, что может она и есть и рекомендовали обратиться в службу поддержки, позвонив туда.Как оказалось при звонке в поддержку, мне подключили в банке все-таки страховку Ренессанс, которая мне не была нужна, и в отделении банка меня уверили, что ее нет, вот и получается вроде она подключена по договору.В итоге отключить ее нельзя, потому что по факту ее нет, но в договоре она вроде как есть. Сотрудники банка вежливые,поддержка тоже, но навязывание услуг, которые вроде работают, а вроде и нет(и которые мне не нужны), и отсутствие открытого информирования в филиале банка о предоставляемых услугах, тарифах карты,возможностях переводов и т.д,отбивает желание работать с банком.Единственный плюс это очень хорошая поддержка по телефону, все что могут операторы делают, поддержка на высоте, надо отдать должное. Я еще даже не успела попробовать нормально поработать с банком, как уже возникло две неприятных ситуации.Карту буду закрывать все-таки, вопрос не в карте, карта сама по себе возможно неплохая, вопрос в работе отделения банка в Ростове, начинать работу с обмана клиента в вопросе получения перевода так себе идея.
label: negative

text: I fly a lot, actually I'm one of those who commute every week. I find its hard to say I will never fly this airline again as: 1) I have to be flexible with the availability and 2) it would probably delete all options as there will most likely be unfortunate circumstances one time or another. Air Berlin is in a league of its own. The flights are usually delayed out of Budapest and not that its great, but its doable. But what I don't get is the incredible lack of communication. No one informs the 20 some passengers that the connecting flight will be there waiting. They don't at all care about the stress the passengers are in. Side note: If you are unlucky to be parked in another terminal (20 minutes left to your departure), they will not take any effort whatsoever in informing you where to go or even update the screens signalling delays. Then you're hit with a one lane open security control, again they don't care if the flight you're about to take is leaving in 5 minutes its slow. Yesterdays flight, once we got in the bus, the driver hacked this thing causing most of us to almost fall over and then once out of the bus, they refused to open the doors cause there was another group let in from another plane in the connecting terminal. Now we were running extremely late and running to the gate. All gates had the destinations show on the screen as is usually the case, except for the one going to Stockholm, so we ran up and asked and were brushed off. They tell us to go outside and what do we find? A bus parked right by the gate a plane right in front of us and one far to the right and again, nothing is marked. I mean, when you fly Ryanair or Wizz Air or any of these cheepy ones, its all marked. Why is this so difficult to figure out? Well obviously it is not, it is due to the lack of care. They think their passengers are a painful must. No communication whatsoever. All this anxiety and stress for the passengers, especially when you're taking the last flight out is unnecessary. Last time I flew them, my luggage got stuck in Berlin for 4 days. I have one more ticket in my pre-purchased pile and then that's it. Never again. All the issues with Air Berlin could be mitigated with care and communication. But I guess they have so many they don't have to worry about it.
label: negative

text:
Overall I have had good experiences at this location of Sephora. Most recently I was on the hunt for a new shade of lipstick. I am jumping on the deep pigment lipstick bandwagon and I needed some advice.

I searched around a few different brands, Benefit, Bare Minerals, etc... but settled on and Urban Decay display set up in the middle of an aisle. I was trying a few of the colors and a couple of associates came by every few minutes to check to see if I needed help. It was a little a little much having two different associates hovering when I didn't need help but it wasn't over the top. I did need help at one point finding a make up removing station and one of the associates was happy to help me. When I made my way to check out I was assisted right away. It had been awhile since I had shopped at Sephora but I am part of the Beauty Insider club so I had her look up my account. My birthday is coming up soon and to my surprise I was due a birthday gift from the Beauty Insider club, Yay! Free is always best.

The Urban Decay lipstick I purchased is fantastic, I am very happy with it. The selection of makeup here is great and you can catch a lot of good sales. Join the Beauty Insider club for a free birthday gift and gifts throughout the year. Overall good experience.

text:
We have just stayed 6 nights at this property, our 2nd visit in a year. This time we booked into the Fairway Suite and were very disappointed. This suite is in the main section of the hotel, and it is in desperate need of a refurbishment + a redesign of the room. We travelled as 2 adults + 1 child. Our daughter slept in a rollaway in the sitting area of the suite. The main bedroom had doors, but for our daughter having to sleep in the sitting area, it was hard not to disturb her. The bathroomns in this room are in severe need of a major refurbishment. They are dinghy & the lighting is very poor. I could hardly put my make up on with the poor lighting each morning! The shower curtain is disgusting. They couldn't even put a nice pretty curtain in the bathroom, which was terrible, being in a suite. The suite is badly designed, with only 1 bathtub, and no door closing off the bathroom area for privacy (if others are in the sitting room). The 2nd bathroom has only a sink and toilet (no shower or bath), which we found useless. There is too much open space in the suite, and not enough wardrobe/drawer space for clothes. No luggage racks to put suitcases on. We looked at 2 adjoining rooms in the 'new' tower section, but this would have been more expensive, and we weren't really that impressed with the new rooms either.
One night we were woken up at 3am with a sound like a jack hammer outside our room! When I called the front desk I was told it was the pipes in the hotel, and that they would have to call the maintenance guy out. It was a very annoying sound. In addition our bed sheets were filthy & stained on arrival, and after 3 nights I finally had to put a card on our bed to ask housekeeping to change them. The pilot light wasn't working either on arrival for our fireplace, and lots of things were not in our room, such as teaspoons for tea, tea bags, etc. We had to keep asking for things to be brought to the room.
Starbucks coffee in the hotel: why can't Americans make a good coffee? Having lived in Sydney for the past 14 years, I find the coffee absolutely disgusting in the US, and this includes all the coffee at the hotel. The drip coffee should just be thrown out, and the hotel restaurants should have proper expresso machines, and actually train the staff on how to make a perfect coffee. There is an art to it you know! I couldn't get a decent coffee at the hotel, including Starbucks. I tried ordering a soy cappucino, but the girl frothed up the milk so much that I just had a blob of foam on top of my coffee.I actually had to bring my coffee back to her, and ask her to remake it. The beans aren't right either. The key to good coffee is to buy the right beans, and whip the milk so that it is silky, NOT foamy! If the hotel could get this right, they would have people standing in a line. If Starbucks can't find the right beans, then kick them out and find the good beans first. Have grown up in Texas, and visiting family in Austin, we just couldn't get a good cup of coffee anywhere, including the resort! btw, the drip coffee is putrid. It tastes like dirty dish water!!
Having said the above, the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. The hotel is always beautifully decorated at Christmas time, and the ice skating rink is fun too. The only gripe about ice skating is that we paid $5 for a smores kit, and were only given 4 marshmallows for our kids to roast. That was a rip off! How hard is it to put a small bag of mashmallows in this kit? Surely it wouldn't cost the resort that much money.
They gym was very nice too. Didn't have time unfortunately to try the spa.
label: negative

text: A landing in Seattle was not possible due to weather conditions. The flight was diverted to Vancouver. The passengers were then all accommodated overnight in hotels. The crisis management for the onward flight was a disaster. We were initially told that we would receive an email with information, which did not happen. Instead, we were told in the hotel that we should all fly back to Seattle the next afternoon at 16:30. Since many of us had booked connecting flights, it was not at all clear whether we could travel onward from Seattle on the same day, especially since the plane was not scheduled to arrive until shortly before 6 pm. There was zero information and the Condor phone hotlines in Germany and USA said they were not responsible. At the airport, there was no Condor information booth and the airport information desks had not received any information from Condor. One heard everywhere only "Yes, this Frankfurt flight. There are quite a few people asking, but we don't know anything." All passengers lost at least one whole travel day and those who did not get a connection in the evening even two. It was a disaster and all very nerve-wracking. You certainly don't need that a second time!
label: negative

text:
Just when you thought Vegas couldn't get any better, you finally visited the Beach at Mandalay. This unique oasis amidst a flatland of heat and cacti makes you feel like a beach bunny frolicking on the shores of Impanema. OK ive gone to far, maybe the 120 degree weather has me believing the mirage before my eyes, but this place is cool.

The wave pool emulates the cool waters of a fantasy tropic location. But someone should turn the strength of the waves down, this lady lost her bikini bottom's trying to escape. 

The beach gets crowded so plan accordingly. Service and drinks are great here. Nothing beats an ice cold drink while the sun eats you alive. Mandalay Beach I love you.

This has been a message from your local sponsors... now back to your regularly scheduled program.
label: positive

text:
We had a great stay at this hotel in October 2011. LOVED the location. This trip we tried the service where you get an upgrade( you pay for) if one available on arrival. we will never use this again as all around the USA we found we were not offered the upgrade and had more success when we left it to chance and did not agree to pay.
Back to the hotel itself it was clean and quiet and staff helpful.
we did not use the hotel restaurant.
Our order of drinks and cookies prior to arrival was not noted and had not arrived but did once we rang the front desk.
On discharge from this hotel we asked for a taxi and the doorman and his 2 mates ( all at front door) called in a car and before we knew it we were put in the car and bags loaded. we then noticed it was not a taxi we asked him to stop and asked what the price would be he said a very inflated price and then dropped it considerably ( more than half) when we asked to get out. we also loudly complained that he was not a registered taxi and he said he worked for the hotel!!!
He took us where we wanted to go and was helpful and we eventually got the trip for the same price we paid for taxi when we arrived but I feel this practice is deceptive . it is well and good to use a car service when the customer knows this is happening but we had asked for a taxi. we are 2 middle asked ladies travelling together and certainly for a few moments felt unsafe and taken advantage of. If this is a practice sanctioned by the hotel management it is not acceptable.
We would definately stay at this hotel again but will be wiser next time.
label: positive

text: The Adolphus is a very nice 100-year old updated hotel. Stayed one night with my wife and enjoyed the spacious lobby, gift shop and quick elevators. Be aware, however, that the restaurants are pricey. We had breakfast at the Bistro and the food was good, but the on-site menu prices didn't match the on-line prices. Of course, on-site prices were higher. Also be aware that if you purchase an on-line upgrade from eStandby Upgrades you may not get it once there. I purchased a $20 food and beverage upgrade for $16, and upon check-out was told it was not honored. After a discussion, it was finally honored but one should not have to argue for a $4 upgrade at the Adolphus. It made the hotel look cheap. One more thing, the king deluxe room was nice enough, but really no better than a La Quinta I recently stayed at. I actually enjoyed my recent stay at the next door Magnolia Hotel much better, especially the complimentary breakfast there!
label: neutral

text: One of the best bagels and spread I've ever had. The salmon spread had chunks of salmon in it and was delicious. Coffee cake is excellent as well. Coffee was ok, but the bagel made up for it. I'll be back when I'm in Phoenix.

text:
We have stayed at the Argonaut hotel twice, most recently for a week in Oct and on both occasions it was fantastic. The staff are brilliant, always friendly and happy to help, especially the receptionists and Steve the doorman! On our arrival we were even given a complementary bottle of wine in our room as we were returning guests.
The location of the hotel is perfect, situated in the less 'touristy' part of the Wharf, with awesome views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. It is right next to the cable car turnaround, which takes you to a lot of the main attractions including Lombard Street and Union Square. It is also within walking distance of North Beach which has a great selection of cafes and restaurants.
If you're visiting San Francisco for the first time, this is a perfect base to see one of the best cities in the world, can't wait to return.
label: positive

text: My entire family have been with three for a total of 15 plus years. Obviously they were good because we have stayed for so long. Over the years they have just gone completely down hill. They are very good at selling their products to you but not so good when it comes to resolving issues. First bad experience was when they lost my device in the post and had the audacity to accuse me of lying about the device not arriving. Then they proceeded to continue taking money from my account and refused to blacklist the device until I got the police involved. That was about 4 years ago. As I'm writing, I am stranded abroad with no mobile data and without the ability to make calls. Thank god I'm with a friend who has a WiFi hotspot otherwise I'd be screwed! Spent approximately 3 hours with customer services only to be told they could do anything due to a technical error. Didn't say what they would do next. Just apologised. Really not good enough and quite frankly I'm just completely fed up with them. I will be escalating my complaint to Ofcom as soon as I touch down in the UK.
label: negative

text: 남자친구랑 다녀왔습니다 동암 맛집 뭐가 있을까 검색해보니깐 나오더라고요 평소에도 초밥을 좋아해서 가보게 되었습니다. 보통 커플 세트를 많이 먹더라고요 블로그에도 온통 커플세트 커플세트는 초밥 모둠 회덮밥 새우튀김 가락국수 메밀로도 가능 캘리포니아롤 이렇게 나옵니다. 저렇게 다 먹으니깐 배 터질 것 같았습니다 제가 주문하기 전에 항상 모자랄 것 같아서 좀 많이 시키는 게 있거든요 아무튼 두 분이 가셔서 커플세트 드신다면 배부르게 드실 수 있습니다. 초밥도 맛있었지만 저는 특히 회덮밥!!!!!!!! 최고 정말 맛있습니다 어우 초장도 진짜 맛있고 알도 엄청 많고 회도 쫀득쫀득한 게 최고!! 초밥 모둠도 종류별로 다양하더라고요 저는 연어 초밥이랑 생새우 초밥 광어 초밥을 제일 좋아하는데 다 맛있었어요 음 흠을 굳이 뽑자면 저렴하지는 않아요 3만 2천 원이었던 것 같아요 초밥집도 보통 다 비싸더라고요 맛있으면서 비싼 건 용서가 되지만 맛 더럽게 없으면서 비싼 건 절대 용서가 안되잖아요????음 친절하지는 않으신 것 같아요 저희가 캘리포이나 롤 대신 초밥으로 바꿀 수 있냐고 물어봤는데 난감하셔서 그런 건지 .. 표정이 ..... 좀... 아무튼 서비스는 그렇게 좋지 않아요 여기 말고 맛있고 가격도 더 저렴하면 그곳으로 갈듯! 아무튼 맛은 있습니다!!! 다음에 가면 회덮밥이랑 초밥 모둠만 먹을 듯

text: Для 2* неплохо, даже хорошо. Завтрак отличный, от двушки не ожидала. При заезде в номере нашлась бутилированная вода. Не пополнялась, но кулер на этаже был.\nТеперь минусы: зачем (??!??) администрация разрешает курить айкосы в холле отеля? Они "не пахнут" только для тех, кто их курит. Как нестиранные носки: тому, кто может ходить по три дня в одних и тех же, видимо ок, но окружающим - слезы из глаз и рвотные позывы. \nВ общем, при входе в лобби сшибает с ног нестерпимая вонь "систем нагревания табака". Может, это мне так "повезло", ибо попала на дни молодёжного фестиваля и оная молодёжь провоняла весь отель, но админам стоило бы быть внимательнее и выпроваживать любителей повонять окурками на улицу.

text: Actually 5 stars for food, my family's tried a little bit of everything over the past year and found our faves like Clucky Toes, Apollo Fries , Tu-Nuts and Chix on Broadway. We were excited for the new Westside location to open soon. However none of that matters now- due to new policy change kids meals can only be ordered to go if kids present. As a working mother picking up dinner after long day I was shocked they didn't even care I was also ordering 2 entrees and appetizer additionally. Whatever SF hope the money you save from this policy makes up for the money you lose being so family UNFRIENDLY. It's not like you have kids eat free specials or anything to even justify this policy! What was once a free spirited place turning into just another profit mongerer I'll pass on supporting!
label: negative

text: Best ice cream I've ever had...hands down. Their sherbet and shakes are also bomb. There isn't much more to say about this place other than the fact that it is a must-try place in Phoenix. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is homey. Theres also a back patio where you can enjoy your treats. Located right by Federal Pizza, Postinos, and Windsor, it's easy to skip dessert at the restaurant and try this place for a change.\n\nOverall, if you love ice cream GO TO CHURN.
label: positive

text: This hotel will certainly suprise you. I booked it from reading reviews on this site. The nachos by the poolside and free sodas are great. It is not located in the absolute best part of town but once you turn into the hotel and are in your room you would never know it. It was quieter than I thought it may be. Have two TV's was the best and my husband would sit in the living room type area while we got ready on the other side. Wireless access is available only at the poolside and cabana BUT if you have a room like we do, near the cabana, you actually pick up the wireless in your room (I'm in my room typing this) . Request a poolside room if that is important to you. The pool is nice and clean and the cabana is right there. The rooms are VERY clean. The staff is more than accomidating when you have a problem. I would recommend this hotel to others. It was a great value for four nights for us. We typically only stayed in Marriott's or Fairfield's but this little secret off the highway made us realize you can't always judge a hotel by its cover. If we had driven by this hotel and noticed it I probably would not have stopped but if all of the rooms are as nice as ours, I can assure you it is worth the stop and we are glad we booked with them.
label: positive

text:
The coffee is quite good.

The Chai Explosion was yummy and cold. 

The coffee drinks were great.

The decor makes this place look like a corporate coffee entity, but it isn't.

They sometimes host events like the Downtown Phoenix Poetry Slam (which we saw on a night when it was a poetry open mike, and it wasn't all that good, but we have heard good things about it when it is an actual slam).

The coffee is actually fair trade. So, when you drink it, you can rest assured that the people who grew it were compensated fairly for their work. This is a good thing.

text: On sait bien que dans les films avec Fred Astaire le scénario est loin d'être la partie la plus travaillée, mais il y a quand même des limites au j'm'en foutisme des scénaristes. Certes quelques numéros musicaux ont un léger parfum Busby Berkeley et Rita Hayworth n'a probablement jamais été aussi belle, mais dieu que l'ensemble est pesant. Les relations entre personnages apparaissent comme un sommet de ringardise et d'immaturité. Les films de Gene Kelly ont globalement, beaucoup mieux vieilli que ceux de Fred Astaire, celui-là en est une illustration de plus.

text: Quelle déception! La bande-annonce envoyait du lourd, le résultat n'est pas du tout à la hauteur. Le premier épisode était bien mieux. Il était sympathique, amusant, divertissant, avec un couple Nicolas Cage/Eva Mendes très en forme. Ici, on a un Nicolas Cage qui fait n'importe quoi, une Violante Placido transparente, et un Johnny Whitworth aux allures de Kurt Russell des années 80. Le Ghost Rider est affreusement mal fait, et complètement ridicule. Un comble! Roarke/Le Malin a perdu tout son charisme et toute son infamie, et ce n'est pas la faute à Ciaran Hinds, celui-ci n'étant pas aidé par l'écriture de son personnage, dans un scénario désastreux. Et puis il y en a marre de cette réalisation hystérique, agaçante, avec une caméra qui part dans tous les sens, des effets ridicules, qui rendent fou le spectateur! RAS LE BOL de cette façon de faire avec les pieds! On peut rajouter aussi ce manque cruel d'action, le ridicule du clan des moines à capuche, la laideur des effets spéciaux, la durée rikiki du film qui renforce l'impression de travail bâclé, la scène de conjuration de malédiction farfelue et affligeante, et la scène finale navrante. Ça se confirme, Mark Neveldine et Brian Taylor sont nuls, comme leur(s) films(s). 0/5
label: negative

text:
It shocks me that this place hasn't been reviewed yet. It's been a staple in the Mill/College/Baseline community for a long time now.

BSP is one of those places where you go, you like it, but you realize something is missing and you just don't know what it is.

I still don't know what it is and I first went there in 2002.

The inside is very nice, tvs are situated nicely around the tables, food is okay and there is outdoor seating. I never find myself going here to watch games though or even to go grab a meal.

I was here for an ALCS game in 2004 and it was the most packed I've ever seen it. I haven't seen it that way since, not even for football.

Now I go in on a very irregular basis because various softball teams I played on have had their post games here. 

I notice on weeknights it has somewhat of a Cheers atmosphere. Regulars sitting up at the bar who know waitresses (who also double as bartenders) by name. 

I think the inside might just be too luxurious though. Furniture looks more like a restaurant and I think the average sports fan (and this is a sports bar) likes more of a dive bar feel.

I couldn't understand why Doc & Eddy's, which is right up the road, gets far more patrons for sporting events. It's a more divey bar with similar food. I know it's got more to do with it than having pool tables and air hockey.

The Woodshed is also walking distance to the west. 

I think BSP just toes the line between casual restaurant and sports bar and that might be what's hurting it. Looks like a place you might take your girlfriend for dinner rather than your buddies for a playoff game.

It's so well situated between Kiwanis park and numerous apartment complexes that it should be far more popular during game times. 

I've just been in far too many times when people at the bar exceed people at tables. 

I still can't put my finger on it...
label: negative

text: This movie deserves the 10 I'm giving it.But it's not the 10 that you'd give to movies like 'The Godfather' or 'Goodfellas' or 'Psycho'. This is the kind of 10 you give to a movie which just makes you laugh,over and over again! It's the most horribly written and directed movie, yet it doesn't fail to entertain. It has the most amateur effects, yet you enjoy every moment! I saw this movie today on TV, and I didn't want to move away! Read the following dialogue to know why!(Whole college is standing around Manisha,who has just undergone a rape attempt and the guys who attempted the rape are asking for forgiveness)Bad Guy 1: Please forgive us! Bad guy 2: Yes,we won't do it again. (No response from Manisha) Akshay: Come on,forgive them! Manisha: I don't know... Akshay: You are a beautiful woman, and even dead men can get aroused by you! And these are living young males! Don't blame them!Pancholi: Yeah Manisha.. Manisha(To Suniel): What if they tried to rape your girlfriend??? Suniel: I'd break their hands,legs and kill them.But anyways,just forgive them..Akshay: Yeah if you don't forgive them then it will be as though you are too arrogant about your beauty!Now that is a true masterpiece of a dialogue! This movie never fails to entertain, mainly because there are so many goofs and unrealistic situations! The bad guy (Munish) can do basically anything..He can blow a sandstorm from his mouth, or he can get a motorcycle from his backside and just as easily make it disappear again. Every actor takes turns to speak..One line from Akshay,then from Suniel, then from Arshad, then Aftab, then Nigam. It's the main rule followed by the director, so that equal screen time is given to each guy. And then there's the all powerful pendant, which can cause even a speeding car to go right through you without you being harmed! All these things make it an enjoyable movie, and I can watch it over and over again. I think this movie can go into the comedy hall of fame if there is one..The only problem is that it wasn't trying to be funny.
label: positive

text:
Local love all the way! This place reminds me of home, Hawaii. I think we were served by the owner. He was extremely nice and told us he was from the Big Island.

I've been craving meat jun and boiled peanuts and got a double score when this place had them both! All the appetizers were delicious especially the kim chee. The mandu was also really good. 

After we put in our order, the table next to us received hot stone dishes with eggs over easy. Our mouths watered at the sight, since they looked so good. 

The meat jun meat was really tender and had great flavor. Although, I thought it wasn't quite authentic since it had batter plus egg. I've typically had it with just the egg. 

My husband got the spicy noodle soup with beef and vegetables. The noodles had great flavor and the base had the right amount of spicy.

I would have knocked it down to a 4 because of the Meat Jun, but the service was so good that it bumped it back up to a 5. He was even offering otter pops for dessert.

Aloha!!
label: positive

text:
Stayed in room 419.
Positive:
Location is great! Close to metro, easy to get form JFK. Close to grocery stores and restaurants.
Free WiFi.
Staff is nice and helpful.
Issues:
Cockroaches
Street noise
Heater did not work
Dirty floors
Elevator is unreliable.
Would never stay again: 3 inch cockroaches, woke up thinking I have a mouse on a table, NOT a mouse just a gigantic cockroach! Very disturbing!
Street noise is horrible! Is it that hard to put noise protective windows? Besides the loud car noise, woke up at 3am from a woman screaming for help, she sounded like she was physically violated, who can go to sleep after that?
Heater never started working, just blew cool air. Unfortunately for me the temperature dropped that evening, the additional thin cotton spread did not save the night, I had to layer myself with clothing I had, it was a rough night. To the management: it is a middle of October, shouldn't it be a rule to provide an additional winter version of a bed spread/comforter starting in fall?
Dirty floors: visible crumbs all over the floor, makes me just think what else hasn't been cleaned that I can not see???
Elevator is hard to get: it is either full or one has to wait for 20 minutes, had to use the narrow stairs, not much fun dragging the suitcase up and down.
I have stayed in other BW hotels multiple times and had a great experience, unfortunately this one was the worst.
label: negative

text:
Although we often visit San Diego we stayed here on this occasion only because we were just here for a couple of days before boarding a ship and the location seemed convenient. Everything started out ok, easy check-in, pleasant staff at the front desk.
Once in the room we found that the balcony door was stuck and would only open a few inches. It also would not close properly. That night was very windy so we were awake most of the night listening to the door rattle. We could also hear everything that went on in the hallways.
We had booked a room that included breakfast, so the next morning went down to the restaurant with our coupon. After being seated, the waitress came by and on seeing the coupon, grabbed our menus and told us we didn't have any choice about what we would be served other than the manner in which our eggs would be cooked. She also made it very clear and I do mean VERY clear that the coupon did not include her tip.
Great start to the day, but when we returned to our room it got better yet, since our keycards wouldn't work. The maid was in the hallway and when we told her the problem she said there was nothing she could do and the problem was caused by carrying the keycards close to a cell phone. Interesting observation inasmuch as my wife's keycard was never near her phone and I don't carry a cell phone.
To rectify the problem we had to go back down to the front desk. There were only two people on duty to handle people checking in and out and no one who could handle this sort of problem. As a result we had to wait in line for over half an hour to address the issue. When we did manage to speak to someone she couldn't understand how this could happen and seemed to think we didn't know how to work a door handle. We told her the maid's story about the cell phones and suddenly all was clear for her, yes indeed the problem was caused by cell phones. The fact that I don't carry one and that my wife's phone was never near the keycard didn't matter, the problem had been solved. All we had to do was go back to our room and she would send someone up to deal with the matter. I indicated that I wasn't too pleased to have to wait in a line for over half an hour to discuss the problem and that I wasn't going to stand around in the hallway waiting for someone to show up. She then decided that she could issue new keycards.
We returned to the room and miraculously the cards worked. We got ready to go out, waited around a bit, but no one ever did show up at our room, at least not while we were there. Went out for the day and also went out for dinner that evening. That night we again could hear everyone entering and exiting their rooms, every noise in the hall as well as the ship arriving and a variety of announcements made by the ship's staff.
Next morning same rigamarole re breakfast although different waitress who didn't make an issue out of her tip. Easy check-out via voicemail.
The quality of the room, the decor and the service for the price charged will ensure that we don't ever return to this hotel. Oh, there was also an issue controlling the water temperature in the shower, but we won't go into the details of that.
label: negative

text:
Hotel is nice, rooms are beautiful large and clean. BUT...
You pay well and supposedly get a high class hotel, only to discover all the small things are not included, not available, or require extra pay.
WIFI included? No! Need to pay extra.
Breakfast included? "No, but we have a restaurant downstairs"... Even in the room, you have coffee for only one cup of regular coffee and one cup of decaf :(.
Refrigerator? Nope. Microwave? Nope.
Free parking for customers? You would think, no? Well, no again. Feel free to use the parking lot across the street and pay another $13 for a 24 hour stay.
Almost any cheep hotel anywhere across the US will give you free WIFI, a refrigerator and microwave in the room, free parking, and more coffee than you will need, and sometimes a good breakfast included. I expected more of the Crowne Plaza Los Angeles International Airport Hotel. Those hotels like that, who try to make another buck on me, after taking my credit card reservation, will not see me again. Nice stay, with a bitter taste.
label: neutral

text:
We got the Le Parker Meridian last minute on Priceline when our flight out of NYC got cancelled, forcing us to stay another day. We got an amazing price, so I'm hesitant to complain, but just one little note.
The hotel itself was amazing and the modern decor was fun. The shower was awesome, incredible amount of water pressure and the bath products were fabulous.
Being that we were coming in late at night (after 9 pm) and that they gave us the non-smoking room we requested, it seems rude to complain, but there was a woman's hair all over the bathroom of the room that we stayed in, which was ridiculously disgusting. I cleaned it myself, too tired after our airport debacle to go back downstairs to complain and wait for a new room, but in a hotel that's this high-caliber and priced accordingly, I found this unacceptable. Needless to say, I was not impressed, and was left with a negative impression of such a seemingly wonderful hotel.
label: negative

text:
Unlike all the other reviews on here, I am not going to give away any of the show! Instead, I will just list the highlights and some low-lights of the night! 

Highlights:

-Been after Minh for a while to go and see this show, but each time we were in town there was always other things to do! 
-Reserving tickets is easy, and we were able to get tickets a couple of hours before the Sunday 8:00pm showing.
-Ticket booth is not located inside of Caesars; instead, it is on the outside across from serendipity 3. 
-Outside door staff were friendly, inside some of the ushers were nice too.
-It is true, try, and not sit in the first two rows unless you would like to be a part of the show!
-Two words........... The Gazillionaire!!!!!
-Get ready to laugh..... And do not be all-uptight! 
-The tent is so pretty inside and I love the feel of the old school circus minus the animals!
-The bartenders "creation of the day" looked and sounded yummi!
-Bring cash for drinks!
-The show was the BEST and it kept you wanting more after each act!!!!

Now the Low-lights:
-Not being told where the box office was located and having to walk through all of Caesars until we saw the signs outside.
-The rows of wooden chairs are so close together that it was hard not to trip over your own feet (mind you I am 5-1).
-If you have issues sitting shoulder to shoulder with a stranger, then maybe this show is not for you!
-The AC is nice and cool until the show starts, then it is switched off and it is super hot inside. Even worse if the show is sold out!
-Walking to the bar, I almost slipped on some water that was on the floor, told an usher who seemed not to care at all!
-Encountered another usher who was rude and told me that the barline started on the right side of the bar not on the left.
-Bar does not sell on tap water; instead, they have bottled which was $5.00 for a small. ummm pass!
label: positive

text:
Instant relief!
This product is amazing. I have sciatica and it has been getting progressively worse. I’ve tried yoga, stretches, medication, and massage with only minimal relief. I saw this and decided to give it a try. Easy to set up. Put on the sleep mask, laid down, asked Alexa to set a timer for 10 minutes and play some spa music, closed my eyes and laid my head in the hammock. I could immediately tell it was helping. Best stretch I ever had. After 10 minutes I was able to feel quite a bit of relief from the pain. I was able to get off the floor much easier. So simple, relaxing, and effective. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text:
Trip started off poorly when we called for courtesy van to pick us up and Union Station only to be told we would have to wait about a couple of hours. Once at the hotel, we found it to be older, run-down and an 'outside door' style. No elevators , so you lug up two flights of stairs to the room. Overall room was clean but the smoke alarm was dis-mantled and laying on our bed. Left a camera in the van, called front desk to ask them to call van driver immediately (before any fares to or from Union Station) .they refused. We went to front desk two times to ask them to call him , they refused and pleaded not good English-so alas...camera was gone ... The van drivers in general were rude, careening thru the DC streets, not acknowledging passengers and just mad at their Days Inn staff.
No wifi in rooms-(it was advertised as wifi in rooms) and no complimentary brkfst. Cold food and steep prices---This inn needs to have a manager retrain his staff on how to work and be personable with guests. Paid same price as Holiday Inn Express across the street that had all the amenities we did not! Not stay here again! Noisy, and can't even open shades as people watching from parking lot who was in which room--scary for female travelers!
label: negative

text:
ちゃんとした国内メーカーのテスタ使いましょう。誤差ひどく精度悪し、品質のバラつきが酷
二つ購入しましたが、精度が悪すぎて電圧が出ているかどうかの参考にくらいしかなりません。 差し込むだけで便利そうかと思って購入しましたが、 ウェブサイトなどでこの類の製品を使って製品などをレビューし、 計測した電圧をのせている人がいますが、そういう用途には使うべきじゃないですね。 精度は、せめて小数点二桁目があるのだから、小数点一桁程度の精度は期待したかったですが、 電圧・電流両方で、10%以上の誤差が出ます。 価格考えればこんなものかもしれません。 あと、この機器自体が消費する電力による電圧降下もあるので、 充電時に挟んで使うような用途にも不適だと感じました。 電源と機器の組み合わせによっては、充電自体が出来なくなるレベルです。
label: negative

text:
I was torn about this Marriott, because the rooms were not as nice as I have experienced at other Marriotts. However, the service and other ammenities helped to redeem the stay.
The rooms had the standard stuff (including the fabulous Marriott bed); there was nothing gross or wrong about them per se. However, they were on the smallish side and lacked some of the upgraded features I have found at other Marriott hotels, including upgraded lighting, ways to connect the television to your computer, and a flexible working area. Worst of all, though, was the total lack of outlets near the desk: to plug in my laptop I had to dive under the desk and plug into a wall outlet that had a 3-outlet extender in it that had only one open space.
That said, the hotel had some great features- a nice pool area, a great fitness center, and a stylish lobby. Best of all was the concierge lounge, which featured outstanding and friendly service in both the morning and evening, an excellent breakfast, and evening meal service that was enough for dinner. Truly excellent. The front desk service was also excellent, as was the valet service (fast and polite).
Location was fine- downtown is more fun, but this was close to where I had business, had easy access to the highway, and had places to eat nearby.
Overall, I think the rooms could use an upgrade, but their decent quality combined with superb service made for a solid stay.
label: positive

text:
The last time I was here was in December. I thought the food was spectacular. Today, three months later, not so much. Had the chicken biryani and the shrimp sag. Asked for the sag (spinach) to be made without dairy. There is another local restaurant that does this for me. Well they accommodated my request but the dish turned out to be flavorless. I didn't ask for the spices to be left out--just the dairy. So the shrimp sag was so so and this is being generous. The basmati rice that came with the shrimp sag lacked salt in its totality so it just tasted like white mush. The chicken biryani was generous and had three pieces of chicken which was enough. However, it was not tasty like the last time--again lacking in spices. Everything was freshly made that has to be said. The waitress gave us some raita (yogurt) and let us sample the "sambar?"when we inquired about what the buffet was like (before we got our food) It was lentils in a tomato base. Really good. 
The waitress was very polite, attentive and just an overall nice young lady. 
I am so disappointed in the food this time around though. I know this cannot be the same chef who made our food the last time. The bad thing about the restaurant business is the movement of chefs and staff. Here today, gone tomorrow. Today was a case where the former chef was greatly missed by us. I don't think I would make another trip out to 24th Avenue and Bell to eat this indian food. I thought I had found a gem, but sadly this is not the case. 
Management: Work on your food... who was cooking in December that made my first visit so great???
label: negative

text: Venant de voir Après le bal, le tub, petit film grivois de Méliès, pas forcément recherché, je ne peux toutefois que voir la différence avec ce film très court aussi de la même année. Là où l’on sent déjà que Méliès cherche à créer une histoire, ou à divertir, ce très court métrage de moins d’1 minute reste, comme pas mal de films Lumière, et d’autres métrages de Promio, avant tout le tournage d’un moment vrai. En sommes on reste sur de la pure démonstration technique, pionnière bien sûr, mais déjà, en 1897, derrière le futur du cinéma tel qu’envisagé par Méliès. Je donne 2.
label: negative

text: Our annual conference this year was held at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square. Nothing too exciting to say about the rooms. I never felt like my room was completely clean as I would continue to find items on the floor. Things were not replenished and my ice bucket was never given a clean baggy each day. The room was nice but I only overlooked a roof. The health club was a good size and plenty of equipment to work out on. Finding conference rooms at times was difficult and confusing (this was a very large conference). There are plenty of places to walk to (would not do it at night by myself). If you need assistance you must ask for it. The food prices in the hotel are a little outrageous. text: I tried the Kalbi and Bulgogi, it was yummy! We couldn't believe how soft the meat was even after we burnt it! Haha! The vegetables were all fresh. I really enjoy the sliced daikon and Kim Chee! Also the staff was very nice and \"on it\", we never had to ask for anything! Then after we stuffed ourselves, there was still room for dessert! They have this liquid thing that looks like watered down honey! Try it! It taste like ginger and cinnamon! It was so good, I had seconds and thirds of that! It's suppose to cleanse your palette. So basically, it's like green tea for Japanese food. But it's served cold and so much better! In fact I'm gonna go to Chinatown today and see if anywhere sells it, it was that good! Now I can say I finally ate at that place with the sign, U cook, U eat! It was bomb! Better and cheaper than Sura down the road! This is now our place to eat Korean food!
label: positive

text:
Michael Argento and his team are fantastic. I own a townhome and operate a business in a rented space... and unfortunately I've experienced HVAC problems at both! I've tried Morris Jenkins, Miller Heating & Air, my landlord's "handy guy"... and NO ONE compares to Rudy Cools. Now that I've found this company, I'll never call anyone else. Here are some of the reasons Rudy Cools gets 5 stars:

1. Michael and his team are all punctual and friendly. You get a specific appointment time, not a 4 hour window like so many other places offer. While they are working, they will chat with you about their kids, gardens, dogs, etc :)
2. The staff is neat, clean and professional - they wear uniforms and don't arrive covered in mud and grime (other companies have done this and tracked dirt and grease all over my home).
3. They are knowledgeable and helpful. They will take you outside and show you what is wrong (how it currently looks vs. how it should look). They spend time explaining the issue and the options to you and let you decide on the best course of action. I've never felt "pushed" to do something and I understand why I'm spending my money on.
4. The prices are completely fair, and the company offers financing too!
5. They can service both residential and commercial units - this was not the case with other companies I had tried in the past.

Every single time I have interacted w/ Michael and his staff, I have been thoroughly impressed. It's great to see a business owner who is so skilled, hard working, and involved w/ his customers. Thanks guys!!!
label: positive
